title: Law Enforcement Recordings
author: ['Givan (D)', 'Daniels (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, recordings, procedure to determine to whom and what portion of a recording to disclose or release established.

title: Crimes and Offenses
author: ['Reynolds (R)']
summary: Concerns crimes and offenses, relates to crimes motivated by race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, or physical or mental disability, includes employment as a law enforcement officer within the protected class.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Jones (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, requires the Alabama Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to provide a mandatory Mental Health Awareness/Crisis Intervention Training program for existing law enforcement officers and certain trainees under certain conditions.

title: Crisis Intervention Training
author: ['Reynolds (R)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement officers, requires officers to have not less than 16 hours of crisis intervention training.

title: Voter Registration Lists
author: ['Coleman-Madison (D)']
summary: Relates to voter registration lists, permits a registered voter or the spouse of a registered voter, who is a federal or state prosecutor, federal, state, probate, or municipal judge, or law enforcement officer, to submit a signed written affidavit requesting that the Secretary of State omit all information except the name of the registered voter or the spouse of the registered voter.

title: Municipalities and Law Enforcement
author: ['Melson (R)']
summary: Relates to municipalities, amends Section 11-45-9.1, Code of Alabama 1975, provides that a municipality may authorize a law enforcement officer to issue a summons and complaint in lieu of custodial arrest for certain criminal offenses, in connection therewith would have as its purpose or effect the requirement of a new or increased expenditure of local funds within the meaning of Amendment 621 of the Constitution of Alabama of 1901.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Applicants Education
author: ['Shelnutt (R)']
summary: Amends Section 36-21-46, Code of Alabama 1975, relating to the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission, provides that graduation from a nonpublic education program satisfies the education component for an applicant to become a law enforcement officer in the state.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Training
status: Pending - House Public Safety and Homeland Security Committee
author: ['Hill J (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, requires the Alabama Peace Officers Standards and Training Commission to provide a mandatory crisis intervention training program for existing law enforcement officers and certain trainees under certain conditions.

title: Law Enforcement Traffic Stops and Racial Profiling
status: Pending - House Public Safety and Homeland Security Committee
author: ['Smitherman (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to traffic stops and state and local law enforcement officers, prohibits a law enforcement officer from engaging in racial profiling, requires adoption of written policies and the forms to be used for statistics on traffic stops, provides for complaints, requires reports to be filed in the Office of the Attorney General, provides for the reporting and collection of data on injuries to state and local law enforcement officers, connections therewith to have as its purpose or effect the requirement.

title: Voter Registration Lists
author: ['Faulkner (R)']
summary: Relates to voter registration lists, amends Section 17-4-33, Code of Alabama 1975, to permit a registered voter or the spouse of a registered voter, who is a federal or state prosecutor, federal, state, probate, or municipal judge, or law enforcement officer, to submit a signed written affidavit requesting that the Secretary of State omit all information except the name of the registered voter or the spouse of the registered voter.

title: Assault Against First Responders and Riots
author: ['Brown C (R)']
summary: Relates to crimes and offenses, creates the crimes of assault against a first responder in the first and second degrees, creates the crimes of damaging a public monument in the first and second degrees, amends Sections 13A-11-1, 13A-11-3, 13A-11-4, and 13A-11-70, Code of Alabama 1975, provides further for the crimes of riot and inciting to riot, adds Section 13A-11-3.1 to the Code of Alabama 1975, to create the crime of aggravated riot, amends Section 13A-6-21, Code of Alabama 1975, to provide further.

title: Law Enforcement and Information
author: ['Smitherman (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, requires the Alabama Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to create a database of certain information relating to law enforcement officers, provides that information in the database is confidential, provides for criminal penalties for unauthorized disclosure, requires former law enforcement employers to disclose information to another law enforcement agency for purposes of employment of law enforcement officers, provides immunity for certain disclosures.

title: Sheriff Office
author: ['Whatley (R)']
summary: Sheriff, office vacant or other circumstances, highest ranking deputy to serve, Section 11-5-5 repealed.

title: Workers Compensation and Firefighters
author: ['Barfoot (R)']
summary: Workers' compensation, firefighters, law enforcement officers, diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder, reimbursed for certain out-of-pocket expenses, companies and municipalities required to maintain certain disability insurance coverage.

title: Post Traumatic Stress Disorder Insurance Coverage
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Relates to counties, municipalities, and fire districts, provides that a law enforcement officer or firefighter employed by a county, municipality, or fire district and diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder would be reimbursed for certain co-payments for treatment under certain conditions, requires counties, municipalities, and fire districts to maintain certain disability insurance coverage for law enforcement officers and firefighters who are unable to return to work.

title: Sheriffs Term of Office
author: ['Reynolds (R)']
summary: Relates to sheriffs, amends Section 36-3-4 of the Code of Alabama 1975, relating to the term of office of certain county elected officers, provides for the term of office of the sheriff effective beginning the next term of office, makes certain technical revisions to the provisions in this section.

title: Crimes and Offenses
author: ['Shaver (R)']
summary: Relates to crimes and offenses, amends Section 13A-10-52, Code of Alabama 1975, to revise the criminal penalties for violations of fleeing or attempting to elude law enforcement.

title: Emergency Treatment of Mental Illness
author: ['Allen (R)']
summary: Relates to emergency treatment of mental illness, authorizes a law enforcement officer from a designated law enforcement agency to take an individual whom the officer believes has a mental illness into protective custody under certain conditions, provides for the transportation of the individual to a hospital or other facility for evaluation and treatment, provides protection from civil liability to law enforcement officers, medical facilities, and medical personnel under certain conditions.

title: Traffic Stops and Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - House Public Safety and Homeland Security Committee
author: ['Coleman (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to traffic stops and state and local law enforcement officers, prohibits a law enforcement officer from engaging in racial profiling, requires adoption of written policies and the forms to be used for statistics on traffic stops, provides for the handling of complaints, requires reports to be filed in the Office of the Attorney General, provides for the reporting and collection of data on injuries to state and local law enforcement officers.

title: Protective Custody of Individuals with Mental Illness
author: ['Jones (R)']
summary: Relates to Covington County, authorizes a law enforcement officer from a designated law enforcement agency to take an individual whom the officer believes has a mental illness into protective custody under certain conditions, provides for the transportation of the individual to a hospital or other facility for evaluation and treatment, provides protection from civil liability to law enforcement officers who, in good faith, place individuals with mental illness into protective custody.

title: Sheriffs and Term of Office
status: Pending - House Constitution, Campaigns and Elections Committee
author: ['Scofield (R)']
summary: Relates to Sheriffs, relates to term of office of certain county elected officers, provides for the term of office of the sheriff effective beginning the next term of office, makes certain technical revisions to the provisions of this section.

title: Sheriff Vacancies
status: Pending - House Public Safety and Homeland Security Committee
author: ['Lawrence (D)']
summary: Relates to sheriffs, provides for the acting sheriff when the office of sheriff of a county is vacant or when certain other circumstances exist in the county, repeals Section 11-5-5 of the Code of Alabama 1975, relating to the county coroner serving as sheriff when the office of sheriff is vacant or when certain other circumstances exists in the county.

title: Sheriff Qualifications
author: ['Price (R)']
summary: Relates to Cleburne County, provides for the qualifications of the sheriff, requires completion of continuing education.

title: Sheriff Education and Qualifications
author: ['Price (R)']
summary: Relates to the continuing education and qualifications required for the Randolph County sheriff.

status: Pending - House Local Legislation - Jefferson County Committee

summary: Relates to Jefferson County and the office of sheriff, provides certain additional qualifications for persons serving as sheriff, provides for continuing education for a sheriff.

title: Prohibits Traffic Citation Quotas

author: ['Sorrell (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, prohibits state and local law enforcement agencies from establishing traffic citation quotas, prohibits state and local law enforcement agencies from providing incentives or rewards to law enforcement officers for issuing traffic citations.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['McCampbell (D)', 'Rafferty (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, requires the State Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to create a database of certain information relating to law enforcement officers, provides that information in the database is confidential, provides for criminal penalties for unauthorized disclosure, requires former law enforcement employers to disclose information to another law enforcement agency for purposes of employment of law enforcement officers, provides immunity for certain disclosures.

title: Crimes and Offenses
author: ['Treadaway (R)']
summary: Relates to crimes and offenses, creates the crimes of assault against a first responder in the first and second degrees, provides further for the crimes of riot and inciting to riot, creates the crime of aggravated riot, provides further for the crime of assault in the second degree.

title: Custody of Individual With Mental Illness
author: ['Sorrells (R)']
summary: Relates to Geneva County, authorizes a law enforcement officer from a designated law enforcement agency to take an individual whom the officer believes has a mental illness into protective custody under certain conditions, provides for the transportation of the individual to a hospital or other facility for evaluation and treatment, provides protection from civil liability to law enforcement officers who, in good faith, place individuals with mental illness into protective custody.

topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification', ' Standards']

summary: Relates to the Police Standards Council, relates to municipal correctional officers and municipal correctional employees, makes municipal police officers subject to police standards, establishes a statewide use of force database in the Department of Public Safety, requires a municipality that employs a person as a municipal police officer or in a municipal correctional facility, the Department of Corrections, or the Department of Public Safety to report in the database incidents of use of force.

author: ['Osborne (R)', 'Bowers (R)', 'Cobb (R)', 'Toma (R)', 'Blackman (R)']
summary: Provides that a first responder who is trained in administering epinephrine injections may administer such injection to a person who the first responder believes in good faith is experiencing anaphylaxis pursuant to a standing order issued by certain persons, provides that certain practitioners are immune from professional liability and criminal prosecution for any decision made, act or omission or injury that results from that act in certain circumstances, provides definitions.

title: Emergency Order for Imposition of Curfew
summary: (Emergency Order) Declares a state of emergency, imposes a curfew for all state citizens.

title: Private Colleges and Universities Law Enforcement
author: ['Eads (R)']
summary: Amends the law concerning law enforcement agencies for private colleges and universities, allows private schools to establish and appoint an institutional law enforcement officer.

author: ['Rapert (R)']
summary: Establishes the public safety equipment grant program, declares an emergency.

title: Law Enforcement Training Costs Reimbursements
author: ['Ingram (D)']
summary: Concerns the reimbursement of law enforcement training costs or expenses.

title: Qualified Immunity
author: ['Hammer (R)']
summary: Concerns qualified immunity, includes that law enforcement agencies for and certified law enforcement officers employed by a public or private institution of higher education shall be immune from liability and from suit for damages except to the extent that they may be covered by liability insurance.

title: Prescription Drug Abuse
author: ['Boyd (R)']
summary: Encourages continued collaboration among healthcare providers, law enforcement, educators, public officials, and the state community in battling the abuse of prescription drugs in the state.

title: Law Enforcement Integrity
author: ['Love (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Regards the Law Enforcement Integrity Act of 2021.

author: ['Gazaway (R)']
summary: Creates Gabo's Law, allows for emergency medical care to be provided to injured police dogs, provides immunity.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Organization and Staffing
author: ['Dalby (R)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Concerns law enforcement agency organization, staffing, and personnel matters.

author: ['Underwood (R)']
summary: Relates to the Back the Blue Act.

title: Nonimmgrants Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - House State Agencies and Governmental Affairs Committee
author: ['Penzo (R)']
summary: Permits nonimmgrants legally admitted to the United States under a compact of free association to be a certified law enforcement officer, states this will be known as the Marshallese Law Enforcement Act.

title: Law Enforcement Retirement Benefits
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Public Retirement and Social Security Programs
author: ['Richardson (D)']
summary: Amends the law concerning the retirement benefits of certain law enforcement officers, amends the law concerning the forfeiture of retirement benefits.

title: Nonimmigrants Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Godfrey (D)']
summary: Permits nonimmigrants legally admitted to the United States under a compact of free association to be a certified law enforcement officer, states this will be known as the Marshallese Law Enforcement Act.

title: Retired Law Enforcement Officers Tax Credit
author: ['Eubanks (R)']
summary: Creates an income tax credit for retired law enforcement officers who work cold cases for the division of state police.

title: Law Enforcement Sobering Centers Transport
author: ['Boyd (R)']
summary: Permits a law enforcement officer to transport a person in crisis to a sobering center.

title: Refusals to Assist Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Bryant (R)']
summary: Concerns the offense of refusal to assist a law enforcement officer, concerns the refusal to comply with a court order.

title: Law Enforcement Blue Alert System
status: Pending - House State Agencies and Governmental Affairs Committee
author: ['Slape (R)']
summary: Creates a statewide Blue Alert System, concerns law enforcement.

title: Law Enforcement Mental and Behavioral Health Counseling
status: Pending - House State Agencies and Governmental Affairs Committee
author: ['Richardson (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer employed by a public law enforcement agency to submit to mental and behavioral health counseling as a qualification to serve as a law enforcement officer.

title: Back the Blue Act
author: ['Underwood (R)']
summary: Relates to the Back the Blue Act, amends the law concerning law enforcement services of cities of the first class, cities of the second class, and incorporated towns.

author: ['Richardson (D)']
summary: Concerns critical incident debriefing for law enforcement officers.

title: Domestic Violence
author: ['Gazaway (R)']
summary: Relates to Arkansas Phoenix Act of 2021, concerns the statute of limitations for certain offenses, concerns the training given to law enforcement officers for situations in which domestic violence is suspected.

title: Aggravated Assault Upon Law Enforcement
author: ['Dalby (R)']
summary: Concerns the offense of aggravated assault upon a law enforcement officer or an employee of a correctional facility, declares an emergency.

title: Private College or University Law Enforcement Immunity
author: ['Johnson (R)']
summary: Concerns qualified immunity for law enforcement officers employed by a private college or university.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Training Costs Reimbursement
author: ['McGrew (R)']
summary: Concerns reimbursement for law enforcement officer training for certified law enforcement officers employed by a private community.

title: Law Enforcement Duty to Intervene Training
author: ['Boyd (R)']
summary: Requires training concerning a law enforcement officer's duty to intervene when the law enforcement officer observes the use of excessive force by another law enforcement office.

title: Law Enforcement Task Force
summary: Establishes a task force to advance the state of law enforcement in the state.

title: Law Enforcement Task Force
summary: Adds members to the Task Force to Advance the State of Law Enforcement.

title: Peace Officers: Certification: Civil Rights
author: ['Bradford (D)', 'Holden (D)', 'Stone (D)', 'Ting (D)', 'Chiu (D)', 'Durazo (D)', 'Atkins (D)', 'Bonta (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Quirk (D)', 'McCarty (D)', 'Kalra (D)', 'Wiener (D)', 'Kamlager (D)']
summary: Provides that a threat, intimidation, or coercion under the Tom Bane Civil Rights Act may be inherent in any interference with a civil right and would describe intentional acts for these purposes as an act in which the person acted with general intent or a conscious objective to engage in particular conduct. Eliminates certain immunity provisions for peace officers and custodial officers, or public entities employing peace officers or custodial officers sued under the act.

title: Peace Officers: Release of Records
author: ['Skinner (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Makes every incident involving use of force to make a member of the public comply with an officer, force that is unreasonable, or excessive force subject to disclosure. Requires records relating to sustained findings of unlawful arrests and unlawful searches to be subject to disclosure.

title: Peace Officers: Disqualification from Employment
author: ['Cooper (D)']
summary: Disqualifies a person from being a peace officer if the person has been discharged from the military for committing an offense that would have been a felony if committed in the state or if the person has been certified as a peace officer and has had that certification revoked by the Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training.

title: Peace Officers: Use of Force
author: ['Holden (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement use-of-force policies to require peace officers to immediately report potential excessive force, and to intercede when present and observing an officer using excessive force. Requires those policies to, among other things, prohibit retaliation against officers that report violations of law or regulation of another officer to a supervisor, and requires that an officer who fails to intercede be disciplined in the same manner as the officer who used excessive force.

title: Law Enforcement: Kinetic Energy Projectiles
author: ['Gonzalez (D)', 'Ting (D)', 'Chiu (D)', 'McCarty (D)', 'Wiener (D)', 'Rivas R (D)', 'Wicks (D)', 'Gonzalez (D)', 'Lee (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Kalra (D)', 'Carrillo (D)']
summary: Prohibits the use of kinetic energy projectiles or chemical agents by any law enforcement agency to disperse any assembly, protest, or demonstration, except in compliance with specified standards. Prohibits their use solely due to a violation of an imposed curfew, verbal threat, or noncompliance with a law enforcement directive. Includes certain standards for the use of kinetic energy projectiles and chemical agents to disperse gatherings.

title: Hate Crimes
author: ['Gabriel (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Ward (D)', 'Rubio (D)', 'Bauer-Kahan (D)', 'Wiener (D)', 'Stern (D)', 'Friedman (D)', 'Glazer (D)', 'Allen (D)', 'Low (D)', 'Ting (D)', 'Quirk (D)', 'Nazarian (D)', 'Medina (D)', 'Levine (D)', 'Holden (D)', 'Bloom (D)', 'Chiu (D)', 'Min (D)']
summary: Requires the Department of Justice to carry out various duties relating to documenting and responding to hate crimes, including conducting reviews of all law enforcement agencies to evaluate the accuracy of hate crime data provided and agencies' hate crime policies, implementing a school-based program in conjunction with school districts and local law enforcement agencies aimed at educating students regarding how to report all suspected hate crimes to prevent future hate crimes.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Salas (D)', 'Daly (D)', 'Quirk-Silva (D)', 'Rodriguez (D)', 'Irwin (D)', 'Lackey (R)', 'Low (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Cervantes (D)', 'Flora (R)', 'Grayson (D)', 'Rubio (D)', 'Ramos (D)', 'Villapudua (D)', 'Cooper (D)']
summary: Disqualifies a person from being employed as a peace officer if that person has been convicted of, or has been adjudicated by a military tribunal as having committed an offense that would have been a felony if committed in this state. Disqualifies any person who has been certified as a peace officer by the Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training and has had that certification revoked by the commission. Establishes the Peace Officer Standards Accountability Advisory Board.

title: Peace Officers: Minimum Qualifications
author: ['Jones-Sawyer (D)', 'Wicks (D)', 'Lee (D)']
summary: Increases minimum qualifying age to become a peace officer. Permits an individual under a specified age to qualify for employment as a peace officer if the individual has a bachelor's or advanced degree from an accredited college or university. Specifies that these requirements do not apply to individuals of a certain age who are already employed as a peace officer as of the effective date of this act.

title: Public Peace: Media Access
author: ['McGuire (D)', 'Portantino (D)', 'Wiener (D)', 'Carrillo (D)', 'Wicks (D)', 'Gonzalez (D)']
summary: Requires that specified media be allowed to enter specified closed areas and prohibits a peace officer or other law enforcement officer from intentionally assaulting, interfering with, or obstructing a duly authorized representative who is gathering, receiving, or processing information for communication to the public. Prohibits a duly authorized representative who is in a closed area from being cited for the failure to disperse, a violation of a curfew, or a violation of other specified laws.

title: Emergency Services: Community Response: Grant Program
author: ['Kamlager (D)']
summary: Enacts the Community Response Initiative to Strengthen Emergency Systems Act or the C.R.I.S.E.S. Act for the purpose of creating, implementing, and evaluating the 3-year C.R.I.S.E.S. Grant Pilot Program, which the act would establish. Requires the Office of Emergency Services to establish rules and regulations for the program with the goal of making grants to community organizations, over 3 years, for the purpose of expanding the participation of community organizations in emergency response.

title: Peace Officers: Firearms: Establishment Serving Public
author: ['Ramos (D)']
summary: Makes it unlawful for an establishment serving the public to prohibit or otherwise restrict a peace officer from carrying a weapon on the establishment's premises that the peace officer is authorized to carry, regardless of whether the peace officer is engaged in the actual discharge of the officer's duties while carrying the weapon.

title: County Sheriffs: Eligibility Requirements
status: Pending - Senate Governance and Finance Committee
author: ['Wiener (D)', 'Skinner (D)', 'Ting (D)', 'McCarty (D)', 'Lee (D)', 'Kalra (D)', 'Wicks (D)']
summary: Repeals specified eligibility requirements for county sheriffs. Allows all eligible voters to run for the office of Sheriff.

title: Workers' Compensation: Firefighters and Peace Officers
author: ['Stern (D)']
summary: Relates to existing Law which provides that injury includes post-traumatic stress that develops during a period in which the injured person is in the service of the department or unit. Makes that provision applicable to active firefighting members of the State Department of State Hospitals, the State Department of Developmental Services, and the Military Department, and the Department of Veterans Affairs, including security officers of the Department of Justice when performing assigned duties.

title: Victim Compensation: Use of Force by an Officer
author: ['Leyva (D)', 'Laird (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Chiu (D)', 'Friedman (D)', 'Lee (D)']
summary: Relates to compensation of victims of crimes from the Restitution Fund. Revises the definition of crime to include certain offenses, including an incident in which an individual sustains serious bodily injury or death as a result of a law enforcement officer's use of force. Prohibits the Victim Compensation Board from denying an application based on certain circumstances.

title: Peace Officers: Certification, Education, Recruitment
author: ['Portantino (D)', 'Daly (D)', 'Cooper (D)', 'Low (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Grayson (D)', 'Stern (D)', 'Bauer-Kahan (D)', 'Caballero (D)']
summary: Requires the Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training to work with stakeholders from law enforcement, the University of California, the California State University, the California Community Colleges, and community organizations to develop a list of courses to include as requirements for obtaining a basic certificate. Requires an applicant for a basic certificate to complete those courses before obtaining the certificate.

title: Peace Officers: California Science Center
author: ['Jones-Sawyer (D)']
summary: Grants peace officer status to security officers of the California Science Center, and clarifies the training requirements for those peace officers.

title: Law Enforcement Policies: Arrests: Positional Asphyxia
author: ['Gipson (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Levine (D)', 'Quirk (D)', 'McCarty (D)', 'Lee (D)', 'Bonta (D)']
summary: Prohibits a law enforcement agency from authorizing techniques or transport methods that involve a substantial risk of positional asphyxia, as defined.

title: Law Enforcement Policies
author: ['McCarty (D)']
summary: Requires, for deadly use of force incidents other than those required to be investigated by the Attorney General, an agency to cause a criminal investigation of these incidents to be conducted. Prohibits a law enforcement agency from having primary responsibility for conducting the criminal investigation into those incidents involving an officer employed by that agency. Provides alternative protocols for investigations of those incidents.

title: Law Enforcement Settlements and Judgments: Reporting
status: Pending - Assembly Consent Calendar - First Legislative Day
author: ['McCarty (D)']
summary: Requires municipalities to annually post on their internet websites specified information relating to settlements and judgments resulting from allegations of improper police conduct, including, among other information, amounts paid, broken down by individual settlement and judgment, information on bonds used to finance use of force settlement and judgment payments, and premiums paid for insurance against settlements or judgments resulting from allegations of improper police conduct.

title: California Law Enforcement Accountability Reform Act
author: ['Kalra (D)', 'Levine (D)', 'Stone (D)']
summary: Requires the background investigation for peace officer candidates to include an inquiry into whether a candidate for specified peace officer positions has engaged in membership in a hate group, participation in hate group activities, or public expressions of hate, as those terms are defined. Provides that certain findings would disqualify a person from employment.

title: District Attorneys: Conflicts Of Interest
author: ['Bradford (D)', 'Friedman (D)']
summary: Requires a District Attorney or the Attorney General to recuse themselves from a decision relating to investigating, charging, or prosecuting a peace officer for alleged criminal conduct while on duty if the District Attorney or Attorney General has a conflict of interest, as specified.

title: Criminal Law
author: ['Portantino (D)', 'McCarty (D)']
summary: Authorizes the state prosecutor to investigate and gather facts in an incident involving a shooting by a peace officer that results in the death of a civilian if there is a reasonable dispute as to whether the civilian was armed. Exempts any licensed common carrier involved in the delivery of a firearm, or a licensed manufacturer of ammunition, from the requirement that the sale, transfer, or loan of a firearm to be processed through a licensed firearm dealer.

title: Peace Officers: Investigations of Misconduct
status: Pending - Assembly Consent Calendar - First Legislative Day
author: ['Cunningham (R)', 'Gipson (D)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement agency or oversight agency to complete its investigation into an allegation of the use of force resulting in death or great bodily injury, sexual assault, discharge of a  firearm, or dishonesty relating to the reporting, investigation, or prosecution of a crime or misconduct by another peace officer or custodial officer, despite the peace officer's or custodial officer's voluntary separation from the employing agency.

title: Crimes: Perjury
author: ['Jones-Sawyer (D)']
summary: Makes it a crime for a peace officer to make a false statement to another peace officer if that statement is included in a peace officer report.

title: Peace Officer Training: Duty To Intercede
author: ['Villapudua (D)']
summary: Requires the Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training to develop training on the duty to intercede, to include, among other elements, a robust discussion of the science of active bystandership.

title: Peace Officers: Law Enforcement Cliques
author: ['Gipson (D)']
summary: Defines a law enforcement clique, a group of law enforcement officers within an agency that engages in a pattern of specified unlawful or unethical on-duty behavior, and would require law enforcement agencies, as specified, to have a policy prohibiting law enforcement cliques and making participation in a law enforcement clique grounds for termination.

title: Sexual Assault by Law Enforcement Officers: Limitations
author: ['Wicks (D)']
summary: Exempts a claim arising out of an alleged sexual assault by a law enforcement officer if the alleged assault occurred while the officer was employed by a law enforcement agency from all state and local government claim presentation requirements. akes conforming changes.

title: Law Enforcement: Social Media
author: ['Low (D)']
summary: Prohibits, except as specified, a police department or sheriff's office from sharing, on social media, booking photos of an individual arrested on suspicion of committing a nonviolent crime.

title: Police: Use of Force
author: ['Gonzalez (D)', 'Ting (D)', 'Weber (D)', 'Chiu (D)', 'McCarty (D)', 'Santiago (D)', 'Wiener (D)', 'Rivas R (D)', 'Durazo (D)', 'Gonzalez (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Kalra (D)', 'Carrillo (D)']
summary: Prohibits the use of kinetic energy projectiles or chemical agents by any law enforcement agency to disperse any assembly, protest, demonstration, or other gathering of persons. Prohibits their use solely due to a violation of an imposed curfew, verbal threat, or noncompliance with a law enforcement directive. Requires specified law enforcement agencies to maintain a policy on the use of force that meets specified requirements.

title: Victim Compensation: Use Of Excessive Force By Officer
author: ['Kamlager-Dove (D)']
summary: Revises the definition of crime to include the use of excessive force by a law enforcement officer regardless of whether the officer is arrested or charged with commission of a crime or public offense. Prohibits the board from denying an application based upon the victim' s involvement in the crime, upon the victim's failure to cooperate, based solely on a police report or the lack thereof, or based upon whether the law enforcement officer was arrested or charged with a crime.

title: Law Enforcement Uniforms
author: ['Archuleta (D)']
summary: Prohibits, with certain exceptions, a law enforcement agency from authorizing or allowing its employees to wear a uniform that is substantially similar to a uniform of the United States Armed Forces.

title: Public Peace: Media Access
author: ['McGuire (D)', 'Portantino (D)', 'Skinner (D)', 'Dodd (D)', 'Carrillo (D)', 'Wicks (D)', 'Gonzalez (D)', 'Hertzberg (D)', 'Hill (D)', 'Wiener (D)']
summary: Requires that a duly authorized representative of any news service, online news service, newspaper, or radio or television station or network be allowed to enter closed areas surrounding any emergency field command post. Prohibits a peace officer or other law enforcement officer from intentionally assaulting, interfering with, or obstructing a duly authorized representative who is gathering, receiving, or processing information for communication to the public.

title: Peace Officers: Certification: Civil Rights
author: ['Bradford (D)', 'Mitchell (D)', 'Bonta (D)', 'Holden (D)', 'Stone (D)', 'Ting (D)', 'Weber (D)', 'Chiu (D)', 'McCarty (D)', 'Allen (D)', 'Kalra (D)', 'Dodd (D)', 'Wiener (D)', 'Kamlager-Dove (D)', 'Wicks (D)', 'Durazo (D)']
summary: Eliminates certain immunity provisions for peace officers or public entities employing peace officers sued under the Tom Bane Civil Rights Act. Authorizes specified persons to bring an action for the death of a person caused by a violation of the Act. Grants the Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training the power to investigate and determine the fitness of any person to serve as a peace officer in the state. Creates the Peace Officer Standards Accountability Division.

title: Victim Compensation: Use of Excessive Force
author: ['Grayson (D)', 'Bonta (D)', 'Wiener (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Weber (D)', 'Chiu (D)', 'Kamlager-Dove (D)', 'Wicks (D)']
summary: Revises the definition of crime to include any public offense regardless of whether any suspect is arrested or charged with the commission of the crime. Includes in the definition of crime the use of excessive force by a peace officer, regardless of whether the peace officer is arrested or charged with the commission of a crime or public offense. Recasts the factors that may be considered in determining whether a victim was involved in the events leading to the qualifying crime.

title: Peace Officers: Release of Records
author: ['Skinner (D)']
summary: Makes every incident involving use of force to make a member of the public comply with an officer, force that is unreasonable, or excessive in force subject to disclosure, commencing on a specified date. Requires the retention of all complaints currently in the possession of a department or agency for a specified number of years, if they are related to a sustained finding of specified conduct.

title: Public Employment: Peace Officers
author: ['Burke (D)', 'Irwin (D)']
summary: Requires the evaluation of peace officers by a physician and surgeon, or psychologist, to include bias against race or ethnicity, gender, nationality, religion, disability, or sexual orientation. Requires every department or agency that employs peace officers to review the job descriptions used in the recruitment and hiring of those peace officers and to make changes that deemphasize the paramilitary aspects of the job and place more emphasis on community interaction and collaborative problem solving.

title: Peace Officers: Use of Force
author: ['Holden (D)', 'Mitchell (D)', 'Weber (D)', 'Burke (D)', 'Gipson (D)', 'Kamlager-Dove (D)', 'McCarty (D)']
summary: Requires each law enforcement agency to require officers to immediately report potential excessive force, and to intercede when present and observing an officer using excessive force. Disqualifies a person from being a peace officer if they have been found by a law enforcement agency that employees them to have either used excessive force that resulted in great bodily injury or death or to have failed to intercede in that incident as required by a law enforcement agency's policies.

title: County Board Of Supervisors: Sheriff Oversight
author: ['McCarty (D)', 'Holden (D)', 'Burke (D)', 'Gipson (D)', 'Mitchell (D)']
summary: Authorizes a county to establish a Sheriff Oversight Board to assist the Board of Supervisors with those duties as they relate to the Sheriff, either by action of the Board of Supervisors or through a vote of county residents. Authorizes the Chair of the Oversight Board and the Inspector General to issue a subpoena or subpoena duces tecum when deemed necessary to investigate a matter within their jurisdiction.

title: Peace Officers: Use of Force
summary: Prohibits a law enforcement agency from authorizing the use of a carotid restraint or a choke hold.

title: Peace and Custodial Officers
author: ['Umberg (D)']
summary: Requires each prosecuting agency to maintain a Brady list. Requires any state or local law enforcement agency maintaining personnel records of peace officers and custodial officers to annually, to each prosecuting agency within its jurisdiction, and upon request to any prosecuting agency, provide a list of names and badge numbers of officers employed by the agency in the five years prior to providing the list who meet specified criteria.

title: Peace Officers: Employment
author: ['Salas (D)', 'Bates (R)', 'Caballero (D)', 'Jones (R)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Wilk (R)', 'Cunningham (R)', 'Gipson (D)']
summary: Requires any agency that employs specified peace officers to provide a notification to the Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training when a peace officer is terminated or, if an officer leaves the agency with a complaint, charge, or investigation of a serious nature pending. Requires the agency to complete the investigation as specified and notify the Commission of its findings.

title: Law Enforcement Use of Force Settlements and Judgments
author: ['McCarty (D)', 'Holden (D)', 'Medina (D)', 'Allen (D)']
summary: Requires municipalities to annually post on their internet websites specified information relating to use of force settlements and judgments, including amounts paid, broken down by individual settlement and judgment, information on bonds used to finance use of force settlement and judgment payments, and premiums paid for insurance against use of force settlements or judgments.

title: Personal Rights: False Reports to Law Enforcement
author: ['Stone (D)', 'Wieckowski (D)', 'Jones-Sawyer (D)']
summary: Creates an additional exception to the privilege provisions for any communication between a person and a law enforcement agency in which the person knowingly or recklessly makes a false report that another person has committed, or is in the act of committing, a criminal act or is engaged in an activity requiring law enforcement intervention. Specifies that intimidation by threat of violence includes knowingly or recklessly making or threatening to make a false claim or report to law enforcement.

title: Police Use of Force
summary: Requires a state prosecutor to investigate incidents of an officer involved shooting resulting in the death of an unarmed civilian. Makes the Attorney General the state prosecutor unless otherwise specified or named. Authorizes the state prosecutor to prepare a written report and to post any reports made on a public internet website. Requires the Attorney General to operate a Police Practices Division to review the use of deadly force policies of a requesting law enforcement agency.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Policies: Use of Force: Protests
author: ['Wicks (D)']
summary: Requires each law enforcement agency to expand the agency's use of force policy to include clear and specific guidelines under which officers may use kettling or corralling and to prohibit officers from failing to wear, or intentionally acting to obscure or conceal information on, a badge while on duty. Authorizes a person who is detained or arrested for engaging in an act that is exempt as described to recover damage for being detained or arrested in violation of agency policies for use of force.

title: Law Enforcement: Use of Force
author: ['Weber (D)', 'Jones-Sawyer (D)']
summary: Removes the specification that a peace officer making an arrest need not desist in their efforts because of resistance or threatened resistance from the person being arrested. Requires a peace officer to attempt to control an incident through deescalation tactics in an effort to reduce or avoid the need to use force, to render medical aid immediately or as soon as feasible, and to intervene to stop a violation of law or an excessive use of force by another peace officer. Defines the term necessary.

title: False Reports and Harassment
author: ['Jones-Sawyer (D)', 'Umberg (D)', 'Portantino (D)', 'Wieckowski (D)', 'Garcia (D)', 'Gonzalez (D)', 'Gipson (D)', 'McCarty (D)', 'Santiago (D)', 'Skinner (D)', 'Bonta (D)', 'Stone (D)']
summary: Creates an exception of protection from civil action the privilege provisions for any communication between a person and a law enforcement agency in the person makes a false report. Provides that intimidation by threat of violence includes knowingly or recklessly making or threatening to make a false claim or report to a peace officer or law enforcement agency alleging that another person has engaged in unlawful activity or in an activity that requires law enforcement intervention.

title: Department of Justice: Law Enforcement Assistance
author: ['Ramos (D)']
summary: Amends existing law relating to the Rural Indian Crime Prevention Program. Requires the Department of Justice to provide technical assistance to local law enforcement agencies and tribal governments with Indian lands, relating to tribal issues, including providing guidance for law enforcement education and training on policing and criminal investigations on Indian lands, providing guidance on improving crime reporting, crime statistics, criminal procedures, and investigative tools. Requires a study.

title: Jail Population Management Tools
author: ['Lee (D)', 'Benavidez (D)']
summary: Concerns measures to reduce jail populations.

title: Policies For Peace Officer Credibility Disclosures
author: ['Cooke (R)', 'Ginal (D)', 'Carver (R)', 'Bird (D)']
summary: Concerns adoption of written policies by law enforcement agencies for constitutionally required peace officer credibility disclosure notifications.

title: Law Enforcement Support And Accountability
status: Pending - Senate State, Veterans, and Military Affairs Committee
author: ['Lundeen (R)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns the modification of measures to ensure law enforcement accountability.

title: Peace Officers Mental Health Grant Program
author: ['McCluskie (D)', 'Cooke (R)', 'McKean (R)', 'Buckner (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Concerns expanding the peace officers mental health support grant program to include community partnerships.

title: First Responder Interactions Persons With Disabilities
author: ['Froelich (D)', 'Larson (R)', 'Kolker (D)']
summary: Concerns establishing a commission to improve first responder interactions with persons with disabilities, makes an appropriation.

title: Missing Child Emergency Electronic Location Information
author: ['Lynch (R)', 'Cooke (R)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement's acquisition of location information of a missing child's telecommunications device in an emergency situation.

title: Measures to Address Law Enforcement Accountability
author: ['Herod (D)', 'Gonzales-Gutier (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns measures to address law enforcement accountability.

title: Enhance Law Enforcement Integrity
author: ['Garcia (D)', 'Fields (D)', 'Herod (D)', 'Gonzales-Gutier (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force']
summary: Concerns measures to enhance law enforcement integrity, makes an appropriation.

title: Repeal Law Enforcement Grant Appropriation Roll Forward
author: ['Ransom (R)', 'Rankin (R)', 'Zenzinger (D)']
summary: Concerns the repeal of the authority for the Division of Criminal Justice to expend an unused appropriation for the law enforcement grant program in the next fiscal year without further appropriation.

title: Mental Health Diversion Pilot Program
author: ['Esgar (D)', 'Rankin (R)', 'Zenzinger (D)', 'McCluskie (D)']
summary: Expands the Mental Health Diversion Pilot Programs to include more judicial districts.

title: Religious Head Coverings As Part Of a Police Uniform
author: ['Duff (D)', 'Osten (D)', 'Anwar (D)']
summary: Allows police officers to wear religious head coverings as part of a police uniform.

title: Law Enforcement Unit Accreditation and Standards
author: ['Anwar (D)', 'Meskers (D)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement unit accreditation and standards, allows law enforcement units to comply with either the standards of the Police Officer Standards and Training Council or the Commission on Accreditation for Law Enforcement Agencies.

title: Track and Trace Cellular Phones
author: ['Cohen (D)']
summary: Allows law enforcement the ability to track and trace a cellular phone of an eighteen to twenty-year-old who is believed to be in distress or danger and still living dependently in the home of a parent or guardian.

title: Police Accountability Act
author: ['Sampson (R)']
summary: Repeals certain provisions of PA 20-1 of the July special session, also known as the Police Accountability Act, repeals certain restrictions on law enforcement and protect officers and municipalities from frivolous lawsuits.

title: Community Crisis Response Teams and Reentry Centers
author: ['Looney (D)']
summary: Concerns community crisis response teams, reentry centers and police officer training.

title: Police Accountability Act
author: ['Kelly (R)']
summary: Makes revisions to public act 20-1 of the July special session, known as the Police Accountability Act.

title: Study of the Impact of Police Accountability Measures
author: ['Somers (R)']
summary: Studies the impact of Public Act 20-1, an Act Concerning Police Accountability, on municipalities.

title: Study of the Crisis Intervention Training
author: ['Cohen (D)']
summary: Requires a study of the crisis intervention training required by the state police academy and police officer standards and training council, recognizes that incidences related to mental health are on the rise and to provide law enforcement officers with the tools they need for mental health awareness and crisis intervention.

title: Elected and Appointed Constables
author: ['Kissel (R)']
summary: Concerns elected and appointed constables as law enforcement officials during a state or national emergency, allows constables to be classified as law enforcement during state and national emergencies for certain purposes.

title: Police Officer Standards and Training Council
author: ['Somers (R)']
summary: Allows the Police Officer Standards and Training Council to create a standardized state wide curriculum, protects against frivolous lawsuits, allows public safety officials to enforce laws and confiscate illegal drugs and weapons, creates a working reasonableness standard for the use of force by police officers, sufficiently prepare municipalities, insurers and insured.

title: Police Accountability Act
author: ['Osten (D)']
summary: Makes changes to the Police Accountability Act.

title: Criminal Justice Commission Division
author: ['Joint Judiciary']
summary: Concerns the Criminal Justice Commission, Division of Criminal Justice and the Office of the Inspector General, makes minor changes to the process of appointments, reviews and evaluations by the Criminal Justice Commission including concerning the appointment of the Inspector General, the membership of the Division of Criminal Justice Advisory Board, and the process by which use of force by a peace officer is investigated.

title: Immunity From Civil Liability
author: ['Joint Judiciary']
summary: Provides immunity to a physician who accompanies and assists a state, regional or municipal swat team.

title: Social Media Policies for Police Departments
author: ['Joint Public Safety and Security']
summary: Requires social media policies for police departments, requires the Police Officer Standards and Training Council to develop a model social media policy for police departments and to require police departments to adopt such model policy or a policy with higher standards.

title: Use of Mobile Telephones By Emergency Personnel
author: ['Joint Public Safety and Security']
summary: Concerns the use of mobile telephones by emergency personnel, prohibits emergency personnel from using a hand-held mobile telephone when operating a motor vehicle upon a highway, and a state police officer from using a mobile telephone when providing police services for private contractors at highway construction sites.

title: Use of Opioid Antagonists
author: ['Joint Public Safety and Security']
summary: Concerns the use of opioid antagonists and epinephrine cartridge injectors by police officers, requires a law enforcement unit to train its police officers in the use of opioid antagonists and epinephrine cartridge injectors, and permit such trained officers to carry and administer opioid antagonists and epinephrine cartridge injectors.

title: Civilian Police Review Boards Worn
author: ['Joint Judiciary']
summary: Concerning civilian police review boards, security guards, body-worn recording equipment and searches by police, provides that the person to whom such subpoena is issued may, not later than fifteen days after service of such subpoena, or on or before the time specified in the subpoena for compliance if such time is less than fifteen days after service.

title: Deprivation of Constitutional Rights
author: ['Rebimbas (R)']
summary: Concerns the deprivation of constitutional rights by state elected officials, ensures state elected officials are held to the same standard as police officers in protecting the Constitutional rights of state residents.

title: Opioid Overdose Response
author: ['Buckbee (R)']
summary: Concerns a study of technology that police officers, firefighters and emergency medical services personnel may use when responding to opioid overdoses.

title: Number Plate Scanning Technology
author: ['Fishbein (R)']
summary: Protects state residents from an unreasonably long retention of information collected by law enforcement units using infrared number plate scanning technology.

title: Training and Liability of Lake Patrolmen
author: ['Callahan (R)']
summary: Concerns the training and liability of lake patrolmen, ensures lake patrolmen receive adequate training to protect themselves and properly enforce boating Laws.

title: Opioid Abuse and Addiction
author: ['Green (R)']
summary: Creates a partnership between the Division of State Police, the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services and mental health authorities regarding care of people addicted to opioids, combats opioid abuse and addiction.

title: State Wide Policy for Pursuits by Police Officers
author: ['Green (R)']
summary: Allows police officers to more effectively apprehend a person suspected of stealing a motor vehicle.

title: Task Force to Study Use of Global Positioning Systems
author: ['Buckbee (R)']
summary: Creates a task force to study the use of global positioning systems and other technologies in order to track drug overdoses and assist first responders.

title: Off Duty Police Officers and Firearms
author: ['Fishbein (R)']
summary: Allows off-duty police officers to carry firearms used in the performance of official duties on school grounds.

title: Federal 1033 Program
author: ['Ferraro (R)']
summary: Allows municipal law enforcement's continued access to the federal 1033 program for emergency response, relief and rescue services.

title: Transportation of Police Dogs By Ambulance
author: ['Hampton (D)']
summary: Provides for the safety and well-being of police dogs by allowing an ambulance to transport a police dog injured in the line of duty and in need of emergency medical care to a veterinary clinic or similar facility if there are no individuals in need of transportation or emergency assistance.

title: Emergency Intervention By a Police Officer
author: ['Hall (R)']
summary: Concerns emergency intervention by a police officer when a person suffers an overdose, allows a police officer to take a person into custody when the officer has reasonable cause to believe that such person is experiencing a drug overdose.

title: Expansion of the Crisis Initiative Pilot Program
author: ['Candelora (R)']
summary: Concerns the expansion of the crisis initiative pilot program throughout the state and the emergency intervention by a police officer when a person suffers an opioid overdose.

title: Reimbursement for Required Body and Dashboard Cameras
author: ['Mushinsky (D)']
summary: Concerns reimbursement for required body and dashboard cameras, assists the municipalities in meeting expenses of public act 20-1 of the July special session, also known as the Police Accountability Act.

title: Police Accountability Legislation
author: ['Candelora (R)']
topics: ['Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Revises the police accountability legislation in order to restore the due process rights of peace officers entrusted to enforce our laws and protect public safety.

title: Police Officer Harassment
author: ['Pavalock (R)']
summary: Increases the penalty for intimidating or harassing a police officer.

title: Police Department Access To Opioid Antagonists
author: ['Paolillo (D)']
summary: Concerns Police Department access to opioid antagonists such as narcan, helps increase the availability of opioid antagonists, such as Narcan, to Police Departments to help save lives.

title: Racial Profiling Prohibition
author: ['Walker (D)']
summary: Extends the provisions of the Alvin W. Penn Racial Profiling Prohibition Act to cover all police stops, including pedestrian stops, in order to give a full and complete picture of any and all racial profiling taking place in the state.

title: Motor Vehicle Searches and Use of Force
author: ['Barry (D)']
summary: Repeals provisions governing search of a motor vehicle by law enforcement officers, delays the effective date of changes to provisions governing use of force by police officers in order to provide sufficient time for police officers to be trained and delay the effective date of provisions regarding civil suits for deprivation of equal protection of the laws of the state committed by police officers in order to fully analyze the effects of the provisions on municipalities.

title: Police Body and Dashboard Camera Data Storage
author: ['Rojas (D)']
summary: Reduces the cost to municipalities of storing data from police body and dashboard cameras.

title: Notations in Law Enforcement Databases
author: ['Winkler (D)']
summary: Concerns notations in law enforcement databases regarding people who may inadvertently respond inappropriately to commands from law enforcement officers, helps prevent misunderstandings in interactions with law enforcement officers that may result in the use of force.

title: Reimbursement to Municipalities
author: ['DiGiovancarlo (D)']
summary: Concerns reimbursement to municipalities when motor vehicle infractions, provides municipalities with a portion of the fine associated with a nolled motor vehicle infraction and to assist municipal police departments with funding and the costs associated with implementing the provisions of public act 20-1 of the July special session.

title: Use of No Knock Warrants
author: ['Hall J (D)']
summary: Prohibits the use of no knock warrants.

title: Public Safety Telecommunicators
author: ['Riley (D)']
summary: Classifies public safety telecommunicators and dispatchers as first responders.

title: Workers Compensation Coverage for First Responders
author: ['Bolinsky (R)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Expands workers' compensation coverage for additional first responders and other personnel suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder.

title: Police Officer Conduct
author: ['McGorty (R)']
summary: Concerns the prohibition on employment of police officers who were terminated for or resigned or retired while under investigation for certain conduct, grants due process protections and the opportunity for relief from the prohibition on future employment as a police officer to officers who were previously terminated, or who resigned or retired while under investigation, for malfeasance or other serious misconduct calling into question such person's fitness to serve as a police officer.

title: Law Enforcement Unit Accreditation and Standards
author: ['Kavros DeGraw (D)']
summary: Allows law enforcement units to comply with accreditation standards in a manner that is cost efficient to municipalities.

title: Civilian Police Review Boards
author: ['McGee (D)']
summary: Grants policy implementation authority to municipal civilian police review boards.

title: Law Enforcement Support Office Program Account
author: ["Joint Cmt on Veterans' Affairs"]
summary: Establishes a law enforcement support office program account.

title: Use of Force By a Peace Officer
author: ['Joint Judiciary']
summary: Concerns use of force by a peace officer, provides that the peace officer reasonably determined that there are no available reasonable alternatives to the use of deadly physical force.

title: Mental Health Data
author: ['Joint Public Safety and Security']
topics: ['Training', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Technology', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns accreditation, reporting requirements, mental health, data storage services and training of law enforcement officers, revises the requirements regarding the accreditation of law enforcement units, study ways to lower the costs associated with data storage or services related to body-worn recording equipment, require police officers receive training regarding interactions with persons with mental or physical disabilities.

title: Police Officers
author: ['Joint Public Safety and Security']
summary: Concerns the prohibition against hiring police officers dismissed for malfeasance or who resigned or retired while under investigation.

title: Police Strategies and Programs.
summary: Modernizes police strategies and programs.

title: Police Accountability
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force']
summary: Concerns police accountability.

title: Law Enforcement Appreciation Day Resolution
author: ['Pettyjohn (R)', 'Lopez (R)', 'Vanderwende (R)', 'Smith M (R)', 'Morris (R)', 'Postles (R)', 'Collins (R)', 'Richardson (R)', 'Yearick (R)', 'Townsend (D)', 'Bonini (R)', 'Spiegelman (R)', 'Smyk (R)', 'Gray (R)', 'Osienski (D)', 'Wilson (R)', 'Short D (R)', 'Mitchell (D)', 'Hocker (R)']
summary: Recognizes January 9, 2021, as Law Enforcement Appreciation Day in Delaware.

title: Police Training Program
status: Pending - House Public Safety and Homeland Security Committee
author: ['Yearick (R)']
summary: Employs a police officer who has within 2 years completed mandatory training while in the employ of another municipality or governmental unit, the new employer reimburses the prior employer, changes the reimbursement if the change of employment occurs within 4 years, and changes the yearly rate of reimbursement to reflect the new time period to for one year, for two years, for three, and for four years.

title: Supplemental Appropriation Grant
author: ['McDowell (D)', 'Ennis (D)', 'Carson (D)', 'Jaques (D)', 'Johnson S (D)', 'Bolden (D)', 'Lawson (R)', 'Paradee (D)', 'Hensley (R)', 'Richardson (R)', 'Sturgeon (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force']
summary: Provides supplementary appropriations to certain grants-in-aid for Fiscal Year 2021.

title: Aggravated Strangulation Crime
summary: Creates the crime of aggravated strangulation, relates to a person being guilty of aggravated strangulation, if the person is a law enforcement officer, and while acting within the person's official capacity as a law enforcement officer, knowingly or intentionally uses a chokehold on another person.

title: Child Custodial Interrogations
author: ['Minor-Brown (D)', 'Bolden (D)', 'Chukwuocha (D)', 'Cooke (D)', 'Johnson (D)', 'Walker (D)', 'Brown (D)', 'Lockman (D)']
summary: Requires that custodial interrogations of children, at a place of detention, by a law enforcement officer, be electronically recorded, requires the law enforcement officer to prepare a written explanation if the interrogation is not electronically recorded.

title: Police Reform Commission Extension
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: Amends the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Second Temporary Amendment Act, extends the report submission and sunset dates of the Police Reform Commission.

title: Emergency Declaration Resolution
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: Declares the existence of an emergency, due to congressional review, with respect to the need to amend the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Second Temporary Amendment Act of 2020 to extend the report submission and sunset dates of the Police Reform Commission.

title: White Supremacy in Policing Prevention
author: ['George (D)']
summary: Requires the Office of the District of Columbia Auditor to initiate an assessment into any ties between white supremacist or other hate groups and members of the Metropolitan Police Department that suggest an individual cannot enforce the law fairly and to recommend reforms to Metropolitan Police Department policy, practice, and personnel to better detect and prevent ties to white supremacist or other hate groups in the Department that may prevent fair enforcement of the law.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force']
summary: (Introduced) Provides, on an emergency basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: (Enrolled) Provides, on an emergency basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

title: Area Transit Authority Police Accountability
author: ['Mendelson (D)']
summary: Amends the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Regulation Compact to prohibit the use of enforcement quotas for the Metro Transit Police Department and to create a multijurisdictional Civilian Complaint Board to review complaints against Metro Transit Police Department members.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: Provides, due to congressional review, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors.

title: Police Department Overtime Spending
author: ['Nadeau (D)']
summary: Requires, on a temporary basis, the Metropolitan Police Department to provide a written report on its overtime pay spending to the Council, requires those reports to include the amount spent year-to-date on overtime pay and describe the staffing plan and conditions justifying the overtime pay.

title: Police Reform Commission
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: Amends, on a temporary basis, the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Second Temporary Amendment Act of 2020 to extend the report submission and sunset dates of the Police Reform Commission, amends the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2020 to make conforming changes.

title: Internationally Banned Chemical Weapon Prohibition
status: Pending - Judiciary and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Nadeau (D)']
summary: (Introduced) Amends the First Amendment Rights and Police Standards Act to prohibit the use of chemical irritants at First Amendment assemblies.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: (Introduced) Provides, on an emergency basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: (Introduced) Provides, on a temporary basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: (Enrolled) Provides, on an emergency basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: (Enrolled) Provides, on a temporary basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

title: Emergency Declaration Resolution
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: (Introduced) Declares the existence of an emergency with respect to the need to provide for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
status: Pending - Judiciary and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Allen (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: (Introduced) Provides for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

title: Area Transit Authority Police Accountability
author: ['Mendelson (D)']
summary: Amends the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Regulation Compact to prohibit the use of enforcement quotas for the Metro Transit Police Department and to create a multijurisdictional Civilian Complaint Board to review complaints against Metro Transit Police Department members.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Provides, due to congressional review, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors.

title: Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: Declares the existence of an emergency, due to congressional review, with respect to the need to provide for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

title: Police Reform Commission
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: Amends, on an emergency basis, the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Second Temporary Amendment Act of 2020 to extend the report submission and sunset dates of the Police Reform Commission, amends the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2020 to make conforming changes.

title: Emergency Declaration Resolution
author: ['Allen (D)']
summary: Declares the existence of an emergency with respect to the need to amend the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Second Temporary Amendment Act of 2020 to extend the report submission and sunset dates of the Police Reform Commission, amends the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2020 to make conforming changes.

title: Drones
author: ['Wright (R)']
summary: Relates to drones, expands the authorized uses of drones by law enforcement agencies, by a state agency or political subdivision, or by certified fire department personnel for specified purposes.

title: Enhanced Penalties for Assault or Battery
status: Pending - House Criminal Justice Public Safety Subcommittee
author: ['Gottlieb (D)', 'Grieco (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Tant (D)']
summary: Relates to enhanced penalties for assault or battery, revises provisions on reclassification of assault or battery of specified officers to include family or household members of certain persons, prohibits an assault or battery on specified courtroom personnel and their family or household members.

title: Behavioral Health Services
status: Pending - House Children, Families & Seniors Subcommittee
author: ['Fetterhoff (R)']
summary: Relates to behavioral health services for defendants with mental illness, exempts certain fiscally constrained counties from local match requirements for specified grants, creates pilot programs in certain counties for specified purposes and number of years, requires sheriffs offices in such counties to establish law enforcement behavioral health intervention units, provides training and program requirements, requires annual reports, provides expiration dates for pilot programs.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - House Criminal Justice Public Safety Subcommittee
author: ['Gregory (R)', 'Grieco (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Relates to Law Enforcement Officers, includes service as law enforcement officer as ground for reclassification of certain criminal offenses on basis of prejudice against victim, authorizes crisis intervention training for law enforcement officers.

title: Statewide Police Misconduct Registry
author: ['Thompson (D)', 'Smith (D)', 'Driskell (D)', 'Eskamani (D)', 'Joseph (D)', 'Chambliss (D)']
summary: Relates to statewide police misconduct registry, requires Department of Law Enforcement (FLDE) to establishes and maintain statewide police misconduct registry, specifies information that registry must contain, requires head of each state and local law enforcement agency to periodically submit specified information.

title: Involuntary Examinations of Minors
author: ['Plasencia (R)', 'Driskell (D)', 'Eskamani (D)', 'LaMarca (R)', 'Valdes (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Hunschofsky (D)', 'Maney (R)', 'Morales (D)', 'Salzman (R)', 'Tant (D)']
summary: Relates to involuntary examinations of minors, revises certain notification requirements that must be met before a minor is removed from school, school transportation, or school sponsored activity for involuntary examination, provides exceptions, revises certain data reporting requirements for Department of Children and Families and Office of Safe Schools, creates certain reporting requirements for schools, revises training requirements for school safety officers.

title: Investigations of Officer Involved Deaths
author: ['Bracy (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to investigations of officer involved deaths, requires that each law enforcement agency have a written policy regarding the investigation of officer involved deaths, authorizes internal investigations under certain circumstances, authorizes compensation for certain investigations to be determined in a manner consistent with mutual aid agreements.

title: Citizen Review Boards
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to Citizen Review Boards.

title: Citizen Review Boards
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to citizen review boards, requires law enforcement agencies that employ law enforcement officers being investigated for use of force by a citizen review board to include a member of the citizen review board as part of the law enforcement agency investigative team, requires the county commission or other governing body of each county to establish a citizen review board with the authority and ability to independently investigate law enforcement agencies within that county.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Body and Vehicle Dash Cameras
author: ['Bracy (D)', 'Book (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officer body and vehicle dash cameras.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Data Reporting
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement agency data reporting.

title: Municipal Law Enforcement Agencies
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to municipal law enforcement agencies.

title: Use Of Force by Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to use of force by law enforcement officers.

title: Early Intervention Systems for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to early intervention systems for law enforcement officers.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Use of Force Deaths
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officer use of force deaths.

title: Officer Training for Initial Certification
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to officer training for initial certification.

title: Compensation for Victims of Excessive Use of Force
author: ['Alexander (D)', 'Eskamani (D)', 'Chambliss (D)']
summary: Relates to compensation for victims of excessive use of force by law enforcement officers, revises definition of term crime to include victims of law enforcement officers excessive use of force for purposes of Florida Crime Victims Compensation Act, provides eligibility for compensation for minor children of nondeceased victim for specified purposes, provides that specified eligibility requirements do not apply to victim of law enforcement officers excessive use of force.

title: Statewide Police Misconduct Registry
author: ['Bracy (D)']
summary: Relates to statewide police misconduct registry, requires the Department of Law Enforcement to establish by a certain date and maintain a statewide police misconduct registry, specifies information that the registry must contain on all state and local law enforcement officers, requires the head of each state and local law enforcement agency to periodically submit specified information to the department beginning on a specified date.

title: Minimum Qualifications for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['McCurdy (D)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Relates to minimum qualifications for law enforcement or correctional officers, provides additional criminal history screening standards for applicants, requires applicants to pass psychological screening and provide names of prior law enforcement agency employers, requires employers to provide certain information concerning applicants, prohibits employment of applicant until prior employers provide required information.

title: Use of Force By Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['McCurdy (D)', 'Eskamani (D)', 'Chambliss (D)']
summary: Relates to use of force by law enforcement officers, requires that court, in case involving use of force by law enforcement officer in making an arrest, make finding regarding reasonableness of officers actions and consider certain factors in doing so.

title: No-Knock Search Warrants
author: ['Benjamin (D)', 'Smith (D)', 'Eskamani (D)', 'Chambliss (D)']
summary: Relates to No-Knock Search Warrants, requires that no-knock warrants only be issued as provided in statute, limits offenses for which such warrants may be issued, provides requirements for issuance of such warrants.

title: Law Enforcement Body and Dashboard Cameras
author: ['Chambliss (D)', 'Smith (D)', 'Eskamani (D)', 'Joseph (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement body and dashboard cameras, mandates that law enforcement agencies require officers to wear and use body cameras in certain circumstances, provides an exception, mandates that law enforcement agencies require law enforcement vehicles to be equipped with and use dashboard cameras in certain circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Use of Force
author: ['Omphroy (D)', 'Hart (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officer use of force, requires law enforcement and correctional agencies to collect data concerning use of force incidents, provides for suspension of funding for local law enforcement agencies that fail to comply with data requirements, requires data to be collected in compliance with federal standards, requires Department of Law Enforcement (FLDE) to maintain statewide database with data and publish database on its website, requires Department of Law Enforcement (FLDE).

title: First Responders Mental Health Awareness Day
author: ['Perry (R)']
summary: Recognizes First Responders Mental Health Awareness Day.

title: Standards for Pursuit and Arrest of Suspects
author: ['Joseph (D)']
summary: Relates to standards for pursuit and arrest of suspects, provides addition criteria for use of force, requires law enforcement agencies to adopt standards for pursuit of different types of fleeing suspects, provides requirements for such standards.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Standards
author: ['Davis (D)', 'Driskell (D)', 'Eskamani (D)', 'Joseph (D)', 'Chambliss (D)']
