summary: Creates the Demilitarization of Policing in Act, amends the Counties Code and Municipal Code, provides that a Sheriff's department or police department may not enroll in or receive any property from any program established by the United States Department of Defense under federal law, limits home rule powers.

title: Criminal Prosecution
author: ['West (D)', 'Didech (D)', 'Robinson (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Code, provides that independent of any criminal prosecution or the result of a criminal prosecution, any person suffering injury as a result of a hate crime may bring a civil action for damages, injunction, or other appropriate relief, if the hate crime was caused by disorderly conduct committed by transmitting or causing to be transmitted in any manner to any peace officer, public officer or public employee a report to the effect that an offense will be committed.

title: Police Department Nonlethal Force Policy Act
author: ['Evans M (D)', 'Harper (D)', 'Collins (D)', 'Williams J (D)', 'Buckner (D)', 'Robinson (D)', 'Meyers-Martin (D)', 'Smith (D)', 'Slaughter (D)', 'Greenwood (D)', 'Flowers (D)', 'Ammons (D)', 'Welch (D)', 'Jones T (D)', 'Lilly (D)', 'Thapedi (D)', 'Gordon-Booth (D)', 'Ford (D)', 'Davis W (D)']
summary: Creates the Police Department Nonlethal Force Policy Act, provides that the State Police, the Secretary of the State Police Department, and each mass transit district police force, university police force, county Sheriff's office, and municipal police department of this state shall develop a plan or strategy for the use of nonlethal force on a person suspected of committing or having committed a criminal offense or resisting arrest.

title: Local Records Act
author: ['Flowers (D)']
summary: Amends the Local Records Act, provides that a Local Records Commission may not destroy public records concerning complaints alleging misconduct by law enforcement officers without prior permission from the Attorney General, provides that the requirements of the Section may not be waived or modified by a collective bargaining agreement or any other agreement, defines law enforcement officer.

title: Public Labor Relations Act
author: ['Ammons (D)']
summary: Amends the Public Labor Relations Act, provides that on or after the effective date of the amendatory Act, any provision in a collective bargaining agreement applicable to peace officers, including, but not limited to, the State Police, that does not pertain directly to wages or benefits, or both, is declared to be against public policy and unenforceable, amends the State Police Act and the Uniform Peace Officers' Disciplinary Act.

title: State Police Law
author: ['Ford (D)']
summary: Amends the Department of State Police Law of the Civil Administrative Code, provides that the Police Training Act is applicable to the training, certification, licensing, decertification, and revocation of licenses of State Police officers one year after the effective date of the amendatory Act, amends the Police Training Act, requires full time and part time police officers to be licensed rather than certified beginning one year after the effective date of the amendatory Act.

title: Police Training Act
author: ['Flowers (D)']
summary: Amends the Police Training Act, provides that the Law Enforcement Training Standards Board, police training schools approved by the Board, law enforcement agencies, and units of local government may not initiate, administer, or conduct training programs that include warrior-style training, either directly or through a third party, provides that the Board may not reimburse a law enforcement agency or unit of local government for any portion of training programs that include warrior-style training.

title: Medical Direction By Law
author: ['Flowers (D)']
summary: Creates the Medical Direction By Law Enforcement Act, provides that a law enforcement officer shall not direct or suggest to a medical professional how to medically treat an individual that is in the care of the medical professional, provides that the Section shall apply even if the medical professional was requested by a law enforcement officer to assist the individual.

title: State Finance Act
author: ['Tarver (D)']
summary: Amends the State Finance Act, modifies the allocation of moneys from the Cannabis Regulation Fund, provides that 4% of specified moneys shall be transferred to the Local Government Distributive Fund to be used for law enforcement training programs, provides that 24% of specified moneys shall be transferred to the Department of Human Services Community Services Fund to be used for specified purposes, makes conforming changes.

title: Driver Instructions of Law Enforcement Procedures
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Homeland Security & Transportation Committee
author: ['Randolph (D)']
summary: Concerns driver instructions of law enforcement procedures, requires the bureau of motor vehicles to include in any driver's manual published by the bureau, a description of law enforcement procedures during a traffic stop and actions a motorist should take during a traffic stop, including appropriate interactions with law enforcement officers.

title: Local Government Budgets
author: ['Bohacek (R)']
summary: Concerns local government budgets, provides that a local government unit may not reduce its annual budget for public safety, police, or fire services for a fiscal year by an amount in excess of the levy reduction by the unit for the fiscal year unless the unit is subject to a revenue shortfall for the fiscal year.

title: Critical Incident Stress Management Services
author: ['Crider (R)']
summary: Relates to peer support services and critical incident stress management services (CISM), provides, with certain exceptions, that written or oral communications concerning the provision of peer support services and CISM services to a first responder are confidential and may not be disclosed without the first responder's consent, provides that a first responder's communication is not confidential and may be disclosed under certain circumstances.

title: Investigators of Sexual Assault Cases
author: ['Crider (R)']
summary: Relates to investigators of sexual assault cases, requires certain training for sexual assault investigators, mandates that the law enforcement training board set specialized standards for training and investigating sexual assault cases involving adult victims.

title: Rioting Penalties
author: ['Grooms (R)']
summary: Relates to rioting, requires a person convicted of a battery against a law enforcement officer, firefighter, or emergency medical services provider to serve a specified mandatory minimum sentence, depending on the severity of the injury, and make restitution to the victim, defines tumultuous conduct and unlawful assembly for purposes of the rioting statute, and requires a person convicted of rioting to serve a specified mandatory minimum sentence, and make restitution to the victim.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Misconduct Database
author: ['Taylor (D)']
summary: Requires the law enforcement training board to establish a law enforcement misconduct database that gives the public access to information on disciplinary actions against law enforcement officers, provides that the database collects and publishes information from law enforcement agencies of certain entities, provides that the data base is limited to certain disciplinary actions.

title: Demographic Information for Traffic Stops
author: ['Taylor (D)']
summary: Relates to demographic information for traffic stops, requires law enforcement officers to record certain demographic information regarding all individuals who are subject to traffic stops, including age, gender, race, and whether those individuals are issued a citation or a warning, requires law enforcement officers to report the demographic information collected to the State Police, Department Criminal Justice Data Division, requires the division to issue a report to the legislative council.

title: Law Enforcement Training
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Corrections & Criminal Law Committee
author: ['Taylor (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement training, requires law enforcement officers to receive training in identifying, responding to, and reporting bias motivated crimes in which the person who committed a criminal offense selected the victim who was injured or whose property was damaged because of the victim's actual or perceived race, color, creed, disability, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity.

title: No Knock Warrants
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Corrections & Criminal Law Committee
author: ['Melton (D)']
summary: Relates to no knock warrants, requires a law enforcement officer serving a search or arrest warrant at a person's home to knock and announce before forcibly executing the warrant, makes conforming amendments.

title: Certification of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Taylor (D)']
summary: Relates to certification of law enforcement officers, defines Merit Board, requires a merit board to notify the the State Law Enforcement Training Board if the merit board has determined that a law enforcement officer has used excessive force against a person, requires the the State Law Enforcement Training Board to conduct a decertification hearing within 30 days of receiving notice from a merit board.

title: Use of Force
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Courts and Criminal Code Committee
author: ['Baldwin (R)']
summary: Relates to use of force, prohibits a state or local law enforcement officer from firing warning shots, allows a guard, official, or officer in a state or local penal facility to fire warning shots to prevent the escape of a person, provides the following with regard to a county, city, or town, allows an officer to use force options that are not in the unit's use of force policy in certain circumstances in which deadly force is justified.

title: State Police Officer Compensation
author: ['Houchin (R)']
summary: Relates to State Police officer compensation, provides an annual salary increase for State Police Employees, Motor Carrier Inspectors, and Capitol Police Officers, provides that the increases are equal to 50% of the average annual salary percentage increase received by those state employees of the executive branch who are under a salary plan that is substantially similar to the salary matrix adopted by the State Police Board for Peace Officers, Motor Carrier Inspectors, and Capitol Police Officers.

title: Collective Bargaining of Law Enforcement Officers
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Corrections & Criminal Law Committee
author: ['Taylor (D)']
summary: Relates to collective bargaining of law enforcement officers, requires a county, city, or town that executes a collective bargaining agreement after June 30, 2021, regarding the unit's police employees, to do the following before executing the agreement, discuss the proposed agreement at a public meeting, and publish the meeting notice and post the proposed agreement on the unit's Internet web site not later than 10 days before the public meeting.

title: Prohibited Crowd Control Practices
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Corrections & Criminal Law Committee
author: ['Melton (D)']
summary: Relates to prohibited crowd control practices, prohibits law enforcement officers from using a kinetic energy projectile or a chemical agent to disperse a lawful assembly, demonstration, protest, or other gathering of people, specifies certain requirements concerning the use of kinetic energy projectiles and chemical agents when dispersing unlawful assemblies, demonstrations, protests, or other gatherings of people.

title: Police Department Administration
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Corrections & Criminal Law Committee
author: ['Freeman (R)']
summary: Relates to police department administration, provides that the chief of a city police department or town board of metropolitan police commissioners has the sole authority to make general or special orders to the police department establishing the department's procedures and policies, including use of force policy.

title: Sharp Paraphernalia
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Corrections & Criminal Law Committee
author: ['Yoder (D)']
summary: Relates to sharp paraphernalia, defines sharp paraphernalia device and establishes a defense to possession of a sharp paraphernalia device and to possession of a residual amount of controlled substance located in a hypodermic syringe or hypodermic needle, if, before conducting a search, a law enforcement officer asks about the existence of a sharp paraphernalia device, and the person informs the law enforcement officer of the existence and location of the sharp paraphernalia device.

title: Law Enforcement Officer De Escalation Training
author: ['Steuerwald (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, requires the Indiana law enforcement training board to establish mandatory training in de-escalation as part of the use-of-force curriculum, requires de-escalation training to be provided as a part of pre-basic training, mandatory inservice training, and the executive training program, establishes a procedure to allow the Indiana law enforcement training board to decertify an officer who has committed misconduct, defines chokehold, prohibits the use of a chokehold.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Misconduct Data Base
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officer misconduct data base, requires the law enforcement training board, in consultation with the office of technology, to establish a law enforcement misconduct data base that gives the public access to information on disciplinary actions against law enforcement officers, provides that the data base collects and publishes information from law enforcement agencies of the state, political subdivisions, and public or private postsecondary educational institutions.

title: Appear for a Misdemeanor
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Courts and Criminal Code Committee
author: ['Pryor (D)']
summary: Relates to appear for a misdemeanor, provides that in lieu of arresting a person who has allegedly committed a misdemeanor in a law enforcement officer's presence, the officer shall issue a summons and promise to appear unless the person has committed a violent misdemeanor offense that involves a victim or a weapon or involves an offense related to the impaired operation of a motor vehicle, poses a safety risk to the person, the officer, or the public, or has falsely identified the person to the officer.

title: Residency of Police Officers and Firefighters
author: ['Frye (R)']
summary: Relates to residency of police officers and firefighters, revises residency requirements for members of police and fire departments to require that members: (1) have adequate means of transportation into the jurisdiction served by the member's department and (2) maintain telephone service to communicate with the department.

title: Byron Ratcliffe Sr. Racial Profiling Reform Act
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Pryor (D)']
summary: Relates to Byron Ratcliffe Sr. Racial Profiling Reform Act, honors the memory of Byron Ratcliffe Sr. by prohibiting law enforcement agencies and law enforcement officers from engaging in racial profiling or conducting unlawful pretextual stops, requiring law enforcement agencies to adopt a detailed policy that defines the elements of racial profiling and unlawful pretextual stops, requiring law enforcement agencies to collect certain data pertaining to stops made by law enforcement officers.

title: State Police Investigation of Use of Force
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Bartlett (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Relates to state police investigation of use of force, requires the State Police Department to investigate when a law enforcement officer uses force in attempting to apprehend or gain physical control of a person resulting in death or serious bodily injury to the person, requires the law enforcement agency that employs the law enforcement officer to cooperate with the department in its investigation, but not participate in the investigation, or conduct an internal administrative investigation.

title: Police Department Budgets
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Frye (R)']
summary: Relates to police department budgets, requires a police department of a county, city, or town to report crime data to the criminal justice division of the state police department, prohibits a unit from reducing the police department's budget except in circumstances of a unit that has a shortfall in property tax revenue within the two calendar years preceding the most recent certified budget and decreases the budgets of all of its departments by the same percentage for the ensuing year.

title: Annual Review of Law Enforcement Actions for Bias
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to annual review of law enforcement actions for bias, provides that the chief executive officer of a law enforcement department or agency in the state shall be the officer in charge of an investigation when there is a complaint made against, or an internal investigation of, as law enforcement officer involving bias or prejudice.

title: Public Safety Matching Grant Fund
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Steuerwald (R)']
summary: Relates to public safety matching grant fund, provides for the establishment of the Indiana Public Safety Training Matching Fund for the purpose of encouraging private investment in first responder training and providing financial assistance to public safety training facilities in Indiana that provide first responder integrated, coordinated, and collaborative training to law enforcement, firefighters, and emergency medical services personnel.

title: Criminal Penalties
author: ['Abbott (R)']
summary: Provides that a person who uses a vehicle to commit the offense of resisting law enforcement or interfering with public safety, and has a prior conviction for either offense that involved the use of a vehicle, commits a Level 5 felony.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Mental Health Assessment
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to mental health assessment of law enforcement officers, requires the law enforcement training board to establish psychological fitness for duty policies, procedures, and standards for law enforcement officers, specifies certain topics and issues to be considered by the board when establishing psychological fitness for duty policies, procedures, and standards, requires officers to undergo a psychological fitness for duty examination after one or more of the following events an officer's return.

title: Prohibition of Acoustic Hailing Devices
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Campbell (D)']
summary: Relates to prohibition of acoustic hailing devices, provides that a law enforcement officer may not operate an acoustic hailing device that emits at least 150 decibels of sound pressure level on any person within 100 feet of the law enforcement officer while acting in the course of the law enforcement officer's official duties, provides that a law enforcement officer may operate an acoustic hailing device if the device meets the National Institute of Occupational Safety and Health's recommended exposure.

title: Battery and Murder by Law Enforcement
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Courts and Criminal Code Committee
author: ['Bartlett (D)']
summary: Relates to battery and murder by an officer, makes the penalty for battery committed by a law enforcement officer acting within the scope of the officer's duty the same level as battery committed on a law enforcement officer, makes murder committed by a law enforcement officer acting within the scope of the officer's duty an aggravating circumstance permitting imposition of the death penalty.

title: Killing of Law Enforcement Animals
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Courts and Criminal Code Committee
author: ['Jeter (R)']
summary: Relates to killing of a law enforcement animal, increases the penalty for killing a law enforcement animal to a Level 5 felony, adds killing a law enforcement animal in the commission of a crime as an aggravating circumstance for sentencing in criminal cases.

title: Rioting and Immunity Under Tort Claims Act
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Courts and Criminal Code Committee
author: ['McNamara (R)']
summary: Relates to rioting, removes immunity under the Indiana Tort Claims Act for the failure to enforce a law if the failure to enforce the law occurs in connection with an unlawful assembly, and constitutes gross negligence, requires a person convicted of a battery against a law enforcement officer, firefighter, or emergency medical services provider to serve a mandatory minimum sentence of a specified number of days, depending on the severity of the injury, and make restitution to the victim.

title: Court Fees for the Law Enforcement Academy
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Courts and Criminal Code Committee
author: ['Mayfield (R)']
summary: Relates to court fees for the law enforcement academy, creates a new court fee of a specified dollar amount per case that applies to criminal, pretrial diversion, infraction, and ordinance violation actions, provides that the fee is dedicated to supporting the law enforcement academy fund, makes conforming amendments.

title: Statewide Citizen Review Commission
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Porter (D)']
summary: Relates to statewide citizen review commission, creates a statewide citizen review commission as an independent state agency that investigates and reviews all incidents involving a local law enforcement officer's use of force in attempting to apprehend or gain physical control of a person resulting in the person's death, and citizen complaints involving local law enforcement officer misconduct that are unresolved by the officer's department.

title: State Police Officer Salary Increases
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Bartlett (D)']
summary: Relates to state police officer salary increases, provides annual raises of a specified percentage amount for state police officers.

title: Law Enforcement Academy Funding
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Abbott (R)']
summary: Relates to Law Enforcement Academy Funding, increases the insurance premiums tax from a specified percentage, transfers the money received from the increase in the tax to the law enforcement academy fund, amends the fund provisions to allow the law enforcement training board to use money in the fund for capital projects, technology equipment and services, and curriculum development for a Law Enforcement Academy, specifies that money in the fund at the end of a state fiscal year does not revert to the state.

title: Police Dashboard and Body Cameras
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Harris (D)']
summary: Relates to police dashboard and body cameras, requires local law enforcement agencies and certain state law enforcement agencies to provide, maintain, and use body cameras and onboard recorders, requires the law enforcement training board to adopt rules not later than a specified date, governing the use and maintenance of body cameras and onboard recorders by local law enforcement agencies and certain state law enforcement agencies, allows the board to adopt emergency rules.

title: Citizen Review Board
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Smith V (D)']
summary: Relates to Citizen Review Board, requires counties, and municipalities that have police departments, establishes a Citizen Review Board not later than a specified date, to review complaints filed by citizens having personal knowledge of alleged misconduct by a police officer.

title: Public Safety Funding
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Local Government Committee
author: ['Ellington (R)']
summary: Relates to public safety funding, relates to police department budgets.

title: Police Department Administration
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Speedy (R)']
summary: Relates to Police Department Administration, provides that the chief of a city police department or town board of metropolitan police commissioners has the sole authority to make general or special orders to the police department establishing the department's procedures and policies, including use of force policy, provides that the city or town may not prohibit or restrict a member of the police department from using a force option consistent with the standards and training.

title: Criminal Justice and Mental Health
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Public Health Committee
author: ['Johnson (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to criminal justice and mental health, provides that a hospital police officer may, within one year after being appointed as a hospital police officer, complete training to become a crisis intervention team trained officer, provides that the governing board of the hospital shall require an individual appointed as a hospital police officer to annually attend inservice training courses approved by the governing board of the hospital, including training courses on verbal deescalation skills.

title: Investigations of Police Officers
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Pryor (D)']
summary: Relates to investigations of police officers, requires the State Police department to investigate when a law enforcement officer uses force in attempting to apprehend or gain physical control of a person resulting in death or serious bodily injury to the person, requires the law enforcement agency that employs the law enforcement officer to cooperate with the department in its investigation, but not to participate in the investigation, or conduct an internal administrative investigation.

title: Mental Health Identification Bracelet
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Miller (R)']
summary: Relates to mental health and law enforcement, requires the Division of Mental Health and Addiction, upon request, to issue a bracelet, an identification card, or both, indicating that an individual has been medically diagnosed with a mental illness, a substance addiction disorder, or both, allows the division to charge a fee for the bracelet and identification card, provides that the information collected by the division is confidential and establishes requirements before information may be released.

title: Police Misconduct Complaint Process
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Summers (D)']
summary: Relates to police misconduct complaint process, requires the Attorney General to establish not later than January 1, 2022, an online portal and telephone hotline to receive complaints regarding police officer misconduct, including anonymous complaints, requires a county, city, or town that has a police department to adopt an ordinance establishing an accountability office that is not a part of the police department, and receives and investigates police misconduct complaints, including anonymous complaints.

title: Law Enforcement Performance Audits
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Porter (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement performance audits, establishes the Law Enforcement Performance Audit Pilot Program to ensure that law enforcement agencies do not engage in discriminatory hiring practices or the use of excessive force.

title: Mental Health Professionals
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Public Health Committee
author: ['Harris (D)']
summary: Relates to mental health professionals, allows a political subdivision, in consultation with the technical assistance center, to contract with mental health providers for the purpose of supplementing existing crisis intervention teams with mental health professionals, specifies certain eligibility requirements for mental health professionals seeking an appointment to a crisis intervention team.

title: Alzheimer's and Other Forms of Dementia
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Public Health Committee
author: ['Manning (R)']
summary: Relates to Alzheimer's and other forms of dementia, specifies training requirements concerning Alzheimer's disease and other dementia for law enforcement officers, requires training and continuing education requirements concerning Alzheimer's disease and other dementia for emergency medical responders, requires the state Department of Health to develop a strategic plan concerning dementia in the State and employ a dementia coordinator.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Goodrich (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, provides that a grant may be awarded to a law enforcement agency for a law enforcement officer in an upper level position to attend a deescalation training course, and establish a deescalation training program, based on the training received during the deescalation training course that is offered to law enforcement officers employed by the law enforcement agency, establishes the deescalation training fund.

title: Interim Study Committee on Special Prosecutor
author: ['Bolkcom (D)']
summary: Establishes an interim study committee to review and develop recommendations for the appointment of a special prosecutor for incidents involving the use of deadly force by a peace officer.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Hunter (D)']
summary: Requires certain peace officers, including tribal law enforcement officers, to wear and use a body camera and providing remedies.

title: Sexual Misconduct by Peace Officer
author: ['Kinney (D)']
summary: Relates to sexual misconduct by a peace officer with offenders and juveniles in the peace officer's custody and providing penalties.

title: Establishment of a Jail Diversion Program
author: ['Jacoby (D)']
summary: Provides for a study regarding the possible establishment of a jail diversion program for offenders with a mental illness.

title: Officer Disciplinary Actions
author: ['Public Safety Cmt']
summary: Relates to officer disciplinary actions.

title: Law Enforcement Profiling
author: ['Hunter (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement profiling by standardizing collection and centralizing the compilation and reporting of officer stop and compliance data, provides for officer training, creating a community policing advisory board, provides for penalties and remedies, includes effective date provisions.

title: Sexual Misconduct by a Peace Officer
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to sexual misconduct by a peace officer with offenders and juveniles in the peace officer's custody and provides penalties.

title: Officer Disciplinary Actions
author: ['Nunn (R)']
summary: Relates to officer disciplinary actions.

title: Law Enforcement Profiling
author: ['Bolkcom (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Relates to law enforcement profiling by standardizing collection and centralizing the compilation and reporting of officer stop and compliance data, provides for officer training, creating a community policing advisory board, provides for penalties and remedies, includes effective date provisions.

title: Public Safety and Law Enforcement Matters
author: ['Jacobsen (R)']
summary: Relates to certain public safety and law enforcement matters, including creating the crime of violent or disorderly assembly, provides penalties.

title: Public Records
author: ['Public Safety Cmt']
summary: Relates to public records including confidentiality, access, and the enforcement of public records violations, and uniform commercial code filings, provides for certain employment matters including benefits, workers' compensation, civil actions, and civil immunity, law enforcement including law enforcement officer rights, eluding law enforcement, and carrying firearms, provides penalties.

title: Officer Disciplinary Actions
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to officer disciplinary actions.

title: Law Enforcement Profiling
author: ['Mascher (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement profiling by standardizing collection and centralizing the compilation and reporting of officer stop and compliance data, provides for officer training, creating a community policing advisory board, provides for penalties and remedies, includes effective date provisions.

title: Qualified Immunity of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['State Government Cmt']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to qualified immunity of law enforcement officers, the peace officer, public safety, and emergency personnel bill of rights, uniform commercial code filings, and protected information of law enforcement officers and state or federal judicial officers and prosecutors.

title: Law Enforcement and Criminal Offenses
author: ['Garrett (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement and certain criminal offenses, and provides penalties.

title: Public Records
author: ['Public Safety Cmt']
summary: Relates to public records including confidentiality, access, and the enforcement of public records violations, and uniform commercial code filings, certain employment matters including benefits, workers' compensation, civil actions, and civil immunity, law enforcement including law enforcement officer rights, eluding law enforcement, and carrying firearms, provides penalties.

title: Civil Action Relating to Harassment
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Creates a civil action relating to harassment by the reporting of false information to law enforcement authority.

title: Open Records Peace Officers Investigative Reports
author: ['Iowa Public Information Board']
summary: Relates to open records peace officers' investigative reports.

title: Qualified Immunity of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['State Government Cmt']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to qualified immunity of law enforcement officers, the peace officer, public safety, and emergency personnel bill of rights, and protected information of law enforcement officers and state or federal judicial officers and prosecutors.

title: Peace Officer Bill of Rights
author: ['Public Safety Cmt']
summary: Relates to peace officer bill of rights.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Public Safety Cmt']
summary: Relates to law enforcement.

title: Blue Alert Program
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Creates a blue alert program within the Department of Public Safety for the apprehension of a person suspected of killing or seriously injuring a peace officer in the line of duty or due to safety concerns for a peace officer missing while on duty.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Whitver (R)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, including the certification, training, and prosecution of peace officers and the use of chokeholds by peace officers, includes effective date and retroactive applicability provisions.

title: Annual Reports Submitted by Law Enforcement Agencies
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Public Safety Committee
author: ['Smith M (D)']
summary: Relates to annual reports submitted by law enforcement agencies to the attorney general regarding information collected during traffic, bicycle, or pedestrian stops.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Windschitl (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to peace officers, including the certification, training, prosecution of peace officers, and the use of chokeholds by peace officers.

title: Newly Certified Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Faust-Goudeau (D)']
summary: Requires newly certified law enforcement officers to attend diversity meetings organized by the Kansas Commission on Peace Officers' standards and training.

title: Public Officer Corruption
author: ['Holland (D)']
summary: Requires the Attorney General to carry out certain duties related to investigating corruption committed by a public officer or public employee.

title: Racial Profiling Data Collection And Reporting
author: ['Haley (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to increase data collection and reporting on racial profiling and other biased policing.

title: Open Records Act
author: ['Haley (D)']
summary: Amends Open Records Act provisions, regards access to certain law enforcement audio and video recordings, enacts the Police and Citizen Protection Act, regards use of body cameras by law enforcement officers.

title: Criminal Justice Reform Measures
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Standards']
summary: Enacts criminal justice reform measures, relates to hiring, firearms certification and psychological testing of law enforcement officers.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Hiring
author: ['Federal and State Affairs Cmt']
summary: Prohibits the hiring of certain law enforcement officers with history of serious misconduct allegations, makes certain law enforcement disciplinary records public records.

title: Training For Law Enforcement Agencies
author: ['Victors (D)', 'Haswood (D)']
summary: Provides for the Attorney General to coordinate training for law enforcement agencies on missing and murdered indigenous people.

title: Private Property Protection
author: ['Corbet (R)']
summary: Protects private property from unauthorized access by certain government officials and unauthorized surveillance.

title: Eluding Police With a Stolen Vehicle
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Increases criminal penalties for fleeing or attempting to elude a police officer when operating a stolen vehicle, makes fleeing or attempting to elude a police officer evidence of intent to commit theft of a vehicle.

title: Search Warrant Executions By Law Enforcement
status: Pending - House Corrections and Juvenile Justice Committee
author: ['Fairchild (R)', 'Finney (D)', 'Houser (R)', 'Parker (D)', 'Xu (D)', 'Murphy (R)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer executing a search warrant at residential premises to be uniformed and to knock and announce themselves before entering the property.

title: Wildlife Simulated Device By Law Enforcement
author: ['Agriculture Cmt']
summary: Makes it unlawful to take a wildlife simulated device being used by a law enforcement officer for the purpose of enforcing the wildlife laws of this state.

title: Workers Compensation Benefits For First Responders
status: Pending - House Commerce, Labor and Economic Development Committee
author: ['Federal and State Affairs Cmt']
summary: Provides workers compensation benefits for first responders suffering from post traumatic stress disorder.

title: Hire of Certain Law Enforcement Officers
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Corrections and Juvenile Justice Committee
author: ['Holscher (D)']
summary: Prohibits hire of certain law enforcement officers with history of serious misconduct allegations, makes certain law enforcement disciplinary records public records.

title: Police Brutality and Racial Profiling
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Federal and State Affairs Committee
author: ['Xu (D)']
summary: Condemns all acts of police brutality, racial profiling and the use of excessive and militarized force throughout the country.

title: Warrants Authorizing Entry Without Notice
author: ['Stivers (R)']
summary: Creates procedures and requirements for issuance of warrants authorizing entry without notice, requires judges to review applications for warrants impartially, requires service by SWAT or special response teams with special training, makes clear that an officer's false statement in an application for a warrant authorizing entry without notice constitutes perjury, proposes a rule of evidence making inadmissible any evidence collected as the result of a warrant authorizing entry without notice.

title: Severe Mental Illness Task Force
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Committee on Committees Committee
author: ['Moser (R)']
summary: Creates the Severe Mental Illness Task Force to study the provision of mental health services to adults with a severe mental illness, outlines membership, requires the Task Force to meet monthly during the 2021 Interim and to submit findings and recommendations to the Legislative Research Commission by a specified date.

title: Public Protection
author: ['Scott (D)']
summary: Requires peace officers to give notice before entering a premises to execute a search warrant, requires officers to activate body worn cameras when serving a warrant, creates processes for enforcement.

title: Public Protection
author: ['Scott (D)']
summary: Requires peace officers to give notice before entering a premises to execute a search warrant, requires officers to activate body worn cameras when serving a warrant, creates processes for enforcement.

title: Mental Health
author: ['Banta (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Makes firefighters eligible for crisis intervention team training along with law enforcement officers currently permitted such training, makes an appropriation each fiscal year for treatment of full time and volunteer firefighters affected by post traumatic stress injury and post traumatic stress disorder.

title: Sexual Offenses by Peace Officers
author: ['Harper Angel (D)']
summary: Amend KRS 510.060, rape in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.090, sodomy in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to deviate sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.120, sexual abuse in the second degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual contact.

title: Custodial Interrogations by Law Enforcement
author: ['Office of Weiderstein']
summary: Creates new sections of KRS Chapter 15 to define terms related to the electronic recording of custodial interrogations, requires law enforcement officers to electronically record custodial interrogations, specifies that law enforcement officers conducting custodial interrogations are not required to obtain consent from the individual being interrogated.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Office of Danny Carroll']
summary: Amends KRS 15.391 to amend the definition of professional malfeasance and professional nonfeasance, adds grounds for the revocation of peace officer certification, provides that the council may impose any reasonable condition upon the reinstatement of certification and provide subpoena power to the council, amends KRS 15.392 to remove reference to KRS 15.386.

title: Sexual Offenses by Peace Officers
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Roberts (D)']
summary: Amends KRS 510.060, rape in the third degree to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.090, sodomy in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to deviate sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.120, sexual abuse in the second degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual contact.

title: Certified Constables and Certified Deputy Constables
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Committee on Committees Committee
author: ['Mills (R)']
summary: Establishes the status of certified constables and certified deputy constables, requires mandatory annual training for constables and deputy constables, requires the Kentucky Constable Association to develop and maintain in-service education courses, offered at night and on weekends throughout the year in various regions across the Commonwealth, requires courses to include firearms qualification, emergency vehicle operations, and defensive driving.

title: Mental Health
author: ['Banta (R)']
summary: Makes firefighters eligible for crisis intervention team training along with law enforcement officers currently permitted such training, makes an appropriation each fiscal year for treatment of full time and volunteer firefighters affected by post traumatic stress injury and post traumatic stress disorder.

title: Public Records
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate State and Local Government Committee
author: ['Carroll D (R)']
summary: Excludes from the Open Records Act photographs or videos that depict a person's death, killing, rape, or sexual assault or abuse, cites as the Bailey Holt-Preston Cope Victims Privacy Act.

title: Local Government
author: ['Schroder (R)']
summary: Requires the Cabinet for Health and Family Services to promulgate regulations regarding splash pads that are operated by local governments, allows peace officers in cities of the home rule class to be scheduled for 80 hours or less in a work period of 14 consecutive days under specified conditions, directs that the relevant provisions of KRS Chapter 309 supersede specified local government regulations on massage therapists, relates to the investment of moneys subject to various governing jurisdictions.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Office of Danny Carroll']
summary: Amends KRS 15.391 to amend the definition of professional malfeasance and professional nonfeasance, adds grounds for the revocation of peace officer certification, provides that the council may impose any reasonable condition upon the reinstatement of certification and provide subpoena power to the council, amends KRS 15.392 to remove reference to KRS 15.386.

title: Sexual Offenses by Peace Officers
author: ['Roberts (D)']
summary: Amends KRS 510.060, rape in the third degree to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.090, sodomy in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to deviate sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.120, sexual abuse in the second degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual contact.

title: First Responders
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Carpenter (R)']
summary: Creates the misdemeanor of unauthorized capture of photographic or videographic images by a first responder.

title: Peace Officer Hours of Work
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Kulkarnir (D)']
summary: Allows peace officers in cities of the home rule class to be scheduled for a specified number of hours or less in a work period of a specified number of consecutive days under specified conditions.

title: Revocation of Peace Officer Certification
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Veterans, Military Affairs & Public Protection Committee
author: ['McGarvey (D)']
summary: Relates to grounds for the revocation of peace officer certification, to require revocation if a peace officer is convicted of domestic violence, allows revocation if a peace officer is named as an adverse party in a domestic violence order or interpersonal protective order.

title: Police Reform
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Willner (D)']
summary: Defines active denial system, chemical agent, kinetic energy projectile, and long range acoustic device, provides circumstances where a peace officer may use active denial systems, chemical agents, kinetic energy projectiles, and long-range acoustic devices on another person, requires the Kentucky Law Enforcement Council to approve de-escalation training courses for students attending law enforcement basic training, prohibits the use of certain law enforcement tactics.

title: Recording Peace Officers In Public Performance
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Willner (D)']
summary: States that photographing or recording peace officers in the public performance of their duties is not unlawful.

title: Recover Punitive Damages
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Raymond (D)']
summary: Allows parties to recover punitive damages, creates a civil cause of action for a victim who is injured, had property damaged, or had law enforcement summoned by another person because of a belief or perception of the victim's race, color, national origin, ancestry, gender, religion, religious practice, age, disability, or sexual orientation, defines public safety answering point.

title: Body Worn Cameras
author: ['Neal (D)']
summary: Requires officers to activate body-worn cameras when engaged in law enforcement activity, establishes rebuttable presumptions in investigative or legal proceedings regarding unrecorded conduct or statements, provides for release of recordings in specific circumstances and allow waiver of privacy concerns, requires law enforcement agencies to possess policies regarding body-worn cameras.

title: Public Records
author: ['Freeland (R)']
summary: Excludes from the Open Records Act photographs or videos that depict a person's death, killing, rape, or sexual assault or abuse, cites as the Bailey Holt-Preston Cope Victims Privacy Act.

title: Public Protection
author: ['Neal (D)']
summary: Limits circumstances in which a warrant may be issued authorizing entry without notice, requires creation of a warrant application form, requires reporting of data on warrants authorizing entry without notice, requires 10-second pause after announcing the presence of law enforcement officers prior to entering premises to serve a warrant, requires use of body-worn cameras by law enforcement officers serving warrants, creates processes for enforcement.

title: Peace Officer Certification
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Roberts (D)']
summary: Prohibits anyone who has been convicted of various misdemeanor offenses and inchoate offenses under KRS Chapter 510 from being certified as a peace officer, prohibits peace officers who have been convicted of various misdemeanor offenses and inchoate offenses under KRS Chapter 510 from returning to active certification from inactive status, provides that a peace officer's certification shall be revoked if he or she pleads guilty to, is convicted of, or enters an Alford plea to various misdemeanor offenses.

title: Officer Training
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Bratcher (R)']
summary: Increases the Kentucky Law Enforcement Program fund stipend to eligible officers from $4,000 to $6,000, allows participation in KLEFP by special law enforcement officers who are executing a certain function within schools July 1, 2021.

title: Severe Mental Illness Task Force
author: ['Moser (R)']
summary: Creates the Severe Mental Illness Task Force to study the provision of mental health services to adults with a severe mental illness, outlines membership, requires the Task Force to meet monthly during the 2021 Interim and to submit findings and recommendations to the Legislative Research Commission by a specified date.

title: Law Enforcement
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Scott (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Defines deadly incident, requires law enforcement agencies to adopt a written policy for mandatory drug testing of officers after the discharge of a firearm or deadly incident, requires the Kentucky Law Enforcement Council to create and maintain a database containing information relating to peace officer certification, termination, and compliance with training requirements, creates various new sections of KRS Chapter 15 to require a peace officer to report information gained during a contact with another.

title: Peace Officer Training
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Bojanowski (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement training on the link between animal abuse and interpersonal violence.

title: Kentucky State Police
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans, Military Affairs, and Public Protection Committee
author: ['Decker (R)']
summary: Permits officers and individuals employed as a Trooper R Class or CVE R Class to participate in political activities while off duty, defines what constitutes a political activity, establishes guidelines for participation.

title: Private Information of Public Officials
author: ['Blanton (R)']
summary: Relates to judges, prosecutors, and law enforcement officers from the Open Records Act, creates a new offense of disseminating personally identifiable information of a law enforcement official, makes the offense of disseminating personally identifiable information of a law enforcement official a Class A misdemeanor, unless disseminated recklessly, in which case it is a Class B misdemeanor, creates a punishment of any dissemination of personally identifiable information performed.

title: False Reporting of Claims of Abuse
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Nemes (R)']
summary: Adds false reporting of claims of abuse towards another party or de facto custodian to the list of factors a court shall consider when making a custody determination, relates to false reporting, to prohibit reports of domestic violence or sexual assault to any law enforcement officer, officer of the court, or government agency officer when the information reported is false or baseless.

title: Peace Officer Certification
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Committees on Committees Committee
author: ['Meade (R)']
summary: Removes the requirement that all mandatory training obligations must be completed for peace officers with certain law enforcement experience, requires that peace officers qualified for basic training credit meet minimum qualifications, establishes the procedure for certification reporting of peace officers who have certain law enforcement experience, waives the requirement for completing a basic training course within one year of employment for those peace officers who have received a basic training.

title: Sexual Offenses by Peace Officers
author: ['Office of Harper Angel']
summary: Amends KRS 510.060, rape in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.090, sodomy in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to deviate sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.120, sexual abuse in the second degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual contact.

title: Public Protection
author: ['Scott (D)']
summary: Requires peace officers to give notice before entering a premises to execute a search warrant, requires officers to activate body worn cameras when serving a warrant, creates processes for enforcement.

title: Custodial Interrogations by Law Enforcement
author: ['Office of Weiderstein']
summary: Creates new sections of KRS Chapter 15 to define terms related to the electronic recording of custodial interrogations, requires law enforcement officers to electronically record custodial interrogations, specifies that law enforcement officers conducting custodial interrogations are not required to obtain consent from the individual being interrogated.

title: Mental Health
author: ['Banta (R)']
summary: Makes firefighters eligible for crisis intervention team training along with law enforcement officers currently permitted such training, makes an appropriation each fiscal year for treatment of full time and volunteer firefighters affected by post traumatic stress injury and post traumatic stress disorder.

title: Sexual Offenses by Peace Officers
author: ['Roberts (D)']
summary: Amends KRS 510.060, rape in the third degree to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.090, sodomy in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to deviate sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.120, sexual abuse in the second degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual contact.

title: State Police Retirement
summary: Provides certain enhanced survivor benefits and insurance coverage for the spouses and children of members killed in the line of duty.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Fields (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Provides for responsibilities of law enforcement officers while interacting with the public.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Fields (D)', 'Carter (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Provides for responsibilities of law enforcement officers while interacting with the public.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Bernard (R)']
summary: Provides for the Peace Officer and Public Safety Personnel Peer Support and Mental Health Wellness Act.

title: Police and Municipal
author: ['Kerner (R)']
summary: Provides relative to municipal police dogs.

title: Weights and Measures
status: Pending - House Transportation, Highways & Public Works Committee
author: ['DeVillier (R)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers have reasonable belief of a weight violation prior to checking the weight of certain vehicles.

title: Police and Local
status: Pending - House Municipal, Parochial and Cultural Affairs Committee
author: ['Seabaugh (R)', 'Milligan (R)']
summary: Provides relative to employees of the Shreveport police department.

title: Law Enforce and Officers
author: ['Bacala (R)', 'James (D)', 'Jordan (D)', 'Marino (I)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Jones (D)', 'Landry M (D)', 'Fields (D)', 'Orgeron (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification']
summary: Provides relative to peace officers.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Green (D)']
summary: Provides relative to the financial security for surviving spouses and children of law enforcement officers who suffer death by heart attack or stroke.

title: Districts and Crime Prevention
author: ['Freiberg (R)']
summary: Creates the Plantation Trace Crime Prevention and Improvement District in East Baton Rouge Parish.

title: Civil Service and Fire Police
status: Pending - House Municipal, Parochial and Cultural Affairs Committee
author: ['Stagni (R)']
summary: Provides relative to the qualifications of the members of the municipal fire and police civil service board.

title: Law Enforcement and Officers
author: ['James (D)']
summary: Provides relative to the officer's bill of rights.

title: Law Enforcement
status: Pending - House House and Governmental Affairs Committee
author: ['Lyons (D)']
summary: Provides relative to body camera footage.

title: Criminal and Procedure
author: ['Emerson (R)']
summary: Provides relative to the issuance of summons by an officer in lieu of arrest.

title: Civil and Immunity
status: Pending - House Civil Law and Procedure Committee
author: ['Jordan (D)']
summary: Provides with respect to liability for peace officers engaged in certain actions.

title: Civil Service and Fire Police
status: Pending - House Municipal, Parochial and Cultural Affairs Committee
author: ['Glover (D)']
summary: Provides relative to the secretary for the municipal fire and police civil service board in certain municipalities.

title: Legislative Powers and Functions
summary: Establishes the Police Training, Screening, and Deesclation Task Force.

title: Body Worn Cameras
author: ['Lyons (D)', 'Marcelle (D)', 'Green (D)']
summary: Requests that the Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office adopt certain policies with respect to body-worn cameras.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['James (D)']
summary: Establishes a study group to study law enforcement systems and policing.

title: Funds and Funding
author: ['Harris (R)', 'Carrier (R)', 'Villio (R)', 'Pressly (R)', 'Owen (R)', 'Nelson (R)', 'Gadberry (R)', 'Fontenot (R)', 'Firment (R)', 'Edmonston (R)', 'Echols (R)', 'Seabaugh (R)', 'Wright (R)', 'Crews (R)', 'Horton (R)', 'Edmonds (R)', 'Bacala (R)', 'Amedee (R)', 'Hodges (R)', 'Garofalo (R)']
summary: Provides relative to funding university, parish, and municipal police departments.

title: Civil and Immunity
author: ['Jordan (D)']
summary: Provides for immunity from civil liability for law enforcement engaged in certain actions.

title: Civil and Immunity
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Civil Law and Procedure Committee
author: ['Jordan (D)']
summary: Provides for immunity from civil liability for law enforcement engaged in certain actions.

title: Law Enforcement
summary: Expresses wholehearted support for law enforcement and police departments, rejects any notion to defund law enforcement or police departments in the state.

title: Funds and Funding
author: ['Crews (R)']
summary: Provides relative to state sales tax dedications for municipalities that defund their police departments.

title: Commendations
author: ['Fields (D)']
summary: Commends Coleen Temple, Noah Hawkins, Myra Richardson, and Mia Spears on organizing a peaceful protest of the killing of George Floyd and excessive police force against black men.

title: Emergency Services
author: ['Tepler (D)']
summary: Criminalizes calls made to emergency services based on racial profiling.

title: Significant Police Reform in the State
author: ['Talbot Ross (D)']
summary: Enacts significant police reform in the state.

title: Victims Employment
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Judiciary
author: ['Davis P (R)', 'Cyrway (R)']
summary: Includes as a factor in sentencing the selection of a victim based on the victims employment as a law enforcement officer.

title: Participation of Marine Patrol Officers in Proceedings
author: ['Agency and Department']
summary: Allows the participation of marine patrol officers in proceedings for administrative suspension of a license or certificate.

title: Qualified Immunity for Police Officers
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Judiciary
author: ['Evangelos (I)', 'Miramant (D)', 'Warren (D)', 'Talbot Ross (D)', 'Harnett (D)', 'Morales (D)']
summary: Eliminates the ability to assert a defense of qualified immunity for civil actions concerning the actions of state police officers, sheriffs, deputies, constables, municipal police officers, marine patrol officers, game wardens and Capitol Police officers brought under the Maine Civil Rights Act.

title: Greater Accountability in the Office of County Sheriff
status: Pending - Joint Committee on State and Local Government
author: ['Keim (R)', 'Davis P (R)', 'Evangelos (I)', 'Cyrway (R)', 'Baldacci (D)']
summary: Creates procedures for a majority of the county commissioners of a county to file a complaint with the Superior Court in the county to remove the sheriff for improper, unethical or criminal behavior, after a hearing in which evidence may be presented by both sides, if the court finds cause, the court is required to forward the matter to the Governor for consideration of removal of the sheriff from office and may place the sheriff on administrative leave with pay.

title: Crime of Hate Crime
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Miramant (D)', 'Bailey (D)', "O'Neil (D)", 'Reckitt (D)', 'Talbot Ross (D)', 'Doudera (D)', 'Morales (D)', 'Geiger (D)', 'Maxmin (D)']
summary: Creates the Class C crime of hate crime, false public alarm or report in which a person gives or causes to be given information the person, motivated by or because of the actual or perceived race, color, religion, religious practice, disability or origin of any person, knows or should reasonably know is false to an emergency responder, government agency or utility with the intent of inducing the responder, agency or utility to respond or to a law enforcement officer that a crime has been committed.

title: Qualified Immunity for Police Officers
author: ['Evangelos (I)']
summary: Eliminates qualified immunity for police officers.

title: Law Enforcement Usage of Seizure and Forfeitures
author: ['Faulkingham (R)']
summary: Regards the use of seizure and forfeitures by law enforcement.

title: Frequent Users System Engagement Collaborative
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Health and Human Services
author: ['Morales (D)']
summary: Establishes the Frequent Users System Engagement Collaborative in order to develop a plan to provide stable housing and community services to certain persons who are homeless or at risk of homelessness who are the most frequent consumers of high-cost services, such as psychiatric hospitals, emergency shelters, emergency rooms, police, jails and prisons.

title: Sentencing Factors
author: ['Senator Davis']
summary: Includes as a factor in sentencing the selection of a victim based on the victim's employment as a law enforcement officer.

title: Disciplinary Authority of the Board of Trustees
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['McCrea (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Evangelos (I)', 'Millett R (D)', 'McCreight (D)', 'Warren (D)', 'Keim (R)', 'Grohoski (D)', 'Harnett (D)', 'Meyer (D)']
summary: (Concept Draft) Expands the disciplinary authority of the Board of Trustees of the Criminal Justice Academy, expands the disciplinary authority of the Board of Trustees of the Criminal Justice Academy, provides the board a pathway for dealing with incidents of misconduct by individuals who hold a certification or license issued by the board.

title: Intensive Case Managers
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Health and Human Services
author: ['Dodge (D)', 'Craven (D)', 'Perry (D)', 'Warren (D)', 'Madigan (D)', 'Reckitt (D)', 'Morales (D)', 'Stover (D)', 'Zager (D)']
summary: Provides intensive case managers to counties that do not have county jails or regional jails, directs the Department of Health and Human Services to create additional intensive case manager positions so that counties that do not have a county jail or regional jail will have an intensive case manager, provides that an intensive case manager oversees persons who are detained by a law enforcement officer and who have intellectual disabilities or mental health conditions or have misused substances.

title: Records of the Employment of Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Corey (R)', 'Bryant M (D)', 'Rosen K (R)', 'Pickett (R)', 'Warren (D)', 'Fay (D)', 'Costain (R)']
summary: Concerns records of the employment of law enforcement officers and corrections officers, requires a law enforcement officer or corrections officer who applies for employment with a law enforcement agency, correctional facility or county or regional jail, when the applicant is employed by or within 90 days prior to the application employed by another law enforcement agency, correctional facility or county or regional jail, to request that the officer's personnel records.

title: Qualified Immunity of Law Enforcement Officers in Maine
author: ['Carney (D)']
summary: Limits qualified immunity of law enforcement officers in Maine civil rights act claims.

title: Laws Protecting Members of Law Enforcement and Promote
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Stewart (R)']
summary: Strengthens Laws protecting members of law enforcement and promote in-classroom drug use avoidance education.

title: Adequate Training for Police Officers
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Lemelin (R)']
summary: Requires adequate training for police officers who use speed measurement devices, requires the Maine Criminal Justice Academy to provide in the basic law enforcement training course a block of instruction on the use of speed measurement devices and methods, including training from the manufacturer of every speed measurement device authorized for use in the State, and requires a law enforcement officer to be trained in a speed measurement method.

title: County Sheriffs Accountability
author: ['Senator Keim']
summary: Creates greater accountability in the office of County Sheriff.

title: Qualifications and Oversight of Sheriffs
status: Pending - Joint Committee on State and Local Government
author: ['Pickett (R)', 'Head (R)', 'Wadsworth (R)', 'Keim (R)', 'Costain (R)', 'Dolloff (R)', 'Rudnicki (R)', 'Newman (R)']
summary: Clarifies the qualifications and oversight of sheriffs, requires a candidate for sheriff or someone serving as sheriff to have met and continue to meet any statutory requirements of preservice, basic or in-service law enforcement training required for certification or continued certification as a law enforcement officer.

title: Use of No Knock Warrants
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Roeder (D)', 'Dunphy M (D)', 'Warren (D)', 'Talbot Ross (D)', 'Gramlich (D)', 'Lookner (D)', 'Osher (D)', 'Supica (D)']
summary: Prohibits the use of no-knock warrants, which are warrants that Allows the executing authority to forcibly enter a location that is the subject of a search warrant without first announcing the authority to execute the warrant and the purpose for which the warrant was issued, applies to law enforcement officers and any employee of the State or a political subdivision of the State.

title: Personnel Working in Public Safety
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Corey (R)', 'Diamond (D)', 'Pickett (R)', 'Cyrway (R)', 'Fay (D)', 'Costain (R)', 'Rudnicki (R)', 'Newman (R)']
summary: Authorizes transport officers to transport prisoners to and from court pursuant to a writ of habeas corpus and to provide safe and secure custody of prisoners during the proceedings, as directed by the court, allows a transport officer to use a reasonable degree of nondeadly force and deadly force, based on the provisions applicable to law enforcement officers, clarifies the power of corrections personnel to use force by eliminating the current law's cross-reference.

title: No Knock Warrants
status: Pending - Carryover - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Fecteau J (R)', 'Pouliot (R)', 'Andrews (R)', 'Faulkingham (R)', 'Maxmin (D)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer, prior to forcibly entering a location that is the subject of a search warrant, to announce the law enforcement officer's authority to execute the warrant and the purpose for which the warrant was issued, provides that this requirement does not apply if the authority issuing the warrant clearly states that providing such notice would create an imminent risk of death or bodily harm to a law enforcement officer or an individual in the location.

title: Composition of the Criminal Law Advisory Commission
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Tuell (R)']
summary: Amends the membership of the Criminal Law Advisory Commission to require that at least one member be a law enforcement officer from a state law enforcement agency and at least one member be a law enforcement officer from a county or municipal law enforcement agency, requires the chair of the commission to provide written notice of each commission meeting to every state, county and municipal law enforcement agency in the State.

title: Integrity of Law Enforcement
author: ['Reckitt (D)']
summary: Ensures the integrity of law enforcement and expand public oversight.

title: Training in Racial Issues Racial Justice
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Criminal Justice and Public Safety
author: ['Gramlich (D)']
summary: Requires training in racial issues, racial justice and social issues at the Maine criminal justice academy and to establish additional requirements for law enforcement officers and candidates.

title: Accountability in Asset Seizure and Forfeiture
author: ['Andrews (R)']
summary: Improves accountability in asset seizure and forfeiture reporting.

title: Review of Law Enforcement Use of Deadly Force
author: ['Talbot Ross (D)']
summary: Regards the review of law enforcement use of deadly force, requires the Attorney General to complete an investigation of and submit the findings regarding the use of deadly force by a law enforcement officer to the Attorney General's Deadly Force Review Panel within 180 days of receiving notice of the use of deadly force.

title: Office of Sheriff Qualifications
author: ['Pickett (R)']
summary: Clarifies the qualifications and oversight of those who serve in the Office of Sheriff.

title: Authority of the Board of Trustees
author: ['McCrea (D)']
summary: Expands the authority of the Board of Trustees of the State Criminal Justice Academy regarding certification standards.

title: Adequate Training for Police Officers
author: ['Lemelin (R)']
summary: Requires adequate training for police officers who use speed detection devices.

title: Transfer of Law Enforcement Officers Between Agencies
author: ['Corey (R)']
summary: Regulates the transfer of law enforcement officers between agencies.

title: Training in Racial Justice and Other Social Issues
author: ['Gramlich (D)']
summary: Requires training in racial, justice and other social issues, establishes additional requirements for candidates at the criminal justice academy.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Sexual Activity Prohibition
author: ['Elfreth (D)', 'Hettleman (D)']
summary: Relates to the prohibition on law enforcement sexual activity.

title: Police Officers Duty
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Carter (D)']
summary: Relates to police officers duty to intervene.

author: ['Bailey (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers and first responder hate crimes.

topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']

title: Law Enforcement Officers Rights
author: ['Acevero (D)']
summary: Repeals Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights.

title: Police Body Cameras
author: ['Crosby (D)']
summary: Relates to Department of State Police body worn cameras.

title: Police Officers Duty
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Sydnor (D)', 'Benson (D)', 'Pinsky (D)', 'Kelley (D)', 'Washington (D)', 'Hayes (D)', 'McCray (D)', 'Elfreth (D)']
summary: Relates to duty to report misconduct, relates to the Maryland Police Accountability Act.

summary: Relates to personnel records.

author: ['Ivey (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement body worn cameras.

author: ['Grammer (R)']
summary: Relates to Knock Warrants.

author: ['Wilson (D)']
summary: Relates to police officers stop procedures, Know Your Rights Act.

title: Improper Officer Summoning
author: ['Charles (D)']
summary: Relates to the improperly summoning a police officer.

title: Law Enforcement Reform
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['West (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Technology']
summary: Relates to law enforcement reform.

title: Police Officers Performance Review Board
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Ellis (D)']
summary: Relates to Police Officers' Performance Review Board.

author: ['Ebersole (D)']
summary: Relates to Law Enforcement Diversion Programs.

author: ['Hartman (R)', 'Long (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers and first responder hate crimes.

summary: Relates to behavioral health crisis response services.
