status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Jackson C (D)']
summary: Relates to false statement to a law enforcement officer.

title: Criminal Procedure Questioning
author: ['Johnson (D)']
summary: Relates to questioning of minors by police officers.

title: Governmental Liability
author: ['Ivey (D)']
summary: Relates to violation of rights.

title: Improperly Summoning
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['McCray (D)']
summary: Relates to improperly summoning a police officer.

title: Civil Claims Against Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['McCray (D)']
summary: Relates to civil claims against law enforcement officers of an institution of higher education.

title: Police Officer Prosecution
author: ['Fisher (R)', 'Fisher W (D)']
summary: Relates to the prosecution of a police officer.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Bill Of Rights
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Cassilly (R)']
summary: Relates to Law Enforcement Officers' Bill Of Rights.

title: Hate Crimes
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Carter (D)']
summary: Relates to false statement to a law enforcement officer.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Sexual Activity Prohibition
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Williams (D)', 'Lierman (D)', 'Bartlett (D)', 'Crutchfield (D)', 'Feldmark (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, relates to sexual activity.

title: No Knock Warrants Elimination
author: ['Carter (D)']
summary: Repeals a provision of law authorizing an application for a search warrant to contain a request authorizing the executing law enforcement officer to enter a building, apartment, premises, place, or thing to be searched without giving notice of the officer's authority or purpose under certain circumstances, applies the Act prospectively.

title: Charging Procedures Citations
author: ['Dumais (D)']
summary: Alters the circumstances under which a police officer is required to charge by citation for certain misdemeanor or local ordinance violations that have an imprisonment penalty of up to 90 days and do not involve serious injury or an immediate health risk, alters the categories of offenses for which a police officer is authorized to charge by citation, alters the circumstances under which a police officer may charge a defendant by citation.

title: Cell Site Simulator Court Order
author: ['Pippy (R)']
summary: Provides the ways in which an application for a court order authorizing or directing a law enforcement officer to use a cell site simulator or obtain location information from an electronic device may be submitted to a judge, provides for the ways in which an applicant for the court order and a judge may converse about the court order application, provides for the ways in which a judge may issue the court order.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Carter (D)']
summary: Prohibits a supervisor, an appointing authority, and the head of a certain law enforcement agency from threatening or taking certain retaliatory actions against a certain law enforcement officer who discloses certain information or seeks a certain remedy, provides that the protections afforded under the Act apply to certain disclosures only under certain circumstances, requires a law enforcement agency to provide certain law enforcement officers a copy of the Act under certain circumstances.

title: Police Procedures
author: ['Rosenberg (D)']
summary: Authorizes a police officer to require a person to lie prone on the ground only when it is objectively reasonable and necessary to obtain compliance with lawful commands or to resolve a conflict, requires a police officer to consider certain factors in deciding whether to require a person to lie prone on the ground.

title: Law Enforcement Hearing Board
author: ['Morgan (R)']
summary: Provides that in St. Mary's County, a certain hearing board may include up to two voting or nonvoting members of the public who have received at least 40 hours of training administered by the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission on the Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights and matters relating to police procedures.

title: Emergency Evaluation Petition
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Health and Government Operations Committee
author: ['Ruth (D)']
summary: Authorizes, rather than requiring, a certain petitioner for emergency evaluation of an individual to give the petition to a peace officer, repeals the requirement that a peace officer explain certain information to a certain petitioner, requires a certain petitioner for emergency evaluation to take an emergency evaluee to the nearest emergency facility under certain circumstances.

title: Automated Traffic Enforcement
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Montgomery County Delegation']
summary: Authorizes Montgomery County to designate the Montgomery County Department of Transportation as the agency responsible for implementing automated traffic enforcement programs in the county, requires that an employee of the Montgomery County Department of Transportation, instead of a law enforcement officer, under certain circumstances, sign a certain required statement on a citation issued through the use of automated traffic enforcement systems in Montgomery County.

title: Body Worn Cameras
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Hettleman (D)']
summary: Requires a certain policy developed and published by the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to require that a body-worn camera purchased or otherwise procured for use by a law enforcement officer on or after a specified date, automatically record and save 2 minutes of audio and video footage immediately prior to the officer activating the record button on the device.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Creditability
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Sydnor (D)']
summary: Requires each State's Attorney to maintain a list of certain law enforcement officers who have been found to have committed or are alleged to have committed acts that bear on credibility, integrity or honesty that would constitute impeachment or exculpatory evidence, provides that certain personnel records are subject to inspection under the Maryland Public Information Act, requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to establish and maintain a certain database.

title: Police Officers Stop Procedures
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Sydnor (D)']
summary: Requires a police officer to display proper identification and provide certain information to certain individuals at the commencement of a certain stop, with a certain exception, requires a police officer to inform certain passengers and occupants of a certain vehicle of the right to refuse to provide identification to the police officer at a certain time, prohibits a police officer from seizing certain items without a warrant or using certain tactics or deliberately misrepresenting facts.

title: Surplus Military Equipment
author: ['Smith W (D)', 'West (R)']
summary: Prohibits certain law enforcement agencies from receiving certain equipment from a federal military surplus program, establishes that the prohibition includes an armored or weaponized aircraft, drone, or vehicle, a destructive device, a firearm silencer, or a grenade launcher.

title: Attorney General Investigation
author: ['Smith W (D)']
summary: Requires a certain law enforcement agency to notify the Office of the Attorney General of a certain incident involving the death of a person caused by a police officer as soon as the law enforcement agency becomes aware of the incident, requires the Attorney General to investigate certain incidents involving the death of a person caused by a police officer, requires the Attorney General to transmit a certain report to a certain State's Attorney at a certain time.

title: Alcohol Testing
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Smith W (D)']
summary: Expands the procedures for conducting an investigation or interrogation under certain circumstances that may lead to disciplinary action, demotion, or dismissal of a law enforcement officer, establishes an exception to an existing authorization for a law enforcement agency to require a certain law enforcement officer to submit to certain testing under certain circumstances, requires a law enforcement officer to submit to certain drug and alcohol testing under certain circumstances.

title: Police Training
author: ['Jackson (D)']
summary: Alters a certain provision of law authorizing a member of the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to designate a certain representative to act at a certain meeting to the same effect as if the member were personally present to require that the designation be made in writing, provides that the Secretary of State Police is the chair of the Commission, alters and reorganizes provisions of law relating to the Powers and duties of the Commission.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Force
author: ['Carter (D)']
summary: Authorizes a person to seek certain relief for use of force by a law enforcement officer that is inconsistent with a certain provision of the Act by filing a civil action with a certain court, provides that a certain person is not precluded from pursuing a certain legal remedy under certain circumstances, authorizes the Attorney General to file a civil action for certain relief under certain circumstances, provides for the use of force by a certain law enforcement officer.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Rights
author: ['Carter (D)']
summary: Repeals the Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights, provides for the discipline of law enforcement officers, provides that provisions of the Act supersede and preempt any other law of the State, a county, or a municipal corporation, provides that a law enforcement agency or the agency's superior governmental authority and a collective bargaining unit may not enter into a certain agreement, establishes that a law enforcement agency has a certain burden of proof in any proceeding under the Act.

title: Failure To Obey
author: ['Ruth (D)']
summary: Repeals the prohibition against willfully failing to obey a reasonable and lawful order that a law enforcement officer makes to prevent a disturbance to the public peace.

title: Metropolitan Area Transit Authority
author: ['Barron (D)']
summary: Alters the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Compact to require the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority to prohibit the use of enforcement quotas to evaluate, incentivize, or discipline members of the Metro Transit Police, including with regard to the number of arrests made or citations or warnings issued, provides for the establishment, composition, powers, and duties of a Police Complaints Board, subject to a certain concurrence in the Act by the District of Columbia.

title: Police Reform Act
author: ['Jones A (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Repeals the Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights, provides that the Police Department of Baltimore City is an agency and instrumentality of the City of Baltimore, instead of the State, authorizes a judge to issue a certain ""no-knock"" search warrant only under certain circumstances, provides that an individual attending a public institution of higher education is exempt from paying tuition if the individual intends to become a police officer under certain circumstances.

title: Public Information Act
author: ['Jones A (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Requires a custodian to grant inspection of certain personnel records by the United States Attorney, the Attorney General, the State Prosecutor, or a State's Attorney, establishes that a record relating to a formal complaint of job-related misconduct made against a police officer is not a personnel record under certain provisions of the Public Information Act under certain circumstances, requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to post on its website and submit to the General.

title: Uniform Discipline
author: ['McComas (R)']
summary: Provides that a law enforcement agency and the agency's superior governmental authority and a collective bargaining unit may not enter into an agreement that is inconsistent with the provisions of the Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights, repeals a certain authorization for a law enforcement agency or the agency's superior governmental authority to negotiate with a certain representative, under certain circumstances, an alternative method of forming a certain hearing board.

title: Law Enforcement Reform
author: ['Bhandari (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Technology']
summary: Provides that the Police Department of Baltimore City is an agency and instrumentality of the City of Baltimore, instead of the State, provides that police officers of the department have the authority conferred under Title 2 of the Criminal Procedure Article, requires that a certain ""no-knock"" search warrant be preapproved by a certain supervisor and the State's Attorney, alters the required frequency of certain police training.

title: Bodyworn Cameras
author: ['Moon (D)']
summary: Requires a policy for the issuance and use of a body-worn camera by a law enforcement officer developed and published by the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to require that a body-worn camera purchased or otherwise procured for use by a law enforcement officer on or after January 1, 2022, automatically record and save 2 minutes of audio and video footage immediately prior to the officer activating the record button on the device.

title: Police Officers Promotional Appointments
author: ['Hayes (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight']
summary: Alters the procedures used by the Police Commissioner of Baltimore City to award promotional appointments, authorizes the Commissioner to remove certain applicants from the list of eligible appointees if the Civilian Review Board has sustained a certain misconduct complaint against the applicant between the time the applicant applied for the promotion and the time in which the applicant is to be selected for the promotion.

title: Police Department Authority
author: ['McCray (D)']
summary: Provides that the Police Department of Baltimore City is an agency and instrumentality of the City of Baltimore, instead of the State, provides that certain police officers have the authority conferred under a certain provision of law, establishes an Advisory Board on the Transfer of Control of the Police Department of Baltimore City, provides for the membership, chair, staffing, and duties of the Advisory Board.

title: Use of Force Training
author: ['Haynes (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Requires a law enforcement agency to report, beginning on a specified date, and every 2 years thereafter, to the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services on certain policies and procedures related to use of force de-escalation training for its law enforcement officers, requires the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to analyze the data collected and report to certain committees of the General Assembly by a specified date, and every 2 years thereafter.

title: Active Duty Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Hornberger (R)']
summary: Exempts certain active duty law enforcement officers from paying tuition at public institutions of higher education in the State if the law enforcement officer lives and works in the State and is seeking a degree related to conflict resolution, community relations, or criminal justice.

title: Hate Crimes
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Judicial Proceedings Committee
author: ['Corderman (R)', 'Edwards (R)', 'Eckardt (R)', 'Carozza (R)', 'West (R)', 'Gallion (R)']
summary: Prohibits a person, with certain motivation, from willfully intimidating, harassing, or terrorizing another person, causing certain damage to certain property of another person without permission, or causing death or serious bodily harm to another person based on the person's actual or perceived employment as a first responder.

title: City Sheriff Authorization
author: ['McCray (D)']
summary: Authorizes all full-time sworn law enforcement officers who are deputy sheriffs at the rank of lieutenant or below and court security officers in Baltimore City to collectively bargain with the Secretary of Budget and Management and the Sheriff of Baltimore City, requires the Sheriff and the Secretary to recognize an exclusive representative for the purpose of collective bargaining, authorizes the Sheriff, the Secretary, and the exclusive representative to select the number of individuals designated to/.

title: Mental Health Law
author: ['Ready (R)']
summary: Modifies standards for involuntary admission of individuals with mental disorders to a certain facility or Veterans' Administration hospital to include consideration that it can be reasonably expected, if not hospitalized, a certain individual presents a danger to the life or safety of the individual or to others, modifies certain standards or emergency evaluations of individuals with mental disorders, requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to provide certain information.

title: Complaint Oversight Board
author: ['Charles County Delegation']
summary: Establishes the Citizens Complaint Oversight Board of Charles County to conduct investigations into incidents of alleged police misconduct that occur in Charles County in a fair and timely manner, identify and address patterns of police misconduct, and make recommendations for improving the policies and operations of law enforcement units to reduce incidents of police misconduct, establishes certain requirements for members of the Board, requires the Board to employ staff.

title: Racial Equity Audits
author: ['Washington A (D)']
summary: Requires the chief of each law enforcement agency with a budget of or exceeding $50,000,000 to perform an annual racial equity audit related to practices on hiring, discipline and use of force within the department and to hire a racial equity coordinator.

title: Law Enforcement Procedures
author: ['Washington A (D)']
summary: Provides that a certain police officer is justified in using force under certain circumstances, provides that a certain police officer is justified in using deadly force under certain circumstances, prohibits a police officer from using a certain type of restraint, subject to a certain exception, requires a certain police officer to make a certain attempt to intervene, to terminate, or to prevent a certain other officer's use of a certain type of restraint under certain circumstances.

title: Complaint Oversight Board
author: ['Charles County Delegation']
summary: Establishes the Citizens Complaint Oversight Board of Charles County to conduct investigations into incidents of alleged police misconduct that occur in Charles County in a fair and timely manner, identify and address patterns of police misconduct, and make recommendations for improving the policies and operations of law enforcement units to reduce incidents of police misconduct, establishes certain requirements for members of the Board, requires the Board to employ staff.

title: Vehicle Law Policies
author: ['Rosenberg (D)']
summary: Requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission in consultation with the Maryland Statistical Analysis Center to expand the model policy against race-based traffic stops to include traffic stops based on national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, or sexual identity, requires a law enforcement officer making a traffic stop to report certain information to the law enforcement agency that employs the officer.

title: Police Qualified Immunity Act
author: ['Wilkins (D)']
summary: Establishes, notwithstanding any other provision of law, that a law enforcement officer is not immune from civil or criminal liability for acts or omissions causing certain physical or mental injury that occur while the law enforcement officer is acting in an official capacity, prohibits a person from bringing an action under the Act under certain circumstances, specifies that certain immunity does not apply to a claim brought under the Act.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Buckel (R)']
summary: Prohibits a law enforcement officer from being required or requested to wear a personal identification tag or badge that indicates the law enforcement officer's first or last name when the law enforcement officer is on duty or acting in an official capacity as a law enforcement officer.

title: Vehicle Law Enforcement
author: ['Lopez (D)']
summary: Authorizes the use of a real-time digital spotter by law enforcement agencies to detect and enforce vehicle Laws governing speeding, the use of wireless communications devices, and the use of seat belts, prohibits the use of a real-time digital spotter in a local jurisdiction unless authorized by the governing body by local law adopted after reasonable notice and a public hearing, reduces certain fines for violations of the vehicle Laws governing the use of wireless communications devices and seat belts.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Data Collection
author: ['Washington A (D)']
summary: Requires certain law enforcement agencies to report by March 1, 2022, and each March 1 thereafter, certain information to the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services regarding law enforcement officer-involved incidents that resulted in a monetary settlement or judgment against the law enforcement agency, requires the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to adopt certain procedures and compile and report certain information to the General Assembly.

title: Performance Measurements Reporting
author: ['Grammer (R)']
summary: Requires local law enforcement agencies to submit certain information relating to law enforcement officer performance evaluation measures to the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission on or before April 1 and October 1 each year, requires the Commission to aggregate and report certain information relating to law enforcement officer performance measures to the General Assembly by May 1 and November 1 each year.

title: Promotional Appointment
author: ['Smith S (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight']
summary: Alters the procedures used by the Police Commissioner of Baltimore City to award promotional appointments, authorizes the Commissioner to remove certain applicants from the list of eligible appointees if the Civilian Review Board has sustained a certain misconduct complaint against the applicant between the time the applicant applied for the promotion and the time in which the applicant is to be selected for the promotion.

title: Police and Firefighter Arbitration
author: ['Hawkins (D)']
summary: Relates to providing for binding arbitration for fire fighters and police officers.

title: Police Board Meeting Attendance
author: ['Hawkins (D)', 'Whelan (R)']
summary: Further regulates the attendance by police officers at police association executive board meeting.

title: Reporting of Excessive Force on Children
author: ['Cronin (D)']
summary: Ensures reporting of excessive force on children.

title: Post Traumatic Stress Disorder Study Commission
author: ['Durant (R)', 'Garry (D)', 'Ashe (D)', 'Ryan (D)', 'Berthiaume (R)', 'McKenna (R)', 'Whelan (R)', 'Kearney (D)', 'LaNatra (D)', 'Robertson (D)']
summary: Establishes a commission to study post traumatic stress disorder in law enforcement officers.

status: Pending - Joint Committee on Advanced Info Technology, the Internet and Cybersecurity
author: ['Duffy (D)']
summary: Relates to studying technology impacts on police, firefighters, and emergency and security personnel.

summary: Relates to age restrictions for veterans applying to be police officers and firefighters.

summary: Provides for the care and transportation of police dogs injured in the line of duty.

title: Board on Law Enforcement Officer Standards and Training
author: ['Massengill (R)']
summary: Revises the membership of the Board on Law Enforcement Officer Standards and Training.

title: Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol
author: ['Massengill (R)']
summary: Increases the salaries of all officers of the Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol and the Mississippi Bureau of Narcotics.

title: Community and Police Safety Act
author: ['Hines (D)']
summary: Creates the Community and Police Safety Act, authorizes the governing authority of any municipality to provide tax forfeited lands and any building thereon to any police officer who is employed full time as a police officer with the municipality, as part of the officer's compensation package, provides the procedure for allocation of lands, if the officer is terminated, authorizes the secretary of state to enter agreements with such municipalities, conforms to the preceding sections.

title: Radar Speed Detection
author: ['Massengill (R)']
summary: Authorizes the county board of supervisors of any county to authorize the sheriff and his deputies in such county to use radar speed detection equipment upon the public streets, roads and highways of the county lying outside of the limits of any incorporated municipality.

title: Police Officers
author: ['Bell C (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight']
summary: Requires police officers to maintain liability insurance, requires the municipality, authority, agency or other political subdivision to cover the base rate of the policy.

title: Mississippi Police Funding Protection Act
author: ['Currie (R)']
summary: Creates the State Police Funding Protection Act, requires the governing authority of any county or municipality to notify the joint legislative budget committee if the operating budget for any municipal police department or sheriff's department, as the case may be, is reduced by ten percent or more and such reduction is not the result of decreased tax collections, provides that after certain determinations are made by the joint legislative committee pertaining to the reductions.

title: Committing Offense Against Peace Office
author: ['Currie (R)']
summary: Creates a registry of persons who have committed an offense against a peace officer, including an act of terrorism under the Laws of another state or federal law, defines certain terms, provides that the information received by local law enforcement agencies under this act shall be forwarded to the State Bureau of Investigation for inclusion in a central registry.

title: Defunding Police
author: ['Currie (R)']
summary: Prohibits municipalities from defunding police departments, provides certain definitions, provides that if a policy is implemented or adopted by a municipality to defund its police department, then the Department of Revenue shall withhold ten percent of the sales tax revenue that would otherwise be payable to the municipality until such time the department receives certain notice that the municipality no longer implements such policy, in conformity thereto.

title: Window Tint
author: ['Young (D)']
summary: Increases the window tint inspection fee and require a certain amount of the fee to be used to conduct Highway Safety Patrol Trooper training classes.

title: Mississippi Joint Municipal Law Enforcement Act
author: ['Clark B (D)']
summary: Creates the Mississippi Joint Municipal Law Enforcement Act, defines certain terms, provides that two or more municipalities in a county may establish a joint police department, if the governing authorities of such municipalities determine it is in the best interest of the municipalities, provides that a joint police department shall be governed by a board, provides the membership of such board, prescribes the establishment process of a joint department.

title: Budget of County Sheriff
author: ['Clark B (D)']
summary: Removes the requirement that the county sheriff, tax assessor and tax collector file a certain monthly report regarding expenses with the board of supervisors for approval at the board's monthly meeting and to remove the provision of law that requires the board to appropriate a certain lump sum for the sheriff, assessor and tax collector for expenses during a quarterly appropriation by the board.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Zuber (R)', 'Anthony (D)', 'Brown W (D)']
summary: Authorizes law enforcement officers who are employed by a county or municipality to wear the official uniform and utilize the official firearm, vehicles and equipment issued by the employing jurisdiction while in the performance of voluntary disaster relief in this state or another state during off duty hours.

title: State Assessments
author: ['Bain (D)']
summary: Provides that a portion of the state assessments collected under this section will be deposited into the law enforcement officers training fund and the State forensics laboratory implied consent law fund and DNA identification system fund instead of into the state general fund.

title: Marine Resources Enforcement Officers' Reserve Unit
author: ['Felsher (R)']
summary: Removes the requirement that members of the Department of Marine Resources Enforcement Officers' Reserve Unit shall serve without pay and without certain benefits, authorizes enforcement officers to protect critical infrastructures related to homeland security threats, removes the prohibition against a member of the reserve also being a member of any police, auxiliary police, civil defense or private security agency.

title: First Responders Health and Safety Act
author: ['Ford (R)']
summary: Provides for payments for benefits and insurance premiums under the Mississippi First Responders Health and Safety Act, creates the Mississippi First Responders Health and Safety trust fund, annually divert forty percent of the nonadmitted policy fee to fund the rural fire truck and supplemental fund, the Mississippi First Responders Health and Safety fund, the Comprehensive Hurricane Mitigation fund and to provide funds to the Fire Marshal's Office for fire prevention and education.

title: First Responders Health and Safety Act
author: ['Ford (R)']
summary: Provides for payments for benefits and insurance premiums under the Mississippi First Responders Health and Safety Act, creates the Mississippi First Responders Health and Safety Act trust fund, creates the minimum fire protection trust fund, annually diverts forty percent of the nonadmitted policy fee to fund the rural fire truck and supplemental fund, the Mississippi First Responders Health and Safety Act fund, the capital expense fund, the comprehensive hurricane mitigation fund.

title: Law Enforcement Supplemental Pay
author: ['Sanford (R)', 'Miles (D)', 'Shanks (R)', 'Owen (R)']
summary: Provides that law enforcement officers who are employed by an accredited law enforcement department shall receive supplementary pay annually, provides that four million dollars of the lottery proceeds fund shall be transferred into the law enforcement officers accreditation supplemental pay fund, creates a new statute that establishes the law enforcement officers accreditation supplemental pay fund.

title: Body Worn Cameras
author: ['Banks (D)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement officers from using body worn cameras to recreate past encounters, prohibits video and audio footage recorded by body worn cameras other than from actual real time encounters from being used in criminal proceedings, requires law enforcement agencies utilizing body worn cameras to adopt policies governing their usage.

title: First Responders Scholarship
author: ['Faulkner (D)']
summary: Provides scholarships to the spouses and children of first responders killed in the line of duty or who become permanently and totally disabled as the result of injuries or wounds which occurred while in the line of duty.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Powell (R)', 'Eure (R)', 'Shanks (R)', 'Stamps (D)']
summary: Allows a certified law enforcement officer or certified part time law enforcement officer, who is employed by a county or municipality, to use his or her official uniform, weapon and vehicle while performing volunteer services for a church, community club, social event or other community event in off duty hours, authorizes members of certain law enforcement agencies to retain his or her sidearm upon retirement.

title: Trooper Training Class
author: ['Miles (D)']
summary: Requires the legislature to appropriate sufficient funds in each regular legislative session held in 2021 and 2022 to defray the expenses of a highway patrol trooper training class.

title: Immunity for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Rushing (R)']
summary: Provides immunity for law enforcement officers when the person filing the claim against the officer was convicted for resisting arrest and the incident was clearly recorded by the officer.

title: Law Enforcement Firefighters
author: ['Bell C (D)']
summary: Provides enhanced penalties when a felony or misdemeanor is committed by a law enforcement officer, firefighter or emergency medical technician and the victim was unarmed, the visual, audio or body camera was off or unable to capture images during the time of the felony or misdemeanor, or the felony or misdemeanor was committed because of the actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, ethnicity, religion, national origin or gender of the victim.

title: Law Enforcement Official Vehicles
author: ['Cockerham (D)', 'Stamps (D)']
summary: Allows a certified law enforcement officer or certified part time law enforcement officer, who is employed by a county or municipality, to use his or her official vehicle while performing private security services in off duty hours, conforms to the preceding section.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Shanks (R)', 'Williamson (R)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to input missing person cases into the national missing and unidentified persons system.

title: Police Officers Body Worn Cameras
author: ['Karriem (D)']
summary: Requires the governing authorities of municipalities to provide police officers, who are on patrol, with body worn cameras, defines the term body worn camera, requires county Boards of Supervisors to include allocations for body worn cameras in the annual budgets for Sheriffs' offices, requires deputy sheriffs, who are on patrol, to wear body worn cameras, creates a new section to provide certain penalties for police officers and sheriff deputies who fail to wear body worn cameras while on patrol.

title: Law Enforcement Salaries
author: ['Harness (D)']
summary: Increases by by a certain amount the salaries of all sworn officers of the Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol, including service in the Driver's License Division and the sworn officers of the Mississippi Bureau of Narcotics.

title: Traffic Tickets and Arrest Quotas
author: ['Thompson (D)', 'Barnett (R)', 'Criswell (R)', 'Hopkins (R)', 'Brown W (D)', 'Williamson (R)']
summary: Prohibits any state or local agency that employs peace officers or parking enforcement employees from establishing any policy requiring any such officers or employees to meet an arrest quota concerning traffic violations, prohibits the number of arrests or citations issued by a peace officer or parking enforcement employee as the sole criterion for earning any benefit provided by a state or local agency, provides certain definitions.

title: Highway Patrol Pay Scale
author: ['Bain (D)']
summary: Increases the pay scale for sworn personnel of the Mississippi Department of Public Safety.

title: Law Enforcement Supplemental Pay Program
author: ['Owen (R)', 'Ford (R)', 'Shanks (R)', 'McCarty (R)', 'Newman (R)']
summary: Creates the law enforcement supplemental pay program to be administered by the Department of Public Safety, provides that in addition to the compensation now paid by any municipality or county to any sworn, certified law enforcement officer, every sworn, certified law enforcement officer employed by any municipality or county which employs one or more sworn, certified law enforcement officers who devotes his or her full working time to law enforcement, shall be paid by the state extra compensation.

title: Law Enforcement Continued Education Class Requirement
author: ['Crudup (D)']
summary: Requires deputy sheriffs and police officers to take certain annual continuing education courses in law enforcement.

title: Littering Increase Fines
author: ['Arnold (R)']
summary: Increases littering fines and allocate collected fines to local police, sheriff and fire departments.

title: First Responders and Essential Workers Incentive
author: ['Stamps (D)', 'Johnson R (D)']
summary: Authorizes the governing authorities of a county or municipality to establish a first responders and essential workers incentive program, requires a county or municipality electing to establish an incentive program to adopt a resolution or ordinance setting forth certain requirements for the program, authorizes the payment of a salary supplement to employees selected for recognition under the program.

title: Mississippi Law Enforcement Interaction Course Act
author: ['Arnold (R)']
summary: Creates the Mississippi Law Enforcement Interaction Course Act, requires the Mississippi Board of Education, the Mississippi Department of Public Safety, the Mississippi Sheriffs' Association, the Mississippi Police Benevolent Association and the Mississippi Law Enforcement Accreditation Commission to enter into a memorandum of understanding that establishes each agency's respective responsibilities in developing instruction, including curriculum and instructional modules.

title: Marshal and Constable Compensation
author: ['Guice J (R)']
summary: Authorizes the board of supervisors of any county in which one or more courts located in the county are closed for more than thirty consecutive days to pay additional compensation to the marshals and constables of the county in such amount as determined by the board, using funds available to the board other than revenues from ad valorem taxes, user fees or other fees received by the county.

title: Sheriffs and Police Officers
author: ['Crudup (D)']
summary: Requires each sheriff or police officer to have at least one less lethal force option made available to such sheriff or police officer while on duty.

title: Radar Speed Detection
author: ['Harness (D)']
summary: Deletes the population threshold for municipal law enforcement officers to use radar speed detection equipment upon the public streets of the municipality.

title: No Knock Warrants
author: ['Summers (D)']
summary: Requires any person executing a warrant at a residence, home, apartment, room, building or premises or any other dwelling place under the laws of this state to give appropriate notice of the identity, authority and purpose of the officer to the person to be searched or arrested before entering such, or to the person in apparent control of the premises to be searched, requires the executing officer to read and give a copy of the warrant to the person to be searched or arrested.

title: Interception of Wire or Oral Communications
author: ['McCaughn (R)']
summary: Authorizes sheriff departments to implement wire taps by allowing the ownership, possession, installation or monitoring of a monitoring device.

title: Off Duty Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Fillingane J (R)', 'McMahan (R)']
summary: Provides that certain law enforcement officers are authorized to use public vehicles in the performance of private security duties within their jurisdiction.

title: Fleeing or Eluding a Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['England (R)', 'Fillingane J (R)', 'Hill (R)', 'Wiggins (R)']
topics: ['Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Standards']
summary: Revises the offense of fleeing or eluding a law enforcement officer when a minor is present in the vehicle at the time of the offense.

title: Sheriffs Salary
author: ['Wiggins (R)']
summary: Revises the annual salaries of sheriffs for counties with a total population of more than 100,000.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Fillingane J (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, provides for immunity under certain circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Sparks (R)', 'Boyd (R)']
summary: Creates a right to follow up testing for a law enforcement officer who tests positive for illegal drug use, and to provide for terms of suspension pending the receipt of results from the follow up test.

title: Mississippi First Responder Protection Act
author: ['England (R)']
summary: Enacts the Mississippi First Responder Protection Act, provides for the offense of bias motivated intimidation, provides penalties upon conviction of the offense of bias motivated intimidation, authorizes a law enforcement officer to bring suit for damages suffered during the officer's performance of official duties.

title: Voluntary Search
author: ['Turner A (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to obtain written consent from a person before subjecting the person to a voluntary search, provides that this act only applies to voluntary searches where there is no legal basis for a search.

title: Community Policing and Transparency Act
author: ['Turner A (D)']
summary: Creates the Community Policing and Transparency Act, provides procedures for use of body worn cameras by law enforcement officers, describes how video from the cameras must be retained by law enforcement agencies, authorizes who may obtain a copy of a recording, provides remedies for violations of this act.

title: Violent or Disorderly Assemblies
author: ['Hill (R)']
summary: Criminalizes the inciting or participation in a violent or disorderly assembly, provides for certain enhancements for the conviction of participating in a violent or disorderly assembly, sets a certain jail term for any defendant convicted of a crime under this act who used force or violence against a law enforcement officer during the commission of the offense, criminalizes the malicious obstruction of a public street, highway or road during a violent or disorderly protest or assembly.

title: Radar Use
author: ['McLendon (R)', 'England (R)']
summary: Authorizes the sheriff and his deputies in any county having a population of a specified number or more to use radar speed detection equipment upon the public streets, roads and highways within the county, lying outside the limits of any incorporated municipality, and excluding any interstate highway, forbids the levy of any fine associated with the issuance of a citation where a driver is detected to have been traveling in excess of the posted speed limit in certain circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Training Expenses
author: ['Jackson R (D)']
summary: Revises the time during which a governmental entity must reimburse the formerly employing governmental entity for the costs incurred by that entity for the officer's law enforcement training.

title: Excessive Window Tint
author: ['Williams (R)']
summary: Authorizes county law enforcement officers to enforce motor vehicle window tint violations.

title: Tax Sale Notices
author: ['Hill (R)']
summary: Revises the service of notice of a tax sale to include service by a constable, provides for purposes of possible amendment.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Regulate Compensation
author: ['Sparks (R)']
summary: Requires the State and political subdivisions thereof to compensate law enforcement officers who are nonexempt employees under the Fair Labor Standards Act by mandating at least the regular hourly rate be paid, or hour for hour compensatory time, for the first 43 hours in a week, 86 hours in a two week period or 171 hours in a 28 day period, requires compliance with the FLSA for hours worked in excess of those stated amounts.

title: Radar Speed Detection
author: ['Blount (D)', 'Michel (R)', 'Horhn (D)', 'Frazier (D)', 'Jackson R (D)', 'Norwood (D)']
summary: Restricts the use of radar speed detection equipment by municipal law enforcement officers in municipalities with a population above 15,000 to federally designated non limited access highways within the corporate limits, removes the prohibition on the Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol setting up radar on highways in municipalities with a population above 15,000, provides that the Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol shall be immediately notified by municipal law.

title: Department of Public Safety
author: ['Polk (R)']
summary: Revises the salaries of all officers of the Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol and the Mississippi Bureau of Narcotics.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Fillingane J (R)']
summary: Increases the salaries of sworn officers of the Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol and the Mississippi Bureau of Narcotics, provides such sworn officers working for an accredited department with supplementary pay, provides that four million dollars of the lottery proceeds fund shall be transferred into the law enforcement officers accreditation supplemental pay fund, creates a new statute that establishes the law enforcement officers accreditation supplemental pay fund.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Fillingane J (R)']
summary: Provides that law enforcement officers who are employed by an accredited law enforcement department shall receive supplementary pay annually, provides that a specified amount of the lottery proceeds fund shall be transferred into the law enforcement officers accreditation supplemental pay fund, creates a new statute that establishes the law enforcement officers accreditation supplemental pay fund, creates a new section to establish the bulletproof vests.

title: Sheriffs Annual Salary
author: ['Barrett (R)']
summary: Removes the maximum limit on the annual salary supplement which may be paid to the sheriff of the county.

title: Body Cameras
author: ['Scott O (D)', 'Anderson (D)', 'Karriem (D)', 'Paden (D)', 'Hudson (D)', 'Gibbs D (D)', 'Summers (D)']
summary: Suspends the deadlines for the purpose of requesting the drafting, and the introduction, consideration and passage, of a bill entitled an act to require each law enforcement officer in this state to wear body cameras at all times while on duty as a law enforcement officer, requires each law enforcement vehicle to have cameras for the purposes of recording all interactions of law enforcement with non law enforcement, provides penalties for any law enforcement agency that fails to provide such cameras.

title: Constitutional Amendment
author: ['Schroer (R)']
summary: Proposes an amendment to the Constitution of Missouri prohibiting increases in property tax rates for municipalities and other political subdivisions that defund local law enforcement.

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Contracts
author: ['Windham (D)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement agencies from contracting with entities to provide instruction unless the instructors and curriculum have been approved by the POST commission.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Residency Requirements
status: Pending - House Rules - Administrative Oversight Committee
author: ['Luetkemeyer (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officer residency requirements.

title: Protect Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - Senate Governmental Accountability and Fiscal Oversight Committee
author: ['Schnelting (R)']
summary: Establishes provisions to protect law enforcement officers and first responders.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Accountability
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary & Civil & Criminal Jurisprudence Committee
author: ['Williams (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement agency accountability.

title: Crimes Committed Against Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Bean (R)']
summary: Relates to crimes committed against law enforcement officers and first responders.

title: Occupational Diseases Diagnosed in First Responders
status: Pending - Senate Insurance and Banking Committee
author: ['Eigel (R)']
summary: Relates to occupational diseases diagnosed in first responders.

title: Police Violence
author: ['Bosley (D)']
summary: Urges a commitment by the House of Representatives to addressing police violence and ensuring that law enforcement officers who engage in misconduct, discrimination, or inappropriate use of force are held accountable for their actions.

title: Prohibitions Against Discriminatory Policing
status: Pending - Senate Transportation, Infrastructure, and Public Safety Committee
author: ['May (D)']
summary: Relates to prohibitions against discriminatory policing.

author: ['Hill (R)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to law enforcement officers.

title: Income Tax Deduction for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Gregory D (R)']
summary: Authorizes an income tax deduction for law enforcement officers.

title: Police Protection Districts
status: Pending - Senate Transportation, Infrastructure, and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Mosley (D)']
summary: Relates to police protection districts.

title: Use of Chokeholds
author: ['Manlove (D)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement officers from using chokeholds, carotid restraints, and vascular immobility.

title: Civil Action for Summoning a Police Officer
author: ['Manlove (D)']
summary: Allows a civil action for summoning a police officer.

title: Peace Officer Licensure
status: Pending - House Rules - Administrative Oversight Committee
author: ['Brown (R)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to peace officer licensure.

title: Peace Officer Basic Training Tuition Reimbursement
status: Pending - Senate Transportation, Infrastructure, and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Roberts L (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues']
summary: Establishes the Peace Officer Basic Training Tuition Reimbursement Program.

title: Affirmative Defense to Prosecution for Law Enforcement
author: ['Roberts L (R)']
summary: Creates an affirmative defense to prosecution for law enforcement officers who acted under exigent circumstances in failing to execute an arrest warrant on a person who committed certain motor vehicle offenses.

title: Use of a Chokehold By a Law Enforcement Officer
status: Pending - Senate Transportation, Infrastructure, and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Roberts (D)']
summary: Relates to the use of a chokehold by a law enforcement officer.

title: Occupational Diseases Diagnosed in First Responders
status: Pending - Senate Insurance and Banking Committee
author: ['Luetkemeyer (R)']
summary: Relates to occupational diseases diagnosed in certain first responders.

title: Webpage for Firearms Reported Stolen
author: ['Mayhew (R)']
summary: Requires the Missouri State Highway Patrol to host a web page where the public can determine whether a serial number of a firearm has been reported stolen.

title: Kansas City Police Department Residency Requirements
author: ['Richey (R)']
summary: Modifies residency requirements for personnel of the Kansas City Police Department.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Use of Force
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary & Civil & Criminal Jurisprudence Committee
author: ['Washington (D)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to law enforcement officer use of force.

title: Reporting Requirements of Law Enforcement Agencies
status: Pending - Senate Transportation, Infrastructure, and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Washington (D)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to reporting requirements of law enforcement agencies.

title: Peace Officer Body Cameras
author: ['Proudie (D)']
summary: Requires peace officers to wear body cameras during interactions with members of the public.

title: Fees Paid To the Highway Patrol
status: Pending - Senate Transportation, Infrastructure, and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Brown (R)']
summary: Relates to fees paid to the Missouri highway patrol.

title: Searches and Seizures By Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - Senate Agriculture, Food Production and Outdoor Resources Committee
author: ['Rowden (R)']
summary: Relates to searches and seizures by certain law enforcement officers.

title: Law Enforcement Appreciation Day
status: Pending - House Rules - Legislative Oversight Committee
author: ['Tate (R)']
summary: Designates the first Friday in May each year as Law Enforcement Appreciation Day.

title: Use of Chokeholds By Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Dogan (R)']
summary: Prohibits the use of chokeholds by law enforcement officers.

status: Pending - House Rules - Administrative Oversight Committee
author: ['Dogan (R)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification']
summary: Establishes The John Ashcroft Fourth Amendment Affirmation Act.

author: ['Dogan (R)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to adopt written investigation policies for officer-involved deaths.

title: Income Tax Deduction for Police Officers
author: ['Christofanelli (R)']
summary: Authorizes an income tax deduction for police officers and members of the highway patrol.

title: Missouri Driver Guide
author: ['Young (D)']
summary: Requires the Department of Revenue to include in the Missouri Driver Guide educational material on vehicular stops and searches by law enforcement.

title: Occupational Diseases Diagnosed in First Responders
author: ['Hicks (R)']
summary: Adds provisions relating to occupational diseases diagnosed in first responders.

title: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights
author: ['Schroer (R)']
summary: Establishes the Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights.

title: Salary of County Sheriffs
status: Pending - Senate Transportation, Infrastructure, and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Brown (R)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to the salary of county sheriffs.

title: Arrange for Motor Vehicle Removal After Arrest
author: ['Windham (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to give persons under arrest forty-eight hours to arrange for their motor vehicle to be removed before authorizing a towing company to remove a motor vehicle.

title: Police Officers Minimum Wage
author: ['Windham (D)']
summary: Requires certain police officers to be paid a minimum wage of twenty dollars per hour.

title: Mental Health Programs for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['May (D)']
summary: Creates provisions relating to mental health programs for law enforcement officers.

title: Occupational Diseases Diagnosed in First Responders
status: Pending - House Rules - Legislative Oversight Committee
author: ['Schroer (R)']
summary: Creates new provisions relating to occupational diseases diagnosed in first responders.

summary: Modifies provisions relating to disciplinary actions for highway patrol members.

title: Searches and Seizures By Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary & Civil & Criminal Jurisprudence Committee
author: ['Moon (R)']
summary: Relates to searches and seizures by law enforcement officers.

title: Task Force on Body-Worn Cameras
author: ['Rogers (D)']
summary: Establishes within the department of public safety a Task Force on Body-Worn Cameras.

title: Retirement System
status: Pending - Senate Health and Pensions Committee
author: ['Bernskoetter (R)']
summary: Relates to the board of trustees of Missouri department of transportation and highway patrol employees' retirement system.

title: Fees for Obtaining Police Report
author: ['Ellebracht (D)']
summary: Prohibits a municipal court from charging a defendant a fee for obtaining a police report or probable cause statement.

title: Court Cost for Service of Documents and Orders
author: ['Houx (R)']
summary: Provides that the court clerk shall collect a specified amount as a court cost for service of any documents and orders of the court when any person other than a sheriff is specially appointed.

title: Offense of Sexual Conduct in the Course of Public Duty
author: ['Doll (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues']
summary: Creates the offense of sexual conduct in the course of public duty.

title: Peace Officer Licensure
author: ['Copeland R (R)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to peace officer licensure.

title: Municipal Police Departments in St. Louis County
author: ['Davis (R)']
summary: Requires certain municipal police departments in St. Louis County to consolidate with another municipal police department or the St. Louis County Police Department.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Dogan (R)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, modifies provisions relating to to sexual conduct in the course of public duty with certain detainees, modifies provisions relating to the offense of using of a laser pointer against a uniformed safety officer, provides fingerprinting requirements for peace officer licensure, provides immunity for chief executive officers of law enforcement agencies if they are in compliance with a certain section.

title: Voluntary Search Advisement and Consent
author: ['Doll (D)']
summary: Requires a peace officer to provide an oral advisement and obtain written consent for a voluntary search of a person not under arrest or the person's effects or vehicle.

title: Hate Crimes Against Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - House Rules - Legislative Oversight Committee
author: ['Cook (R)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to hate crimes against law enforcement officers and first responders.

title: Highway Patrol Fees for Record Requests

author: ['Ruth (R)']
summary: Allows the Highway patrol to charge certain fees for record requests.

title: Civil Actions Brought Against Peace Officers
author: ['Bosley (D)']
summary: Establishes provisions relating to civil actions brought against peace officers.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Accountability
author: ['Bosley (D)']
summary: Contains provisions relating to law enforcement officer accountability.

title: Database of Violent Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Bosley (D)']
topics: ['Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Requires the attorney general to set up a database containing names of law enforcement officers who have committed violent acts.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Use of Force Database
author: ['Aldridge (D)']
summary: Creates a law enforcement officer use-of-force database to be maintained by the Attorney General.

title: Time Allowed for Arrested Person to Arrange Towing
author: ['Aldridge (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to give persons under arrest ninety-six hours to arrange for their motor vehicle to be removed before authorizing a towing company to remove a motor vehicle.

title: Police Use of Force Transparency Act
author: ['DeGroot (R)']
summary: Establishes the Police Use of Force Transparency Act.

title: Law Enforcement Animals

summary: Modifies offenses relating to law enforcement animals.

author: ['Hovis (R)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to emergency orders to suspend peace officer licenses.

summary: Modifies provision relating to civilian review boards.

summary: Changes the Law regarding the compensation of sheriffs.

summary: Requires certain disclosures by a person applying for a position as a peace officer.

summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to adopt certain policies and practices regarding the investigation of deaths involving law enforcement officers.

summary: Establishes a board for review of officer-involved deaths.

summary: Modifies the provision allowing law enforcement officers to use deadly force in certain circumstances and establishes a task force on the use of force.

title: Task Force To Study Community Based Policing

summary: Establishes a Task Force to Study Community-based Policing within the Department of Public Safety.

summary: Requires law enforcement agencies that use confidential informants to adopt certain policies and procedures.

title: Law Enforcement Redaction from Public Records
author: ['Davis (R)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement agencies from setting policies redacting certain information from public records unless such information is protected from disclosure under state law.

summary: Relates to law enforcement officer disciplinary actions.

summary: Relates to occupational diseases diagnosed in first responders.

title: Law Enforcement Officers

author: author

title: Law Enforcement Qualification Changes
author: ['Lathrop (NP)']
summary: Changes and provides qualifications for and duties relating to certification of law enforcement officers, requires accreditation of law enforcement agencies, prohibits chokeholds in law enforcement, requires policies on excessive force.

title: Photographing or Recording a Peace Officer
author: ['Pansing Brooks (NP)']
topics: ['Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Technology']
summary: Provides that photographing or recording a peace officer is not obstruction of justice.

title: Use of Force in Law Enforcement
author: ['Pansing Brooks (NP)']
summary: Changes and provides duties relating to use of force in law enforcement.

title: Notice to Enforce Federal Immigration Law
author: ['Vargas (NP)']
summary: Requires jails and law enforcement agencies to provide public notice before entering into agreements to enforce federal immigration law.

title: State Patrol Insurance Premium Deduction
author: ['Brewer (NP)']
summary: Provides for an insurance premium deduction from the retirement annuity of certain Nebraska State Patrol employees.

title: Law Enforcement Training and Certification
author: ['Wishart (NP)']
summary: States intent regarding appropriations for law enforcement training and certification.

title: Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Wishart (NP)']
summary: States intent regarding appropriations for law enforcement training.

title: Peace Officer Public Communications
author: ['Wayne (NP)']
summary: Prohibits certain public communications by a peace officer.

title: Peace Officer Penalty for Filing a False Report
author: ['Wayne (NP)']
summary: Provides a penalty for filing a false report by a peace officer.

title: Line of Duty Compensation Act
author: ['Hansen M (NP)']
summary: Adopts the In the Line of Duty Compensation Act, provides definitions, eligibility, and determination of compensation amounts.

title: Civil Action for Damages by Public Safety Officers
author: ['Halloran (NP)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Standards']
summary: Authorizes a civil action for damages sustained by public safety officers.

title: Commission on Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice
author: ['Hansen M (NP)']
summary: Appropriates funds to the Nebraska Commission on Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice.

title: Claims Against First Responders
author: ['Slama (NP)']
summary: Provides immunity for claims against first responders operating motor vehicles and arising from vehicular pursuits and provide for policies, training, and duties relating to vehicular pursuits.

title: Peace Officers Taking Juveniles into Custody
author: ['Hansen M (NP)']
summary: Changes requirements for peace officers taking juveniles into custody or interrogating juveniles and prohibit use of statements taken in violation of such requirements.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['DeBoer (NP)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, requires a law enforcement officer to intervene when excessive force is used, requires law enforcement agencies to adopt policies on excessive force.

title: Municipal Police Oversight Act
author: ['McKinney (NP)']
summary: Adopts the Municipal Police Oversight Act.

title: Law Enforcement Qualifications
author: ['Wayne (NP)']
summary: Changes and provides qualifications for and duties relating to certification of law enforcement officers, require accreditation of law enforcement agencies, prohibit chokeholds in law enforcement, require policies on excessive force, and create a public data base of law enforcement officer misconduct.

title: Includes Body Worn Camera as Public Record
author: ['Hansen M (NP)']
summary: Changes provisions relating to public records and include body-worn camera recordings in certain circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Discipline Records
author: ['McKinney (NP)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to maintain records regarding officer discipline and create a public data base of law enforcement officer misconduct.

title: Interim Study
author: ['Pansing Brooks (NP)']
summary: Allows for an interim study to complete a comprehensive review on the reform of policing in Nebraska.

title: Interim Study
author: ['Geist (NP)']
summary: Allows for an interim study to examine whether continuity of care and safety for individuals and the public can be enhanced by allowing mental health providers to coordinate with law enforcement.

title: Interim Study
status: Failed - Adjourned - Business and Labor Committee
author: ['Hansen M (NP)']
summary: Allows for an interim study to review the collective bargaining agreements of law enforcement agencies and the statutory requirements for such agreements.

title: Interim Study
status: Failed - Adjourned - Nebraska Retirement Systems Committee
author: ['McDonnell (NP)']
summary: Allows for an interim study to examine retirement benefits for law enforcement employees in all counties except counties containing a city of the metropolitan class.

title: Interim Study
author: ['Hansen M (NP)']
summary: Allows for an interim study to examine the terms used to refer to law enforcement officers in Nebraska statutes.

title: Interim Study
author: ['Hansen M (NP)']
summary: Allows for an interim study to examine law enforcement jurisdictions in the state and the existing policies on the use of force by law enforcement officers.

title: Racial Profiling and Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Chambers (NP)']
summary: Changes provisions relating to racial profiling and require law enforcement training.

title: Municipal Police Oversight Act
author: ['Wayne (NP)']
summary: Adopts the Municipal Police Oversight Act.

title: Criminal Procedure
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to criminal procedure, prohibits a magistrate from issuing a no-knock arrest warrant or search warrant except under certain circumstances.

title: Civil Action filed by Attorney General
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to the Attorney General, authorizes the Attorney General to file a civil action to eliminate certain patterns or practices that deprive persons of certain rights, privileges or immunities, requires a law enforcement agency to provide notice to the Attorney General if a peace officer uses physical force that results in substantial bodily harm to or the death of another person, provides a penalty, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Peace Officer Civil Liability
author: ['Wheeler (R)']
summary: Relates to civil liability, authorizes a peace officer to bring a civil action for damages under certain circumstances, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Peace Officer Lawful Use of Force Training
author: ['Office of Ohrenschall']
summary: Requires peace officers to be trained in the constitutional and lawful use of force.

title: Peace Officers Standards and Training Program
author: ['Frierson (D)']
summary: Makes various changes regarding the Peace Officers Standards and Training program.

title: Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission
author: ['Frierson (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to peace officers, revises provisions relating to the Executive Director of the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Peace Officer Portable Event Recording Devices
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Flores E (D)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, revises provisions requiring certain peace officers to wear a portable event recording device under certain circumstances, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Peace Officer Open Carry Interaction Training
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Flores E (D)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, requires a law enforcement agency to provide training to peace officers in approaching and interacting with a person who is openly carrying a firearm, requires all uniformed peace officers to wear a portable event recording device while interacting with the public on duty, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Roberts (R)']
summary: Revises provisions governing the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission.

title: Peace Officer Civil Liability
author: ['Monroe-Moreno (D)']
summary: Relates to civil liability, authorizes a person who is the victim of certain discriminatory conduct relating to an incident involving a peace officer to bring a civil action under certain circumstances, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Compensation
author: ['Office of Pickard']
summary: Restores compensation for Nevada Highway Patrol Troopers and support staff.

title: Peace Officer Traffic Citation or Arrest Quota
author: ['Nguyen (D)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, prohibits a law enforcement agency from requiring a peace officer to issue a certain number of traffic citations or make a certain number of arrests, prohibits a law enforcement agency from considering the number of citations issued or arrests made by a peace officer, or the amount of fines or fees assessed from the citations or arrests, in evaluating the performance of the peace officer, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Use of Force by Peace Officer Incident Reports
author: ['Harris D (D)']
topics: ['Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to peace officers, revises provisions relating to the use of force by peace officers, requires certain law enforcement agencies to submit to the Office of the Attorney General certain information relating to certain incidents involving the use of force by peace officers, requires the preparation and submittal of a report relating to such information, prohibits the use of restraint chairs.

title: Law Enforcement and Surveillance Devices
author: ['Hansen (R)']
summary: Relates to criminal procedure, defines certain terms, including the term surveillance device, prohibits law enforcement officers from using surveillance devices except when authorized by surveillance warrants or in exigent circumstances, establishes provisions relating to applying, issuing and executing surveillance warrants.

title: Policing Reform
author: ['Office of Harris']
summary: Makes changes relating to policing reform.

title: Use of Mobile Devices by Peace Officers
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Frierson (D)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, requires each law enforcement agency to adopt a written policy establishing standards of conduct for the use of mobile devices by peace officers employed by the law enforcement agency, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission
author: ['Roberts (R)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, revises the membership of the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Police Officers
author: ['Monroe-Moreno (D)']
summary: Provides for certain annual requirements relating to police officers.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Duran (D)']
summary: Revises provisions governing peace officers.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Krasner (R)']
summary: Revises provisions governing peace officers.

title: Peace Officer Bias Indicator Early Warning Systems
author: ['Harris D (D)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to public safety, requires law enforcement agencies to establish early warning systems to identify peace officers who display bias indicators or other problematic behavior, authorizes the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to adopt regulations relating to such early warning systems, revises the qualifications for certification as a peace officer by the Commission, imposes liability on peace officers who subject another person.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Office of Flores']
summary: Revises provisions governing peace officers.

title: Body Cameras
author: ['Office of Flores']
summary: Revises provisions governing the use of body cameras for peace officers.

title: State Police Reform Advisory Task Force
author: ['Orentlicher (D)']
summary: Relates to the administration of justice, creates the Nevada Police Reform Advisory Task Force and prescribing its membership and duties, revises certain provisions relating to the sentences of offenders who are less than 21 years of age, requires each prosecutorial office to establish a system of race-blind charging to be used when determining whether criminal charges should be filed against a person, requires each district attorney to establish a system of race-blind charging.

title: Peace Officers Use of Force
author: ['Krasner (R)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, requires each law enforcement agency to adopt a written policy regarding the use of force, prohibits a peace officer from using deadly force against a person based on the danger that the person poses to himself or herself under certain circumstances, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Supervisor Ratios
author: ['Frierson (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, requires certain law enforcement agencies to maintain specific supervisor ratios, establishes provisions relating to staffing assignments of nonsupervisory peace officers and first-line supervisors, requires first-line supervisors to perform certain duties relating to the use of force by nonsupervisory peace officers, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Public Employees Collective Bargaining
author: ['Harris D (D)']
summary: Relates to public employees, revises the definition of supervisory employee for purposes of collective bargaining for local government and state employees to include certain peace officers and persons who provide civilian support services to a law enforcement agency, revises the definition of employee for purposes of collective bargaining for state employees to include category II peace officers who are in the unclassified service of the State.

title: Peace Officers Continuing Education
author: ['Frierson (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, revises provisions governing the standards for programs of continuing education for peace officers, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Police Officer or Firefighter Mental Health Information
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ["O'Neill (R)"]
summary: Relates to public employees, requires the employer of a police officer or firefighter to make available certain information and counseling relating to mental health issues to the police officer or firefighter, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Peace Officer Annual Behavioral Healthcare Assessment
author: ['Monroe-Moreno (D)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, requires the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to adopt regulations establishing standards for an annual behavioral healthcare assessment for peace officers, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Use of Deadly Force and Justifiable Homicide
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to peace officers, revises provisions relating to justifiable homicide, revises provisions relating to the use of deadly force to effectuate an arrest, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Public Safety and Law Enforcement Activity
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to public safety, clarifies the application of certain provisions relating to the recording of law enforcement activity, the placing of a person in certain positions by a peace officer and the use of physical force by a peace officer, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Recruitment and Selection of Peace Officers
author: ['Government Affairs Cmt']
summary: Relates to peace officers, requires the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to adopt certain regulations concerning the recruitment and selection of peace officers, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Criminal Forfeiture Process Act
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to criminal procedure, establishes the Criminal Forfeiture Process Act, revises provisions relating to the civil forfeiture of property and proceeds attributable to certain crimes, authorizes the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to provide training in the certification of peace officers relating to the Act, repeals certain provisions relating to property subject to forfeiture, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

title: Terms if Aggregate Offense and Crime Of Violence
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to crimes, defines the terms aggregate offense and crime of violence, requires a peace officer to issue a misdemeanor citation in lieu of executing a warrant by arresting the defendant if the warrant is issued upon an offense punishable as a misdemeanor and the offense does not constitute an aggregate offense or a crime of violence, requires certain persons to issue misdemeanor citations, traffic citations, vessel citations and wildlife citations under certain circumstances for offenses.

title: Crimes Committed Against Peace Officers
author: ['Wheeler (R)']
summary: Revises provisions governing crimes committed against peace officers.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Frierson (D)']
summary: Revises provisions governing peace officers.
