author: ['Government Affairs Cmt']
summary: Revises provisions governing peace officers.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Committee of the Whole Cmt']
summary: Relates to peace officers, eliminates the prohibition on the use of a peace officer's compelled statement in a civil case, revises provisions regarding when a law enforcement agency may initiate an investigation into the alleged misconduct of a peace officer, revises provisions relating to the reassignment of a peace officer who is under investigation, authorizes a peace officer or representative to inspect certain evidence and submit a response after the conclusion of an investigation.

title: Public Safety
author: ['Committee of the Whole Cmt']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Authorizes a person to record law enforcement activity, revises provisions relating to the use of physical force by a peace officer, requires a peace officer to intervene to prevent the use of unjustified physical force by another peace officer and report the observation, requires agencies to adopt a policy regarding the drug and alcohol testing of a peace officer, relates to probation or suspension of sentence, relates to traffic stops and other stops by law enforcement officers.

title: Peace Officer Lawful Use of Force Training
author: ['Office of Ohrenschall']
summary: Requires peace officers to be trained in the constitutional and lawful use of force.

author: ['Frierson (D)']
summary: Makes various changes regarding the Peace Officers Standards and Training program.

title: Peace Officers
author: ['Roberts (R)']
summary: Revises provisions governing the Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission.

summary: Restores compensation for Nevada Highway Patrol Troopers and support staff.

summary: Makes changes relating to policing reform.

summary: Provides for certain annual requirements relating to police officers.

summary: Revises provisions governing peace officers.

summary: Revises provisions governing peace officers.

author: ['Office of Flores']
summary: Revises provisions governing the use of body cameras for peace officers.

author: ['Wheeler (R)']
summary: Revises provisions governing crimes committed against peace officers.

title: Use of Deadly Force By a Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['True (R)']
summary: Relates to the use of deadly force by a law enforcement officer.

title: Police Disciplinary Hearings
author: ['French (R)', 'Reagan (R)']
summary: Provides that a party may petition to close a portion of a police disciplinary hearing.

title: Body Worn Cameras
author: ['Cushing (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to wear body cameras and establishing a grant program to assist local law enforcement agencies to purchase of body worn cameras.

title: Use of Deadly Force by a Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['True (R)', 'Edwards J (R)', 'Greene (R)']
summary: Removes the legal authority for a law enforcement officer to use deadly force in effecting an arrest.

title: Fees for the Services of Sheriffs and Deputy Sheriffs
author: ["D'Allesandro (D)", 'Bradley (R)', 'Watters (D)']
summary: Increases fees for certain services of sheriffs and deputy sheriffs.

title: Qualified Immunity
author: ['Berch (D)']
summary: Eliminates qualified immunity in certain cases of alleged police misconduct.

title: Death Benefits of First Responders Who Die From Suicide
status: Pending - Retained in Committee for Second Year Action
author: ['Abbas (R)', 'Doucette (R)', 'Lang (R)', 'Roy (R)', 'Trottier (R)']
summary: Relates to death benefits of first responders who die from suicide.

title: Post-Arrest Photo Distribution
author: ['Klein (D)']
summary: Relates to post-arrest photo distribution by law enforcement officers.

title: Penalty for Criminal Mischief
status: Pending - House Criminal Justice and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Bradley (R)', "D'Allesandro (D)", 'Giuda (R)', 'Carson (R)', 'Avard (R)', 'Hennessey E (R)', 'Cavanaugh (D)', 'Ricciardi (R)']
summary: Increases the penalty for criminal mischief involving vandalizing public property, amends the statute governing bail and pre-trial release to include provisions for pre-trial detention for commission of certain offenses that would create a presumption that the defendant is a danger to the public, requires an employer to release information upon request by a law enforcement agency conducting a background check on a candidate for a position as a law enforcement officer.

title: Implicit Bias Training for Judges
author: ['Bradley (R)', 'Smith M (D)', "D'Allesandro (D)", 'Rosenwald (D)', 'Cushing (D)', 'Watters (D)', 'Morse (R)', 'Gray (R)', 'Sherman (D)', 'Soucy D (D)', 'Hennessey E (R)', 'Kahn (D)', 'Kwoka (D)', 'Prentiss (D)', 'Whitley (D)']
summary: Amends the municipal retention schedule for certain police non-criminal internal affairs investigations, extends the authority of a law enforcement officer to any elementary, secondary, or postsecondary educational institution pursuant to a request or written agreement with the administrator of the institution or the governing body of the school district, establishes a body-worn and dashboard camera fund and makes an appropriation therefor, amends the juvenile delinquency statutes.

title: Safe Use Of Publicly Accessible Recreation Areas
status: Pending - House Executive Departments and Administration Committee
author: ['Whitley (D)', 'Alicea (D)', 'Harriott-Gathri (D)', 'Espitia (D)', 'Wazir (D)', 'Perez (D)', 'Kwoka (D)', 'Prentiss (D)']
summary: Requires the departments of natural and cultural resources and fish and game to develop protocols to address the enjoyment and safe use of publicly-accessible recreation areas for people without fear of violence resulting from discrimination, and requires authorized personnel from both departments to undergo ethics and diversity training, requires the police standards and training council to provide additional training to law enforcement officers.

title: Post Arrest Photo Distribution
author: ['Klein (D)', 'Bouchard (D)', 'Roy (R)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement from distributing post-arrest photos of suspects except in certain circumstances.

title: Procedure for Conducting Firearm Background Checks
status: Pending - House Criminal Justice and Public Safety Committee
author: ['Giuda (R)', 'Avard (R)', 'Burt (R)', 'Edwards J (R)', 'Gorski (R)', 'Kelsey (R)', 'Rhodes (R)']
summary: Authorizes the FBI to conduct all National Instant Criminal Background Check System searches concerning the purchase, sale, and transfer of firearms through Federal Firearm Licensees operating in the State, abolishes the ""gun line"" in the division of state police, repeals the states partial point of contact system for handguns, allowing the authority to remain exclusively with the FBI, authorizes county sheriffs to conduct background searches using NICS.

title: Omnibus Legislation Relative to Study Commissions
author: ['Birdsell (R)']
summary: Reestablishes the commission to study the incidence of post-traumatic stress disorder in first responders, requires first responders to have mental health training focusing on post-traumatic stress disorder, relates to the commission to study barriers to increased land development, reestablishes the commission to study grandfamilies.

title: Reporting a Collision Between a Cat and a Motor Vehicle
author: ['Abbas (R)', 'Janigian (R)', 'Burroughs (D)', 'Kenney (D)']
summary: Requires the reporting of a collision between a cat and a motor vehicle to the cat's owner or the police.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Body Worn Cameras
status: Pending - Retained in Committee for Second Year Action
author: ['Conley (D)', 'Cushing (D)', 'Mangipudi (D)', 'Wilhelm (D)', 'Labranche (D)', 'Moran (D)']
summary: Establishes the public safety enhancement fund, requires all law enforcement officers to use body-worn cameras, transfers one percent of the money from the penalty assessment fund to the public safety enhancement fund.

title: Peace Officer Status for Federal Law Enforcement
author: ['Schmidt J (D)', 'Shurtleff (D)']
summary: Allows federal law enforcement officers to be certified by the commissioner of the department of safety for the purpose of making arrests.

title: Destruction of Valueless Contraband By Chief of Police
author: ['Long (D)']
summary: Allows the destruction of valueless contraband by the chief of police.

title: Police Disciplinary Hearings
author: ['Roy (R)', 'Welch (R)', 'Reagan (R)', 'Bixby (D)', 'Bordenet (D)', 'Potucek (R)', 'Spillane (R)', 'Frost S (D)', 'King (D)', 'Stevens (D)', 'Moran (D)']
summary: Requires police disciplinary hearings to be open to the public unless certain confidential information may be revealed.

title: Right to Refuse a Consensual Search
author: ['Roy (R)', 'Abramson (R)', 'Avellani (R)', 'Potucek (R)', 'Binford (R)', 'Bouldin A (D)', 'Fellows (D)', 'Klein (D)', 'King B (R)', 'Moran (D)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer to inform a person of their right to refuse a consensual search before conducting a consensual search.

title: No Knock Warrants
author: ['Bouldin (D)', 'Rosenwald (D)', 'Bordenet (D)', 'DiLorenzo (D)', 'Gourgue (D)', 'Bouldin A (D)', 'Craig (R)', 'McWilliams (D)', 'Meuse (D)', 'Nutting-Wong (D)', 'Labranche (D)', 'Whitley (D)']
summary: Prohibits a law enforcement officer from seeking, executing, or participating in the execution of a no-knock search warrant.

title: Candidate Background Checks for Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Dolan (R)', 'Lekas T (R)']
summary: Allows an employer to share certain information with a law enforcement agency about a candidate for a position as a peace officer or other position within a law enforcement agency.

title: Police Disciplinary Hearings
author: ['Senator Harold French']
summary: Relates to police disciplinary hearings.

title: Penalty for Criminal Mischief
author: ['Office of Bradley']
summary: Relates to increasing the penalty for criminal mischief, the release of a defendant pending trial, and requiring law enforcement candidate background checks.

title: Group II Accidental Disability Allowances

title: Use of Deadly Force Reporting
author: ['Sedillo Lopez (D)', 'Ortiz y Pino (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Relates to criminal procedure, provides a reporting mechanism and an assignment of a prosecutor following the use of deadly force by a peace officer resulting in great bodily harm or death, provides for an independent investigation.

title: Law Enforcement Licensure
author: ['Maestas (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, creates the law enforcement certification board, changes the entity responsible for police officer and telecommunicator certification suspensions, revocations and reinstatements from the law enforcement academy board to the law enforcement certification board, amends the composition of the law enforcement academy board, amends the powers and duties of the director of the law enforcement academy board.

title: Law Enforcement Mental Health Programs
author: ['Soules (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement mental health programs.

title: Officer Training and Certification
author: ['Munoz (D)', 'Ingle (R)']
summary: Relates to public safety, provides for new areas of emergency responder training, creates a law enforcement officer database, creates the law enforcement certification board, makes an appropriation.

title: Prohibit Defense of Qualified Immunity
author: ['Cervantes (D)']
summary: Relates to prohibit defense of qualified immunity.

title: Emergency Dispatchers as Police Under PERA
author: ['Gallegos (R)']
summary: Relates to emergency dispatchers as police under PERA.

title: Law Enforcement Body Cam Exceptions
author: ['Baca (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement body cam exceptions.

title: Study Model Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Sedillo Lopez (D)']
summary: Relates to a study of model law enforcement training, requests the University of New Mexico of Law to convene a task force to study model law enforcement training curricula from other jurisdictions and make recommendations to improve the current curriculum.

title: Study Model Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Hochman (D)']
summary: Relates to a study of model law enforcement training, requests the University of New Mexico of Law to convene a task force to study model law enforcement training curricula from other jurisdictions and make recommendations to improve the current curriculum.

title: Law Enforcement Use of Force Reporting
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Rules and Order Of Business Committee
author: ['Roybal Caballer (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement use of force reporting.

title: Law Enforcement Body Cameras
author: ['Cervantes (D)']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Requires certain law enforcement agencies to use body-worn cameras, requires law enforcement agencies to adopt certain policies and procedures, revokes a police officer's certification after conviction or making certain pleas, adds a cause of action for spoliation by a law enforcement officer in the tort claims act.

title: Police Personnel Records
author: ['Quart (D)', 'Benedetto (D)', 'Kim (D)', 'Dilan (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Technology']
summary: Excludes video camera recordings from cameras worn or used by police from being included as personnel records, makes certain records available to independent review boards.

title: Reverse Location and Keyword Searches
author: ['Quart (D)', 'Rosenthal (D)', 'Hyndman (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Amends the criminal procedure law, prohibits the search, with or without a warrant, of geolocation and keyword data of a group of people who are under no individual suspicion of having committed a crime, but rather are defined by having been at a given location at a given time or searched particular words, phrases, character strings, or websites.

title: Reporting Use of Force by Police Officer
author: ['Quart (D)', 'Jackson C (D)']
summary: Relates to reporting the use of force by a police officer or peace officer.

title: Traffic Stops
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)']
summary: Relates to traffic stops conducted by law enforcement officers involving racial profiling.

title: Removal of Policemen
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Myrie (D)', 'Kavanagh (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to the removal of policemen.

title: Transport of Arrested Persons
author: ['Liu (D)']
summary: Limits the transport of an arrested, detained or apprehended person in an unmarked police vehicle or concealed identity police vehicle.

title: Pre-Employment Course Curricula for Police
author: ['Persaud (D)']
summary: Requires the inclusion of diversity and inclusion training in the basic training and pre-employment course curricula for police, firefighters, correction officers and first responders.

title: Auxiliary Police Officers
author: ['Addabbo (D)', 'Kaminsky (D)', 'Gounardes (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Mannion (D)']
summary: Relates to on duty auxiliary police officers.

title: Spoofing of Police Agency Telephone Number
author: ['Kaplan (D)']
summary: Establishes the crimes of spoofing a police agency telephone number in the first and second degrees as a class E felony and a class A misdemeanor.

title: Aggravated Harassment of a Police Officer
author: ['Jones (D)', 'Colton (D)', 'Thiele (I)', 'Lavine (D)', 'Lupardo (D)', 'Montesano (R)', 'Friend (R)', 'Byrne (R)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated harassment of a police officer where a person causes such police officer to come into contact with blood, seminal fluid, urine, feces, or the contents of a toilet bowl, by throwing, tossing or expelling such fluid or material.

title: Training Requirements for Peace Officers
status: Pending - Assembly Economic Development, Job Creation, Commerce, and Industry Committee
author: ['Braunstein (D)']
summary: Amends the General Business Law, relates to the training requirements for peace officers, creates a waiver of these requirements for federal law enforcement officers.

title: Crisis Intervention Demonstration Program
author: ['Hoylman (D)', 'Comrie (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a Crisis Intervention Demonstration Program.

title: Orders of Custody
status: Pending - Senate Children and Families Committee
author: ['Hoylman (D)', 'Mayer (D)']
summary: Requires orders of custody to state whether law enforcement is authorized to remove a child or children in order to comply with and enforce such orders.

title: Service in the Form of Magnetic Tape
status: Pending - Senate Budget and Revenues Committee
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Permits consent for service in the form of magnetic tape or through electronic means for certain collection procedures by the sheriff's office or an officer or employee of the department of taxation and finance.

title: Police Officer Use of Racial and Ethnic Profiling
author: ['Benjamin (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Prohibits police officers from using racial and ethnic profiling, requires that a procedure be established for the taking and review of complaints against police officers for racial and ethnic profiling, allows an action for injunctive relief and/or damages to be brought against a law enforcement agency, any agent of a law enforcement agency and the supervisor of an agent.

title: Discoverability of Recordings on Police Body Cameras
author: ['Myrie (D)', 'Comrie (D)']
summary: Amends the civil practice law and rules and the criminal procedure law, relates to recordings found on police cameras, establishes the Panel of Experts on the Use and Disclosure of Recorded Video, Digital Audio, Film and Photographs.

title: Municipal Police Training Council
author: ['Biaggi (D)']
summary: Requires the municipal police training council to develop policies and procedures regarding the use of internet technology and the use of such technology to perpetuate harassment or other crimes.

title: Blue Alert System
author: ['Kaminsky (D)', 'Addabbo (D)', 'Kennedy (D)', 'Gaughran (D)', 'Kaplan (D)']
summary: Establishes a blue alert system to aid in the identification, location and apprehension of any individuals suspected of killing or seriously wounding any local, state or federal law enforcement officer.

title: Granting of Peace Officer Powers
author: ['Thomas (D)']
summary: Grants Federal Bureau of Investigation police certain peace officer powers.

title: Maximum Fine for Equipment Violations
author: ['Gounardes (D)', 'Gaughran (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Amends the vehicle and traffic law, relates to certain equipment violations and fines, amends the executive law, relates to requiring police vehicles to be equipped with a decibel reader.

title: Supplemental Burial Allowance for First Responders
status: Pending - Senate Veterans, Homeland Security and Military Affairs Committee
author: ['Kaplan (D)']
summary: Establishes a supplemental burial allowance for certain first responders.

title: Use of Chemical Incapacitant by Law Enforcement Agency
author: ['Biaggi (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Myrie (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Provides that no law enforcement agency shall use a chemical incapacitant except for pepper spray, defines terms.

title: Police Misconduct Complaint Review Board
author: ['Seawright (D)', 'Darling (D)', 'Anderson (D)', 'Meeks (D)']
summary: Creates the New York state civilian complaint review board to investigate alleged misconduct by police and peace officers.

title: Appointment as Police Officer
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Biaggi (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Myrie (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Decertification']
summary: Provides that no person shall be eligible for appointment as a police officer who was previously employed as a police officer and who: (i) was dismissed for malfeasance or other serious misconduct calling into question such person's fitness to serve as a police officer, or (ii) resigned or retired from such officer's position while under investigation for such malfeasance or other serious misconduct, defines terms, makes related provisions.

title: Use of Unmarked Police Vehicles
author: ['Biaggi (D)']
summary: Prohibits the use of unmarked police vehicles, concealed identity police vehicles and undercover police officers for routine traffic enforcement.

title: Office of the Correctional Ombudsman
author: ["O'Donnell (D)", 'Glick (D)', 'Nolan (D)', 'Benedetto (D)', 'Lavine (D)', 'Weprin D (D)', 'Rozic (D)', 'Simon (D)']
summary: Creates the office of the correctional ombudsman to achieve transparency, fairness, impartiality and accountability in New York state correctional facilities, relates to reports by coroners, designates investigators of the office of the correctional ombudsman as peace officers, authorizes the attorney general to investigate the alleged commission of any criminal offense committed by an employee of the department of corrections and community supervision in connection with his or her official duties.

title: Police Officer Discipline
author: ['Magnarelli (D)', 'Hunter (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in cities with a population between one hundred thirty-nine thousand and one hundred forty-five thousand.

title: National Instant Criminal Background Checks
author: ['Paulin (D)']
summary: Relates to the point of contact for conducting national instant criminal background checks, authorizes and directs the division of state police to serve as the point of contact for implementation of specified section, establishes the background check fund.

title: Crime Against an Essential Worker
author: ['Gaughran (D)']
summary: Provides that a person commits a crime against an essential worker during a declared state disaster emergency when he or she commits a specified offense against an essential worker and such crime is committed against such worker while in the course of their employment during the pendency of a declared state disaster emergency, defines terms, makes related provisions.

title: Assault Offenses Regarding Police Officers
author: ['Buttenschon (D)']
summary: Increases the offense classification for certain assault offenses regarding police officers and peace officers.

title: Injury Occurring During Mutual Aid Call
author: ['Gaughran (D)', 'Comrie (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Requires the state to provide reimbursement of certain costs and benefits incurred as a result of an injury occurring during a mutual aid call.

title: Police Officers Liability Insurance
author: ['Biaggi (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to maintain liability insurance, excludes police officers from provisions requiring defense and indemnification of state officers and employees.

title: Crime of Stalking a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Buttenschon (D)']
summary: Creates the crime of stalking a police officer or peace officer when a person intentionally, and for no legitimate purpose, engages in a course of conduct directed at a specific police officer, peace officer or a person who he or she knows or reasonably should know is a member of such officer's immediate family, and knows or reasonably should know that such conduct is likely to cause reasonable fear of material harm to the physical health, safety or property of such officer or member.

title: Facial Recognition Technology
author: ['Hoylman (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Persaud (D)', 'Myrie (D)', 'Brisport (D)']
summary: Prohibits facial recognition technology to be used in connection with an officer camera used by both local and state police including the storage of biometric data.

title: Lethal or Offensive Weapons for Peace Officers
author: ['Liu (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'May (D)']
summary: Prohibits any local police department, county sheriff's office, the division of the state police or any agency that employs a peace officer in this state from participating in the 1033 federal excess property program for the purposes of receiving lethal or offensive weapons.

title: Canine Training Licensing and Educational Standards
author: ['Kaminsky (D)']
summary: Relates to requiring the commissioner to establish licensing and educational standards for individuals providing canine training for non-service and non-police dogs.

title: Orders of Custody Law Enforcement Removal of Children
author: ['Paulin (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Giglio (R)', 'Otis (D)', 'Buttenschon (D)', 'Sayegh (D)']
summary: Requires orders of custody to state whether law enforcement is authorized to remove a child or children in order to comply with and enforce such orders.

title: Basic Pre Employment Diversity and Inclusion Training
author: ['Buttenschon (D)', 'Thiele (I)', 'Gunther (D)', 'Woerner (D)', 'Griffin (D)']
summary: Requires the inclusion of diversity and inclusion training in the basic training and pre-employment course curricula for state police officers and municipal police officers and sheriffs, members of fire departments and companies, corrections officers, first responders, emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians.

title: Law Enforcement Racial and Ethnic Profiling Prohibition
author: ['Benjamin (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Harckham (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement officers from using racial and ethnic profiling, requires that a procedure be established for the taking and review of complaints against law enforcement officers for racial and ethnic profiling, allows an action for injunctive relief and or damages to be brought against a law enforcement agency.

title: Dangerous Employment Benefits
author: ['Buttenschon (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Establishes a dangerous employment benefit of five hundred thousand dollars for law enforcement officers who become seriously physically or mentally incapacitated or dies as the result of an injury, sustained in the performance or discharge of duties or as the natural and proximate result of an incident that occurred during such performance of duties.

title: Frontline Worker Trauma Informed Care Report
author: ['Gunther (D)', 'Rodriguez (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Oversight', ' Standards']
summary: Directs the commissioner of mental health to create a workgroup and report regarding frontline worker trauma informed care.

title: Employee Ticket Quota Discrimination
author: ['Gianaris (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Parker (D)', 'Serrano (D)', 'Rivera G (D)']
summary: Designates discrimination against employees for failure to meet certain ticket quotas as a class A misdemeanor.

title: Collective Bargaining and Police Officer Discipline
author: ['Magnarelli (D)', 'Hunter (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in municipalities in the state.

title: Doxing Police or Peace Officers
author: ['Woerner (D)', 'Lawler (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of doxing a police officer or a peace officer when a person knowingly makes restricted personal information about a police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, publicly available with the intent to threaten, intimidate, or incite the commission of a crime of violence against the police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, or with the intent and knowledge that the restricted personal information.

title: Annual Reports of Legal Settlement Payments
author: ['Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)']
summary: Requires annual reports of legal settlement payments related to law enforcement activity, such report shall include, but not be limited to, monetary amounts, plaintiffs and named parties, and shall be published on the website of the comptroller.

title: Sheriff Services Various Fixed Fees
author: ['Dinowitz (D)', 'Abbate (D)', 'Rosenthal D (D)']
summary: Increases the various fixed fees for the provision of certain services by the sheriff.

title: Minor Questioning by Police Officers
status: Pending - Assembly Children and Families Committee
author: ['Rosenthal (D)']
summary: Requires a parent or other person legally responsible for a minor and the law guardian appointed pursuant to law to be present during questioning by a peace or police officer.

title: State Police Superintendent Appointment and Duties
author: ['Krueger (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Parker (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Liu (D)']
summary: Relates to the appointment and reporting duties of the superintendent of the state police and to the appointment of employees of the state police.

title: State Civilian Police Misconduct Complaint Review Board
author: ['Serrano (D)', 'Parker (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Sanders (D)']
summary: Creates the New York State civilian complaint review board to investigate alleged misconduct by police and peace officers.

title: Discrimination in the Promotion of Police Officers
author: ['Pretlow (D)']
summary: Prohibits discrimination in the promotion of police officers who fail to meet their employer's traffic ticket quota.

title: Use of Deadly Force by Police Officer
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Rosenthal (D)', 'Dickens (D)', 'Taylor (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Limits the circumstances which justify the use of deadly force by a police officer or peace officer.

title: Terminated Peace Officers or Police Officers
author: ['Carroll (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Seawright (D)', 'Taylor (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Decertification']
summary: Prohibits prior peace officers or police officers whose position as such was terminated or vacated due to misconduct from again becoming a peace officer or a police officer.

title: Bullet Proof Vests for Officers Fund
author: ['Tedisco (R)']
summary: Establishes the bullet-proof vests for officers fund.

title: Police Officer Deadly Force Justification Limits
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, limits the circumstances which justify the use of deadly force by a police officer or peace officer.

title: Metropolitan Transportation Authority Police Force
status: Pending - Assembly Corporations, Authorities, and Commissions Committee
author: ['Reyes (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Englebright (D)', 'Rosenthal (D)', 'Carroll (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Requires members of the metropolitan transportation authority police force to wear body cameras and for such camera to be on at all times during the officer's shift, directs the chief of the metropolitan transportation authority police force to promulgate rules and regulations pertaining to such body cameras.

title: State Police Jumper Cable Requirements
author: ['Gounardes (D)']
summary: Requires state police to carry and offer use of jumper cables to disabled vehicles.

title: Facial Recognition Technology
author: ['Fernandez (D)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Prohibits facial recognition technology to be used in connection with an officer camera used by both local and state police including the storage of biometric data.

title: Timing of Proceedings Against a Body or an Officer
author: ['Perry (D)']
summary: Relates to the timing of proceedings against a body or an officer.

title: Re-Assignment of Police Officers
author: ['Perry (D)']
summary: Relates to the re-assignment of police officers pending certain investigations of incompetency or misconduct involving egregious behavior including, but not limited to, police brutality, intimidation, racial profiling, planting or fabricating evidence, unwarranted search and seizure, violating department procedures, and abuse of authority, and provides for an expeditious investigation of such incidents.

title: Line of Duty Sick Leave for First Responders
author: ['Sanders (D)', 'Persaud (D)', 'Brooks (D)']
summary: Provides line of duty sick leave for first responders who are diagnosed with or display symptoms of a pandemic virus.

title: Police Excessive Force Intervention
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Mandates that any police officer that is present and observes another police officer using force that is clearly excessive to safely intervene to prevent the use of such excessive force and report to the supervisor.

title: Police Officer Involved in Execution of Search Warrant
author: ['Perry (D)']
summary: Requires that each police officer involved in the execution of a search warrant wear a functioning and unobstructed body camera that shall be active prior to and throughout the execution of the search and during any related action following the execution of the search warrant.

title: Police Commissioner of the City of New York
author: ['Perry (D)']
summary: Provides that the police commissioner of the city of New York and all other cities with a population of one hundred thousand or more shall be an elected office with a four-year term, provides that such office shall be subject to term limits of two terms.

title: Issuance of Arrest Warrants and Appearance Tickets
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Cook (D)']
summary: Relates to the issuance of arrest warrants and appearance tickets upon a youth, provides for the police officer to immediately notify the parent or other person legally responsible for the care of such youth with whom the youth is domiciled that the youth has been arrested, provides further that the police officer need not notify the parent or other person legally responsible when such youth is not also a juvenile offender and the notification would endanger the health and safety of such youth.

title: Review of Incidents Where Civilian is Killed by Police
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Directs the attorney general to review incidents where a civilian is killed by a police officer.

title: Indefinite Suspension of New York City Police Officers
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Aubry (D)']
summary: Provides for the indefinite suspension of New York city police officers without pay pending the disposition of charges of incompetence or misconduct resulting in death or serious physical injury as defined in section 10.00 of the penal law.

title: New York City Auxiliary Police Officers
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Cook (D)']
summary: Waives the 60 credits required for New York City Auxiliary Police Officers to become members of the regular NYC police force for up to a period of 5 years, provided they are enrolled in college, otherwise meet the eligibility requirements and pass the entrance examination.

title: COVID 19 Extra Time for Heroes Act
author: ['Perry (D)']
summary: Enacts ""The COVID-19 Extra Time for Heroes Act"" providing an additional five days of personal time to public employees who worked as a certified first responder and a healthcare worker and had contact with infected patients during the Coronavirus 2019 pandemic.

title: Citizenship Requirements for Police and Firefighters
author: ['Perry (D)']
summary: Authorizes localities to waive citizenship requirements for certain police and firefighters in their jurisdictions.

title: Citizenship Requirements for Police and Firefighters
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Gottfried (D)']
summary: Authorizes localities to remove citizenship requirements for police and firefighters in their jurisdictions.

title: Toll Free Office of Court Administration Hotline
author: ['Pretlow (D)']
summary: Establishes a statewide toll-free office of court administration hotline for use by police officers seeking court orders to compel persons to submit to a chemical test of breath, blood, urine or saliva, to determine the alcohol and/or drug content.

title: Terroristic Threat Against a Police Officer
status: Pending - Senate Veterans, Homeland Security and Military Affairs Committee
author: ['Gallivan (R)', "O'Mara (R)", 'Akshar (R)', 'Helming (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of making a terroristic threat against a police officer, makes such crime a class C felony.

title: State Trooper Highway Memorial Task Force
author: ['Gallivan (R)']
summary: Creates a state trooper highway memorial task force to develop and establish guidelines for recognition of members of the division of state police who have died in the line of duty, provides such recognition shall be by means of dedicating a portion of the state highway system, or the placement of a memorial plaque or marker along a state highway.

title: Motorcycle Profiling Basic Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Lupardo (D)', 'Benedetto (D)', 'Rosenthal (D)', 'Stirpe (D)', 'Weprin D (D)']
summary: Requires the Municipal Police Training Council to ensure that issues related to motorcycle profiling are addressed in basic law enforcement training.

title: Police Misconduct Accusation Investigation
author: ['Pretlow (D)']
summary: Requires the superintendent of state police to investigate accusations of police misconduct filed against town or village police.

title: Municipal Police Department Member Training Expenses
author: ['Pretlow (D)']
summary: Includes all counties and cities with a population of two hundred thousand or less within provisions which permit the apportionment of expense of municipal police department member training, thus allowing police departments to receive reimbursement of training costs if an officer is hired by another department.

title: Pistol Permits for Active and Retired Police Disclosure
author: ['Pretlow (D)']
summary: Exempts from disclosure, under the freedom of information law, the issuance of pistol permits to active and retired police officers, peace officers and correction officers.

title: Diversity in Police Departments
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Bailey (D)']
summary: Amends the Civil Service Law, allows municipal commissions to use alternate lists for filling vacancies with resident and non-resident minority group members and women in order to achieve diversity in police departments.

title: Municipal Police Mandatory Hiring and Retirement Ages
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Ritchie (R)']
summary: Amends the Civil Service Law, relates to lifting mandatory hiring and retirement ages for municipal police.

title: Falsely Reporting Incidents
author: ['Ritchie (R)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, includes falsely reporting incidents in an attempt to bring about the dispatch of a large number of police officers to a particular address or location as a felony offense under the crime of falsely reporting an incident in the second degree.

title: Termination of Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Carroll (D)', 'Seawright (D)', 'Fernandez (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force']
summary: Requires the termination of any police officer or peace officer who uses physical force which is not justifiable or which is not part of procedure regardless of if harm is done any person or if any complaint is filed against such police officer or peace officer.

title: Hate Crime Designation
author: ['Akshar (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Brooks (D)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, designates offenses against law enforcement officers, firefighters and emergency medical services personnel as hate crimes.

title: Written Notice Requirements for Mass Layoffs
author: ['Otis (D)', 'Zinerman (D)']
summary: Relates to written notice requirements for mass layoffs, includes a requirement to notify each locality which provides police, firefighting, emergency medical or ambulance services to the site of employment at which the mass layoff will occur.

title: Police Body and Vehicle Camera Recordings
author: ['Perry (D)']
summary: Relates to the discoverability of recordings found on police body cameras and vehicle cameras, establishes Panel of Experts on the Use and Disclosure of Recorded Video, Digital Audio, Film, and Photographs.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
author: ['Cruz (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Simon (D)', 'Jackson C (D)', 'Zinerman (D)']
summary: Amends the Public Officers Law, relates to residency requirements for police officers in a City with a population of one million or more, provides that any person appointed as a paid member of the police force of such City shall become a resident of any political subdivision or municipal corporation within such City within one year of his or her appointment and shall continue to reside within any political subdivision or municipal corporation.

title: Police or Peace Officers Tampering with Body Camera
author: ['Jackson (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, includes a police or peace officers turning off his or her body camera or deleting a body camera recording in the crime of tampering with physical evidence.

title: Police Misconduct Intervention Immunity From Liability
author: ['Jackson (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Grants immunity from liability and professional retaliation against a law enforcement employee who intervenes against police misconduct committed by another member of law enforcement.

title: Criminal Offenses Committee by Police Officers
author: ['Aubry (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, authorizes the attorney general to investigate and prosecute the alleged commission of any crimal offense or offenses committed by police officers in connection with the performance of their regular duties.

title: Improper Conduct of Police Officer
author: ['Aubry (D)', 'Pretlow (D)']
summary: Provides that it shall not be an improper practice for a public employer to immediately refer to the appropriate district attorney any issue regarding the alleged improper conduct of a police officer within forty-eight hours of such conduct.

title: Law Enforcement Dangerous Employment Benefits
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Akshar (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Griffo (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes a dangerous employment benefit of five hundred thousand dollars for law enforcement officers who become seriously physically or mentally incapacitated or dies as the result of an injury, sustained in the performance or discharge of duties or as the natural and proximate result of an incident that occurred during such performance of duties.

title: Killing a Police Work Dog or Police Work Horse
author: ['Tedisco (R)', 'Jordan (R)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, elevates the offense of killing a police work dog or police work horse from being a class E felony to a class D felony, establishes the class E felony of injuring a police work dog or police work horse for intentionally causing serious physical injury to a police work dog or police work horse while such dog or horse is performing its duties under the supervision of a police officer.

title: First Responder Exposure to Fentanyl
author: ['Jordan (R)', 'Akshar (R)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, includes exposing a first responder to fentanyl, a fentanyl derivative or an opiate containing fentanyl or a fentanyl derivative in the definition of the offense of assault in the first degree.

title: Police Officers Annual Diversity Training Seminars
author: ['Tedisco (R)', 'Jordan (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Requires police officers to attend annual diversity training seminars.

title: Establishment of Police Training High Schools
author: ['Aubry (D)']
summary: Provides for the establishment of police training high schools in certain city school districts and provides for further education and employment, establishes preferential admissions criteria for the state and city universities, establishes preferential civil service criteria in the recruitment of police officers.

title: Military Surplus Equipment for Police Prohibition
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Prohibits state or local police from accepting military surplus equipment from the federal government.

title: Liability Insurance on Police Officers
author: ['Fernandez (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to requiring municipalities, authorities and agencies to obtain liability insurance on each duly appointed police officer in an amount not less than $200,000.

title: Law Enforcement Self Identification
author: ['Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)']
summary: Relates to requiring state and local law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public during law enforcement activities.

title: Establishment of Incapacity to Consent
author: ['May (D)', 'Biaggi (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, establishes incapacity to consent when a person is a witness to or subject of an investigation under certain circumstances.

title: Training Program for First Responders
author: ['Rosenthal (D)']
summary: Establishes a training program for first responders for responding to victims of suspected drug overdose and the administration of intranasal naloxone.

title: Office of the Correctional Ombudsman
status: Pending - Senate Crime Victims, Crime and Correction Committee
author: ['Sepulveda (D)', 'Benjamin (D)']
summary: Creates the office of the correctional ombudsman to achieve transparency, fairness, impartiality and accountability in New York state correctional facilities, relates to reports by coroners, designates investigators of the office of the correctional ombudsman as peace officers, authorizes the attorney general to investigate the alleged commission of any criminal offense committed by an employee of the department of corrections and community supervision in connection with his or her official duties.

title: Police Officer Reporting on Misconduct
author: ['Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, requires police officers to report the misconduct of a police officer, requires the division of criminal justice to establish a protocol to be followed by police agencies when handling and recording mandatory reports of misconduct by a police officer, amends the penal law, in relation to establishing the crime of failure to report misconduct by a police officer.

title: Crisis Intervention Demonstration Program
author: ['Aubry (D)', 'Otis (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a crisis intervention demonstration program.

title: Crime of Stalking a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Helming (R)', 'Lanza (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Jordan (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Creates the crime of stalking a police officer or peace officer when a person intentionally, and for no legitimate purpose, engages in a course of conduct directed at a specific police officer, peace officer or a person who he or she knows or reasonably should know is a member of such officer's immediate family, and knows or reasonably should know that such conduct is likely to cause reasonable fear of material harm to the physical health, safety or property of such officer.

title: Credits for Children of Parents Killed in Line of Duty
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Brooks (D)', 'Comrie (D)']
summary: Amends the Civil Service Law, allows additional credits for children or siblings of firefighters, police officers, emergency medical technicians, or paramedics killed in the administrative line of duty.

title: Traffic Stops in Pre Licensing Courses Instructions
author: ['Simon (D)', 'Cook (D)', 'Davila (D)', 'Walsh (R)', 'Buttenschon (D)']
summary: Relates to instruction concerning traffic stops in pre-licensing courses, provides drivers with their responsibilities when stopped by a law enforcement officer.

title: Appearance Tickets In Lieu of Arrest
author: ['Aubry (D)', 'Quart (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Frontus (D)', 'Darling (D)']
summary: Requires police officers and peace officers to issue appearance tickets to individuals charged with certain offenses instead of arresting such individuals.

title: State Police Jumper Cable Requirements
author: ['Fernandez (D)', 'Colton (D)', 'Ramos (D)', 'Jean-Pierre (D)', 'Griffin (D)', 'Smullen (R)']
summary: Requires state police to carry and offer use of jumper cables to disabled vehicles.

title: Discovery and Disclosure of Immigration Status
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Reyes (D)', 'Cook (D)', 'Rosenthal (D)', 'Weprin D (D)', 'Rodriguez (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Prohibits and regulates the discovery and disclosure of immigration status, prohibits police officers, peace officers, school resource officers, probation agencies, state entities, state employees, and municipal corporations from questioning individuals regarding their citizenship or immigration status and regulates the disclosure of information relating to immigration status, repeals certain provisions of the correction law relating thereto.

title: Police Officer's Pension Reduction to Satisfy Judgments
author: ['Fernandez (D)']
summary: Proposes a constitutional amendment, relates to reducing a police officer's pension to satisfy judgments in a wrongful death action, provides that a police officer's pension may be reduced to no less than $20,000 to satisfy a wrongful death judgment, provides that a court shall hold a hearing to determine the amount of the reduction.

title: Use of Sustained Auditory Dispersal Tools
author: ['Hyndman (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, creates a written policy prohibiting the use of sustained auditory dispersal tools by police agencies.

title: Grand Jury Proceedings for Police Officers
author: ['Barron (D)', 'Cook (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Hyndman (D)', 'Williams (D)', 'Vanel (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, requires grand jury proceedings for police officers or peace officers involved in a shooting or excessive use of force to be conducted in open, contemporaneous public hearings.

title: Homicide by a Peace or Police Officer
author: ['Aubry (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to the justification for the use of force in a homicide by a peace officer or police officer.

title: Police Departments
author: ['Eichenstein (R)']
summary: Amends the Vehicle & Traffic Law, requires police departments to electronically transmit to parking violations bureaus a copy of each stolen vehicle report prepared (within 5 days of the completion thereof), provides that for the purposes of an owner asserting a defense to a charge of parking violation (that the motor vehicle had been reported stolen and had not been recovered by such time), it shall be a sufficient defense that a copy of the electronically transmitted police report is on file.

title: Police Officers Liability Insurance
author: ['Hyndman (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to maintain liability insurance, excludes police officers from provisions requiring defense and indemnification of state officers and employees.

title: Police Officer Hiring and Transfers
author: ['Hyndman (D)']
summary: Relates to police officer and peace officer hiring and transfers and requires police agencies review any possible internal files of police misconduct and complaints as well as pending criminal charges before hiring or allowing for a transfer.

title: Police Officers Hiring Requirements
author: ['Aubry (D)']
summary: Provides that no person shall be eligible for appointment as a police officer who was previously employed as a police officer and who was dismissed for malfeasance or other serious misconduct calling into question such person's fitness to serve as a police officer, or resigned or retired from such officer's position while under investigation for such malfeasance or other serious misconduct, defines terms, makes related provisions.

title: Participation in Federal Excess Property Program
author: ['Reyes (D)', 'Gottfried (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Frontus (D)']
summary: Prohibits any local police department, county sheriff's office, the division of the state police or any agency that employs a peace officer in this state from participating in the federal excess property program for the purposes of receiving lethal or offensive weapons.

title: Police Misconduct Reporting
author: ['Fahy (D)', 'Aubry (D)']
summary: Grants immunity from liability and professional retaliation against a law enforcement employee who intervenes against police misconduct committed by another member of law enforcement.

title: Assaults on Police Officers
author: ['Jordan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, relates to the classification of certain crimes relating to assaults on police officers, increases such classifications by one level.

title: Offenses of Menacing a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Jordan (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Ortt (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Helming (R)']
summary: Establishes the offenses of menacing a police officer or peace officer in the first degree and menacing a police officer or peace officer in the second degree, relates to circumstances under which an officer is not required to issue an appearance ticket, makes conforming changes.

title: Inciting Violence Against a Police Officer
author: ['Helming (R)']
summary: Relates to inciting violence against a police officer.

title: Public Protection Professionals
author: ['Stern (D)']
summary: Relates to designating crimes against public protection professionals.

title: Blood Alcohol Measurement Devices
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Sayegh (D)', 'Gottfried (D)', 'Ramos (D)', 'Montesano (R)', 'Simon (D)', 'Ashby (R)']
summary: Directs the Commissioner of Health to study the effectiveness and accuracy of devices used to estimate blood alcohol content by law enforcement agencies.

title: Persons Designated as Peace Officers
author: ['Helming (R)']
summary: Relates to persons designated as peace officers and the authority of such peace officers to carry, possess, repair, or dispose of a firearm without an appropriate license.

title: Periodic Inspections of Police Vehicles
author: ['Gallivan (R)']
summary: Relates to periodic inspections of police vehicles, removes exemption for police vehicles for periodic inspections.

title: Police Officer Use of Racial and Ethnic Profiling
author: ['Bichotte (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Gottfried (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Walker (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues', ' Standards']
summary: Prohibits police officers from using racial and ethnic profiling, requires that a procedure be established for the taking and review of complaints against police officers for racial and ethnic profiling, allows an action for injunctive relief and or damages to be brought against a law enforcement agency, any agent of a law enforcement agency and the supervisor of an agent.

title: Use of Sustained Auditory Dispersal Tools by Police
author: ['Ramos (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, creates a written policy prohibiting the use of sustained auditory dispersal tools by police agencies.

title: Officer Terminated for Malfeasance
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Provides that any officer terminated who was dismissed for malfeasance or serious misconduct or resigned or retired during an investigation relating to such malfeasance or serious misconduct shall not be entitled to receive any retirement or other benefit or payment of any kind.

title: Division of Criminal Justice Services Database
author: ['Sanders (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification']
summary: Directs the Division of Criminal Justice services to establish a statewide public database covering every local police department, each county sheriff's office, the division of the state police and every agency that employs a peace officer in this state, which shall compile the names of any police or peace officer who has had his or her employment terminated due to misconduct.

title: Point of Contact for National Instant Criminal Checks
author: ['Kavanagh (D)']
summary: Relates to the point of contact for conducting national instant criminal background checks, authorizes and directs the division of state police to serve as the point of contact for implementation of 18 U.S.C. sec, 922(t), establishes the background check fund.

title: Mandatory Continuing Law Enforcement Education
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Bailey (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing mandatory continuing law enforcement education for peace officers, requires peace officers to biannually complete a minimum of 32 credit hours of training including de-escalation techniques, implicit biases and mental health training.

title: Use of Force and Homicide by Peace or Police Officers
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Biaggi (D)']
summary: Relates to the justification for the use of force in a homicide by a peace officer or police officer.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
status: Pending - Senate Investigations and Government Operations Committee
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to residency requirements for police officers in a city with a population of one million or more, provides that any person appointed as a paid member of the police force of such city shall become a resident of any political subdivision or municipal corporation within such city within one year of his or her appointment and shall continue to reside within any political subdivision or municipal corporation.

title: Consumer Electrical or Gas Consumption Data
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Gounardes (D)']
summary: Prohibits the release of a consumer's electrical or gas consumption data to any police officer, or private, local, state or federal law enforcement entity without a judicial court-ordered subpoena, warrant or the consumer's written consent.

title: Issuance of Arrest Warrants and Appearance Tickets
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Relates to the issuance of arrest warrants and appearance tickets upon a youth, provides for the police officer to immediately notify the parent or other person legally responsible for the care of such youth with whom the youth is domiciled that the youth has been arrested, provides further that the police officer need not notify the parent or other person legally responsible when such youth is not also a juvenile offender and the notification would endanger the health and safety of such youth.

title: Traffic Stops Conducted by Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Relates to traffic stops conducted by law enforcement officers, defines racial profiling, authorizes Division of Criminal Justice Services to conduct a study relating to racial profiling, prohibits use of race or ethnicity of an individual as the sole factor in determining the existence of probable cause to place such person under arrest or take into custody.

title: Obstruction of Law Enforcement Identification
author: ['Rivera G (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Myrie (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing the offense of unlawful obstruction of law enforcement identification, establishes that such offense is a class A misdemeanor.

title: Unlawful Obstruction of Law Enforcement Identifcation
author: ['Epstein (D)', 'Quart (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Cruz (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing the offense of unlawful obstruction of law enforcement identification, establishes that such offense is a class A misdemeanor.

title: Domestic Violence
author: ['Fernandez (D)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, relates to a training course and curriculum on the handling, investigation and response procedures concerning reports of domestic violence, requires law enforcement and judicial employees to participate in such training, makes related provisions.

title: Discovery and Disclosure of Immigration Status
author: ['Salazar (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Brisport (D)', 'Brouk (D)', 'Cooney (D)']
summary: Prohibits and regulates the discovery and disclosure of immigration status, prohibits police officers, peace officers, school resource officers, probation agencies, state entities, state employees, and municipal corporations from questioning individuals regarding their citizenship or immigration status, regulates the disclosure of information relating to immigration status, repeals certain provisions of the correction law relating thereto.

title: Motor Vehicle Driver Arrests Without a Warrant
author: ['Kavanagh (D)']
summary: Authorizes police officers to arrest a driver of a motor vehicle in certain circumstances without a warrant.

title: Performance of Duty Disability Retirement Benefits
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Kaplan (D)']
summary: Relates to providing performance of duty disability retirement benefits for the employee titles police medic, police medic supervisor, police medic coordinator, bureau director emergency ambulance, and deputy bureau director emergency ambulance in the employ of Nassau County.

title: Boundaries of Police Precincts
author: ['Cook (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Colton (D)', 'Gottfried (D)', 'Cymbrowitz (D)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Provides that the police commissioner of any police department in a city having a population of one million or more shall not substantially alter the boundaries of police precincts, once fixed, or close, remove or relocate a police stationhouse unless at least thirty days prior to the date such action shall take effect, written notice of such action has been given to each local community board or board having jurisdiction over that part of the city directly affected by such action.

title: Civil Actions for Deprivation of Constitutional Rights
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to civil actions for deprivation of constitutional rights, provides that a peace officer employed by a local government, who under color of law, subjects or causes to be subjected, including failing to intervene, any other person to the deprivation of any individual rights that create binding obligations on government actors secured by the bill of rights, article one of the state constitution, is liable to the injured party for legal or equitable relief or any other appropriate relief.

title: Calendar Designation
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Designates the month of September as firefighter, police officer and emergency medical technician appreciation month.

title: Death of a Relative Notification by Police Officers
author: ['Comrie (D)', 'Parker (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)']
summary: Enacts Valeria's Law, requires police officers to notify family members in person of a relative's death in certain circumstances.

title: Release of Criminal History Records by Coroner
author: ['Dilan (D)']
summary: Prohibits the release of criminal history or any mental health history records by a coroner, coroner's physician or medical examiner of individuals who were the subject of the use of force by a police or peace officer.

title: Aggravated Harassment of a Police Officer
author: ['Ortt (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated harassment of a police officer where a person causes or attempts to cause such police officer to come into contact with bottles, rocks, flammable liquids, hazardous or dangerous substances or objects, blood, seminal fluid, urine, feces, saliva or the contents of a toilet bowl, by throwing, tossing, intentionally expectorating or expelling such fluid or material.

title: Maternity Policy Minimum Standards
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Relates to providing minimum standards governing maternity policy for institutions employing police officers and correctional officers including uniform and/or equipment modifications, exemption from firearm qualification requirements, and ensuring there is no discrimination or poor treatment of pregnant individuals.

title: State Police Vehicles Dashboard Camera Requirements
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Requires that certain New York state police vehicles be equipped with a dashboard camera.

title: Criminal or Mental Health History Information Release
author: ['Dilan (D)']
summary: Prohibits the release of criminal history or any mental health history records by a police agency, prosecutorial agency or other law enforcement agency of individuals who were the subject of the use of force by a police or peace officer.

title: Police and Peace Officer Encounter Death Investigations
author: ['Bailey (D)']
summary: Establishes the Office of Special Investigation within the Department of Law to investigate and prosecute any alleged criminal offense or offenses committed by a police officer or peace officer, concerning the death of any person as a result of any encounter with such police officer or peace officer.

title: Police Officer Sexual Assault Training
author: ['Bailey (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to receive training instruction for crimes involving sexual assaults, requires training for child protective services workers in certain instances.

title: Traffic Enforcement Agents or City Marshals
author: ['Pretlow (D)']
summary: Includes traffic enforcement agents or city marshals within the category of persons protected while performing their lawful duties along with peace officers, police officers, firefighters and EMTs, makes technical corrections.

title: Crisis Intervention Training for Police Officers
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Myrie (D)']
summary: Relates to crisis intervention training for police officers in any city having a population of one million or more.

title: Officer Involved Deaths and Near Deaths Review Board
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)']
summary: Creates a board to review officer-involved deaths and near deaths.

title: Photographing or Recording of Law Enforcement
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Relates to permitting the photographing or recording of a law enforcement officer as long as such person isn't under arrest, outlines unlawful retaliatory measures by law enforcement for such photography or recording.

title: Valerias Law
author: ['Cook (D)', 'Galef (D)', 'Hevesi (D)', 'Joyner (D)', 'Hyndman (D)', 'Dickens (D)', 'Taylor (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Griffin (D)']
summary: Enacts Valeria's Law, requires police officers to notify family members in person of a relative's death in certain circumstances.

title: Volunteer First Responders Traumatic Stress Support
author: ['Gaughran (D)', 'Jordan (R)']
summary: Establishes a pilot program which shall provide support services to volunteer certified first responders suffering from the effects of traumatic stress related to the performance of their duties.

title: Mandatory Life Imprisonment Without Parole
author: ['Addabbo (D)']
summary: Makes life imprisonment without parole mandatory for defendants convicted of murder in the first degree and the victim is a police officer.

title: Crime of Doxing a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Gallivan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Griffo (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of doxing a police officer or a peace officer when a person knowingly makes restricted personal information about a police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, publicly available with the intent to threaten, intimidate, or incite the commission of a crime of violence against the police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer.

title: Crime of Failure to Retreat
author: ['Gallivan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Griffo (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of failure to retreat when a person who is within twenty-five feet of a police officer or peace officer engaged in the performance of his or her duties and the police officer or peace officer orders such person to halt or retreat and the person fails to do so immediately, requires the posting of bail.

title: Aggravated Offering of False Accusation Against Police
author: ['Gallivan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Griffo (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated offering of a false accusation against a police officer or peace officer for knowing the information reported to be false or baseless, he or she reports, by word or action, to a law enforcement officer or agency, the wrongdoing by a police officer or peace officer in the performance of his or her duties, requires the posting of bail.

title: Police Medics Retirement
author: ['Abbate (D)']
summary: Relates to the retirement of members who serve as police medics, police medic supervisors and members who perform police medic related services in the Nassau county police department.

title: Medical Providers Employed by Municipal Police
author: ['Ortt (R)']
summary: Relates to designating certain medical providers employed by a municipal police department, while deployed with the special weapons and tactics team, as peace officers.

title: Police Officers Firearm Carry and Training Courses
author: ['Bailey (D)']
summary: Relates to prohibiting police officers from carrying or using a firearm during any phase of the officer's official duties unless the officer has satisfactorily completed a course of training that meets or exceeds the minimum standards established by the municipal police training council.

title: Pistol Permit Issuance Authorization
author: ['Hawley (R)', 'Blankenbush (R)', 'DiPietro D (R)', 'Ashby (R)', 'DeStefano (R)']
summary: Authorizes the sheriff of any county outside the city of New York to issue pistol permits upon the approval of the county clerk.

title: Police Officer Shooting or Excessive Force Hearings
author: ['Sanders (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force']
summary: Requires grand jury proceedings for police officers or peace officers involved in a shooting or excessive use of force to be conducted in open, contemporaneous public hearings.

title: Database for Property Seized by Law Enforcement
author: ['Abinanti (D)', 'Gottfried (D)', 'Simon (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Sayegh (D)']
summary: Relates to the creation of a database for property seized by law enforcement agencies.

title: University and Park Police Retirement Plan
author: ['Griffin (D)', 'Durso (R)']
summary: Relates to authorizing certain persons in an optional twenty year retirement plan for state university police officer service and regional state park police, requires for completion of a course of law enforcement training.

title: Enforcement of Federal Laws
author: ['Ortt (R)', 'Jordan (R)']
summary: Provides that employees of the state police shall not be directed by executive order or regulations to not assist with the enforcement of federal laws.

title: Police Officers Badges
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Salazar (D)', 'Brisport (D)']
summary: Prohibits members of the state police, police officers, and peace officers from intentionally covering their badges.

title: Reckless Endangerment of an Emergency Service Person
author: ['Gaughran (D)', 'Mayer (D)', 'Skoufis (D)', 'Reichlin-Melnic (D)']
summary: Establishes the offenses of reckless endangerment of an emergency service person in the first and second degrees.

title: Death of Certain First Responders in the Line of Duty
author: ['Serino (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Ritchie (R)']
summary: Directs the flag to be flown at half-staff to commemorate the death of certain first responders who passed away in performance of emergency response activities in this state.

title: Uniform Investigatory Standards
author: ['Ramos (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Meeks (D)', 'Forrest (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Requires the superintendent of the state police to establish uniform investigatory standards when there is a shooting of a civilian by a police officer.

title: Civilian Complaint Review Board Powers
author: ['Comrie (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Expands the investigative powers of the Civilian Complaint Review Board to include complaints alleging racial profiling.

title: Police Youth Outreach Department
author: ['Comrie (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a Youth Outreach Department within the state police, city, village, town, and district police departments, and sheriff departments for the purposes of designing and carrying out youth activities organized by the department.

title: Police Officer Search Warrant Execution Body Camera
author: ['Sepulveda (D)']
summary: Requires that each police officer involved in the execution of a search warrant wear a functioning and unobstructed body camera that shall be active prior to and throughout the execution of the search and during any related action following the execution of the search warrant.

title: Police Disciplinary Decisions and Penalties Review
author: ['Sepulveda (D)']
summary: Establishes a process for neutral arbitrators to review certain disciplinary decisions and penalties imposed on members of the New York City Police Department.

title: Misconduct of a Police Officer Reporting
author: ['Ramos (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Jackson C (D)', 'Meeks (D)', 'Forrest (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to report the misconduct of a police officer, requires the division of criminal justice to establish a protocol to be followed by police agencies when handling and recording mandatory reports of misconduct by a police officer, establishes the crime of failure to report misconduct by a police officer.

title: Offenses Against Emergency Medical Services Personnel
author: ['DeStefano (R)', 'Giglio (R)', 'DiPietro D (R)', 'Brabenec (R)', 'Miller B (R)', 'Walsh (R)']
summary: Designates certain offenses against emergency medical services personnel, firefighters, and law enforcement officers as hate crimes, includes the definition of emergency medical services personnel, firefighters, and law enforcement officers.

title: Municipal Police Training Council
author: ['Sanders (D)', 'May (D)']
summary: Requires the municipal police training council to ensure that issues related to motorcycle profiling are addressed in basic law enforcement training.

title: Police Officer and Peace Officer Hiring and Transfers
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to police officer and peace officer hiring and transfers and requires police agencies review any possible internal Files of police misconduct and complaints as well as pending criminal charges before hiring or allowing for a transfer.

title: Maximum Age for Taking Civil Service Examination
author: ['Giglio (R)']
summary: Eliminates the maximum age for taking the civil service examination for appointment as a police officer or as an environmental conservation officer.

title: State Police Presence at Work Zones
author: ['Kennedy (D)']
summary: Requires state police presence at certain work zones.

title: Use of Chemical Agents by Police Against Minors
author: ['Brouk (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Brisport (D)']
summary: Prohibits the use of chemical agents by police officers against minors.

title: State Police Vehicle Dashboard Cameras
author: ['Abinanti (D)', 'McDonough (R)', 'Woerner (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Sayegh (D)']
summary: Requires that certain New York state police vehicles be equipped with a dashboard camera.

title: Superintendent of State Police
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Myrie (D)', 'Cooney (D)']
summary: Directs the superintendent of State police to develop and institute child-sensitive arrest policies and procedures for instances where police are arresting an individual who is a parent, guardian or other person legally charged with the care or custody of a child.

title: Issuance of Arrest Warrants Upon Youth
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Addabbo (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Gounardes (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to the issuance of arrest warrants and appearance tickets upon a youth, provides for the police officer to immediately notify the parent or other person legally responsible for the care of such youth or with whom the youth is domiciled that the youth has been arrested, provides further that the police officer need not notify the parent or other person legally responsible when such youth is not also a juvenile offender and the notification would endanger the health and safety of such youth.

title: Certain Medical Providers
author: ['Rodriguez (D)']
summary: Relates to designating certain medical providers employed by a municipal police department, while deployed with the special weapons and tactics team, as peace officers.

title: Health Insurance Contracts or Plans for Retired Officer
author: ['Abinanti (D)']
summary: Relates to changes in health insurance contracts or plans for retired officers, employees, and their families.

title: Obstructing Administration by Dousing Police
author: ['Colton (D)', 'Cook (D)', 'Dickens (D)', 'Buttenschon (D)', 'Salka (R)', 'Sayegh (D)']
summary: Establishes the offenses of obstructing governmental administration by means of dousing a police officer in the first degree, obstructing governmental administration by means of dousing a police officer in the second degree and obstructing governmental administration by means of dousing a police officer in the third degree.

title: Police Commissioner Terms
author: ['Comrie (D)']
summary: Provides that the police commissioner of the city of New York and all other cities with a population of one hundred thousand or more shall be an elected office with a four-year term, provides that such office shall be subject to term limits of two terms.

title: Benefits for Police Officers
author: ['Gounardes (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Relates to benefits for police officers, correction officers, firefighters, and other emergency personnel diagnosed with PTSD by making their injury compensable if it cannot be shown, by a preponderance of evidence, that the PTSD was caused by factors unrelated to their occupation.

title: Mandatory Continuing Law Enforcement Education
author: ['Walker (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing mandatory continuing law enforcement education for peace officers, requires peace officers to biannually complete a minimum of 32 credit hours of training including de-escalation techniques, implicit biases and mental health training.

title: Crisis Intervention Demonstration Program
author: ['Walker (D)', 'Simon (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a crisis intervention demonstration program.

title: Falsely Reporting Incidents
author: ['Walczyk (R)']
summary: Includes falsely reporting incidents in an attempt to bring about the dispatch of a large number of police officers to a particular address or location as a felony offense under the crime of falsely reporting an incident in the second degree.

title: Forest Rangers and Park Rangers
author: ['Tedisco (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Helming (R)', 'Jordan (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
