summary: Authorizes forest rangers, park rangers, and environmental conservation police officers to possess and administer epinephrine by use of an epinephrine auto-injector device.

title: Offenses Against Law Enforcement Officers as Hate Crime
author: ['Ra (R)', 'Durso (R)']
summary: Designates offenses against law enforcement officers as hate crimes and designates making graffiti as a specified offense.

title: Accidental Disability Retirement for Deputy Sheriffs
author: ['Abbate (D)', 'Griffin (D)']
summary: Relates to accidental disability retirement for deputy sheriffs, provides that deputy sheriffs shall receive a pension of three-quarters of their final average salary.

title: Police Officer Salary and Civil Service Exam Credits
author: ['Cook (D)', 'Englebright (D)', 'Barnwell (D)']
summary: Allows salary and civil service exam credits for police officers in certain cities and property tax credits for resident officers and student loan forgiveness program for certain police officers.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Identification Requirement
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Requires state and local law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public upon initiation of law enforcement activity.

title: Police Officer Discipline
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['May (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in cities with a population between one hundred thirty-nine thousand and one hundred forty-five thousand.

title: Police Officer Discipline
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['May (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in municipalities in the state.

title: Lung Disease Presumption
author: ['Abbate (D)', 'Griffin (D)']
summary: Provides a lung disease presumption for correction officers, correction supervisors, deputy sheriff patrol or deputy sheriff patrol supervisors.

title: Division of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Benjamin (D)', 'Brouk (D)']
summary: Directs the division of criminal justice services to promulgate safety standards and training requirements for the protection of law enforcement staff against biological hazards posed by spitting of persons in custody.

title: Security Guard Training Requirements
author: ['Lanza (R)']
summary: Exempts certain officers of the Department of Correction and the Department of Sanitation of the city of New York from training requirements for security guards, designates correction officers of New York city as peace officers.

title: Law Enforcement Training Requirements
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Relates to providing increased and uniform training requirements including implicit bias, use of force, first aid and firearm training, and outreach for law enforcement, establishes law enforcement peer support through the office mental health.

title: Law Enforcement Twenty Year Retirement Plan
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Gounardes (D)', 'Brooks (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a twenty year retirement plan for members or officers of law enforcement, includes every non-seasonally appointed sworn member or officer of the division of law enforcement in the Department of Environmental Conservation, a forest ranger in the service of the Department of Environmental Conservation, a police officer in the Department of Environmental Conservation, the regional state park police, and university police officers in such twenty year plan.

title: Coronavirus Vaccine Priority
author: ['Helming (R)']
summary: Provides that no person holding elected office in this state shall be given priority over healthcare workers, members of vulnerable populations, or first responders for purposes of receiving any vaccine against the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) unless such elected official is a healthcare worker, member of a vulnerable population or a first responder, or otherwise qualifies as a member of a group to which priority in COVID-19 vaccination is given.

title: Police Shootings and Killings Awareness Study
author: ['Parker (D)']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Requires the New York State Office of Mental Health to study the effects that awareness of or exposure to police shootings or killings of unarmed African Americans has on the mental health of African Americans in New York State and to deliver a finding of the results of such study to the Governor and the legislative leaders.

title: Disclosure of Police Officer Disciplinary Charges
author: ['Epstein (D)']
summary: Relates to the disclosure of disciplinary charges against a police officer or peace officer.

title: Police Biological Hazard Safety Standards and Training
author: ['Clark (D)', 'Gallagher (D)', 'Jackson C (D)', 'Meeks (D)', 'Mitaynes (D)']
summary: Directs the Division of Criminal Justice Services to promulgate safety standards and training requirements for the protection of law enforcement staff against biological hazards posed by spitting of persons in custody.

title: Unlawfully Fleeing a Uniformed Police Officer
author: ['Lanza (R)']
summary: Relates to the penalty for unlawfully fleeing a uniformed police officer of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission.

title: Staph Infection Disability Retirement Benefits
author: ['Abbate (D)', 'Griffin (D)']
summary: Establishes disability retirement benefits for correction officers, correction supervisors, deputy sheriff patrols and deputy sheriff patrol supervisors who suffer any condition or impairment of health caused by methicillin resistant staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) or Staph/MRSA, provides that such disability benefits shall be three-quarters of a member's final average salary.

title: Law Enforcement Legal Settlement Payment Reports
author: ['Cruz (D)']
summary: Requires annual reports of legal settlement payments related to law enforcement activity, provides that such report shall include, but not be limited to, monetary amounts, plaintiffs and named parties, and shall be published on the website of the comptroller.

title: Heart Disease Presumption for Correction Officers
author: ['Abbate (D)', 'Griffin (D)']
summary: Provides a heart disease presumption for correction officers, correction supervisors, deputy sheriff patrol or deputy sheriff patrol supervisors.

title: Maximum Age for Taking the Civil Service Examination
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Borrello (R)']
summary: Eliminates the maximum age for taking the civil service examination for appointment as a police officer or as an environmental conservation officer.

title: Various Fixed Fees for Sheriff Services
author: ['Hoylman (D)']
summary: Increases the various fixed fees for the provision of certain services by the sheriff.

title: First Responders Diagnosed With PTSD
author: ['Ashby (R)', 'Lawler (R)']
summary: Allows first responders who are diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder to request line of duty sick leave.

title: Forest Rangers Administration of Epinephrine
author: ['Santabarbara (D)']
summary: Authorizes forest rangers, park rangers, and environmental conservation police officers to possess and administer epinephrine by use of an epinephrine auto-injector device.

title: Spoofing of Police Agency Telephone Number
author: ['Sillitti (D)']
summary: Establishes the crimes of spoofing a police agency telephone number in the first and second degrees as a class E felony and a class A misdemeanor.

title: Crisis Intervention Team Training Demonstration Program
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Establishes a crisis intervention team training demonstration program, establishes a crisis intervention team training program advisory committee and crisis intervention team training fund.

title: State and Regional Councils
author: ['Bronson (D)', 'Clark (D)', 'Kelles (D)', 'Meeks (D)', 'Lunsford (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing state and regional councils and regional response units for mental health emergencies, relates to certain Powers of peace officers and police officers handling mental health emergencies.

title: Municipal Police Training Council Repeal
author: ['Savino (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Repeals the municipal police training council, creates the police training council to establish a statewide mandatory training curriculum for all law enforcement agencies established with police officer or peace officer status throughout the state.

title: State Auxiliary Officer Death Benefit Fund
author: ['Stern (D)']
summary: Establishes the New York state auxiliary officer death benefit fund to provide a death benefit to the families of auxiliary officers who died in the line of duty during the state of emergency declared by the governor pursuant to section twenty-nine of the executive law beginning specified date.

title: Crime of Aggravated Assault Upon a Police Officer
author: ['Smith (R)', 'Giglio (R)', 'Montesano (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Salka (R)']
summary: Relates to the crime of aggravated assault upon a police officer or a peace officer.

title: Volunteer Certified First Responders Pilot Program
author: ['Stern (D)', 'Buttenschon (D)', 'Byrnes (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Simpson (R)']
summary: Establishes a pilot program which shall provide support services to volunteer certified first responders suffering from the effects of traumatic stress related to the performance of their duties.

title: State Crisis Intervention Demonstration Program
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Comrie (D)']
summary: Establishes a state crisis intervention demonstration program and a crisis intervention team training fund.

title: Residency for Members of Police Force
status: Pending - Senate Investigations and Government Operations Committee
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Bailey (D)']
summary: Authorizes the enactment of local Laws requiring residency in cities with a population of one million or more for members of the police force appointed to such positions, provides increased salaries for certain police officers who are residents of certain cities, provides additional credits on competitive exams for original appointment of police officers, tax credits, real property tax credits and student loan forgiveness based upon residency in certain cities.

title: On Duty Auxiliary Police Officer
author: ['Smith (R)', 'Montesano (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Salka (R)', 'Smullen (R)']
summary: Includes injury to an on-duty auxiliary police officer within the elements of assault in the second degree.

title: Police Safety Equipment Grant Program
author: ['Smith (R)', 'Giglio (R)', 'Mikulin (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Manktelow (R)']
summary: Creates a police safety equipment grant program, provides for services and expenses related to police safety equipment, directs a sum of $30,000,000 to be appropriated to such program.

title: Visor Card for the Deaf or Hard of Hearing
author: ['Stern (D)']
summary: Directs the superintendent of the New York State Police to prepare a visor card for the deaf or hard of hearing to enable police to respond to traffic stops involving the deaf or hard of hearing and avoid conflict and escalation because of difficulty communicating.

title: Offense of Obstructing a Police Officer
author: ['Smith (R)', 'Ra (R)', 'Mikulin (R)', 'Byrnes (R)', 'DeStefano (R)']
summary: Establishes the offense of obstructing a police officer.

title: Police Officer Salary and Civil Service Exam Credits
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Allows salary and civil service exam credits for police officers in certain cities and property tax credits for resident officers and a student loan forgiveness program for certain police officers.

title: Councils for Mental Health Emergencies
author: ['Brouk (D)', 'Brooks (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Brisport (D)', 'Cooney (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing state and regional councils and regional response units for mental health emergencies, relates to certain powers of peace officers and police officers handling mental health emergencies.

title: Peace Officer Status for Facilities Parole Officers
author: ['Miller B (R)', 'Hawley (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Salka (R)']
summary: Relates to retaining peace officer status for facilities parole officers.

title: Police Officer Firearm Carry and Training
author: ['Epstein (D)', 'Rivera J (D)', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Relates to prohibiting police officers from carrying or using a firearm during any phase of the officer's official duties unless the officer has satisfactorily completed a course of training that meets or exceeds the minimum standards established by the municipal police training council.

title: Emergency Personnel Benefits for Post Traumatic Stress
author: ["O'Donnell (D)", 'Simpson (R)']
summary: Relates to benefits for police officers, correction officers, firefighters, and other emergency personnel diagnosed with PTSD by making their injury compensable if it cannot be shown, by a preponderance of evidence, that the PTSD was caused by factors unrelated to their occupation.

title: Privacy Protections for All Emergency Personnel
author: ['Simpson (R)']
summary: Ensures privacy protections for all emergency personnel present at a crime scene including ambulance services or advanced life support first response services, certified first responders, firefighters, emergency medical technicians or advanced emergency medical technicians, who are employed by or enrolled members of any such service.

title: Crime of Aggravated Offering of a False Accusation
author: ['Stern (D)']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated offering of a false accusation against a peace officer or police officer for knowingly reporting false or baseless information relating to wrongdoing by a police or peace officer to a law enforcement agency, creates a private right of action for damages.

title: Crime of Doxing a Police Officer or a Peace Officer
author: ['Stern (D)']
summary: Establishes the crime of doxing a police officer or a peace officer when a person knowingly makes restricted personal information about a police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, publicly available with the intent to threaten, intimidate, or incite the commission of a crime of violence against the police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, or with the intent and knowledge that the restricted personal information.

title: Penalties for Assault on Police Officers
author: ['Stern (D)', 'Simpson (R)']
summary: Increases the penalties for assault on police officers, peace officers, firefighters and emergency medical technicians causing physical injury or serious physical injury.

title: Members of the Nassau County Auxiliary Police Force
author: ['McDonough (R)', 'Montesano (R)', 'Ra (R)', 'Miller (R)', 'Miller B (R)']
summary: Allows members of the Nassau County auxiliary police force to possess a police baton when authorized by the police commissioner of such county.

title: Transfer of the Regional State Park Police
author: ['Solages (D)', 'Thiele (I)', 'McDonough (R)', 'Lupardo (D)', 'Hevesi (D)', 'Weprin D (D)', 'Woerner (D)', 'Walsh (R)']
summary: Provides for the transfer of the regional state park police to the division of state police, repeals certain provisions related thereto.

title: Family Violence and Temporary Custody of Firearms
author: ['Harckham (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to take temporary custody of firearms for not less than one hundred twenty hours when responding to reports of family violence.

title: Victim or Witness Immigration Status Inquiries
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement officers and peace officers from inquiring about the immigration status of a victim of or witness to a criminal offense.

title: Benefits of the Variable Supplements Fund
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Extends the benefits of the variable supplements fund to all New York city police officers, firefighters, housing police, transit police, correction officers and registered domestic partners.

title: State Police Retirement Plan
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Brooks (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues']
summary: Relates to authorizing certain persons in an optional twenty year retirement plan for state university police officer service and regional state park police.

title: Peace Officer Designation
author: ['Reilly (R)']
summary: Includes uniformed members of the special investigation unit of the New York city housing authority in the definition of peace officer.

title: Retirement Plan for Members of State Park Police
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Gounardes (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues']
summary: Relates to establishing a twenty year retirement plan for members or officers of the regional state park police.

title: Provision of Licenses for Firearms
author: ['Benedetto (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Stern (D)', 'Griffin (D)', 'Jackson C (D)']
summary: Prohibits the provision of licenses for firearms to persons on the federal no-fly list or terrorist screening database, authorizes firearms licenses of persons on the federal no-fly list or terrorist screening database to be suspended or revoked, requires the superintendent of state police to search the federal no-fly list or terrorist screening database each year and report findings to appropriate enforcement agencies in order to suspend or revoke appropriate licenses.

title: Salary Increases for Heads of Police Departments
author: ['Paulin (D)', 'Lupardo (D)', 'Montesano (R)', 'Abinanti (D)']
summary: Relates to salary increases for heads of police departments of municipalities, districts or authorities.

title: Students Having Mental Health Crises
author: ['Benjamin (D)']
summary: Includes polices and procedures for responding to students having mental health crises in a manner that does not include contacting law enforcement unless implied or direct threats of violence or other criminal activity is involved in school safety plans.

title: Members of Agency Police Services Unit
author: ['Gounardes (D)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Ryan (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Hinchey (D)']
summary: Relates to compensation, benefits and other terms and conditions of employment of members of the agency police services unit, relates to the employee benefit fund for certain members of the agency police services unit, implements an agreement or interest arbitration award between the state and the employee organization representing the members of the agency police services unit, makes an appropriation for the purpose of effectuating certain provisions thereof.

title: Special Prosecutor to Investigate Death of Civilian
status: Pending - Senate Investigations and Government Operations Committee
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Establishes a special prosecutor to investigate and prosecute matters involving the death of an unarmed civilian caused by a law enforcement officer.

title: Crime of Stalking a Police Officer
author: ['Reilly (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of stalking a police officer, peace officer, correction officer or firefighter to include intent to harass, annoy or alarm a police officer, peace officer, correction officer, firefighter or an immediate family member of a police officer, peace officer, correction officer or firefighter, intentionally engaging in a course of conduct directed at such person which is likely to cause such person to reasonably fear physical injury or serious physical injury.

title: Crime of Aggravated Resisting Arrest
author: ['Reilly (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated resisting arrest as where a person intentionally prevents or attempts to prevent a police officer or peace officer from effecting an authorized arrest of such person or another person through the use of physical force, where such authorized arrest is for a crime which is a felony.

title: Disclosure of Disciplinary Charges Against Police
author: ['Brisport (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to the disclosure of disciplinary charges against a police officer or peace officer.

title: Local Laws Relating to Police Force Residency
status: Pending - Senate Investigations and Government Operations Committee
author: ['Cooney (D)', 'Brouk (D)']
summary: Authorizes every City with a population of more than ninety thousand but less than three hundred thousand to have the authority to enact a local law requiring any person who is appointed as a member of the police force of such city to be a resident of such a city during his or her employment as a member of such police force, makes related provisions.

title: Police Misconduct
author: ['Abinanti (D)']
summary: Relates to granting the attorney general jurisdiction to investigate and prosecute police misconduct.

title: Paid Admission Event Additional Police Protection
author: ['Brabenec (R)', 'McDonough (R)', 'Morinello (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Salka (R)']
summary: Authorizes municipalities located in the county of Orange and county of Rockland to charge for the cost of providing additional police protection to paid-admission events.

title: Killing a Police Work Dog or Horse
author: ['Brabenec (R)', 'Miller B (R)', 'Manktelow (R)', 'Durso (R)', 'Tannousis (R)']
summary: Elevates the offense of killing a police work dog or police work horse from being a class E felony to a class D felony, establishes the class E felony of injuring a police work dog or police work horse for intentionally causing serious physical injury to a police work dog or police work horse while such dog or horse is performing its duties under the supervision of a police officer.

title: Income Tax Credit for Retired Disabled Police Officers
status: Pending - Senate Budget and Revenues Committee
author: ['Oberacker (R)', 'Helming (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Provides a $750 income tax credit for retired disabled police officers.

title: Photographing or Recording of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Taylor (D)']
topics: ['Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Technology']
summary: Relates to permitting the photographing or recording of a law enforcement officer as long as such person isn't under arrest, outlines unlawful retaliatory measures by law enforcement for such photography or recording.

title: Members or Officers of the State Police Service Credit
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Akshar (R)']
summary: Grants members or officers of the state police credit for service as a deputy sheriff, county corrections officer, or state corrections officer, relates to two years credit, costs borne by member.

title: Calculation of Past Service Credit for Deputy Sheriffs
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Akshar (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Helming (R)']
summary: Relates to the calculation of past service credit for members in the title of deputy sheriff transferring between the New York state and local employees' retirement system to the New York state and local police and fire retirement system.

title: Police and Peace Officer Licensing Act
author: ["O'Donnell (D)"]
summary: Enacts the ""police and peace officer licensing act"".

title: Recognizance Procedures and Bail Reform
author: ['Quart (D)', 'Lupardo (D)', 'Kim (D)', 'Rozic (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Simon (D)']
summary: Relates to recognizance procedures and bail reform, repeals certain provisions relating thereto.

title: Chemical Agents Use by Police Officers Against Minors
author: ['Meeks (D)', 'Fernandez (D)', 'Clark (D)', 'Lunsford (D)']
summary: Prohibits the use of chemical agents by police officers against minors.

title: Police and Correctional Officer Maternity Policies
author: ['Walker (D)']
summary: Relates to providing minimum standards governing maternity policy for institutions employing police officers and correctional officers including uniform and/or equipment modifications, exemption from firearm qualification requirements, and ensuring there is no discrimination or poor treatment of pregnant individuals.

title: Family Violence Response Temporary Custody of Firearms
author: ['Paulin (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to take temporary custody of firearms for not less than one hundred twenty hours when responding to reports of family violence.

title: Retired State Police Officers
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ["O'Mara (R)"]
summary: Allows retired state police officers to serve as police officers for local police departments without diminution of retirement benefits, empowers the superintendent of state police to approve such service.

title: Removal of Police Officers
author: ['Richardson (D)', 'Simon (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Jackson C (D)', 'Forrest (D)']
summary: Relates to the removal of certain police officers.

title: Calculation of Past Service Credit for Police Officers
author: ['Mayer (D)']
summary: Relates to the calculation of past service credit for police officers employed by the division of law enforcement in the department of environmental protection in the city of New York transferring between the New York city employees' retirement system to the New York state and local police and fire retirement system.

title: Granting of Police Officer Status
author: ['Abbate (D)']
summary: Grants police officer status to members of the uniformed correction force of the N.Y. city department of correction who complete a certain training program.

title: Crisis Intervention Demonstration Program
author: ['Lanza (R)']
summary: Relates to establishing a crisis intervention demonstration program.

title: Crime of Tampering With Physical Evidence
author: ['Hunter (D)', 'Sillitti (D)']
summary: Includes a police or peace officers turning off his or her body camera or deleting a body camera recording in the crime of tampering with physical evidence.

title: Members of the Agency Police Services Unit
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Abbate (D)', 'Woerner (D)', 'Jones (D)', 'Wallace (D)', 'Griffin (D)']
summary: Relates to compensation, benefits and other terms and conditions of employment of members of the agency police services unit, relates to the employee benefit fund for certain members of the agency police services unit, implements an agreement or interest arbitration award between the state and the employee organization representing the members of the agency police services unit, makes an appropriation for the purpose of effectuating certain provisions thereof.

title: Law Enforcement Agents and Peace Officers
author: ['Ramos (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agents and peace officers to record information in their memo books pertaining to the race of persons with whom they have meaningful interactions.

title: Benefits of the Variable Supplements Fund
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Savino (D)']
summary: Extends the benefits of the variable supplements fund for transit police members of the New York city employees' retirement system for persons who retired on or after October 1, 1968.

title: Implementation of Body Cameras on Police Officers
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Gianaris (D)']
summary: Allows the implementation of body cameras on police officers notwithstanding binding arbitration.

title: New York City Marshals
author: ['Dinowitz (D)']
summary: Extends the authorization for the New York city marshals to exercise the same functions, powers and duties as sheriffs with respect to the execution of money judgments.

title: Superintendent of the State Police
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Comrie (D)']
summary: Requires the superintendent of the state police to establish uniform investigatory standards when there is a shooting of a civilian by a police officer.

title: Annual Earnings for Retired Police Officers
author: ['Paulin (D)', 'Englebright (D)', 'McDonough (R)', 'Zebrowski (D)', 'Brabenec (R)']
summary: Limits annual earnings for retired police officers that work as school security officers to $50,000.

title: Head Official of a Law Enforcement Department
author: ['Lalor (R)']
summary: Requires the head official of a law enforcement department to enforce a special schedule on Memorial day and Veterans' day that allows law enforcement officers, who are veterans entitled to paid leave, to take such leave on such public holidays.

title: Act of Stalking a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Ramos (D)']
summary: Relates to criminalizing the act of stalking a police officer or peace officer.

title: Liability Insurance on Police Officers
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Thomas (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to requiring municipalities, authorities and agencies to obtain liability insurance on each duly appointed police officer in an amount not less than $200,000.

title: Duty to Report Unauthorized Use of Force by Police
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Hoylman (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a duty to report an unauthorized use of force by a police officer, provides that failure to report is a class B misdemeanor.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
status: Pending - Senate Investigations and Government Operations Committee
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Relates to residency requirements for police officers, provides that no person shall be a paid member of any police force that does not reside in the political subdivision or municipal corporation of the state for which he or she shall be chosen for one year prior to being appointed and continues to reside therein.

title: Grand Jury Inquiry Into Police Officer Shooting
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Prohibits a grand jury from inquiring into an offense or misconduct that involves a shooting or use of excessive force by a police officer and/or peace officer that led or leads to the death or personal injury of a civilian.

title: Civil Actions for Deprivation of Constitutional Rights
author: ['Walker (D)']
summary: Relates to civil actions for deprivation of constitutional rights, provides that a peace officer employed by a local government, who under color of law, subjects or causes to be subjected, including failing to intervene, any other person to the deprivation of any individual rights that create binding obligations on government actors secured by the bill of rights, article one of the state constitution, is liable to the injured party for legal or equitable relief or any other appropriate relief.

title: Program for Body Worn Cameras on Correction Officers
author: ['Jackson C (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a pilot program for the use of body-worn cameras on certain correction officers.

title: Disability Retirement
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Gounardes (D)']
summary: Relates to disability retirement for members of the Department of Environmental Conservation, forest rangers, university police officers and the regional state park police.

title: Implementation of Body Cameras on Police Officers
author: ['Ramos (D)']
summary: Amends the Civil Service Law, relates to allowing the implementation of body cameras on police officers notwithstanding binding arbitration.

title: Accidental Disability Retirement for Deputy Sheriffs
status: Pending - Senate Civil Service and Pensions Committee
author: ['Gounardes (D)']
summary: Relates to accidental disability retirement for deputy sheriffs, provides that deputy sheriffs shall receive a pension of three-quarters of their final average salary.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Chemical Incapacitant Use
author: ['Richardson (D)', 'Jackson C (D)', 'Zinerman (D)', 'Forrest (D)']
summary: Provides that no law enforcement agency shall use a chemical incapacitant except for pepper spray, defines terms.

title: False Reporting by Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Thomas (D)']
summary: Provides that false reporting and falsifying business records by law enforcement officers shall be felonies.

title: Police and Peace Officer Licensing Act
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Enacts the ""police and peace officer licensing act"".

title: Precinct Commander Assessment Board in New York City
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Directs the borough president of each borough in the city of New York to establish a precinct commander appointment board in each police precinct in the city of New York for the purpose of evaluating and selecting the precinct commander for such police precinct.

title: Superintendent of State Police
author: ['Vanel (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Directs the superintendent of state police to develop and institute child-sensitive arrest policies and procedures for instances where police are arresting an individual who is a parent, guardian or other person legally charged with the care or custody of a child.

title: Blue Alert System
author: ['Stern (D)']
summary: Establishes a blue alert system to aid in the identification, location and apprehension of any individuals suspected of killing or seriously wounding any local, state or federal law enforcement officer.

title: Residency Requirements for Peace Officers in Monroe
author: ['Bronson (D)']
summary: Relates to residency requirements for certain peace officers in Monroe county, allows peace officers residing in counties adjacent to Monroe county to be appointed as peace officers for the Monroe county society for the prevention of cruelty to animals.

title: Uniformed Court Officers and Peace Officers
author: ['Abbate (D)']
summary: Provides that uniformed court officers and peace officers employed in the unified court system shall be entitled to accidental disability retirement if they sustain injuries as the result of a physical assault by an assailant suffered while in service.

title: Disability Retirement
author: ['Abbate (D)']
summary: Relates to disability retirement for members of the department of environmental conservation, forest rangers, university police officers and the regional state park police.

title: Retirement Plan for Members of Law Enforcement
author: ['Abbate (D)', 'Durso (R)']
summary: Relates to establishing a twenty year retirement plan for members or officers of law enforcement, includes every non-seasonally appointed sworn member or officer of the division of law enforcement in the department of environmental conservation, a forest ranger in the service of the department of environmental conservation, a police officer in the department of environmental conservation, the regional state park police, and university police officers in such twenty year plan.

title: Uniformed Court Officers and Court Clerks
author: ['Abbate (D)']
summary: Relates to authorizing uniformed court officers and court clerks designated as peace officers to execute arrest warrants.

title: Police Officers to Wear Body Worn Cameras
author: ['Dickens (D)', 'Abinanti (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Hyndman (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Allows police officers to wear body-worn cameras, prohibits agreements with other state or federal agencies that prevent the use of such cameras.

title: Continuous Service Credit for Peace Officers
author: ['Abbate (D)']
summary: Allows a continuous service credit for retirement purposes for peace officers of the unified court system who were laid off for economy reasons in 1991 and returned to service in 1992.

title: Inciting Violence Against a Police Officer
author: ['Lawler (R)', 'Durso (R)']
summary: Relates to inciting violence against a police officer.

title: Police Officers Use of Pepper Spray
author: ['Epstein (D)']
summary: Provides that police officers may not intentionally or recklessly use pepper spray on an individual who is not being lawfully arrested.

title: Crimes Relating to Assaults on Police Officers
author: ['Montesano (R)', 'Miller B (R)', 'Jensen (R)', 'Lawler (R)', 'Sillitti (D)']
summary: Relates to the classification of certain crimes relating to assaults on police officers, increases such classifications by one level.

title: Offenses of Menacing a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Montesano (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Gallahan (R)', 'Jensen (R)', 'Lawler (R)']
summary: Establishes the offenses of menacing a police officer or peace officer in the first degree and menacing a police officer or peace officer in the second degree, relates to circumstances under which an officer is not required to issue an appearance ticket, makes conforming changes.

title: Confidentiality of Personnel Records of Police Officers
author: ['Lawler (R)', 'Durso (R)']
summary: Provides for the confidentiality of personnel records of police officers, firefighters, correction officers and probation officers.

title: Judicial Diversion Programs
author: ['Hevesi (D)']
summary: Relates to judicial diversion programs and establishes a diversion part in each county, repeals certain provisions of law relating thereto.

title: Mental Health Screening
author: ['Frontus (D)']
summary: Provides for mental health screening, creates a presumption that post-traumatic stress disorder is proximately caused by employment for law enforcement officers and emergency medical services personnel.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
author: ['Glick (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Simon (D)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Relates to residency requirements for police officers in cities with a population of one million or more.

title: Service Consent Through Magnetic Tape or Electronics
status: Pending - Assembly Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Zebrowski (D)']
summary: Permits consent for service in the form of magnetic tape or through electronic means for certain collection procedures by the sheriff's office or an officer or employee of the Department of Taxation and Finance.

title: State and Local Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Bichotte (D)', 'Barron (D)']
summary: Relates to requiring state and local law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public during law enforcement activities.

title: Municipal Police Training Council
author: ['Pichardo (D)', 'Taylor (D)', 'Sayegh (D)']
summary: Requires the municipal police training council to promulgate rules and regulations regarding psychological evaluations for certain members of the police force of a city with a population of one million or more.

title: Special Prosecutor to Investigate Deaths of Civilians
author: ['Taylor (D)']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Establishes a special prosecutor to investigate and prosecute matters involving the death of an unarmed civilian caused by a law enforcement officer.

title: Police Reform and Reinvention Collaborative
summary: Establishes the New York State Police Reform and Reinvention Collaborative.

title: Nonemergency Incident Reporting
author: ['Richardson (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Simon (D)', "D'Urso (D)", 'Ashby (R)', 'DeStefano (R)', 'Sayegh (D)']
summary: Amends the Civil Rights Law, provides for the reporting of a nonemergency incident involving a member of a protected class.

title: Office of Special Investigation
author: ['Perry (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Cook (D)', 'Gantt (D)', 'Gottfried (D)', 'Ortiz (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Mosley (D)', 'Davila (D)', 'Simon (D)', 'Carroll (D)']
summary: Establishes the office of special investigation within the department of law to investigate and prosecute any alleged criminal offense or offenses committed by a police officer or peace officer, concerning the death of any person as a result of any encounter with such police officer or peace officer.

title: Chief Administrator of the Courts
author: ['Hoylman (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Parker (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Amends the criminal procedure law and the judiciary law, relates to functions of the chief administrator of the courts, amends the executive law, relates to reporting requirements.

title: Office of Special Investigation
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Carlucci (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Establishes the Office of Special Investigation within the Department of Law to investigate and prosecute any alleged criminal offense or offenses committed by a police officer, or peace officer, concerning the death of any person as a result of any encounter with such police or peace officer.

title: Reporting of Police Officer Discharge of Weapon
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Carlucci (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer or peace officer who discharges his or her weapon under circumstances where a person could be struck by a bullet to immediately report the incident.

title: Recording Law Enforcement Activities
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)']
summary: Relates to recording certain law enforcement activities, provides that a person not under arrest or in the custody of a law enforcement official has the right to record police activity,and to maintain custody and control of that recording and of any property or instruments used by that person to record police activities, provides that a person in custody or under arrest does not, by that status alone, forfeit such right to record.

title: Law Enforcement Inspector General
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Brooks (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, establishes the Law Enforcement Misconduct Investigative Office.

title: Custodial Interrogation of Children
status: Pending - Senate Children and Families Committee
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Montgomery (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Amends procedures required for the custodial interrogation of children by law enforcement to provide additional protections and for taking juveniles into custody.

title: Strangulation in the First Degree
author: ['Mosley (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Otis (D)', 'Blake (D)', 'Carroll (D)', 'Reyes (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, establishes the crime of strangulation in the first degree, provides that a person is guilty of strangulation in the first degree when that person disregards any procedures banned by his or her employment and commits the crime of criminal obstruction of breathing or blood circulation, thereby causing serious physical injury or death to another person, makes such offense a class B felony.

title: Duty of Law Enforcement
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Harckham (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Liu (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Provides that when a person is under arrest, or otherwise in custody of a police officer, peace officer, or other law enforcement representative or entity, such officer, representative or entity shall have a duty to provide attention to the medical and mental health needs of such person.

title: Crime of Strangulation in the First Degree
author: ['Benjamin (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Carlucci (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Biaggi (D)', 'Gounardes (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, establishes the crime of strangulation in the first degree, provides that a person is guilty of strangulation in the first degree when he or she disregards any procedures banned by his or her employment and commits the crime of criminal obstruction of breathing or blood circulation, and thereby causes serious physical injury or death to another person, makes such offense a class B felony.

title: Use of Body Worn Cameras State Police Officers
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Liu (D)']
summary: Relates to the use of body-worn cameras by New York state police officers, establishes the New York state police body-worn cameras program, requires the division of state police to provide body-worn cameras to be worn by all officers including state university police officers.

title: Custodial Interrogation of Children
status: Pending - Assembly Children and Families Committee
author: ['Joyner (D)', 'Dinowitz (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Quart (D)', 'Mosley (D)']
summary: Amends the Family Court Act and the Criminal Procedure Law, relates to the custodial interrogation of juveniles by law enforcement.

title: Police Officer Duty
author: ['Fernandez (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Pichardo (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Taylor (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Reyes (D)']
summary: Provides that when a person is under arrest, or otherwise in custody of a police officer, peace officer, or other law enforcement representative or entity, such officer, representative, or entity shall have a duty to provide attention to the medical and mental health needs of such person.

title: Reporting of Non Emergency Incident
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Brooks (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)']
summary: Relates to reporting a non-emergency incident involving a member of a protected class.

title: Body Worn Cameras by State Police
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)']
summary: Relates to the use of body worn cameras by state police officers, establishes the State Police Body Worn Cameras Program, requires the Division of State Police to provide body worn cameras to be worn by all officers.

title: Prohibition on Racial and Ethnic Profiling
author: ['Benjamin (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Bailey (D)', 'Harckham (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement officers from using racial and ethnic profiling, requires that a procedure be established for the taking and review of complaints against law enforcement officers for racial and ethnic profiling, allows an action for injunctive relief and/or damages to be brought against a law enforcement agency.

title: Law Enforcement Disciplinary Records
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Breslin (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Benjamin (D)', 'Biaggi (D)']
summary: Amends the Civil Rights Law and the Public Officers Law, provides for the disclosure of law enforcement disciplinary records.

title: Law Enforcement Property Limitation
author: ['Biaggi (D)', 'Montgomery (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Myrie (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Amends the executive law, relates to limitations on certain excess property provided to local law enforcement.

title: Police Acceptance of Military Surplus Equipment
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Prohibits state or local police from accepting military surplus equipment from the federal government.

title: Division of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Directs the division of criminal justice services to establish a statewide public database covering every local police department, each county sheriff's office, the division of the state police and every agency that employs a peace officer in this state, which shall compile the Names of any police or peace officer who has had his or her employment terminated due to misconduct.

title: Police Officer and Peace Officer Hiring and Transfers
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Relates to police officer and peace officer hiring and transfers and requires police agencies review any possible internal files of police misconduct and complaints as well as pending criminal charges before hiring or allowing for a transfer.

title: State Police Vehicles Requirement
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Requires that certain New York state police vehicles be equipped with a dashboard camera.

title: Use of Chemical Incapacitant by Law Enforcement Agency
author: ['Biaggi (D)', 'Montgomery (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Provides that no law enforcement agency shall use a chemical incapacitant except for pepper spray, defines terms.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Hiring Requirements
author: ['Biaggi (D)', 'Montgomery (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Myrie (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Amends the Civil Service Law and the Administrative Code of the City of New York, relates to the hiring of certain police officers.

title: Use of Tear Gas By Law Enforcement Personnel
author: ['Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, prohibits the use of tear gas by law enforcement personnel.

title: State and Municipal Law Enforcement Agencies
author: ['Ramos (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Myrie (D)']
summary: Prohibits state and municipal law enforcement agencies, including campus law enforcement agencies, from accepting or purchasing surplus or other military property from the defense logistics agency for law enforcement purposes.

title: Division of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Ramos (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Liu (D)', 'Myrie (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, requires the Division of Criminal Justice Services to establish a policy prohibiting police agencies from using chemical weapons and kinetic energy munitions on civilian populations and from acquiring and stockpiling such weapons or munitions.

title: Execution of a Warrant of Arrest
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Relates to the execution of a warrant of arrest, authorizes the commissioner of the Division of Criminal Justice Services to establish a system to record and monitor the issuance and execution of search warrants, authorizes the chief administrator of the court system to establish educational programs for judicial personnel on the law of searches, arrests and seizures.

title: Unlawful Obstruction of Law Enforcement Identification
author: ['Rivera G (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Myrie (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing the offense of unlawful obstruction of law enforcement identification, establishes that such offense is a class A misdemeanor.

title: Participation in Federal Excess Property Program
author: ['Liu (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Prohibits any local police department, county sheriff's office, the division of the state police or any agency that employs a peace officer in this state from participating in the 1033 federal excess property program for the purposes of receiving lethal or offensive weapons.

title: Police Officer Observing Use of Force
author: ['Sanders (D)']
summary: Mandates that any police officer that is present and observes another police officer using force that is clearly excessive to safely intervene to prevent the use of such excessive force and report to the supervisor.

title: Law Enforcement Misconduct Investigative Office
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Revises provisions relating to the Law Enforcement Misconduct Investigative Office.

title: Immunity From Liability and Professional Retaliation
author: ['Jackson (D)', 'Montgomery (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Grants immunity from liability and professional retaliation against a law enforcement employee who intervenes against police misconduct committed by another member of law enforcement.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Requirement to Identify
author: ['Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)']
summary: Relates to requiring state and local law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public during law enforcement activities.

title: Diversity and Inclusion Training for State Police
author: ['Persaud (D)', 'Hoylman (D)']
summary: Requires the inclusion of diversity and inclusion training in the basic training and pre-employment course curricula for state police officers and municipal police officers and sheriffs, members of fire departments and companies, corrections officers, first responders, emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians.

title: Requirement to Report Misconduct of Police Officer
author: ['Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, requires police officers to report the misconduct of a police officer, requires the Division of Criminal Justice to establish a protocol to be followed by police agencies when handling and recording mandatory reports of misconduct by a police officer.

title: Unauthorized Use of Force by Police
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Hoylman (D)']
summary: Establishes a duty to report an unauthorized use of force by a police officer, provides that failure to report is a class B misdemeanor.

title: Officer Terminated for Malfeasance or Misconduct
author: ['Sepulveda (D)', 'Montgomery (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Any officer terminated who was dismissed for malfeasance or serious misconduct or resigned or retired during an investigation relating to such malfeasance or serious misconduct shall not be entitled to receive any retirement or other benefit or payment of any kind.

title: Crime of Tampering With Physical Evidence
author: ['Jackson (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Sepulveda (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, includes a police or peace officers turning off his or her body camera or deleting a body camera recording in the crime of tampering with physical evidence.

title: Police Use of Sustained Auditory Dispersal Tools
author: ['Ramos (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, creates a written policy prohibiting the use of sustained auditory dispersal tools by police agencies.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Krueger (D)', 'Hoylman (D)', 'Comrie (D)', 'Jackson (D)']
summary: Amends the Public Officers Law, relates to residency requirements for police officers in a city with a certain population count, provides that no person shall be a paid member of the police force in a such city that does not reside in the political subdivision or municipal corporation of the state for which he or she shall be chosen for one year prior to being appointed and continues to reside therein.

title: Liability Insurance on Police Officers
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Thomas (D)']
summary: Requires municipalities, authorities, and agencies to obtain liability insurance on each duly appointed police officer.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Amends the Public Officers Law, relates to residency requirements for police officers, provides that no person shall be a paid member of any police force that does not reside in the political subdivision or municipal corporation of the state for which he or she shall be chosen for one year prior to being appointed and continues to reside therein.

title: Civil Actions for Deprivation of Constitutional Rights
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Relates to civil actions for deprivation of constitutional rights, provides that a peace officer employed by a local government, who under color of law, subjects or causes to be subjected, including failing to intervene, any other person to the deprivation of any individual rights that create binding obligations on government actors secured by the bill of rights, article one of the state constitution, is liable to the injured party for legal or equitable relief or any other appropriate relief.

title: Police Officer Annual Diversity Training Seminars
author: ['Tedisco (R)', 'Little (R)', 'Jordan (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Requires police officers to attend annual diversity training seminars.

title: Constitutional Amendment
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Thomas (D)']
summary: Proposes a constitutional amendment, relates to reducing a police officer's pension to satisfy judgments in a wrongful death action, provides that a police officer's pension may be reduced to no less than a specified amount to satisfy a wrongful death judgment, provides that a court shall hold a hearing to determine the amount of the reduction.

title: Mandatory Continuing Law Enforcement Education
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, relates to establishing mandatory continuing law enforcement education for peace officers, requires peace officers to biannually complete a minimum of 32 credit hours of training including de-escalation techniques, implicit biases and mental health training.

title: Phoenix Act
author: ['Parker (D)', 'Martinez (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, enacts the Phoenix Act, extends the statute of limitations for certain family offenses, expands training for police officers dealing with family offenses, establishes the crime of coercive control.

title: Law Enforcement Personnel Peer Support Program
author: ['Jordan (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the Officer Ron Griffith law enforcement personnel peer support program to provide grants, within appropriations therefor, to eligible entities for the purpose of establishing peer-to-peer mental health programs for law enforcement personnel, makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Qualified Immunity for Law Enforcement
author: ['Jackson (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Ramos (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Relates to ending qualified immunity for law enforcement in any action brought for the deprivation of any rights, privileges, or immunities secured by the federal or state Constitution and Laws, provides a civil action for deprivation of rights which is caused by any person or public entity.

title: Use of Body Worn Cameras State Police Officers
author: ['Walker (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Rodriguez (D)', 'Mosley (D)', 'Blake (D)', 'Richardson (D)']
summary: Relates to the use of body-worn cameras by New York state police officers, establishes the New York state police body-worn cameras program, requires the division of state police to provide body-worn cameras to be worn by all officers including state university police officers.

title: Police Officer Liability Insurance
author: ['Biaggi (D)', 'Rivera G (D)', 'Jackson (D)', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to maintain liability insurance, excludes police officers from provisions requiring defense and indemnification of state officers and employees.

title: Police Officer Discipline in Collective Bargaining
author: ['May (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in cities with a population between one hundred thirty-nine thousand and one hundred forty-five thousand.

title: Police Officer Discipline in Collective Bargaining
author: ['May (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in municipalities in the state.

title: Police Commissioner Term of Elected Office
author: ['Comrie (D)']
summary: Provides that the police commissioner of the City of New York and all other cities with a population of one hundred thousand or more shall be an elected office with a four-year term, provides that such office shall be subject to term limits of two terms.

title: State Police Body Worn Cameras Program
author: ['Parker (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, relates to the New York state police body-worn cameras program, provides that the Internal Affairs Department of the Division of State Police shall investigate any instance where a body camera fails to record an event, requires recordings to be preserved for three years or longer if such video is evidence in any investigation of any nature.

title: Aggravated Offering of False Accusation Against Police
author: ['Gallivan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Amedore (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated offering of a false accusation against a police officer or peace officer for knowing the information reported to be false or baseless, he or she reports, by word or action, to a law enforcement officer or agency, the wrongdoing by a police officer or peace officer in the performance of his or her duties, requires the posting of bail.

title: Crime of Failure to Retreat
author: ['Gallivan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Amedore (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of failure to retreat when a person who is within twenty-five feet of a police officer or peace officer engaged in the performance of his or her duties and the police officer or peace officer orders such person to halt or retreat and the person fails to do so immediately, requires the posting of bail.

title: Crime of Doxing a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Gallivan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Amedore (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes the crime of doxing a police officer or a peace officer when a person knowingly makes restricted personal information about a police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, publicly available with the intent to threaten, intimidate, or incite the commission of a crime of violence against the police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, or with the intent and knowledge that the restricted personal information.

title: Crime of Stalking a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Helming (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Amedore (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Creates the crime of stalking a police officer or peace officer when a person intentionally, and for no legitimate purpose, engages in a course of conduct directed at a specific police officer, peace officer or a person who he or she knows or reasonably should know is a member of such officer's immediate family, and knows or reasonably should know that such conduct is likely to cause reasonable fear of material harm to the physical health, safety or property of such officer.

title: Police Memorial Day as State Holiday
author: ['Serino (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Amedore (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, relates to making May 15th Police Memorial Day, a state holiday, and requires the state division of criminal justice services to annually organize a fitting ceremony at the Police Memorial Wall, requires the governor to appear in person at such ceremony.

title: Dangerous Employment Benefit for Law Enforcement
author: ['Akshar (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Amedore (R)', 'Funke (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Establishes a dangerous employment benefit of a specified amount for law enforcement officers who become seriously physically or mentally incapacitated or dies as the result of an injury, sustained in the performance or discharge of duties or as the natural and proximate result of an incident that occurred during such performance of duties.

title: Prohibition on Police Covering Their Badges
author: ['Bailey (D)', 'Salazar (D)']
summary: Prohibits members of the state police, police officers, and peace officers from intentionally covering their badges.

title: Classification of Crimes Relating to Assaults on Police
author: ['Jordan (R)', 'Boyle (R)', 'Amedore (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Borrello (R)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, relates to the classification of certain crimes relating to assaults on police officers, increases such classifications by one level.

title: Offenses of Menacing a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Jordan (R)', 'Gallivan (R)', 'Ortt (R)', 'Akshar (R)', 'Helming (R)']
summary: Establishes the offenses of menacing a police officer or peace officer in the first degree and menacing a police officer or peace officer in the second degree, relates to circumstances under which an officer is not required to issue an appearance ticket, makes conforming changes.

title: Study on Drug Exposure for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Ritchie (R)']
summary: Requires the Department of Health in conjunction with the Department of Corrections and community supervision to identify the short-term and long-term effects of fentanyl, heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, synthetic hallucinatory substances and certain prescription drug exposure on law enforcement officers and correctional officers who repeatedly come into contact with such substances during screening efforts at correctional facilities, raids and arrests.

title: Law Enforcement Inspector General
author: ['Taylor (D)', 'Aubry (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Vanel (D)']
summary: Relating to the port authority of New York and New Jersey, establishes the law enforcement misconduct investigative office.

title: Geolocation Data Searches
author: ['Quart (D)', 'Rosenthal (D)', 'Simotas (D)', 'Mosley (D)']
summary: Prohibits the search of geolocation data of a group of people who are under no individual suspicion of having committed a crime, prohibits courts from issuing and law enforcement authorities from executing such searches, authorizes the suppression of evidence obtained from or as a result of such searches, establishes a private right of action for individuals whose records were obtained via such searches.

title: Removal of Policemen
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Lifton (D)', 'Blake (D)', 'Simon (D)', 'Richardson (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Relates to the removal of certain policemen.

title: Offenses of Undue Use of Force by Police Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Perry (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, establishes the offenses of undue use of force by an officer in the second degree and undue use of force by an officer in the first degree relating to a police or peace officer intentionally using a maneuver to subdue a person which limits the ability of the person to breath including, but not limited to, restraining a person around the neck, using a choke hold, or putting his or her knee on the person's neck, includes a death resulting from the commission of undue use of force.

title: Civilians Killed by Police Officer Incident Review
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Perry (D)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, directs the Attorney General to review incidents where a civilian is killed by a police officer.

title: Domestic Violence Investigation and Response Training
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'McDonald J (D)', "D'Urso (D)", 'Dickens (D)', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, relates to a training course and curriculum on the handling, investigation and response procedures concerning reports of domestic violence, requires law enforcement and judicial employees to participate in such training, makes related provisions.

title: Outside Agitators in Peaceful Protests Commission
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Abinanti (D)']
summary: Establishes a temporary commission to investigate the influence of outside agitators on peaceful protests, provides for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof.

title: Federal Excess Property Program
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Mosley (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Blake (D)', 'Reyes (D)']
summary: Prohibits any local police department, county sheriff's office, the division of the state police or any agency that employs a peace officer in this state from participating in the 1033 federal excess property program.

title: Police Officer and Peace Officer Hiring and Transfers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Galef (D)', 'Hyndman (D)', 'Barnwell (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Relates to police officer and peace officer hiring and transfers and requires police agencies review any possible internal files of police misconduct and complaints as well as pending criminal charges before hiring or allowing for a transfer.

title: Crime of Tampering With Physical Evidence
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Lentol (D)', 'Simotas (D)', 'Fahy (D)', 'Mosley (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, includes a police or peace officers turning off his or her body camera or deleting a body camera recording in the crime of tampering with physical evidence.

title: Requirement to Report Misconduct of a Police Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Ramos (D)', 'Blake (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, requires police officers to report the misconduct of a police officer, requires the division of criminal justice to establish a protocol to be followed by police agencies when handling and recording mandatory reports of misconduct by a police officer.

title: Prohibition on Use of Tear Gas by Law Enforcement
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Simotas (D)', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Prohibits members of law enforcement from using tear gas at any time.

title: Diversity and Inclusion Training for Police
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Thiele (I)', 'Gunther (D)', 'McDonald J (D)', 'Woerner (D)', 'Buttenschon (D)']
summary: Requires the inclusion of diversity and inclusion training in the basic training and pre-employment course curricula for state police officers and municipal police officers and sheriffs, members of fire departments and companies, corrections officers, first responders, emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians.

title: Termination of Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Mosley (D)', 'Seawright (D)', 'Carroll (D)', 'Taylor (D)', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Requires the termination of any police officer or peace officer who uses physical force which is not justifiable or which is not part of procedure regardless of if harm is done any person or if any complaint is filed against such police officer or peace officer.

title: Unlawful Obstruction of Law Enforcement Identification
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Simotas (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Epstein (D)', 'Cruz (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing the offense of unlawful obstruction of law enforcement identification, establishes that such offense is a class A misdemeanor.

title: Execution of a Warrant of Arrest
author: ['Rules Cmt', "O'Donnell (D)"]
summary: Relates to the execution of a warrant of arrest, authorizes the commissioner of the division of criminal justice services to establish a system to record and monitor the issuance and execution of search warrants, authorizes the chief administrator of the court system to establish educational programs for judicial personnel on the law of searches, arrests and seizures.

title: Crimes of Aggravated Falsely Reporting an Incident
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Ramos (D)']
summary: Establishes the crimes of aggravated falsely reporting an incident in the first, second, and third degrees when a person commits the crime of falsely reporting an incident in the first, second, or third degree and such person intended to harass, annoy, threaten, or alarm another person because of a believe or perception regarding a person's race, color, national origin, or ancestry.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Aubry (D)', 'Perry (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Walker (D)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer or peace officer, who discharges his or her weapon under circumstances where a person could be struck by a bullet, to immediately report the incident to his or her superiors.

title: Chief Administrator of the Courts
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Aubry (D)', 'Lentol (D)', 'Heastie (D)', 'Peoples-Stokes (D)', 'Mosley (D)']
summary: Relates to the functions of the Chief Administrator of the Courts, relates to reporting requirements.

title: Disclosure of Law Enforcement Disciplinary Records
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Aubry (D)', 'Arroyo (D)', 'Heastie (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Peoples-Stokes (D)']
summary: Relates to the disclosure of law enforcement disciplinary records.

title: Law Enforcement Misconduct Investigative Office
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Taylor (D)']
summary: Relates to the law enforcement misconduct investigative office.

title: Arrest Recording Requirements
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Mosley (D)', 'Seawright (D)', 'Carroll (D)', 'Taylor (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, requires arrests be recorded or else such arrest is void and the defendant is discharged.

title: Police Misconduct Liability Professional Retaliation
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Aubry (D)', 'Fahy (D)']
summary: Grants immunity from liability and professional retaliation against a law enforcement employee who intervenes against police misconduct committed by another member of law enforcement.

title: Peace and Police Officer Misconduct and Reemployment
author: ['Rules Cmt', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Mosley (D)', 'Seawright (D)', 'Carroll (D)', 'Taylor (D)']
summary: Prohibits prior peace officers or police officers whose position as such was terminated or vacated due to misconduct from again becoming a peace officer or a police officer.

title: Police Officer Involved in Execution of Search Warrant
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Perry (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, requires that each police officer involved in the execution of a search warrant wear a functioning and unobstructed body camera that shall be active prior to and throughout the execution of the search and during any related action following the execution of the search warrant.

title: Re-assignment of Police Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Perry (D)']
summary: Amends the Civil Service Law, relates to the re-assignment of police officers pending certain investigations of incompetency or misconduct involving egregious behavior including, but not limited to, police brutality, intimidation, racial profiling, planting or fabricating evidence, unwarranted search and seizure, violating department procedures, and abuse of authority, and provides for an expeditious investigation of such incidents.

title: Use of Deadly Force by Police or Peace Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Perry (D)', 'Dickens (D)', 'Wright T (D)', 'Taylor (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, limits the circumstances which justify the use of deadly force by a police officer or peace officer.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Purchase of Military Equipment
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Gottfried (D)', 'Kim (D)', 'Mosley (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Simon (D)']
summary: Prohibits a law enforcement agency from receiving or purchasing certain property from a military equipment surplus program operated by the federal government, includes armored and weaponized drones, aircraft that are combat configured or coded, grenades or similar explosives and grenade launchers, silencers, militarized armored vehicles, camouflage uniforms, bayonets, riot gear including batons, helmets, and shields, firearms or ammunition, explosives or pyrotechnics, or chemical incapacitants.

title: Criminal History Release Prohibition
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Dilan (D)']
summary: Prohibits the release of criminal history or any mental health history records by a coroner, coroner's physician or medical examiner of individuals who were the subject of the use of force by a police or peace officer.

title: Criminal History Release Prohibition
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Dilan (D)']
summary: Prohibits the release of criminal history or any mental health history records by a police agency, prosecutorial agency or other law enforcement agency of individuals who were the subject of the use of force by a police or peace officer.

title: Sustained Auditory Dispersal Tool Prohibition
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Hyndman (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, creates a written policy prohibiting the use of sustained auditory dispersal tools by police agencies.

title: Police Badge Cover Prohibition
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Gottfried (D)', "O'Donnell (D)", 'Simotas (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Epstein (D)']
summary: Prohibits members of the state police, police officers, and peace officers from intentionally covering their badges.

title: Constitutional Right Deprivation Civil Actions
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Walker (D)']
summary: Relates to civil actions for deprivation of constitutional rights, provides that a peace officer employed by a local government, who under color of law, subjects or causes to be subjected, including failing to intervene, any other person to the deprivation of any individual rights that create binding obligations on government actors secured by the bill of rights, article one of the state constitution, is liable to the injured party for legal or equitable relief or any other appropriate relief.

title: Mandatory Continuing Law Enforcement Education
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Walker (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, relates to establishing mandatory continuing law enforcement education for peace officers, requires peace officers to biannually complete a minimum of 32 credit hours of training including de-escalation techniques, implicit biases and mental health training.

title: Officer Terminated or Dismissed for Malfeasance
author: ['Richardson (D)', 'Barron (D)']
summary: Any officer terminated who was dismissed for malfeasance or serious misconduct or resigned or retired during an investigation relating to such malfeasance or serious misconduct shall not be entitled to receive any retirement or other benefit or payment of any kind.

title: Police Officer Discipline in Collective Bargaining
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Magnarelli (D)', 'Hunter (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in cities with a population between a specified number.

title: Release of Body Camera Recordings
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Mosley (D)', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Requires the release of body camera recordings in instances where an officer fires a gun and hits someone or could have caused injury, uses a stun gun, or makes use of any other force that causes harm within thirty days of such incident.

title: Police Officer Discipline in Collective Bargaining
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Magnarelli (D)', 'Hunter (D)']
summary: Removes police officer discipline from collective bargaining in municipalities in the state.

title: Prohibition on Peace Officers Carrying Firearms
author: ['Rules Cmt']
summary: Prohibits peace officers from carrying firearms for any purpose during the scope of their employment other than to dispose of such firearm.

title: Police Officers Liability Insurance Requirement
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Hyndman (D)']
summary: Requires police officers to maintain liability insurance, excludes police officers from provisions requiring defense and indemnification of state officers and employees.

title: Reporting Use of Force By Police or Peace Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Quart (D)']
summary: Amends the Executive Law, relates to reporting the use of force by a police officer or peace officer, includes pointing a firearm at or in the direction of another person as a use of force which must be reported.

title: Park Rangers in Erie County
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Burke (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, grants park rangers in Erie county peace officer status to issue appearance tickets, simplified traffic informations, simplified parks informations and simplified environmental conservation informations, provided that such shall not be deemed to authorize such officer to carry, possess, repair or dispose of a firearm unless the appropriate license has been issued therefor.

title: Phoenix Act
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Jaffee (D)', 'Seawright (D)', 'Dickens (D)', 'Cruz (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law, enacts the Phoenix Act, extends the statute of limitations for certain family offenses, expands training for police officers dealing with family offenses, establishes the crime of coercive control.

title: Liability Insurance on Police Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Relates to requiring municipalities, authorities and agencies to obtain liability insurance on each duly appointed police officer in an amount not less than a specified amount.
