title: Constitutional Amendment
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Proposes a constitutional amendment, relates to reducing a police officer's pension to satisfy judgments in a wrongful death action, provides that a police officer's pension may be reduced to no less than a specified amount to satisfy a wrongful death judgment, provides that a court shall hold a hearing to determine the amount of the reduction.

title: Duty To Report Unauthorized Use of Force
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Taylor (D)']
summary: Relates to establishing a duty to report an unauthorized use of force by a police officer, provides that failure to report is a class B misdemeanor.

title: Eligibility for Appointment as Police Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Aubry (D)']
summary: Provides that no person shall be eligible for appointment as a police officer who was previously employed as a police officer and who: (i) was dismissed for malfeasance or other serious misconduct calling into question such person's fitness to serve as a police officer, or (ii) resigned or retired from such officer's position while under investigation for such malfeasance or other serious misconduct, defines terms, makes related provisions.

title: Detaining Persons
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Richardson (D)']
summary: Amends the Criminal Procedure Law and the Civil Practice Law and Rules, relates to detaining persons for longer than twenty four hours, requires cities with a certain population count to establish and maintain a searchable online registry, consisting of the names, ages, and locations of persons detained by a police department, which will permit authorized users to locate persons detained for any reason.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Seawright (D)', 'Dickens (D)', 'Cruz (D)']
summary: Amends the Public Officers Law, relates to residency requirements for police officers in a city with a certain population, provides that any person appointed as a paid member of the police force of such city shall become a resident of any political subdivision or municipal corporation within such city within one year of his or her appointment, and shall continue to reside within any political subdivision or municipal corporation.

title: Crime of Doxing a Police or Peace Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Woerner (D)']
summary: Establishes the crime of doxing a police officer or a peace officer when a person knowingly makes restricted personal information about a police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, publicly available with the intent to threaten, intimidate, or incite the commission of a crime of violence against the police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer.

title: Facial Recognition Technology
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Fernandez (D)']
summary: Prohibits facial recognition technology to be used in connection with an officer camera used by both local and state police, including the storage of biometric data.

title: Law Enforcement Personnel Peer Support Program
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Montesano (R)']
summary: Establishes the Officer Ron Griffith Law Enforcement Personnel Peer Support Program to provide grants, within appropriations therefor, to eligible entities for the purpose of establishing peer to peer mental health programs for law enforcement personnel, makes an appropriation therefor.

title: Crime of Aggravated Resisting Arrest
author: ['Rules Cmt']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated resisting arrest as where a person intentionally prevents or attempts to prevent a police officer or peace officer from effecting an authorized arrest of such person or another person through the use of physical force, where such authorized arrest is for a crime which is a felony.

title: Offenses Against Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Ra (R)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, designates offenses against law enforcement officers as hate crimes and designates making graffiti as a specified offense.

title: Crime of Stalking a Police Officer Peace Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt']
summary: Establishes the crime of stalking a police officer, peace officer, correction officer or firefighter to include intent to harass, annoy or alarm a police officer, peace officer, correction officer, firefighter or an immediate family member of a police officer, peace officer, correction officer or firefighter, intentionally engaging in a course of conduct directed at such person which is likely to cause such person to reasonably fear physical injury or serious physical injury.

title: Offenses of Destruction of Police Property
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Cusick (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, establishes the offenses of destruction of police property in the fourth degree, destruction of police property in the third degree, destruction of police property in the second degree and destruction of police property in the first degree.

title: Crime of Stalking a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Buttenschon (D)']
summary: Creates the crime of stalking a police officer or peace officer when a person intentionally, and for no legitimate purpose, engages in a course of conduct directed at a specific police officer, peace officer or a person who he or she knows or reasonably should know is a member of such officer's immediate family, and knows or reasonably should know that such conduct is likely to cause reasonable fear of material harm to the physical health, safety or property of such officer.

title: Assault Offenses Regarding Police and Peace Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Buttenschon (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, increases the offense classification for certain assault offenses regarding police officers and peace officers.

title: Dangerous Employment Benefit for Law Enforcement
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Buttenschon (D)']
summary: Establishes a dangerous employment benefit of five hundred thousand dollars for law enforcement officers who become seriously physically or mentally incapacitated or dies as the result of an injury, sustained in the performance or discharge of duties or as the natural and proximate result of an incident that occurred during such performance of duties.

title: Penalties for Assault on Police Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Stern (D)']
summary: Amends the Penal Law, increases the penalties for assault on police officers, peace officers, firefighters and emergency medical technicians causing physical injury or serious physical injury.

title: False Accusation Against Peace or Police Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Stern (D)']
summary: Establishes the crime of aggravated offering of a false accusation against a peace officer or police officer for knowingly reporting false or baseless information relating to wrongdoing by a police of peace officer to a law enforcement agency, creates a private right of action for damages.

title: Crime of Doxing a Police Officer or Peace Officer
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Stern (D)']
summary: Establishes the crime of doxing a police officer or a peace officer when a person knowingly makes restricted personal information about a police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer, publicly available with the intent to threaten, intimidate, or incite the commission of a crime of violence against the police officer or peace officer, or a member of the immediate family of such officer.

title: Mental Health Screening
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Frontus (D)']
summary: Provides for mental health screening and creates a presumption that post-traumatic stress disorder is proximately caused by employment for law enforcement officers and emergency medical services personnel.

title: Residency Requirements for Police Officers
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Glick (D)', 'Mosley (D)', 'Barron (D)', 'Bichotte (D)', 'Dickens (D)']
summary: Relates to residency requirements for police officers in cities with a population of one million or more.

title: COVID 19 Extra Time for Heroes Act
author: ['Rules Cmt', 'Perry (D)']
summary: Enacts ""The COVID-19 Extra Time for Heroes Act"" providing an additional five days of personal time to public employees who worked as a certified first responder and a healthcare worker and had contact with infected patients during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: title
author: author
summary: summary

title: Police Benevolent Association
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Johnson (R)', 'Sanderson (R)', 'Daniel (R)', 'Hise (R)', 'Krawiec (R)', 'Steinburg (R)', 'Woodard (D)', 'Chaudhuri (D)', 'Corbin (R)', 'Britt (R)', 'Edwards (R)', 'Newton P (R)', 'Sawyer (R)', 'DeViere (D)', 'Perry (R)', 'Crawford (D)', 'Galey (R)']
summary: Provides that the Police Benevolent Association can appoint one full-time sworn law-enforcement officer to serve on the Criminal Justice Education and Training Standards Commission.

title: Police Benevolent Association
summary: Provides that the Police Benevolent Association can appoint one full-time sworn law-enforcement officer to serve on the Criminal Justice Education and Training Standards Commission.

title: Punishment for Discharging a Firearm
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
summary: Increases the punishment for discharging or attempting to discharge a firearm at or into an unoccupied emergency vehicle, increases the punishment for pointing a laser device at a law enforcement officer or other emergency personnel when the person or animal is in the performance of his or her duties.

title: Safety Inspection of Tinted Windows
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Johnson (R)']
summary: Removes the safety inspection of tinted windows, requires a driver to lower a tinted window upon the approach of a law enforcement officer.

title: Local Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Davis D (D)', 'Daniel (R)', 'Harrington (R)', 'Hise (R)', 'Krawiec (R)', 'Steinburg (R)', 'Lee (R)', 'Britt (R)', 'Edwards (R)', 'Sawyer (R)', 'Alexander T (R)']
summary: Authorizes local law enforcement officers to purchase prior weapon used.

title: Police Funding Protection
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Edwards (R)', 'Britt (R)', 'Lazzara (R)', 'Galey (R)', 'Johnson (R)', 'Burgin (R)', 'Alexander T (R)', 'Jarvis (R)', 'Barnes (R)', 'Newton P (R)', 'Sanderson (R)', 'Corbin (R)', 'Lee (R)', 'Steinburg (R)', 'Ford C (R)', 'Krawiec (R)', 'Hise (R)', 'Harrington (R)', 'Daniel (R)']
summary: Provides that cities and counties that reduce funds for law enforcement officers or law enforcement agencies by an amount that exceeds the funds appropriated in any fiscal year for all other city or county employees or departments, or both, shall receive a corresponding reduction in state-shared revenue.

title: Fraternal Order of Police
summary: Provides that the fraternal order of police can appoint one full-time sworn law-enforcement officer to serve on the Criminal Justice Education and Training Standards Commission.

title: Vacancies in the Office of Sheriff
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Clampitt (R)']
summary: Relates to vacancies in the office of sheriff of swain county.

title: Police Telecommunicator Certification
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
summary: Extends the deadline for certification of police telecommunicators.

title: Telecommunications Device Location Information
status: Pending - House Rules, Calendar and Operations of the House Committee
summary: Authorizes the provision of telecommunications device location information to law enforcement under certain emergency circumstances.

title: Body Worn Camera Recordings
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Robinson (D)', 'Garrett (D)']
summary: Allows the release of law enforcement body-worn camera recordings to certain Greensboro entities.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Britt (R)', 'Daniel (R)', 'Steinburg (R)', 'Lee (R)', 'Sawyer (R)', 'Perry (R)', 'Galey (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Increases protections, training, and oversight for state and local law enforcement officers, requires use of the federal bureau of investigation's record of arrest and prosecution background (Rap Back) system for law enforcement hiring purposes, expands the administrative office of the court's court date reminder system, decriminalizes non-statutory criminal offenses and violations, increases the punishment for riot offenses, mandates misdemeanor first appearances when a defendant is in custody.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - House Rules, Calendar and Operations of the House Committee
summary: Requires cities and counties to remove personal information from websites maintained by counties and cities when requested by certain law enforcement personnel, prosecutors, and judicial officers and to clarify certain personnel records of law enforcement officers.

title: Sheriff Candidates and Appointees
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Britt (R)', 'Steinburg (R)']
summary: Requires a candidate or appointee for the office of sheriff to disclose all felony convictions, including any expunged convictions.

title: Retirement System Membership Waiting Periods
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Corbin (R)', 'Steinburg (R)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Prohibits membership waiting periods for law enforcement officers under the Local Governmental Employees' Retirement System.

title: Sheriff Candidates and Appointees
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['McNeill (R)', 'Cleveland (R)', 'Brisson (R)', 'Boles (R)', 'Moffitt (R)', 'Pittman (R)', 'Carter (R)', 'Goodwin (R)', 'Kidwell (R)', 'Smith C (R)', 'Greene (R)', 'Miller (R)']
summary: Requires a candidate or appointee for the office of sheriff to disclose all felony convictions, including any expunged convictions.

title: Law and Order
author: ['Pittman (R)', 'Cleveland (R)', 'Brisson (R)', 'Brody (R)', 'Goodwin (R)', 'Kidwell (R)']
summary: Restores law and order in the state by holding accountable any public official in this state, whether elected or appointed, for the consequences that occur directly or indirectly from the public official's act of causing law enforcement officers to stand down in the face of violent criminal actions including murder, rioting, looting, physical assault, damage to public or private property, pulling down statues or other memorials or monuments, vandalism, arson, or any other criminal act.

title: Scope and Punishment of Hate Crimes
author: ['Majeed (D)', 'Smith R (D)', 'Butler (D)', 'Morey (D)', 'Dahle (D)', 'Hawkins (D)', 'Gailliard (D)', 'Harris (D)', 'Hunt (D)', 'Logan (D)', 'Smith K (R)', 'Quick (D)', 'Von Haefen (D)', 'Alston (D)', 'Cooper-Suggs (D)', 'Baker A (D)', 'Brown (D)', 'Farkas (D)', 'Hurtado (D)', 'Roberson (D)', 'Meyer (D)', 'Lucas (D)', 'Willingham (D)', 'Carney (D)', 'Fisher (D)', 'Harrison (D)', 'Pierce (D)', 'Alexander K (D)', 'Gill (D)', 'Cunningham (D)', 'Insko (D)', 'Adcock (D)', 'Ager (D)', 'Brockman (D)', 'Turner B (D)', 'Autry (D)', 'Ball (D)', 'Garrison (D)', 'John (D)']
summary: Increases the scope and punishment of hate crimes, requires the State Bureau of Investigation to create and maintain a hate crimes statistics database, requires the North Carolina Justice Academy to develop and provide law enforcement officers with training on identifying, responding to, and reporting hate crimes, requires the conference of district attorneys of North Carolina to develop and provide training to prosecutors on how to prosecute hate crimes.

title: Veterans Justice Intervention Program
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Bell J (R)', 'Morey (D)', 'Sasser (R)', 'Lofton (D)', 'Kidwell (R)', 'Hanig (R)', 'Goodwin (R)', 'Hawkins (D)', 'Dahle (D)', 'Carter (R)', 'Smith R (D)', 'White (R)', 'Strickland (R)', 'Quick (D)', 'John (D)', 'Clampitt (R)', 'Autry (D)', 'Richardson W (D)', 'Miller (R)', 'Zenger (D)', 'Winslow (R)', 'Willis (R)', 'Wheatley (R)', 'Pless (R)', 'Pickett (R)', 'Pare (R)', 'Moss (R)', 'Zachary (R)', 'Brown (D)', 'Baker A (D)', 'Cooper-Suggs (D)', 'Baker (R)', 'Alston (D)', 'Johnson J (R)', 'Von Haefen (D)', 'Pierce (D)', 'Faircloth (R)', 'Gill (D)', 'Stevens S (R)', 'Mills (R)', 'Boles (R)', 'McElraft (R)', 'Hurley (R)', 'Wray (D)', 'Graham C (D)', 'Harrison (D)', 'Cleveland (R)', 'Fisher (D)', 'Moore T (R)', 'Carney (D)', 'Willingham (D)', 'Lucas (D)', 'Insko (D)', 'Hastings (R)', 'Moffitt (R)', 'Shepard (R)', 'Torbett (R)', 'Warren H (R)', 'McNeill (R)', 'Arp (R)', 'Davis T (R)', 'Riddell (R)', 'Szoka (R)', 'Adcock (D)', 'Ager (D)', 'Bradford (R)', 'Brockman (D)', 'Turner B (D)']
summary: Establishes a pilot program to expand the veterans justice intervention program and appropriating funds for the program.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Hastings (R)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Provides a special separation allowance for certain cleveland, rutherford, wayne, and Moore County law enforcement officers who attain twenty-five years of service.

title: Employee Retirement System
summary: Allows law enforcement, probation/parole, and correctional officers who hold an advanced law enforcement or corrections certificate issued by the Criminal Justice Education and Training Standards Commission or the advanced law enforcement certificate issued by the Sheriffs' Education and Training Standards Commission to purchase at full cost up to four years' creditable service in the Teachers' and State Employees' Retirement System.

title: Threats To Law Enforcement
summary: Makes it a crime to threaten to inflict serious bodily harm upon or to kill a law enforcement officer, probation or parole officer, detention facility employee, or another person as retaliation against the officer for performing the officer's official duties.

title: Troopers Association Caisson Unit
author: ['Perry (R)', 'Britt (R)', 'Newton P (R)', 'Sawyer (R)', 'Craven (R)']
summary: Appropriates funds for the North Carolina Troopers Association Caisson Unit.

title: Psychological Screenings of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Baker (R)', 'Lofton (D)', 'Turner B (D)', 'Autry (D)', 'Belk (D)', 'John (D)', 'Quick (D)', 'Morey (D)', 'Hawkins (D)', 'Gailliard (D)', 'Harris (D)', 'Hunt (D)', 'Brockman (D)', 'Logan (D)', 'Smith K (R)', 'Smith R (D)', 'Von Haefen (D)', 'Alston (D)', 'Baker A (D)', 'Brown (D)', 'Farkas (D)', 'Hurtado (D)', 'Graham C (D)', 'Hunter (D)', 'Lucas (D)', 'Carney (D)', 'Fisher (D)', 'Harrison (D)', 'Wray (D)', 'Brisson (R)', 'Gill (D)', 'Faircloth (R)', 'Insko (D)', 'Shepard (R)', 'Pittman (R)', 'Cunningham (D)', 'Hardister (R)', 'Szoka (R)', 'Terry (D)', 'Meyer (D)', 'Reives (D)', 'Adcock (D)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Requires psychological screenings of law enforcement officers prior to certification or employment, educates law enforcement officers on maintaining good mental health, provides information to law enforcement officers on mental health resources available.

title: Scope and Punishment of Hate Crimes
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Chaudhuri (D)', 'Foushee (D)', 'Lowe (D)', 'DeViere (D)', 'Garrett (D)', 'Marcus (D)', 'Mohammed (D)', 'Murdock (D)', 'Mayfield (D)', 'Salvador (D)']
summary: Increases the scope and punishment of hate crimes, requires the State Bureau of Investigation to create and maintain a hate crimes statistics database, requires the North Carolina Justice Academy to develop and provide law enforcement officers with training on identifying, responding to, and reporting hate crimes, requires the Conference of District Attorneys of North Carolina to develop and provide training to prosecutors on how to prosecute hate crimes.

title: Arson Law Revisions
status: Pending - Senate Rules and Operations of the Senate Committee
author: ['Britt (R)', 'Sawyer (R)', 'Johnson (R)']
summary: Increases the punishment for the burning of commercial structures, amends the offense of arson or other unlawful burnings that result in injury to a firefighter, law enforcement officer, fire investigator, or emergency medical technician, authorizes the Commissioner of Insurance through the Office of State Fire Marshal to investigate fires, requires criminal history record checks of applicants to fire departments, requires applicants to disclose certain criminal charges.

title: Virtual Training
summary: Appropriates funds to the North Carolina Justice Academy and the North Carolina Community Colleges System Office for the purchase of police training simulators to be available for use by all law enforcement agencies in North Carolina.

title: Workers Compensation Benefits For Psychological Trauma
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Provides that law enforcement officers, firefighters, 911 dispatchers, and emergency management services personnel are entitled to workers' compensation benefits for psychological trauma whether or not such injuries are accompanied by physical injuries under specified circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Officers

summary: Relates to community policing standards, creates the State Community Policing Standards Task Force, provides termination date, states purpose of the Task Force, provides for membership, provides date for appointments and organizational meeting, provides for selection of officers, states duties, directs Task Force to comply with State Open Meeting Act and Open Records Act, provides for meetings, provides reimbursement for travel expenses, provides staff assistance.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Nichols (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, relates to duties of the Attorney General, expands duties of the Attorney General, directs the Attorney General to establish, administer and operate a database containing certain information about law enforcement officers, directs the Attorney General to maintain database separate and apart from other records, requires database to be operational by date certain, directs law enforcement agencies to furnish certain information to the Attorney General.

title: Crimes and Punishments
status: Pending - House Criminal Justice and Corrections Committee
author: ['Echols (R)']
summary: Relates to crimes and punishments, relates to the Victim's Rights Act, directs peace officer to contact domestic violence intervention program for victim under certain circumstances, provides an effective date.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Ford R (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, relates to Open Records Act, relates to confidentiality.

title: Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Ford R (R)']
summary: Relates to the Council on Law Enforcement Education and Training, directs the Council to mail notice of complaints to certain persons.

title: Retention of United States Prisoners by County Sheriffs
author: ['Pfeiffer (R)']
summary: Relates to immigration, relates to the retention of United States prisoners by county sheriffs, directs law enforcement personnel to comply with immigration detainer requests issued by certain federal agency, requires certain notification to persons held pursuant to immigration detainer, provides exemption to certain duty upon proof of citizenship.

title: Sanctuary Policies
author: ['Roberts S (R)']
summary: Relates to cities and towns, defines terms, prohibits governing bodies from enacting or adopting sanctuary policies, states ineligibility for funds under certain conditions, provides procedures for determining violations of the act, authorizes the legislator to request certain legal opinion, provides method of determining eligibility, directs certain entities to provide law enforcement officers with copies of the law and certain notice, prohibits state agencies from enacting or adopting certain policies.

title: Police Officers Recording Equipment
author: ['Goodwin (D)']
summary: Relates to criminal procedure, requires the use of audio or audiovisual recording equipment under certain circumstances, prohibits officers from modifying recordings, makes certain acts unlawful, provides penalty, defines term, provides for codification, provides an effective date.

title: Injuries and Rights Violations by Peace Officers
author: ['Goodwin (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to torts, states liability of peace officers for injuries related to the deprivation of certain rights, makes statutory immunities and limitations on liability inapplicable to claims brought by plaintiffs, prohibits the assertion of qualified immunity as a defense to liability, provides for the award of reasonable attorney fees and costs, directs employers to indemnify peace officers under certain circumstances, prohibits indemnification of peace officers under certain circumstances.

title: Fire and Police Arbitration and Collective Bargaining
author: ['Goodwin (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to cities and towns, relates to fire and police arbitration, prohibits certain acts in collective bargaining agreements with police departments, requires collective bargaining agreements to provide for community component, provides an effective date.

title: Deadly and Excessive Force
author: ['Goodwin (D)']
summary: Relates to deadly and excessive force, relates to justifiable deadly force by an officer, modifies elements that justify the use of deadly force, prohibits the use of deadly force under certain circumstances, directs peace officers to exercise use of force judiciously, requires peace officers to evaluate circumstances and use de-escalation tactics and resources when safe and feasible, provides guidelines for peace officers when making or attempting to make an arrest.

title: Department of Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Governor Kate Brown']
summary: Provides for Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to license private security entities that employ private security providers.

title: Department of Public Safety Standards and Training
author: ['Governor Kate Brown']
summary: Clarifies procurement authority of Department of Public Safety Standards and Training.

title: Private Security Provider or Entity Rules
author: ['Governor Kate Brown']
summary: Provides that it is unlawful for private security provider or entity that employs private security providers to possess or use equipment, vehicles, uniforms or titles that imply affiliation with public or private safety agency.

title: Law Enforcement Data Collection

author: ['Attorney General Ellen Rosenblum']
summary: Repeals certain provisions requiring data collection by law enforcement.

author: ['Senate Interim Committee on Judiciary']
summary: Directs Department of Justice to study law enforcement officers.

title: Department of Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Ways and Means
author: ['Senate Interim Committee on Judiciary']
summary: Directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to study public safety and to submit findings and recommendations for legislation to interim committee of Legislative Assembly related to judiciary.

title: Department of State Police Staffing Level
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Ways and Means
author: ['Senate Interim Committee on Judiciary']
summary: Directs Department of State Police to maintain staffing level of at least a specified number of patrol troopers per a specified number of residents of this state, beginning on a specified date.

title: Department of Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Senate Interim Committee on Judiciary']
summary: Directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to study Oregon State Police and report to appropriate committee or interim committee of the Legislative Assembly no later than a specified date.

title: Emergency Response Services
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Ways and Means
author: ['Office of the Governor']
summary: Directs Department of State Police to expand existing interagency coordination efforts for responding to emergencies to include community-based and faith-based organizations that provide emergency response services to specified communities.

title: Refusal to Obey Lawful Order Issued By Peace Officer
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Prozanski (D)']
summary: Provides that refusal to obey lawful order issued by peace officer or parole and probation officer does not constitute crime of interfering with a peace officer or parole and probation officer unless order is to move back and keep distance while officer is performing lawful duties.

summary: Prohibits peace officer from using deceit, trickery or artifice during interview of youth concerning act that, if committed by adult, would constitute crime.

title: Database About Police Officers

author: ['Manning (D)']
summary: Transfers responsibility for database about police officers from Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to Department of Justice.

title: Board on Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Thomsen (R)']
summary: Directs Board on Public Safety Standards and Training to ensure that all police officers and certified reserve officers are trained in treatment of allergic responses.

title: Police Trooper Study
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Gorsek (D)']
summary: Directs the State Police to study impact that number of the State Police troopers has on public safety and report to appropriate committee or interim committee of Legislative Assembly no later than a specified date.

title: Riot or Civil Disturbance
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Girod (R)', 'Findley (R)']
summary: Requires public body that declares riot or civil disturbance to pay peace officers double regular pay for responding to riot or civil disturbance.

title: Police Officers
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Frederick (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to police officers.

title: Board on Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Frederick (D)']
summary: Modifies membership and purpose of Board on Public Safety Standards and Training.

title: Law Enforcement
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Frederick (D)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues', ' Standards']
summary: Requires police officers, corrections officers, parole and probation officers, regulatory specialists and reserve officers to complete post-secondary education.

title: Excessive Force
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Frederick (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Decertification']
summary: Provides that arbitral determinations made in proceedings concerning alleged misconduct by law enforcement officers concerning use of excessive force are nonbinding and subject to review and approval by Department of Public Safety Standards and Training.

title: Excessive Force
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Frederick (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement unit to have policy on use of force that complies with rules adopted by Board on Public Safety Standards and Training.

topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Decertification']
summary: Upholds, under certain circumstances, local laws concerning local community oversight board established to oversee disciplinary matters concerning law enforcement officers, notwithstanding collective bargaining Laws that require bargaining over such matters.

title: Board on Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Hansell (R)', 'Taylor (D)']
summary: Directs Board on Public Safety Standards and Training to require all police officers and certified reserve officers to be trained to recognize, investigate and report cases involving labor trafficking and sex trafficking of children and adults.

status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Gorsek (D)']
summary: Directs Oregon Criminal Justice Commission to study issues related to requiring all law enforcement agencies to use body-worn cameras and to provide results of study to interim committees of Legislative Assembly no later than a specified date.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Lateral Assistance
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Frederick (D)']
summary: Permits Governor to allocate, assign and make available law enforcement officers from one law enforcement unit to another law enforcement unit to assist other law enforcement unit in performance of law enforcement services.

author: ['Frederick (D)']

summary: Requires Employment Relations Board to conduct study relating to standards applied in arbitration proceedings involving alleged misconduct by law enforcement officers and to submit report of board's findings to interim committees of Legislative Assembly no later than a specified date.

title: Tribal Police Officers
author: ['Judiciary and Ballot 110 Implementation Cmt']
summary: Relates to tribal police, modified provisions relating to tribal police officers.

title: Peace Officer Uniform Requirements
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Establishes requirements for peace officer uniforms, establishes requirements for displaying identifying information on peace officer uniforms and for disclosing identifying information to public upon request, provides that failure to comply with requirements constitutes crime of official misconduct in the second degree, punishable by maximum of 30 days imprisonment, $1,250 fine, or both. Establishes requirements for displaying identifying information on law enforcement motor vehicles.

title: Police Officer Misconduct Report
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Modifies police officers duty to report misconduct, requires law enforcement unit to investigate reports of misconduct.

title: Peace Officer Use of Force Prohibition
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Provides that peace officer or corrections officer may not use force that impedes normal breathing or circulation of blood of another person by applying pressure on throat or neck under any circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Misconduct Arbitration
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight']
summary: Imposes limitations on arbitrators decisions concerning alleged misconduct by law enforcement officers, prescribes method for selecting arbitrator to serve in arbitration proceeding concerning law enforcement officer misconduct, establishes Commission on Statewide Law Enforcement Standards of Conduct and Discipline.

title: Police Officer Disciplinary and Certification Database

title: Task Force on Law Enforcement Disciplinary Standards
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Establishes Task Force on Uniform Statewide Law Enforcement Disciplinary Standards.

title: Peace Officer Physical Force Justification
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Modifies justification defenses available to peace officer who uses physical force or deadly physical force upon another person, requires peace officer to give verbal warning, and reasonable opportunity to comply, before using physical force or deadly physical force if reasonable opportunity to do so exists, requires peace officer to consider alternatives to deadly physical force if reasonable opportunity to do so exists.

title: Peace Officer Physical Force Use Database
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Directs Oregon Criminal Justice Commission to establish statewide database of reports of use of physical force by peace officers and corrections officers, requires commission to report annually to appropriate committee or interim committee of Legislative Assembly on reports, requires law enforcement units to report on use or threat of physical force, and deaths of persons in custody, to commission.

title: Public Safety Standards
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Judiciary and Ballot 110 Implementation Cmt']
summary: Relates to public safety standards, directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to study public safety standards.

title: Department of Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Ways and Means
author: ['Office of the Governor']
summary: Directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to study changes to police officer training and to provide results of study to Legislative Assembly no later than a specified date.

title: Law Enforcement Officer may Euthanize Wild Animal
status: Pending - House Agriculture and Natural Resources Committee
author: ['Wilde (D)', 'Gomberg (D)', 'Neron (D)']
summary: Provides that law enforcement officer may euthanize wild animal that does not pose immediate danger to life or property only if law enforcement officer consults with licensed veterinarian before euthanizing wild animal or euthanizes wild animal in manner consistent with euthanasia guidelines established by rule by Oregon State Veterinary Medical Examining Board.

title: Office of Emergency Management
status: Pending - House Veterans and Emergency Management Committee
author: ['Wilde (D)', 'Evans (D)', 'Grayber (D)']

title: Public Employees Retirement System

author: ['Wilde (D)', 'Evans (D)']

title: Police Oversight Board
author: ['Evans (D)']

title: Peace Officer Uniforms Information Display Requirements
author: ['Evans (D)']

author: ['Sanchez (D)', 'Neron (D)', 'Ruiz (D)', 'Reynolds (D)', 'Pham (D)', 'Grayber (D)', 'Campos (D)', 'Dexter (D)', 'Williams (D)', 'Wilde (D)', 'Prusak (D)', 'Gelser (D)', 'Wagner (D)', 'Sollman (D)', 'Marsh (D)', 'Alonso Leon (D)', 'Nosse (D)', 'McLain (D)', 'Evans (D)', 'Reardon (D)']

title: Public Records and Public Safety Officers
author: ['Power (D)']
summary: Modifies provisions relating to public records about public safety officers.

title: Police Officers Airway and Circulatory Anatomy Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Grayber (D)', 'Nosse (D)', 'Bynum (D)', 'Noble (R)', 'Power (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Prusak (D)', 'Williams (D)', 'Dexter (D)', 'Campos (D)', 'Hudson (D)', 'Kropf (D)', 'Pham (D)', 'Reynolds (D)']

author: ['Sanchez (D)', 'Frederick (D)', 'Meek (D)', 'Wilde (D)', 'Grayber (D)']
summary: Requires Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to establish by rule standards and procedures for licensing of private security entities.

author: ['Leif (R)', 'Morgan L (R)']
summary: Authorizes peace officer to request order from circuit court for information regarding missing individual.

title: Abuse Investigator Osteogenesis Imperfecta Training
author: ['Sollman (D)']
summary: Directs Department of Human Services, Department of Justice and Board of Public Safety Standards and Training to provide training regarding osteogenesis imperfecta to investigators of allegations of abuse.

title: Crime of Criminal Impersonation of a Peace Officer
author: ['Smith (R)']
summary: Renames crime of criminal impersonation of a peace officer to criminal impersonation of a law enforcement officer.

title: Criminal Peace Officer Impersonation
author: ['Leif (R)', 'Zika (R)']
summary: Expands crime of criminal impersonation of a peace officer to include possession of false law enforcement vehicle.

title: Reserve Officer Police Training and Education Benefits
author: ['Evans (D)', 'Wilde (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues']
summary: Authorizes reserve officers sponsored by law enforcement unit to pay for training as police with cash and GI Bill education benefits.

author: ['Bynum (D)', 'Power (D)', 'Dexter (D)', 'Campos (D)', 'Pham (D)', 'Reynolds (D)', 'Valderrama (D)']
summary: Regulates use of chemical incapacitants, kinetic impact projectiles and sound devices by law enforcement agencies.

summary: Modifies police officer's duty to report misconduct.

author: ['Bynum (D)']
summary: Imposes limitations on arbitrators' decisions concerning alleged misconduct by law enforcement officers.

title: Database of Reports of Use of Physical Force
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Ways and Means

summary: Directs Oregon Criminal Justice Commission to establish statewide database of reports of use of physical force by peace officers and corrections officers.

summary: Provides that public safety officer who represents that person is acting as employee or agent of public body is acting in scope of employment for purposes of Oregon Tort Claims Act.

title: Department of Public Safety Standards and Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Bynum (D)', 'Nosse (D)', 'Alonso Leon (D)', 'Noble (R)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Prusak (D)', 'Dexter (D)', 'Grayber (D)', 'Kropf (D)', 'Pham (D)', 'Reynolds (D)', 'Valderrama (D)']

summary: Provides that employer may not use evidence that public safety officer has been placed on impeachment list for purpose of other investigations or disciplinary action.

title: Police Training
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Gomberg (D)', 'Nosse (D)', 'Bynum (D)', 'Alonso Leon (D)', 'Power (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Prusak (D)', 'Dexter (D)', 'Pham (D)', 'Reynolds (D)']
summary: Requires Board on Public Safety Standards and Training to ensure that police officers and certified reserve officers are trained to investigate, identify and report crimes motivated by prejudice based on perceived gender of victim.

title: Command Dispersal of Unlawful Assemblies
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Bynum (D)', 'McLain (D)', 'Nosse (D)', 'Alonso Leon (D)', 'Noble (R)', 'Power (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Dexter (D)', 'Pham (D)', 'Reynolds (D)', 'Valderrama (D)']
summary: Repeals statute authorizing law enforcement officers to command dispersal of unlawful assemblies and arrest participants who do not disperse.

title: Public Safety Employee Public Record Database

author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to records, directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to establish publicly available database of certain information about misconduct and discipline of public safety employees established by department.

title: Crime of Interfering With a Peace Officer
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Kotek (D)', 'McLain (D)', 'Nosse (D)', 'Alonso Leon (D)', 'Noble (R)', 'Power (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Prusak (D)', 'Wilde (D)', 'Dexter (D)', 'Kropf (D)', 'Pham (D)', 'Reynolds (D)', 'Valderrama (D)']
summary: Modifies crime of interfering with a peace officer or parole and probation officer.

title: Municipal Law Enforcement Agency
author: ['Evans (D)']
summary: Directs municipal law enforcement agency with jurisdiction over population of at least 350,000 to staff patrol vehicles with minimum of two officers.

title: State Police Staffing Level
author: ['Noble (R)', 'Evans (D)']
summary: Directs Department of State Police to maintain staffing level of at least 15 patrol troopers per 100,000 residents of this state, beginning January 1, 2030.

title: Mental Health Treatment for People in Custody
author: ['Evans (D)']
summary: Requires each county to have facility jointly managed by sheriff and community mental health director to house and treat individuals with behavioral health disorders or intellectual or developmental disabilities who are in custody of county sheriff pending trial.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Identification
status: Pending - Senate Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation Committee
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officer identification, specifies identification required on uniforms of law enforcement officers working in crowd management.

title: Department of Public Safety Standards and Training
author: ['Bynum (D)']
summary: Directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to study public safety standards.

title: Department Of Public Safety Standards And Training
status: Pending - Joint Committee on Ways and Means
author: ['Oregon Department of Administrative Services']
summary: Appropriates moneys from General Fund to Department of Public Safety Standards and Training for debt service.

title: Law Enforcement Plan to Keep the Peace
summary: Implements the Law Enforcement Plan to Keep the Peace, Protect Free Speech, and Prevent Violence in the City of Portland.

title: Implements Law Enforcement Plan
summary: Implements Law Enforcement Plan to Keep the Peace, Protect Free Speech, and Prevent Violence in the City of Portland.

title: Police Officer Discipline Records Database
author: ['Senator Courtney']
summary: Directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to establish statewide database of police officer discipline records, directs department to publish online information about disciplinary proceedings against police officers.

title: Police Officer Physical Force Use Investigations
author: ['Senator Courtney']
summary: Requires law enforcement agency to notify Attorney General when police officer uses physical force resulting in death or qualifying physical injury, requires Attorney General to appoint special investigator to lead investigation upon receipt of notification, directs Attorney General to prosecute violations of law related to use of physical force, directs Attorney General to release reports from investigation if criminal proceedings are not initiated.

title: Improper Use of Force Interventions and Reporting
author: ['Senator Courtney']
summary: Directs Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to adopt rules requiring police officer to intervene to stop another police officer from engaging in act that is unethical or that violates law, rules or policy, directs department to adopt rules requiring police officer to report to appropriate authority when any police officer engages in act that is unethical or that violates law, rules or policy.

title: Law Enforcement Use of Breath Restricting Force
author: ['Senator Courtney']
summary: Provides that peace officer may not use force that limits ability of person to breathe, including but not limited to choke holds.

title: Peace Officer Uniform Requirements
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Establishes requirements for peace officer uniforms, establishes requirements for displaying identifying information on peace officer uniforms and for disclosing identifying information to public upon request, provides that failure to comply with requirements constitutes crime of official misconduct in the second degree, punishable by maximum of 30 days imprisonment, $1,250 fine, or both. Establishes requirements for displaying identifying information on law enforcement motor vehicles.

title: Police Officer Misconduct Report
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Modifies police officers duty to report misconduct, requires law enforcement unit to investigate reports of misconduct.

title: Peace Officer Use of Force Prohibition
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Provides that peace officer or corrections officer may not use force that impedes normal breathing or circulation of blood of another person by applying pressure on throat or neck under any circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Misconduct Arbitration
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Imposes limitations on arbitrators decisions concerning alleged misconduct by law enforcement officers, prescribes method for selecting arbitrator to serve in arbitration proceeding concerning law enforcement officer misconduct, establishes Commission on Statewide Law Enforcement Standards of Conduct and Discipline.

title: Police Officer Disciplinary and Certification Database
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Modifies requirements for database of disciplinary and certification actions relating to police officers and reserve officers established by Department of Public Safety Standards and Training, requires law enforcement agencies to report to department when agency imposes disciplinary action with economic consequences on police officer or reserve officer.

title: Task Force on Law Enforcement Disciplinary Standards
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Establishes Task Force on Uniform Statewide Law Enforcement Disciplinary Standards.

title: Peace Officer Physical Force Justification
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Modifies justification defenses available to peace officer who uses physical force or deadly physical force upon another person, requires peace officer to give verbal warning, and reasonable opportunity to comply, before using physical force or deadly physical force if reasonable opportunity to do so exists, requires peace officer to consider alternatives to deadly physical force if reasonable opportunity to do so exists.

title: Peace Officer Physical Force Use Database
author: ['Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force']
summary: Directs Oregon Criminal Justice Commission to establish statewide database of reports of use of physical force by peace officers and corrections officers, requires commission to report annually to appropriate committee or interim committee of Legislative Assembly on reports, requires law enforcement units to report on use or threat of physical force, and deaths of persons in custody, to commission.

title: Law Enforcement Disciplinary Actions
author: ['Senator Courtney']
summary: Restricts an arbitration award from ordering disciplinary action that differs from disciplinary action imposed by a law enforcement agency, if the arbitrator makes a finding that misconduct occurred consistent with the agency's finding of misconduct, and disciplinary action imposed by the agency is consistent with provisions of a discipline guide or discipline matrix adopted by the agency as a result of collective bargaining and incorporated into the agency's disciplinary policies.

title: Transparent Policing and Use of Force Reform
author: ['Kotek (D)']
summary: Establishes the Joint Committee on Transparent Policing and Use of Force Reform.

title: Use of Force by Police Officers
author: ['Kotek (D)']
summary: Provides that a peace officer may not use force that limits ability of person to breathe, including but not limited to choke holds, directs the Board of Public Safety Standards and Training to adopt rules prohibiting the training of police officer and reserve officers to use physical force that impedes the normal breathing or circulation of blood of another person by applying pressure on the throat or neck of another person.

title: Police Officer Rules
author: ['Kotek (D)']
summary: Directs the Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to adopt rules requiring police officer to intervene to stop another police officer from engaging in act that is unethical or that violates law, rules, or policy, defines misconduct.

title: Police Officer Discipline Records
author: ['Kotek (D)']
summary: Directs the Department of Public Safety Standards and Training to establish a statewide database of police officer discipline records.

title: Law Enforcement Usage of Tear Gas
author: ['Kotek (D)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement agencies from using tear gas or from using long range acoustic devices or sound cannons for the purposes of crowd control, except in circumstances constituting a riot.

title: Peace Officer Use of Force Allowance
author: ['Kotek (D)']
summary: Provides that a peace officer or corrections officer may not use force that impedes normal breathing or circulation of blood of another person by applying pressure on throat or neck, except in specified circumstances, modifies justification defenses available to a peace officer who uses physical force or deadly physical force upon another person, requires a peace officer to give verbal warning, and reasonable opportunity to comply, before using physical force or deadly physical force.

title: Police Officers
author: ['Davis A (D)', 'Deasy (D)', 'Harris J (D)', 'Schweyer (D)', 'Hill-Evans (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Webster (D)', 'Pisciottano (D)']
summary: Directs the Legislative Budget and Finance Committee to conduct a study of the salaries and training of police officers in this Commonwealth.

title: False Reports To Law Enforcement Authorities
author: ['Hughes (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Boscola (D)', 'Tartaglione (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Brewster (D)', 'Blake (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Street (D)', 'Comitta (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Muth (D)', 'Cappelletti (D)']

title: Excessive Force

author: ['Hughes (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Schwank (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Street (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Muth (D)', 'Cappelletti (D)']

status: Pending - Senate Law and Justice Committee
author: ['Hughes (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Schwank (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Comitta (D)', 'Kearney (D)']
summary: Establishes a task force on law enforcement policies and procedures used in response to large-scale demonstrations, protests and other acts of civil disobedience.

title: Harassment of Law Enforcement Officers
summary: Provides for the offense of harassment of law enforcement officer, imposes penalties.

status: Pending - Senate Law and Justice Committee
author: ['Fontana (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Boscola (D)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Street (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Muth (D)']

title: Parole Power
author: ['Street (D)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Schwank (D)', 'Bartolotta (R)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Cappelletti (D)', 'Kane (D)']
summary: Provides for sentence of persons under a certain age for murder, murder of an unborn child and murder of a law enforcement officer, relates to sentencing, provides for sentences for second and subsequent offenses, relates to miscellaneous provisions, establishing the Life with Parole Reinvestment Fund.

title: Drug Recognition Expert Training Fund
author: ['Hutchinson (R)', 'Scavello (R)', 'Mensch (R)', 'Yaw (R)', 'Aument (R)', 'Regan (R)', 'Dush (R)', 'Stefano (R)', 'Pittman (R)']

summary: Provides for use of force and deadly force policy for law enforcement agencies.

title: Hate Crimes Against Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Langerholc (R)', 'Brooks (R)', 'Ward (R)', 'Aument (R)', 'Blake (D)', 'Regan (R)', 'Ward J (R)', 'Bartolotta (R)', 'Stefano (R)']

title: State Police Budget Study
status: Pending - Senate Law and Justice Committee
author: ['Tartaglione (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Kane (D)']
summary: Imposes a duty on the Legislative Budget and Finance Committee to conduct a study relating to effects of certain areas of criminal law enforcement on budget of the Pennsylvania State Police.

title: Accident Reports By Police
author: ['Diamond (R)', 'Millard (R)', 'Culver (R)', 'Neilson (D)', 'James R (R)', 'Staats (R)', 'Zimmerman (R)', 'Ciresi (D)', 'Nelson N (D)']
summary: Provides for accident reports by police.

title: Police Canine Training Standards
author: ['Krueger (D)', 'Hill-Evans (D)', 'Delloso (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', "O'Mara (D)", 'Pisciottano (D)']
summary: Provides for police canine training standards.

title: Municipal Police Enhancement Consolidation Grant
author: ['Davis A (D)', 'Deasy (D)', 'Kim (D)', 'Schlossberg (D)', 'Schweyer (D)', 'Cephas (D)', 'Hill-Evans (D)', 'Burgos (D)', 'Ciresi (D)', 'Pisciottano (D)']
summary: Provides for Municipal Police Enhancement Consolidation Grant Program, establishes the Municipal Police Enhancement Consolidation Grant Program Fund.

title: Police Academy Loan and Stipend Assistance
status: Pending - Senate Law and Justice Committee
author: ['Schwank (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Comitta (D)']
summary: Provides for police academy loan and stipend assistance.

title: Municipal Police Diversity Recruitment Program
status: Pending - Senate Law and Justice Committee
author: ['Schwank (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Comitta (D)']
summary: Establishes the Municipal Police Diversity Recruitment Program and Municipal Police Diversity Recruitment Program Fund.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['DeLuca (D)', 'Galloway (D)', 'Kinsey (D)', 'Burgos (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Oversight', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Provides for the termination of law enforcement officers upon testing positive for a controlled substance.

title: Recordings of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Miller D (D)', 'Hill-Evans (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Lee (D)', 'Innamorato (D)', 'Hohenstein (D)', 'Ciresi (D)', 'Davis A (D)', 'Madden (D)', 'Kirkland B (D)', 'Conklin (D)', 'Cephas (D)', 'Bullock (D)', 'McClinton (D)', 'Sims (D)', 'Schlossberg (D)', 'Kim (D)', 'Galloway (D)']
summary: Relates to recordings by law enforcement officers, provides for definitions, for scope of chapter, for requests for law enforcement audio recordings or video recordings, for procedure and for petition for judicial review, relates to actions, proceedings and other matters generally, provides for recordings of law enforcement officers.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Miller D (D)', 'Galloway (D)', 'Briggs (D)', 'Kinsey (D)', 'Schlossberg (D)', 'Sims (D)', 'McClinton (D)', 'Hill-Evans (D)', 'Madden (D)', 'Davis A (D)', 'Hohenstein (D)', 'Lee (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Kinkead (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Provides for use of force reporting and for duties of the Municipal Police Officers' Education and Training Commission, the Pennsylvania State Police and law enforcement agencies.

title: Law Enforcement
summary: Provides for actions by law enforcement.

title: Law Enforcement Citizen Advisory Commission
summary: Creates the Law Enforcement Citizen Advisory Commission to improve policing practices within law enforcement agencies under the Governor's jurisdiction.

title: Police Education and Training
author: ['Klunk (R)', 'Readshaw (D)', 'Saylor (R)', 'Pickett (R)', 'Moul (R)', 'Grove (R)', 'Culver (R)', 'Stephens T (R)', 'Toohil (R)', 'Neilson (D)', 'Hill-Evans (D)', 'Owlett (R)', 'Ecker (R)', 'Gaydos (R)', 'Mizgorski (R)', 'Schroeder (R)', 'Mihalek (R)']
summary: Amends statutes relating to municipalities, provides for municipal police education and training, requires training on domestic violence.

title: Use of Force Recordkeeping
author: ['Costa J (D)', 'Boscola (D)', 'Williams A (D)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Killion (R)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Farnese (D)', 'Schwank (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Street (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Muth (D)', 'Iovino (D)']
summary: Amends statutes relating to municipalities, provides for use of force recordkeeping and reporting for law enforcement agencies.

title: Special Session
status: Failed - Adjourned - House State Government Committee
summary: Petitions the Governor to call a special session of the General Assembly to address police accountability and police violence.

title: Body Worn Camera Footage
author: ['Rabb (D)', 'Hanbidge (D)', 'Green (D)', 'Zabel (D)', 'Shusterman (D)', 'Sappey (D)', 'Sanchez (D)', 'Mizgorski (R)', 'Lee (D)', 'Hohenstein (D)', 'Frankel (D)', 'Warren (D)', 'Madden (D)', 'Hill-Evans (D)', 'Schweyer (D)', 'Rozzi (D)', 'Toohil (R)', 'Sturla (D)']
summary: Directs the Joint State Government Commission to conduct a study on how body-worn camera footage can be more effectively used to provide positive and safe outcomes for both law enforcement officers and civilians.

title: Sheriff and Deputy Sheriff Education and Training
summary: Amends statutes relating to law and justice, establishes the Sheriff and Deputy Sheriff Education and Training Board, sets forth training requirements, provides for the Sheriff and Deputy Sheriff Education and Training Account.

title: Use of Force in Law Enforcement
author: ['Haywood (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Boscola (D)', 'Williams A (D)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Farnese (D)', 'Street (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Williams (D)']
summary: Provides for use of force in law enforcement.

title: Civilian Police Oversight Boards
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Law and Justice Committee
author: ['Williams A (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Boscola (D)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Farnese (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Street (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Muth (D)']
summary: Provides for civilian police oversight boards.

title: Actions by Law Enforcement
author: ['Street (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Boscola (D)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Scavello (R)', 'Killion (R)', 'Fontana (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Farnese (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Laughlin (R)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Muth (D)', 'Williams (D)', 'Iovino (D)']
summary: Amends statutes relating to municipalities, relates to employees, establishes a use of force and deadly force model policy for law enforcement agencies.

title: Law Enforcement Review Boards
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Law and Justice Committee
author: ['Fontana (D)', 'Costa J (D)', 'Boscola (D)', 'Hughes (D)', 'Santarsiero (D)', 'Farnese (D)', 'Haywood (D)', 'Street (D)', 'Kearney (D)', 'Muth (D)', 'Williams (D)']
summary: Provides for law enforcement review boards.

title: Medals Honoring Law Enforcement Officers
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Veterans Affairs & Emergency Preparedness Committee
author: ['Regan (R)', 'Yudichak (I)', 'Browne (R)', 'Scavello (R)', 'Killion (R)', 'Baker L (R)', 'Vogel (R)', 'Brewster (D)', 'Blake (D)', 'Schwank (D)', 'Phillips-Hill (R)', 'Ward J (R)', 'Martin (R)', 'Street (D)', 'Iovino (D)', 'Mastriano (R)', 'Arnold (R)']
summary: Amends statutes relating to municipalities, establishes a program for medals honoring law enforcement officers.

title: First Responders
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Veterans Affairs and Emergency Preparedness Committee
summary: Provides for medals honoring first responders.

title: Law Enforcement Background Investigations
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force']
summary: Amends statutes relating to law and justice, provides for law enforcement background investigations, provides for duties of the Municipal Police Officers' Education and Training Commission, law enforcement agencies, and employers, provides immunity from liability and violations.

title: Judicial Officers
summary: Amends statutes relating to the judiciary and judicial procedure, relates to the selection and retention of judicial officers, provides for continuing education credits, provides for mental health evaluations, provides for powers and duties of the Commission.

title: Policemen and Firemen Collective Bargaining Act
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Labor & Industry Committee
summary: Amends the Policemen and Firemen Collective Bargaining Act, provides for right to collectively bargain.

title: Actions by Law Enforcement
summary: Provides for actions by law enforcement.

title: Law Enforcement Review Boards
summary: Provides for law enforcement review boards.

title: Offense of Sexual Assault By Police Officer
summary: Provides for the offense of sexual assault by police officer.

title: Policemen and Firemen
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Labor & Industry Committee
author: ['Diamond (R)', 'Cox (R)', 'Schemel (R)', 'Bullock (D)']
summary: Amends the Policemen and Firemen Collective Bargaining Act, provides for public notice, provides for the Board of Arbitration, powers and procedures regarding arbitration and for determination of the Board, provides for issues excluded from collective bargaining and arbitration, provides for costs and expenses.

title: Traffic Stop Data
author: ['Quezada (D)', 'McCaffrey (D)', 'Calkin (D)', 'Euer (D)', 'Cano (R)', 'Bell (D)', 'Acosta (D)', 'Kallman (D)', 'Mack (D)']
summary: Requires data collection and a study of traffic stops and searches to determine whether racial disparities in stops and searches exist, provides that the data acquired may be used in civil or criminal proceedings in accordance with the rules of procedure, requires the appointment of a community review board.

title: Children Confinement in Motor Vehicle Prohibition
author: ['Raptakis (D)', 'Felag (D)', 'Archambault (D)', 'Lombardi (D)', 'Coyne (D)', 'Paolino (R)', 'Euer (D)', 'Rogers (R)']
summary: Repeals the requirement that law enforcement officers issue only warnings of the risks to persons leaving a child under the age of seven unattended in a motor vehicle.

title: Criminal Offenses Sexual Assault
author: ['Bell (D)', 'Goldin (D)', 'Calkin (D)', 'Quezada (D)', 'Cano (R)', 'Murray (D)', 'Valverde (D)', 'Acosta (D)', 'Anderson (D)', 'Mendes (D)']
summary: Establishes criteria for the criminal offense of sexual assault when the victim is in the custody of a peace officer, provides that a person convicted of custodial sexual assault would face imprisonment for not more than a specified amount of time.

title: Animal Cruelty Enforcement
author: ['Archambault (D)', 'Lombardo (D)', 'Burke (D)', 'Kallman (D)']
summary: Authorizes a law enforcement or animal control officer to hold an animal for a specified amount of time pending a district court hearing as to medical costs, fees, charges, and/or surrender of physical possession and ownership of the animal by a person charged with confining the animal in a motor vehicle in a manner that places the animal in a life-threatening or extreme health-threatening situation.

title: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights
author: ['Burke (D)', 'Lombardo (D)', 'Archambault (D)', 'Lombardi (D)']
summary: Increases the number of committee members in a law enforcement officers' bill of rights hearing to five, three of whom would be permanent, mandates that any hearing be commenced within fifteen days of the selection of the committee, allow for summary punishment of up to five days suspension and mandates that any officer charged with a felony or imprisoned on a misdemeanor have their pay suspended while the case is pending.

title: Municipal Police Arbitration
author: ['Ciccone (D)', 'Goodwin (D)', 'McCaffrey (D)']
summary: Provides that all contractual provisions in a municipal police collective bargaining agreement would continue until a successor agreement has been reached or an interest arbitration award has been rendered.

title: Labor Relations Act
author: ['Bell (D)', 'Goodwin (D)', 'Ciccone (D)', 'Kallman (D)', 'Mack (D)']
summary: Provides for the right to strike for public sector workers in Rhode Island, including teachers, with exceptions for police officers, firefighters, 911 employees, and correctional officers.

title: Law Enforcement Integrity Act
author: ['Acosta (D)', 'Calkin (D)', 'Anderson (D)', 'Kallman (D)', 'Mack (D)', 'Mendes (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Requires that all peace officers use body cameras with certain specified limited exceptions, subjects the peace officer to discipline for wrongful failure to use the camera, specifies circumstances when camera recordings shall be released, specifies and restrict the use of force by peace officers and provide for various reporting requirements.

title: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights
author: ['Mack (D)', 'Bell (D)', 'Acosta (D)']
summary: Repeals the Law Enforcement Officers Bill of Rights, specified chapters of the General Laws, in its entirety.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Bill of Rights
author: ['Bennett (D)']
summary: Would amend the law enforcement officers' bill of rights to require that a person wishing to serve as a third member of a hearing committee attend training established by the Rhode Island Police Chiefs Association before being eligible for appointment and would amend the suspension period for minor violations and the appeals procedure. This act would take effect upon passage.

title: Police Officers Commission Standards and Training
author: ['Bennett (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Oversight', ' Standards']
summary: Would require the commission on standards and training to provide training and instructions for police officers and trainees in order to more accurately identify complaints involving persons with cognitive or communication-related disabilities and to develop law enforcement responses to such emergencies, including training for police detectives investigating such complaints. This act would take effect upon passage.

title: Municipal Police Arbitration
author: ['Bennett (D)']
summary: Extends provisions of an existing collective bargaining agreement for municipal police arbitration purposes until a successor agreement is reached or an interest arbitration award is rendered.

title: State Police Diversity
status: Pending - House State Government and Elections Committee
author: ['Williams (D)', 'Wilkinson (D)', 'Alzate (D)', 'Giraldo (D)', 'Batista (D)']
summary: Requires that at least two in every five recruits to the Rhode Island State Police Training Academy be a person of color and at least two in every five new appointments to the Rhode Island state police be a person of color, requires the superintendent to conduct a vigorous effort to recruit persons of color to the Rhode Island state police training academy.

title: Electronic Information and Data Privacy Act
author: ['Place (R)', 'Newberry (R)', 'Filippi (I)', 'Roberts (R)', 'Quattrocchi (R)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to obtain search warrants for electronic information, data, location information and other identifying information of subscribers and customers, except in specified circumstances.

title: State Affairs and Government State Police
author: ['Williams (D)', 'Wilkinson (D)', 'Alzate (D)', 'Batista (D)', 'Morales (D)']
summary: Prohibits more than two members of the state police to be from the same family whether by blood, adoption or marriage.

title: Police Cognitive and Communication Disability Training
author: ['Cortvriend (D)', 'Bennett (D)', 'Hull (D)', 'Tanzi (D)', 'Casey (D)', 'Craven (D)', 'Fogarty (D)', 'Cassar (D)', 'Hawkins (D)', 'Noret (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Oversight', ' Standards']
summary: Requires the police officers commission on standards and training to provide training and instructions for police officers and trainees in order to more accurately identify complaints involving persons with cognitive or communication-related disabilities and to develop law enforcement responses to such emergencies, including training for police investigating such complaints.

title: Public Records Access
status: Pending - House State Government and Elections Committee
author: ['Bennett (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Decertification']
summary: Exempts the city or town of residence for city, town and state police officers from the definition of a public record and would prohibit the release of the same.

title: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights
author: ['Noret (D)', 'Hull (D)']
summary: Increases the number of committee members in a law enforcement officers' bill of rights hearing, mandates that any hearing be commenced within a certain time of the selection of the committee, allows for summary punishment of suspension, mandates that any officer charged with a felony or imprisoned on a misdemeanor have their pay suspended while the case is pending.

title: Traffic Stop and Search Data Collection
author: ['Ajello (D)', 'Williams (D)', 'Tanzi (D)', 'Craven (D)', 'Knight (D)', 'Ranglin-Vassell (D)', 'Cassar (D)', 'Kislak (D)', 'Speakman (D)', 'Morales (D)']
summary: Requires data collection and a study of traffic stops and searches to determine whether racial disparities in stops and searches exist, provides that the data acquired may be used in civil or criminal proceedings in accordance with the rules of procedure, requires the appointment of a community review board.

title: Department of Public Safety
author: ['Knight (D)', 'Filippi (I)', 'Henries (D)']
summary: Authorizes the department of public safety to provide for the retention and storage of body camera footage of all cities and towns where body cameras are in use by municipal police officers.

title: Developmental Disability Incident Police Training
status: Pending - House Health and Human Services Committee
author: ['Lombardi (D)']
summary: Requires mandatory training standards for police officers and trainees, in identifying, responding, and handling all incidents involving any person with a developmental disability.

title: Criminal Offenses Weapons
author: ['Noret (D)', 'Corvese (D)', 'Amore (D)', 'Casey (D)', 'Craven (D)', 'Lombardi (D)', 'Solomon (D)', 'Casimiro (D)', 'Wilkinson (D)', 'Lima S (D)']
summary: Increases the number of minimum rounds fired during the qualification and training of police officers.

title: Police Officers Weapons Qualification Mandate
author: ['Noret (D)', 'Corvese (D)', 'Fellela (D)', 'Casey (D)', 'Casimiro (D)', 'Knight (D)', 'Wilkinson (D)', 'Baginski (D)']
summary: Mandates that police officers qualify in the use of firearms at a specified rate.

title: Police Officers Weapons Qualification Mandate
author: ['Noret (D)', 'Corvese (D)', 'Fellela (D)', 'Casey (D)', 'Casimiro (D)', 'Knight (D)', 'Wilkinson (D)', 'Baginski (D)']
summary: Mandates that police officers qualify in the use of firearms in both daylight and nighttime conditions two times per year and that correctional officers qualify every year instead of once every two years.

title: Rishod Gore Justice in Policing Act of 2021
author: ['Batista (D)', 'Williams (D)', 'Alzate (D)', 'Felix (D)', 'Morales (D)']
summary: Provides police reform by requiring body cameras and makes certain methods of restraint a felony such as chokeholds and using the foot as a weapon.

title: Criminal Offenses Sexual Assault
author: ['Henries (D)', 'Hull (D)', 'Kazarian (D)', 'Lombardi (D)', 'Cassar (D)', 'Batista (D)', 'Felix (D)']
summary: Establishes criteria for the criminal offense of sexual assault when the victim is in the custody of a peace officer, provides that a person convicted of custodial sexual assault would face imprisonment.

title: Police Officer Commission on Standards
author: ['Batista (D)']
summary: Requires all police officers in Rhode Island to be certified through the municipal police training academy and complete mandatory continuing education, creates a process in which the police may be decertified for failure to maintain proper certification.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Bill of Rights
author: ['Williams (D)', 'Ajello (D)', 'Alzate (D)', 'Kislak (D)', 'Giraldo (D)', 'Batista (D)', 'Biah (D)', 'Henries (D)', 'McGaw (D)', 'Morales (D)']
summary: Amends the law enforcement officers bill of rights to provide greater accountability in the disciplinary process over law enforcement.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Accountability
author: ['Williams (D)', 'Ajello (D)', 'Alzate (D)', 'Kislak (D)', 'Giraldo (D)', 'Batista (D)', 'Biah (D)', 'Henries (D)', 'McGaw (D)', 'Morales (D)']
summary: Amends the law enforcement officers bill of rights, provides greater accountability in the disciplinary process over law enforcement officers, provides that upon a finding that a law enforcement officer has violated a law or department of rule or regulation, the chief of police may impose discipline up to and including termination of employment, provides that the police officer may appeal the chief's decision to a hearing committee, provides that the committee may affirm, reverse, or modify the decision.

title: Law Enforcement Task Force
author: ['Metts (D)']
summary: Creates a special legislative study task force whose purpose it would be to study and provide recommendations on policies pertaining to the Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Bill of Rights
author: ['Williams (D)']
summary: Amends the Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights to provide greater accountability in the disciplinary process over law enforcement.

title: Municipal Police Educational Requirements
author: ['Williams (D)']
summary: Prohibits an educational requirement beyond high school graduation for attendance at the Municipal Police Training School or for appointment as a municipal police officer.

title: Police Worn Body Cameras
author: ['Millea (D)']
summary: Requires all peace officers with arrest powers in the state to wear and activate body cameras during any car stop, search, arrest or during any interaction with any civilian or member of the public, provides that any officer engaged in undercover police work shall not be required to wear a body camera, establishes protocols for the retention and destruction of body camera footage, establishes penalties for failure to comply with this chapter.

title: Mounted Video Audio Surveillance Cameras
author: ['Williams (D)']
summary: Establishes a central command video/audio surveillance center administered by the state police, provides funding by use of a portion of E-911 funds.

title: Candidates Qualifications
author: ['Hutto C (D)']
