summary: Relates to candidates' qualifications, provides that a candidate for sheriff and a candidate for coroner may be certified by a political party or authority to which a petition is submitted if the candidate submits a sworn fully completed affidavit, relates to certification of candidates, provides that a candidate for sheriff and a candidate for coroner may be certified by a political party or authority to which a petition is submitted if the candidate submits a sworn fully completed affidavit.

title: Interrogation and Questioning Recording Evidence
author: ['Malloy (D)']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Technology', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to law enforcement and public safety, provides that certain statements made during questioning or interrogation must be audio or video recorded, provides that a court must instruct a jury that it may draw an adverse inference for a law enforcement officer who fails to record a statement, provides the circumstances in which a person's statement may be used for impeachment purposes, provides the circumstances in which a statement obtained in another state or by the federal government is admissible.

title: Officer Involved Deaths Investigation Requirements
author: ['Malloy (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement and public safety, provides that each law enforcement agency shall have a written policy regarding the investigation of officer-involved deaths, provides for the contents of the policy, provides for investigations, provides for reports, provides for the release of a report if prosecution is not pursued, provides for notices of victim's rights, defines necessary terms.

title: Penalty for Hindering a Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Malloy (D)']
summary: Relates to the penalty for hindering a law enforcement officer or rescuing a prisoner, provides that a person who hinders a law enforcement officer is guilty of a misdemeanor, provides that an officer shall not interfere with a person photographing or recording an officer in certain circumstances, relates to opposing, resisting, or assaulting a law enforcement officer serving process, makes conforming changes.

title: Workers Compensation
author: ['Malloy (D)']
summary: Relates to injury and personal injury in workers' compensation, provides that a limitation on stress, mental injuries, and mental illness for workers' compensation does not apply to a first responder diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder, defines necessary terms.

title: Study Committee on Racial Profiling
author: ['Malloy (D)']
summary: (Concurrent Resolution) Creates the study committee on racial profiling to review law enforcement policies, practices, and procedures regarding racial profiling and make a report of recommendations to the general assembly regarding proposed changes to the Laws regarding such policies, practices, and procedures.

title: SC Leads Act
author: ['Massey (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Enacts the SC Leads Act, relates to the law enforcement training council and criminal justice academy, provides that the law enforcement training council shall establish required standards for all law enforcement agencies, provides that the council shall have the authority to take punitive action against any law enforcement agency that refuses to implement and enforce compliance with these standards, provides a penalty for such a failure.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Certification Requirement
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Relates to the certification requirement for law enforcement officers, requires law enforcement officers to complete an approved field training program, provides that a law enforcement officer who is not certified shall only perform his duties as a law enforcement officer under certain circumstances and while accompanied by a certified law enforcement officer.

title: Law Enforcement Training Council
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Relates to the law enforcement training council and criminal justice academy, provides for a model training program for newly appointed chiefs of police, revisions to the program, and the time period to complete the program, provides that the training program does not apply to duly elected sheriffs.

title: Misconduct Allegations
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Relates to adjudications of allegations of misconduct, provides that misconduct also means willfully failing to intervene when observing another law enforcement officer not complying with the standards established by the law enforcement training council, provides that a law enforcement agency that has made a report shall fully cooperate with any investigation by the council to include mandatory attendance by a representative of the agency knowledgeable of the circumstances surrounding the allegation.

title: Offenses Against Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Hembree (R)']
summary: Relates to offenses against the person, provides for enhanced penalties if an offense is committed against a law enforcement officer.

title: Law Enforcement and Public Safety
author: ['Kimpson (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Oversight', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Relates to law enforcement and public safety, prohibits the deletion or destruction of data from a body worn camera with the intent to alter or influence a criminal action, criminal investigation, internal police investigation, civil action, or potential civil action if notice is provided by the adverse party, or if litigation is reasonably anticipated, provides penalties, provides exemptions, relates to policies and procedures for the use of body worn cameras.

title: Admittance to Mental Health Facility
author: ['Kimpson (D)']
summary: Relates to circumstances under which a person may be admitted to a public or private hospital, mental health clinic, or mental health facility for emergency admission, provides for the extension of a certification by a physician during a natural disaster or life threatening conditions, relates to the custody and transport of a person who is believed to have a mental illness and is requiring immediate care.

title: Certification as a Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to evidence of good character concerning certification as a law enforcement officer, provides that favorable results resulting from a review of the central registry of police misconduct are required to make a determination of good character, relates to the law enforcement training council and criminal justice academy, provides that the law enforcement training council shall operate and maintain the central registry of police misconduct.

title: Law Enforcement Assistance Programs
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to the South Carolina Law Enforcement Assistance Program's provision of counseling services and other support services, requires the South Carolina Law Enforcement Division to disclose to an officer's employing agency information that identifies whether counseling services have been provided, whether future counseling is recommended.

title: Law Enforcement Assistance Programs
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to the South Carolina law enforcement assistance program's provision of counseling services and other support services, requires the South Carolina Law Enforcement Division to disclose to an officer's employing agency information that identifies whether counseling services have been provided, whether future counseling is recommended, and any additional relevant information.

title: Renewal of Law Enforcement Officer's Certificate
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to the renewal of a law enforcement officer's certificate, requires the completion of an eight-hour general training continuing law enforcement education program as a condition for renewal.

title: Police Misconduct Investigations
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to extensions for police misconduct investigations, provides that parties may agree to an extension, provides that the director of the South Carolina Law Enforcement Division may grant an extension, provides that an extension must be for a specified time period, relates to reporting findings of allegations of excessive force to the South Carolina Criminal Justice Academy.

title: Officer Misconduct
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to the definition of misconduct, provides that it is misconduct for an officer to willfully provide a false, misleading, incomplete, deceitful, or incorrect statement on an affidavit for the purpose of procuring a warrant, or for an officer to fail to report witnessing or having knowledge of another officer who willfully provided a false, misleading, incomplete, deceitful, or incorrect statement on an affidavit for the purpose of procuring a warrant.

title: Injury and Personal Injury in Workers' Compensation
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to injury and personal injury in workers' compensation, provides that a limitation on stress, mental injuries, and mental illness for workers' compensation does not apply to a first responder diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder, defines necessary terms.

title: Sale of Property Seized By Law Enforcement Agencies
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to the sale of property seized by law enforcement agencies, provides that a law enforcement agency that seized property and law enforcement officers that work for the law enforcement agency may not purchase any of the property at a sale.

title: Data Recorded on a Body Worn Camera
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to data recorded on a body-worn camera being exempt from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act, provides that recordings of an incident involving a loss of life are subject to the Freedom of Information Act beginning thirty days after the incident.

title: Transparency in Justice Act
author: ['McLeod (D)']
summary: Enacts the transparency in justice act, relates to the release of the name, identity, or picture of a child under the jurisdiction of the family court, permits the release of the identity of a child under the jurisdiction of the court to a newspaper, radio, or television station if the child is alleged to have communicated a threat of mass violence by means of a video, audio, or internet-based social media communication to two or more persons.

title: Law Enforcement Mental Health Evaluations
author: ['McLeod (D)']
summary: Provides that all law enforcement officers must undergo a mental health evaluation that must include an assessment of implicit bias before they can become certified and periodically after they become certified and to provide the evaluation must be conducted under the direction of the law enforcement training council.

title: Failure to Stop a Motor Vehicle When Signaled
author: ['Rice (R)']
summary: Relates to the offense of failure to stop a motor vehicle when signaled by a law enforcement vehicle, provides a penalty when a vehicle leads an officer on a high-speed pursuit which has been video recorded.

title: Injury and Personal Injury in Workers Compensation
author: ['Gustafson (R)']
summary: Relates to injury and personal injury in workers' compensation, provides that a limitation on stress, mental injuries, and mental illness for workers' compensation does not apply to a first responder diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder, defines necessary terms.

title: Advanced State Constables
author: ['Alexander Th (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement and public safety, provides for advanced state constables, their duties, and related provisions.

title: Vehicle Registration Medical Condition Information
author: ['Fanning (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues']
summary: Provides the Department of Motor Vehicles may add a notation to a private passenger carrying motor vehicle registration to indicate the vehicle owner or an occupant of the vehicle suffers from certain medical conditions, provides the Criminal Justice Academy shall offer courses to train law enforcement officers on handling situations that may arise from the enforcement of this provision.

title: Motor Vehicle Traffic Stop
status: Pending - House Education and Public Works Committee
author: ['Govan (D)']
summary: Provides that during a motor vehicle traffic stop, the driver and passengers in a motor vehicle must disclose to the law enforcement officer the existence of all firearms located in the motor vehicle.

title: Private Passenger Carrying Motor Vehicle Registration
author: ['Garvin (D)', 'Govan (D)', 'Jefferson (D)', 'Williams R (D)', 'King (D)', 'Rivers M (D)', 'Matthews (D)', 'Williams (D)', 'Johnson J (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues']
summary: Provides the Department of Motor Vehicles may add a notation to a private passenger-carrying motor vehicle registration to indicate the vehicle owner or an occupant of the vehicle suffers from certain medical conditions and to provide the criminal justice academy shall offer courses to train law enforcement officers on handling situations that may arise from the enforcement of this provision.

title: Injection of Ketamine Into Criminal Suspect
author: ['Govan (D)', 'Henegan (D)']
summary: Provides it is unlawful for a law enforcement officer or paramedic to inject ketamine into a criminal suspect as a means to incapacitate him and provide a penalty.

title: Certified Law Enforcement Officer Diversity Training
author: ['King (D)']
summary: Provides that a certified law enforcement officer annually must complete continuing law enforcement education credits in diversity training.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Mental Health Evaluations
author: ['King (D)', 'Johnson J (D)']
summary: Provides that all law enforcement officers must undergo a mental health evaluation before they can become certified or recertified and to provide that the evaluation must be conducted under the direction of the law enforcement training council.

title: Law Enforcement Integrity Act
author: ['McKnight (D)', 'Henegan (D)', 'Johnson J (D)']
summary: Enacts the law enforcement integrity act, requires all law enforcement agencies provide their officers body-worn cameras and provide when they or dash cameras must be activated, provides the circumstances when failure to activate a body-worn or dash camera is unlawful, provides for the retention and release of body-worn camera recordings, provides the state law enforcement division shall issue an annual report containing information regarding law enforcement officer conduct.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Certification
author: ['Moss D (R)', 'Hixon (R)', 'Wooten (R)', 'McGarry (R)']
summary: Relates to the certification of a law enforcement officer employed or appointed by a public law enforcement agency, provides a noncertified law enforcement officer only shall perform his duties as a law enforcement officer while accompanied by a certified law enforcement officer, makes a technical change.

title: Procedures for Executing a Warrant
author: ['Rutherford (D)']
summary: Provides procedures for executing a warrant, penalties for violating these procedures, and a civil remedy for a person aggrieved for a violation of these procedures, relates to the powers and duties of the South Carolina Law Enforcement Training Council, authorizes the council to establish a course to train law enforcement officers on aspects of executing warrants and minimum standards for certification and recertification of law enforcement officers as eligible to conduct the execution of warrants.

title: Failure To Stop a Motor Vehicle
author: ['Collins (R)', 'Caskey (R)', 'Pendarvis (D)']
summary: Relates to failure to stop a motor vehicle when signaled by a law enforcement vehicle, provides a driver proceeding at or below the posted speed limit to a reasonable location and stops or to a well-lit location and stops while engaging his emergency lights are mitigating circumstances to failing to stop when signaled by a law enforcement vehicle.

title: Sex Offender Registry
author: ['Bryant (R)']
summary: Relates to the state's sex offender registry, devolves the responsibility for registering sex offenders from a county sheriff to the Department of Probation, Parole and Pardon Services.

title: Employer and Employee Contribution Rates
status: Pending - House Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Bannister (R)']
summary: Relates to employer and employee contribution rates under the South Carolina retirement system and the police officers retirement system respectively, provides that an employer, up to certain limits, may elect to pay all or a portion of required employee contributions during a fiscal year.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Excessive Restraint
author: ['Rutherford (D)']
summary: Prohibits a law enforcement officer from using excessive restraint, which includes, but is not limited to, the use of chokeholds and strangleholds when detaining a person or unreasonable force while making an arrest and to provide penalties for an officer who uses excessive restraint or force, grants the South Carolina Law Enforcement Division specific and exclusive jurisdiction and authority to conduct an investigation of all officer-involved uses of force.

title: Collection of Data About Driver of Motor Vehicle
status: Pending - House Education and Public Works Committee
author: ['Rutherford (D)']
summary: Relates to the collection of certain data about the driver of a motor vehicle by a law enforcement officer who stops a motor vehicle and does not issue a citation or make an arrest, and the development of a database containing the information collected by the officer, provides this provision applies also to a motor vehicle stop where an officer issues a citation or makes an arrest.

title: Fallen First Responder Survivor Advocate Position
status: Pending - House Ways and Means Committee
author: ['McCravy (R)', 'Huggins (R)', 'Yow (R)', 'Bennett (R)', 'Wooten (R)', 'Trantham (R)', 'Oremus (R)']
summary: Creates the fallen first responder survivor advocate position within the Department of Administration and provides for duties and responsibilities.

title: Interrogation of Children
author: ['Rutherford (D)', 'Henegan (D)', 'Johnson J (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to comply with certain requirements before interrogating a child who has been taken into custody for violating a criminal law or ordinance, and for other purposes.

title: Workers' Compensation for COVID-19
status: Pending - House Labor, Commerce and Industry Committee
author: ['Fry (R)', 'Henegan (D)', 'Johnson J (D)']
summary: Defines first responder, health care provider, correctional officer, and isolate or isolation, establishes a presumption that a first responder, health care provider, or correctional officer contracting COVID-19 is entitled to workers' compensation benefits as an occupational disease, provides temporary total disability benefits for first responders, health care providers, and correctional officers required to isolate due to COVID-19 if certain conditions are met.

title: Office of Freedom of Information Act
author: ['Taylor B (R)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Technology', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Creates the Office of Freedom of Information Act review within the administrative law court, provides related general functions, powers, and duties of the office and the court, among other things, provides applicable procedures, exempts data from video or audio recordings made by law enforcement vehicle mounted recording devices or dashboard cameras, relates to equitable remedies available to the general public to enforce provisions of the freedom of information act.

title: Vacancies in the Office of Sheriff
author: ['Gilliam (R)']
summary: Relates to vacancies in the office of sheriff, provides that when the governor has appointed an interim sheriff who then runs unsuccessfully for sheriff in the ensuing primary, primary runoff, special election, or general election, the governor may, with the advice and consent of that county's legislative delegation, declare the office vacant, remove the interim appointee from office, and appoint the sheriff-elect to fill the remainder of the original unexpired term.

title: Assault and Battery Offenses
author: ['Pope (R)']
summary: Relates to assault and battery offenses, adds that assault and battery of a high and aggravated nature occurs when a person injures a federal, state, or local law enforcement officer or corrections officer, a firefighter, or an emergency medical services (EMS) worker in the discharge of or because of their official duties.

title: Police Brutality Citizens Review Committee
author: ['King (D)', 'Johnson J (D)']
summary: Creates a police brutality citizens review committee in every county to investigate instances of alleged police brutality and publish a report, designates the evidence available for the committee's review, provides for the composition of the committee, provides for the filling of vacancies on the committee.

title: Personal Injury in Workers Compensation
status: Pending - House Labor, Commerce and Industry Committee
author: ['Pope (R)']
summary: Relates to the definitions of injury and personal injury in workers' compensation, exempts injuries sustained by law enforcement in the line of duty from certain limitations on claims for injury caused by stress, mental injury, or mental illness.

title: Citizen and Taxpayer Protection
author: ['Burns (R)']
summary: Enacts the Citizen and Taxpayer Protection Act, declares that a public officer ordering law enforcement to prohibit enforcement provisions of the citizen and taxpayer protection act is guilty of misconduct in office, prohibits camping on state owned land that is not designated for camping, designates an assault on a first responder as a separate crime, prohibits the unlawful obstruction of public highways and roads, relates to assault and battery by a mob.

title: Sheriff Election
author: ['Thigpen (D)', 'Caskey (R)']
summary: Provides a procedure by which the sheriff may be elected in a nonpartisan election.

title: Data From a Body Worn Camera
author: ['Thigpen (D)', 'Johnson J (D)']
summary: Prohibits the destruction or deletion of data from a body-worn camera with the intent to alter or influence a criminal action, criminal investigation, internal police investigation, civil action, or potential civil action if notice is provided by the adverse party, or if litigation is reasonably anticipated, provides penalties, provides exemptions, relates to policies and procedures for the use of body-worn cameras, provides for the circumstances in which the policies and procedures.

title: Law Enforcement Officers HALO Act
author: ['Thigpen (D)']
topics: ['Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Enacts the law enforcement officers helping alleviate lawful obstruction - HALO Act provides that a bystander shall remain at least twelve feet away from a law enforcement officer when the officer is apprehending, arresting, searching, or consulting an individual when the bystander is recording the actions of the officer, provides a penalty.

title: Red Flags Act
author: ['Thigpen (D)']
summary: Enacts the Red Flags Act, provides for the authority of law enforcement officers to seize a person's firearms and ammunition if the person poses a risk of imminent personal injury to himself or other individuals, establishes criteria addressing application for and issuance of a warrant, requires the probate court to hold a hearing within seven days of execution of the warrant to determine whether the firearms and ammunition may be returned to the person.

title: Body Camera Data Protections
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Prohibits the deletion or destruction of data from a body worn camera with the intent to alter or influence a criminal action, criminal investigation, internal police investigation, civil action, or potential civil action if notice is provided by the adverse party, or if litigation is reasonably anticipated, provides penalties, provides exemptions, relates to policies and procedures for the use of body worn cameras.

title: Law Enforcement Perjury
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to the crime of perjury, provides the circumstances upon which a law enforcement officer is guilty of perjury and provide a penalty.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Hiring and Recruitment Practices
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Provides a law enforcement agency that serves a community with a relatively high concentration of minority residents shall make efforts to recruit, retain, and promote minority law enforcement officers so that the racial and ethnic diversity of the agency is representative of the community.

title: Law Enforcement Civilian Review Board
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Provides a local governmental body shall establish a law enforcement civilian review board and provide for its responsibilities.

title: Law Enforcement Ketamine Use
author: ['Govan (D)']
summary: Provides it is unlawful for a law enforcement officer or paramedic to inject ketamine into a criminal suspect as a means to incapacitate him.

title: Law Enforcement Racial Sensitivity Education
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Provides certain law enforcement officers shall complete continuing law enforcement education credits in racial sensitivity over a three year recertification period.

title: Law Enforcement Certificates Requirements
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Relates to the issuance of certificates and other appropriate indicia of compliance and qualification to law enforcement officers and other persons by the law enforcement training council, provides the director may accept for training as a law enforcement officer an applicant who has obtained an associate degree or is enrolled in an associate degree program.

title: Law Enforcement Certificates Requirements
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Relates to the issuance of certificates and other appropriate indicia of compliance and qualification to law enforcement officers and other persons by the law enforcement training council, provides law enforcement agencies having an officer as a candidate for certification shall submit to the director a certificate of a licensed psychiatrist that the candidate recently has undergone a complete psychiatric examination and its results, and evidence satisfactory to the director.

title: Law Enforcement Certification Requirement
author: ['Wooten (R)']
summary: Enacts the Police and Communities Together (PACT) Act, relates to the certification requirement for law enforcement officers, requires law enforcement officers complete an approved field training program, provides that a law enforcement officer who is not certified shall perform only his duties as a law enforcement officer under certain circumstances and while accompanied by a certified law enforcement officer.

title: Law Enforcement Retirement Forfeiture
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Provides that if a law enforcement officer who becomes a member of any state retirement system after the effective date of this act is convicted of, pleads guilty or nolo contendere to a felony related to the person's employment, then the person forfeits all retirement benefits.

title: Law Enforcement Misconduct Standards
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Provides the law enforcement training council shall develop a minimum set of standards that a state or local law enforcement agency must follow when establishing and implementing a mediation program as an alternate method of resolving law enforcement misconduct complaints.

title: Police Misconduct Central Registry
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification']
summary: Provides the Law Enforcement Training Council shall operate and maintain the central registry of police misconduct, provides for the information that must be maintained on the registry, provides for the circumstances under which information must be included on the registry, provides that the state's law enforcement agencies shall have access to the information on the registry, provides which information is confidential and which information is subject to public disclosure.

title: Law Enforcement Misconduct Investigations
author: ['Henderson-Myers (D)']
summary: Provides a law enforcement officer who is the subject of a law enforcement officer misconduct investigation is prohibited from retiring from his law enforcement agency during the course of the investigation.

title: Law Enforcement Cars Recordings
status: Pending - House Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Wooten (R)', 'McGarry (R)']
summary: Relates to the video recording of an incident site and breath test site, relates to a violation of laws that prohibit driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or another substance, deletes the provision that makes the Department of Public Safety responsible for monitoring law enforcement vehicles used for traffic enforcement, establishes an in-car-video cameras fund within the department.

title: Law Enforcement Chemical Agents Use on Minors
author: ['McKnight (D)']
summary: Provides it is unlawful for a law enforcement officer to use any chemical agent to incapacitate certain minors.

title: Ethical Policing Transparency and Accountability
author: ['Cobb-Hunter (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Enacts the Ethical Policing Transparency and Accountability Act, defines certain terms, provides for a framework to institutionalize high standards for policing practices and conduct by the creation of citizen review boards and their duties, provides for the use of standard forms to record law enforcement officer complaints, provides a law enforcement agency shall record all instances of disciplinary action against a law enforcement officer.

title: Body Worn Cameras Data Requests
author: ['Johnson J (D)']
summary: Relates to body worn cameras, provides a person who is a subject in data recorded by a body worn camera may request and must receive the data without pursuing an action under the rules of criminal procedure or civil procedure, or obtaining a court order.

title: Law Enforcement Body Cameras
author: ['Stavrinakis (D)']
summary: Provides certain terms and their definitions, provides a law enforcement agency or officer shall not install, activate, or use a biometric surveillance system in connection with an officer's camera or data collected by an officer's camera, provides a penalty for a violation of this section.

title: Workers Compensation Law Enforcement Exemptions
author: ['Pope (R)', 'Hixon (R)', 'Wheeler (D)', 'Wooten (R)']
summary: Relates to the definitions of injury and personal injury in workers' compensation, exempts injuries sustained by law enforcement in the line of duty from certain limitations on claims for injury caused by stress, mental injury, or mental illness.

title: Police Misconduct Determinations and Registry
author: ['Bright Matthews (D)']
summary: Relates to evidence of good character concerning certification as a law enforcement officer, provides that favorable results of a review of the central registry of police misconduct is required to make a determination of good character, relates to the Law Enforcement Training Council and Criminal Justice Academy, provides that the Law Enforcement Training Council shall operate and maintain the central registry of police misconduct.

title: Law Enforcement Standards
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Enacts the SC LEADS Act, relates to the Law Enforcement Training Council and Criminal Justice Academy, provides that the Law Enforcement Training Council shall establish required standards for all law enforcement agencies, provides that the Council shall have the authority to take punitive action against any law enforcement agency that refuses to implement and enforce compliance with these standards, provides a penalty for such a failure.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Certification Requirements
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Relates to the certification requirement for law enforcement officers, requires law enforcement officers to complete an approved field training program, provides that a law enforcement officer who is not certified shall only perform his duties as a law enforcement officer under certain circumstances and while accompanied by a certified law enforcement officer.

title: Chiefs of Police Training Program
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Relates to the law enforcement training council and criminal justice academy, provides for a model training program for newly appointed Chiefs of Police, provides for revisions to the program and the time period to complete the program, provides that the training program does not apply to duly elected Sheriffs.

title: Law Enforcement Misconduct Allegations
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Relates to adjudications of allegations of law enforcement misconduct, provides that misconduct also means willfully failing to intervene when observing another law enforcement officer not complying with the standards established by the Law Enforcement Training Council, provides that a law enforcement agency that has made a report shall fully cooperate with any investigation by the Council.

title: CARES Funds
summary: Authorizes the expenditure of federal funds disbursed to the state in the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act, specifies the manner in which the funds may be expended.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Standards Commission
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Revises the membership of the Law Enforcement Officers Standards Commission.

title: Sheriff's Compensation
author: ['Schoenbeck (R)']
summary: Corrects a cross-reference relating to sheriff's compensation.

title: Law Enforcement Officers Training Requirements Reform
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Reforms training requirements for law enforcement officers.

title: First Responder Organizations Mental Health Coverage
author: ['Milstead (R)']
summary: Makes an appropriation to contract for mental health insurance for certain first responder organizations and to declare an emergency.

title: First Responder Organizations Critical Incident Stress
author: ['Milstead (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Makes an appropriation for and the establishment of peer support and critical incident stress management training for first responder organizations, declares an emergency.

title: Mental Health of First Responders Task Force Study
author: ['Cwach (D)']
summary: Encourages the Executive Board of the Legislature to reauthorize the Mental Health of First Responders Task Force interim legislative study.

title: Confirmation of Appointment
author: ['Bell (R)']
summary: Relates to Lowell Russell, concerns Tennessee Peace Officers Standards and Training (POST) Commission.

title: Drone Use Without a Search Warrant
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Authorizes law enforcement agencies to use a drone without a search warrant to provide or enhance security for a public event, including a concert, athletic event, festival, protest, or other outdoor event, extends the time within which law enforcement must determine whether evidence collected by a drone may be retained or deleted.

title: Local General Government
author: ['Kelsey (R)', 'Watson B (R)', 'Rose (R)']
summary: Prohibits a local government from having residency requirements as a condition of employment for a first responder.

title: Precious Cargo Act
author: ['Ogles (R)']
summary: Enacts the Precious Cargo Act, authorizes commissioner of revenue to adopt policies and procedures to update the Tennessee vehicle title and registration system database to account for persons who need assistance with expressive language or communicating needs to a first responder or law enforcement officer.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Faison (R)']
summary: Prohibits law enforcement from entering private property for the purpose of engaging in surveillance or setting up surveillance equipment to search for and collect evidence or obtain information or other data unless the officer has obtained a search warrant or a judicially recognized exception to the warrant requirement exists.

title: Spencer Bristol Act
author: ['Lamberth (R)', 'Garrett (R)']
summary: Enacts the Spencer Bristol Act, which increases the penalty for evading arrest that results in the serious bodily injury of a law enforcement officer to a Class C felony and evading arrest that results in the death of a law enforcement officer to a Class A felony.

title: Local General Government
author: ['Moon (R)', 'White M (R)', 'Sparks (R)', 'Vaughan (R)', 'Leatherwood (R)', 'Wright (R)', 'Gillespie (R)']
summary: Prohibits a local government from having residency requirements as a condition of employment for a first responder.

title: Precious Cargo Act
author: ['Powers (R)']
summary: Enacts the 2021 Precious Cargo Act, authorizes commissioner of revenue to adopt policies and procedures to update the State vehicle title and registration system database to account for persons who need assistance with expressive language or communicating needs to a first responder or law enforcement officer.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Haile (R)']
summary: Enacts the Spencer Bristol Act, which increases the penalty for evading arrest that results in the serious bodily injury of a law enforcement officer to a Class C felony and evading arrest that results in the death of a law enforcement officer to a Class A felony.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Moody (R)']
summary: Expands the type of equipment for which law enforcement agencies may exchange confiscated weapons to include any equipment suitable for use for legitimate law enforcement purposes.

title: Defense Doctrine
author: ['Bowling (R)']
summary: Enacts the 2021 Defense Doctrine, which adds imminent danger of grave sexual abuse as a justification for the use of deadly force in self defense and to defenses of duress and use of deadly force by law enforcement officer, defines grave sexual abuse as rape, aggravated rape, rape of a child, or aggravated rape of a child.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer to notify the Department of Children's Services when a person under 18 years of age is taken into custody for suspicion of committing the offense of prostitution.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Rose (R)']
summary: Expands the type of equipment for which law enforcement agencies may exchange confiscated weapons to include any equipment suitable for use for legitimate law enforcement purposes.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Howell (R)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to undergo training on the proper testing procedures for use in investigating cases of suspected driving under the influence as part of the annual in service training required for certifications that occur on or after a specified date.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Littleton (R)', 'Carter (R)', 'Moody (R)', 'Curcio (R)', 'Cepicky (R)', 'Eldridge R (R)', 'Garrett (R)', 'Rudder (R)', 'Gillespie (R)', 'Mannis (R)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer to notify the Department of Children's Services when a person under 18 years of age is taken into custody for suspicion of committing the offense of prostitution.

title: Alcoholic Beverages
author: ['Johnson C (R)']
summary: Extends from five to 10 days the amount of time a law enforcement officer has to file a written informational statement with the county court clerk after taking possession of illicit intoxicating liquors.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Hensley (R)']
summary: Increases the penalty for assault of a first responder from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class E felony.

title: Wildlife Resources Officers
author: ['Casada (R)']
summary: Prohibits wildlife resources officers from entering private property to install monitoring device without a search warrant, order for electronic surveillance, or written permission of the landowner.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Casada (R)']
summary: Requires that members of a community oversight board complete the local police force's citizen academy course within six months of beginning service on the board, removes authority from the board until all members have complied.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Massey (R)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to undergo training on the proper testing procedures for use in investigating cases of suspected driving under the influence as part of the annual in-service training required for certifications that occur on or after January 1, 2022.

title: Orders of Protection
author: ['Gilmore (D)']
summary: Allows a court to issue an extreme risk protection order upon a finding by clear and convincing evidence that a person poses a significant risk of harm to the person or others if allowed to possess or purchase a firearm, authorizes a law enforcement officer or family or household member to petition for such an order.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Rose (R)']
summary: Establishes a reward for information leading to the arrest of any person responsible for the shooting of a law enforcement officer in the line of duty, sets the reward at $10,000 if the officer is injured in the shooting or $20,000 if the officer is killed in the shooting.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Bell (R)']
summary: Requires that members of a community oversight board complete the local police force's citizen academy course within six months of beginning service on the board, removes authority from the board until all members have complied.

title: Public Safety Through Hiring Act
author: ['Campbell (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Decertification']
summary: Enacts the Public Safety Through Hiring Act, which prohibits law enforcement agencies from hiring a person as a police officer who was fired due to disciplinary infractions or while under investigation for misconduct in the line of duty, or who resigned or retired while under investigation for disciplinary infractions or misconduct in the line of duty.

title: Firearms and Ammunition
author: ['White M (R)']
summary: Clarifies that a law enforcement officer is not prohibited from carrying a firearm into certain locations regardless of whether the officer is on or off duty, clarifies that the exemption to the ban on weapons in parks and other similar places for a law enforcement officer applies regardless of whether the officer is on duty.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Haile (R)']
summary: Increases the punishment for assault committed against a first responder from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class E felony.

title: Alcoholic Beverages
status: Pending - Senate State & Local Government Committee
author: ['Briggs (R)']
summary: Extends from five to 10 days the amount of time a law enforcement officer has to file a written informational statement with the county court clerk after taking possession of illicit intoxicating liquors.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Moody (R)']
summary: Establishes a reward for information leading to the arrest of any person responsible for the shooting of a law enforcement officer in the line of duty, sets the reward at $10,000 if the officer is injured in the shooting or $20,000 if the officer is killed in the shooting.

title: Criminal Offenses
status: Pending - House Finance, Ways & Means Committee
author: ['Terry (R)', 'Gant (R)', 'Baum (R)']
summary: Increases the penalty for harassment if the person committed the offense because of the victim's employment as a first responder, defines first responder for the purposes of harassment.

title: Reconnect Grant Eligibility for Students
author: ['Hensley (R)']
summary: Creates Tennessee reconnect grant eligibility for students admitted to an eligible postsecondary institution and enrolled in a basic law enforcement training academy operated by the postsecondary institution.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Hodges (D)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer who conducts a search of a motor vehicle to report in person to a judge of the general sessions court within three days and provide certain statistical information, requires the clerk of the general sessions court to report the information to the administrative office of the courts, requires the administrative office of the courts to provide an annual report to the chairs of the appropriate committees of the general assembly.

title: Operational Expenses of the Sheriff Department
author: ['Moon (R)', 'Ragan (R)', 'Lamberth (R)', 'Howell (R)', 'Bricken (R)', 'Russell (R)']
summary: Prohibits a county governing body from reducing funding for the operational expenses of the sheriff's department.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Hakeem (D)', 'Miller (D)', 'Towns (D)', 'Shaw (D)', 'Parkinson (D)', 'Clemmons (D)', 'Thompson (D)', 'Chism (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to satisfactorily complete a diversity training program created by the peace officer standards and training commission by July 1, 2022, or within six months of the officer's date of employment.

title: Human Rights
author: ['Powers (R)']
summary: Expands the offense of civil rights intimidation to include a person who injures, threatens to injure, or damages the property of another due to the other's actual or perceived employment as a law enforcement officer or judge.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Russell (R)']
summary: Increases the punishment for assault committed against a first responder from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class E felony.

title: State Government
author: ['Hulsey (R)']
summary: Prohibits the governor or the chief executive officer of a local government from requiring a law enforcement agency or an officer thereof from enforcing executive orders that require private business entities to close, restrict the freedom to assemble peaceably, or restrict the freedom to travel.

title: Human Rights
author: ['Reedy (R)']
summary: Expands the offense of civil rights intimidation to include a person who injures, threatens to injure, or damages the property of another due to the other's actual or perceived employment as a law enforcement officer or judge.

title: State Government
status: Pending - Senate State & Local Government Committee
author: ['Pody (R)']
summary: Prohibits the Governor or the chief executive officer of a local government from requiring a law enforcement agency or an officer thereof from enforcing executive orders that require private business entities to close, restrict the freedom to assemble peaceably, or restrict the freedom to travel.

title: Criminal Procedure
author: ['Chism (D)']
summary: Prohibits a court from issuing or a law enforcement officer from serving a no knock search or arrest warrant, defines a no knock warrant as a warrant that specifically enables an officer to enter a structure without giving notice of the officer's authority or the purpose of the officer's presence.

title: Orders of Protection
author: ['Kyle (D)']
summary: Allows a court to issue an emergency protection order upon a finding that a person poses an imminent risk of harm to the person or others if allowed to purchase or possess a firearm, authorizes a family member, household member, intimate partner, or law enforcement officer to petition for such an order.

title: Law Enforcement Canine Unit Annual Report
author: ['Kyle (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to annually report statistics and policies regarding police canine units to the Peace Officers Standards and Training (POST) Commission, requires the POST Commission to develop and implement state guidelines for the training, care, and use of police canine units for law enforcement purposes.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Whitson (R)']
summary: States that a law enforcement officer meeting certain qualifications who makes an arrest outside of the law enforcement officer's jurisdiction has the same legal status and immunity from suit as a state or local law enforcement officer making an arrest within the state or local law enforcement officer's jurisdiction if certain circumstances are met.

title: No Knock Entry Search or Arrest Warrants
author: ['Gilmore (D)']
summary: Requires a complainant seeking a no-knock entry provision in a search warrant or an arrest warrant to have the facts supporting the warrant reviewed by the district attorney general prior to presenting any facts to a magistrate.

title: Public Safety Through Hiring Act
author: ['Dixie (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Decertification']
summary: Enacts the Public Safety Through Hiring Act, prohibits law enforcement agencies from hiring a person as a police officer who was fired due to disciplinary infractions or while under investigation for misconduct in the line of duty, or who resigned or retired while under investigation for disciplinary infractions or misconduct in the line of duty.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Watson B (R)']
summary: Requires each law enforcement agency to post the agency's written policy prohibiting racial profiling to the agency's website, if the agency maintains a website.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Kumar (R)']
summary: Increases the penalty for assault of a first responder from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class E felony.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['White (R)']
summary: Increases the penalty for harassment if the person committed the offense because of the victim's employment as a first responder, defines first responder for the purposes of harassment.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Pody (R)']
summary: Authorizes a law enforcement officer to charge a person with criminal trespass who resides with a person at least 65 years of age and makes a threat against the life, health, or safety of such person under certain circumstances.

title: Pensions and Retirement Benefits
status: Pending - Senate Select Committee on Calendar
author: ['Jackson (R)']
summary: Requires board of trustees for the Tennessee consolidated retirement system to prepare and submit a report to the council on pensions and insurance as to the number of members retired by the board of trustees on a disability retirement allowance and whose disability determination resulted from their service as law enforcement officers.

title: Criminal Procedure
author: ['Garrett (R)']
summary: Authorizes law enforcement officers, district attorneys general, and the attorney general to seek criminal process for the production of wire and electronic communications and transactional records pertaining to the communications, sets guidelines for the service of and compliance with the criminal process.

title: Retired Law Enforcement Firearm Carry
author: ['Niceley (R)']
summary: Deletes the requirement that a retired law enforcement officer submit to a criminal history records check in order to carry a firearm in the same manner as an active law enforcement officer under federal law.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Arrest Outside Jurisdiction
author: ['Rose (R)']
summary: States that a law enforcement officer meeting certain qualifications who makes an arrest outside of the law enforcement officer's jurisdiction has the same legal status and immunity from suit as a state or local law enforcement officer making an arrest within the state or local law enforcement officer's jurisdiction if certain circumstances are met.

title: Criminal Offenses
author: ['Thompson (D)', 'Hardaway (D)']
summary: Classifies the theft of a firearm from a law enforcement vehicle as a Class D felony, regardless of the value of the firearm.

title: Orders of Protection and Firearms
author: ['Johnson G (D)']
summary: Allows a court to issue an emergency protection order upon a finding that a person poses an imminent risk of harm to the person or others if allowed to purchase or possess a firearm, authorizes a family member, household member, intimate partner, or law enforcement officer to petition for such an order.

title: Racial Profiling Prevention Training Act
author: ['Chism (D)']
summary: Enacts the Racial Profiling Prevention Training Act.

title: Issuance of Citations to Children
author: ['Hensley (R)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer to make efforts to contact a parent, legal guardian, or legal custodian when issuing a citation to a child in lieu of continuing to keep the child in custody, changes the evidentiary requirement for a supervising authority who petitions a court to intervene when a child has violated the terms or conditions of the judicial diversion.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Stewart M (D)', 'Hardaway (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to report findings of excessive use of force by a law enforcement officer to the district attorney general, to be reviewed for possible criminal prosecution, requires the district attorney general to review 10 percent of all allegations of excessive force in each previous calendar year.

title: Search and Seizure
author: ['Hardaway (D)']
summary: Requires a complainant seeking a no-knock entry provision in a search warrant or an arrest warrant to have the facts supporting the warrant reviewed by the district attorney general prior to presenting any facts to a magistrate.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Hardaway (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to annually report statistics and policies regarding police canine units to the post commission, requires the post commission to develop and implement state guidelines for the training, care, and use of police canine units for law enforcement purposes.

title: Reconnect Grant Eligibility for Law Enforcement
author: ['Casada (R)']
summary: Creates Tennessee reconnect grant eligibility for students admitted to an eligible postsecondary institution and enrolled in a basic law enforcement training academy operated by the postsecondary institution.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Lynn (R)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, deletes the requirement that a retired law enforcement officer submit to a criminal history records check in order to carry a firearm in the same manner as an active law enforcement officer under federal law.

title: Madison County Sheriffs Civil Service Law of 2021
author: ['Todd (R)']
summary: Relates to all fulltime employees in the Madison County Sheriff's Office which are the classified service positions, creates civil service board, provides standards needed for the members of the board, provides duties and responsibilities.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Bell (R)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to develop certain policies regarding the use of force, prohibits magistrates from issuing no-knock warrants.

title: Operational Expenses of the Sheriff's Department
author: ['Swann (R)']
summary: Prohibits a county governing body from reducing funding for the operational expenses of the sheriff's department.

title: Law Enforcement
status: Pending - House Calendar and Rules Committee
author: ['Curcio (R)']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to Law Enforcement, requires law enforcement agencies to develop certain policies regarding the use of force, prohibits magistrates from issuing no-knock warrants.

title: Children and Custody
author: ['Haston (R)']
summary: Relates to Children, requires a law enforcement officer to make efforts to contact a parent, legal guardian, or legal custodian when issuing a citation to a child in lieu of continuing to keep the child in custody, changes the evidentiary requirement for a supervising authority who petitions a court to intervene when a child has violated the terms or conditions of the judicial diversion.

title: Health Insurance Benefits for First Responders
author: ['Johnson J (R)']
summary: Requires the state to reimburse a local government that provides health insurance benefits for first responders for the portion of health insurance premiums and benefits for which the local government is responsible if it provides for the surviving spouse and children of a first responder killed in the line of duty, and not Just the amount for which the local government is responsible under the health insurance policy.

title: Law Enforcement and Body Cameras
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to provide body cameras for each officer, requires reporting of incidents of use of force, officer resignations, stops by officers, and unannounced entries into residences, requires termination of employment of any officer convicted of or found civilly liable for certain acts, prohibits the use of chokeholds by officers.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer who conducts a search of a motor vehicle to report in person to a judge of the general sessions court within three days and provide certain statistical information, requires the clerk of the general sessions court to report the information to the administrative office of the courts, requires the administrative office of the courts to provide an annual report to the chairs of the appropriate committees of the general assembly.

title: Diversity Training Program
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers to satisfactorily complete a diversity training program created by the peace officer standards and training commission by July 1, 2022, or within six months of the officer's date of employment.

title: Public Safety Through Hiring Act
author: ['Akbari (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Decertification']
summary: Enacts the Public Safety Through Hiring Act to prohibit law enforcement agencies from hiring officers with a history of certain misconduct.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Changes from March 31 to March 1 the date by which the Tennessee bureau of investigation must provide to the commissioner of health and the general assembly a report on all law enforcement-related deaths that occurred in the prior calendar year.

title: Autism Spectrum Disorder
status: Pending - Senate Transportation and Safety Committee
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Requires commissioner of safety to design and make available to persons with autism spectrum disorder a blue envelope containing written information and guidance on ways to enhance effective communication between a law enforcement officer and a person with such disorder, and the person's driver license, registration, and insurance card.

title: Theft of a Firearm from a Law Enforcement Vehicle
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Classifies the theft of a firearm from a law enforcement vehicle as a Class D felony, regardless of the value of the firearm.

title: No Knock Search or Arrest Warrants
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Prohibits a court from issuing or a law enforcement officer from serving a no knock search or arrest warrant, defines a no knock warrant as a warrant that specifically enables an officer to enter a structure without giving notice of the officer's authority or the purpose of the officer's presence.

title: Traffic Safety
author: ['Towns (D)']
summary: Relates to Traffic Safety, requires commissioner of safety to design and make available to persons with autism spectrum disorder a blue envelope containing written information and guidance on ways to enhance effective communication between a law enforcement officer and a person with such disorder, and the person's driver license, registration, and insurance card.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Towns (D)']
summary: Relates to Law Enforcement, includes in the requirement that a law enforcement officer have good moral character, that the officer must not be a member of a hate group or terrorist organization, states that membership in a hate group or terrorist organization is sufficient grounds for termination of a law enforcement officer for lack of good moral character, defines hate group as an organization whose primary purpose is to promote animosity, hostility, and malice against a person or persons.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Akbari (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to report findings of excessive use of force by a law enforcement officer to the district attorney general, to be reviewed for possible criminal prosecution, requires the district attorney general to review 10 percent of all allegations of excessive force in each previous calendar year.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Akbari (D)']
summary: Includes in the requirement that a law enforcement officer have good moral character, that the officer must not be a member of a hate group or terrorist organization, states that membership in a hate group or terrorist organization is sufficient grounds for termination of a law enforcement officer for lack of good moral character.

title: Racial Profiling Prevention Training Act
author: ['Robinson (D)']
summary: Enacts the Racial Profiling Prevention Training Act.

title: Search and Seizure

title: Criminal Procedure
author: ['Bailey (R)']
summary: Authorizes law enforcement officers, district attorneys general, and the attorney general to seek criminal process for the production of wire and electronic communications and transactional records pertaining to the communications, sets guidelines for the service of and compliance with the criminal process.

title: Memorial Resolution
author: ['Hardaway (D)']
summary: Honors the memory of George Floyd of Minnesota.

title: Traffic Offense Citation Quotas
author: ['Roberts (R)']

summary: Requires law enforcement agencies to provide body cameras for each officer, requires reporting of incidents of use of force, officer resignations, stops by officers, and unannounced entries into residences, requires termination of employment of any officer convicted of or found civilly liable for certain acts, prohibits the use of chokeholds by officers.

title: Governmental Entity

summary: Prohibits a governmental entity from intentionally preventing or prohibiting law enforcement or fire and rescue services from accessing a specifically bounded area within the governmental entity's jurisdiction during a public demonstration, declares a governmental entity may be held liable for injury proximately caused by the governmental entity intentionally preventing or prohibiting law enforcement or fire and rescue services from accessing a specifically bounded area during a public demonstration.

title: Peaceful Demonstrations
author: ['Johnson J (R)']
summary: Revises certain criminal laws impacting peaceful demonstrations, authorizes the Attorney General to investigate and prosecute crimes when the victim is a state employee, state property was damaged, or the administration of state government was delayed as a result of the crime.

title: Governmental Entity
author: ['Ogles (R)']
summary: Prohibits a governmental entity from intentionally preventing or prohibiting law enforcement or fire and rescue services from accessing a specifically bounded area within the governmental entity's jurisdiction during a public demonstration, declares that a governmental entity may be held liable for injury proximately caused by the governmental entity intentionally preventing or prohibiting law enforcement or fire and rescue services from accessing a specifically bounded area during a public demonstration.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Dixie (D)']
summary: Requires law enforcement officers and agents to clearly identify themselves as officers or agents, as applicable, when arresting a person during a protest or demonstration.
