title: Discharge of a Firearm by a Peace Officer
author: ['Meza (D)']
summary: Relates to requiring law enforcement agencies to adopt a policy regarding the discharge of a firearm by a peace officer at or in the direction of a moving vehicle.

title: Establishment of the Texas Active Shooter Alert System
author: ['Landgraf (R)']
summary: Relates to establishment of the State Active Shooter Alert System.

title: Law Enforcement and Detainee Interactions
author: ['West (D)']
summary: Relates to interactions between law enforcement and individuals detained or arrested on suspicion of the commission of criminal offenses, witnesses to the commission of those offenses, and other members of the public, to peace officer liability for those interactions, and to the confinement, conviction, or release of detained or arrested individuals.

title: No Knock Warrant Prohibition
author: ['Miles (D)']
summary: Relates to a prohibition on the issuance of a warrant authorizing the use of a no-knock entry by a peace officer.

title: Civilian Complaint Review Boards
author: ['Thierry (D)']
summary: Relates to civilian complaint review boards in certain municipalities and counties.

title: Regarding Implicit Bias Peace Officers Training
author: ['Collier (D)']
summary: Relates to training for peace officers regarding implicit bias.

title: Retired Peace Officers Uniform Purchasing
author: ['VanDeaver (R)']
summary: Relates to the purchasing of a uniform by certain honorably retired peace officers.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Accreditation Grant Program
author: ['King P (R)']
summary: Relates to a law enforcement agency accreditation grant program.

title: Duties and Powers of Peace Officers
author: ['Rose (D)']
summary: Relates to the duties and powers of peace officers.

title: Use of Force Techniques
author: ['Sherman (D)']
summary: Relates to prohibiting the use of certain techniques when using force to make an arrest or search.

title: Notice to Adult Victims of Family Violence
author: ['Sherman (D)']
summary: Relates to the notice provided by peace officers to adult victims of family violence.

title: Prohibition of No Knock Warrant Entry
author: ['Wu (D)']
summary: Relates to a prohibition on the issuance of a warrant authorizing the use of a no-knock entry by a peace officer.

title: Peace Officers Duty to Display Name and Badge Number
author: ['Wu (D)']
summary: Relates to a peace officer's duty to display and provide the officer's name and identification number, creates a criminal offense.

title: title
author: author
summary: summary

title: Swift Appointment Modernization Act of 2021
author: ['Moylan (R)']
summary: Relates to modernizing a process which would allow for the streamlining in the recruitment and hiring of law enforcement officers, to be known as the Swift Appointment Modernization Act of 2021.

title: Post-Attraction, Retention, and Incentive Act of 2021
status: Pending - Senate Pub. Acc., Hum. Res., GU Build., H. Rev., Reg. Af., Pub. Lib., Tel., & Tech. Committee
author: ['Moylan (R)']
summary: Relates to authorizing the post commission to establish a standardized and uniformed law enforcement officer general force leadership structure tier and pay scale plan for peace officers, to be known as the Post-Attraction, Retention, and Incentive Act of 2021.

title: Police Rank System for Retirement
author: ['Matias Rosario (PNP)']
summary: Creates the Law to provide a decent retirement for members of the rank system of the police of Puerto Rico.

title: Motorcycle Profiling
author: ['Weiler (R)', 'Brooks (R)']
summary: Promotes awareness of motorcycle profiling, encourages collaboration and communication between the motorcycle community and law enforcement officials to prevent motorcycle profiling.

title: Law Enforcement Internal Investigation Requirements
author: ['Iwamoto (D)', 'Wilcox (R)']
summary: Adjusts requirements for law enforcement agencies to conduct internal investigations regarding law enforcement officers.

title: Death Resulting From Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Nelson (R)', 'Thatcher (R)']
summary: Requires the Chief Medical Examiner to investigate deaths resulting directly from the actions of a law enforcement officer, prohibits providing false information to the chief medical examiner, establishes a criminal penalty.

title: Mental Health Protections for First Responders
author: ['Kwan (D)', 'Mayne K (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Extends the Mental Health Protections for First Responders Workgroup.

title: K-9 Policy Requirements
author: ['Thatcher (R)', 'Pierucci (R)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Standards']
summary: Amends the liability provisions for dog bites relating to law enforcement activities and requires the annual certification of law enforcement canines and handlers.

title: Mental Health Crisis Intervention Council
author: ['Thatcher (R)', 'Romero A (D)']
summary: Creates the Mental Health Crisis Intervention Council to establish protocols and standards for the training and functioning of local mental health crisis intervention teams.

title: Peace Officer Certification Suspension
author: ['Stoddard (D)', 'Escamilla (D)']
summary: Adds additional grounds for suspending or revoking the certification of a peace officer.

title: Sheriffs Provisions
author: ['Snider (R)']
summary: Amends provisions relating to a sheriff.

title: Municipal Police Oversight
author: ['Wheatley (D)']
summary: Allows municipalities to create police oversight boards under certain conditions.

title: Peace Officer Training Qualifications
author: ['Mayne K (D)', 'Ray (R)']
summary: Permits some lawful permanent residents to apply to become peace officers or dispatchers.

title: Peace Officer Use of Force Standards
author: ['Thatcher (R)', 'Hollins (D)']
summary: Addresses statewide use of force standards for peace officers.

title: Law Enforcement Recording Release
author: ['Wheatley (D)']
summary: Mandates the release of law enforcement video recordings in certain situations.

title: Peace Officer Standards and Training Council Members
author: ['Winder (R)', 'Thatcher (R)']
summary: Modifies the membership of the Peace Officer Standards and Training Council.

title: Public Safety Post Retirement Reemployment
author: ['Gwynn (R)']
summary: Amends the postretirement reemployment restrictions for public safety workers and firefighters.

title: Peace Officer Use of Force Revisions
author: ['Birkeland (R)', 'Kitchen (D)']
summary: Addresses the use of force by peace officers, sets a timeline for completion of investigations into an officer's use of force, requires that certain information be posted online, makes technical corrections.

title: Mental Health Crisis Assistance
author: ['Thatcher (R)', 'Eliason (R)']
summary: Creates the 988 Suicide Prevention and Crisis Services Account.

title: Peace Officer Annual Training
author: ['Romero A (D)', 'Escamilla (D)']
summary: Requires a portion of a peace officer's annual training to include certain subjects.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Disclosure Immunity
author: ['Iwamoto (D)', 'Wilcox (R)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Decertification']
summary: Provides immunity for law enforcement agencies to disclose information to other law enforcement agencies regarding law enforcement officers.

title: Peace Officer Lethal Force
author: ['Dailey-Provost (D)', 'Vickers (R)']
summary: Modifies when a peace officer may use lethal force.

title: Forcible Entry and Warrants
author: ['Hall (R)']
summary: Modifies provisions related to the forcible entry of an officer into a building.

title: Mental Health Support Program for First Responders
author: ['Kwan (D)', 'Thatcher (R)']
summary: Relates to mental health resources for first responders, defines terms, requires the Division of Substance Abuse and Mental Health to administer a grant program to provide mental health resources for first responders.

title: Law Enforcement Weapons Use Report
author: ['Romero A (D)', 'Weiler (R)']
topics: ['Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Requires a law enforcement officer to file a report after pointing a firearm or a conductive energy device at an individual.

title: Community and Police Relations Commission
author: ['Wheatley (D)', 'Anderegg (R)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight']
summary: Creates the Community and Police Relations Commission.

title: Domestic Violence Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Pierucci (R)', 'Fillmore (R)']
summary: Provides for domestic violence and lethality assessment training for law enforcement officers and reporting requirements.

title: Mindset and Equality Training for Peace Officers
author: ['Christiansen (R)', 'Weiler (R)']
summary: Creates a grant program for local law enforcement agencies to provide outward mindset and equality training, defines terms, allows local law enforcement agencies to provide outward mindset and equality training to their officers, creates a grant program to be administered by POST to assist in providing a training program, requires POST to define the requirements and curriculum for the program, provides rulemaking authority, appropriates a specified amount for the grant program.

title: Special Needs Training for Law Enforcement
author: ['Eliason (R)', 'Thatcher (R)']
summary: Requires peace officer training to include training on autism spectrum disorder and other mental illnesses.

title: Peace Officer Qualified Immunity
author: ['King B (D)']
summary: Creates a cause of action against peace officers and their employers for the deprivation of rights, requires a certified peace officer to obtain a bond or insurance.

title: Peace Officers and Chokeholds
author: ['Hollins (D)']
summary: Prohibits training peace officers in the use of chokeholds or restraints that may cause unconsciousness, prohibits a peace officer's use of such a restraint.

title: Law Enforcement Tuition Reimbursement
author: ['Mayne K (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement tuition reimbursement, reopens the Public Safety Officer Career Advancement Reimbursement Program for new applicants, provides for pro rata reimbursement distributions for eligible applicants in certain circumstances.

title: Whistleblower Protections for Law Enforcement Officers
status: Pending - House General, Housing, and Military Affairs Committee
author: ['Donahue (R)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to whistleblower protections for law enforcement officers.

title: Mental Health Providers Grants
author: ['Anthony (D)', 'Walz (D)']
summary: Relates to the provision of grants for mental health providers working in collaboration with municipal police departments.

title: Sheriff Deputy Employee Classification
author: ['Hooker (D)', 'McCormack (D)', 'Pollina (D)', 'Perchlik (D)']
summary: Relates to designating certain sheriff's deputies as classified State employees.

title: Use of Force Standards
author: ['Grad (D)', 'Christie (D)']
summary: Relates to amending the standards for law enforcement use of force.

title: Facial Recognition Technology
author: ['Grad (D)']
summary: Relates to use of facial recognition technology by law enforcement in cases involving sexual exploitation of children, sexual assault, homicide, or kidnapping.

title: Body-Worn Camera Footage
author: ['Rachelson (D)']
summary: Relates to an independent monitoring board for body-worn camera footage.

title: New Criminal Investigation Tools
author: ['Rachelson (D)']
summary: Relates to requiring the Vermont General Assembly to approve the use of new criminal investigation and prosecution technologies by law enforcement officers.

title: Law Enforcement Excessive Force
author: ['White (D)', 'Christie (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Decertification']
summary: Relates to administrative penalties for law enforcement use of excessive force.

title: Governor's Public Safety Reform Initiative
summary: Implements the Governor's Public Safety Reform Initiative, engages with communities, especially those marginalized or harmed by policing, to develop and deploy best policing practices, provides that state and local law enforcement agencies recruit, hire, retain and promote officers who reflect the values and diversity of the communities they serve.

title: Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Ingram (D)', 'Pearson (P)', 'Pollina (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement training on appropriate use of force, de-escalation tactics, and cross cultural awareness.

title: Miscellaneous Law Enforcement Amendments
author: ['White (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to miscellaneous law enforcement amendments.

title: Law Enforcement
author: ['Baruth (D)']
summary: Addresses racial bias and excessive use of force by law enforcement.

title: Judiciary Procedure Sunsets
author: ['Judiciary Cmt']
summary: Extends several sunsets related to judiciary procedures, provides for the Court Diversion Program and the Racial Disparities in the Criminal and Juvenile Justice System Advisory Panel.

title: State Employee Compensation
author: ['Government Operations Cmt']
summary: Relates to compensation for certain state employees.

title: Body Worn Camera Systems
author: ['Reeves (R)']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Technology', ' Data and Transparency', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement agencies, relates to body-worn camera systems, creates a special nonreverting fund to be known as the Body-Worn Camera System Fund to assist state or local law-enforcement agencies with the costs of purchasing, operating, and maintaining body-worn camera systems.

title: Law Enforcement Training
author: ['Marsden (D)']
summary: Relates to membership on Criminal Justice Services Board and Committee on Training, relates to law-enforcement training, requires the social justice organization represented by a member of the Criminal Justice Services Board and a member of the Committee on Training be engaged in advancing inclusion and human rights, provides that the bill contains a technical amendment to compulsory in-service training for law-enforcement officers.

title: Assault and Battery
author: ['Morrissey (D)']
summary: Relates to assault and battery, relates to penalty, eliminates the mandatory minimum term of confinement of six months for an assault and battery committed against a judge, magistrate, law-enforcement officer, correctional officer, person directly involved in the care, treatment, or supervision of inmates, firefighter or volunteer firefighter, or emergency medical services personnel, removes simple assault from enhanced punishment and provides that the enhanced punishment applies for assault and battery.

title: Use of Deadly Force By a Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Reeves (R)']
summary: Relates to use of deadly force by a law-enforcement officer during an arrest or detention, eliminates the requirements that a law-enforcement officer shall not use deadly force against a person unless he has provided a warning to the subject of the deadly force that he will use deadly force, if feasible, and exhausted all other options or such options do not reasonably lend themselves to the circumstances.

title: Law Enforcement Civilian Oversight Bodies
author: ['Reeves (R)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement civilian oversight bodies, provides that any person appointed to a law-enforcement civilian oversight body shall be a citizen of the United States, shall reside in the jurisdiction that he is appointed to serve, shall not have a criminal record, and shall be required to complete a Citizen's Law Enforcement or Police Academy with a basic firearms instruction course conducted by an accredited law-enforcement agency and one daytime and one nighttime ride-along with each agency.

title: Retirement System
author: ['Cosgrove (R)']
summary: Relates to Virginia Retirement System, relates to retired law-enforcement officers employed as fingerprint examiners, allows a retired law-enforcement officer to continue to receive his service retirement allowance during a subsequent period of employment by a law-enforcement agency as a civilian fingerprint examiner, so long as he has a break in service of at least 12 calendar months between retirement and reemployment, did not retire under an early retirement program.

title: Civil Action for Unlawful Acts of Force
author: ['Surovell (D)']
summary: Relates to civil action for unlawful acts of force or failure to intervene by a law-enforcement officer or correctional officer, creates a civil action for the use of unlawful acts of force, including deadly force, or failure to intervene as required by law, by a law-enforcement officer or correctional officer while performing his duties for a public entity or private police department, provides that a public entity or private police department employing such officer is liable for any injuries sustained.

title: Victims of Qualifying Criminal Activity
author: ['Surovell (D)']
summary: Relates to certifications for victims of qualifying criminal activity, establishes a process for a state or local law-enforcement agency, an attorney for the Commonwealth, the Attorney General, or any other agency or department employing law-enforcement officers to complete a certification form or statement that is required by federal immigration law certifying that a person is a victim of qualifying criminal activity.

title: Execution of Search Warrants
author: ['Stuart (R)']
summary: Relates to execution of search warrants.

title: Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission
author: ['Webert M (R)']
summary: Relates to Virginia Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission Accreditation Grant Fund and Program, establishes the Virginia Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission Accreditation Grant Fund and the Virginia Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission Accreditation Grant Program, The Fund and Program shall be overseen by the Department of Criminal Justice Services, disbursements from the Fund shall be made to law-enforcement agencies.

title: Issuing Citations
author: ['Wyatt (R)']
summary: Relates to issuing citations, relates to certain traffic offenses, authorizes law-enforcement officers to lawfully stop a motor vehicle for operating without a light illuminating a license plate, with defective and unsafe equipment, without brake lights or a high mount stop light, without an exhaust system that prevents excessive or unusual levels of noise, with certain sun-shading materials and tinting films, and with certain objects suspended in the vehicle.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Coyner (R)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement officers, relates to minimum qualifications, modifies the existing minimum qualification for law-enforcement officers that prohibits any such officer from entering upon the duties of such office if he has been convicted of or pled guilty or no contest to any misdemeanor involving moral turpitude, including petit larceny, by providing that the prohibition applies only if such conviction or plea has occurred within the last three years.

title: Destroying or Tampering with Emergency Equipment
author: ['Wyatt (R)']
summary: Relates to destroying or tampering with firefighting or emergency medical services equipment or law-enforcement equipment and vehicles, provides that penalty, increases from a Class 1 misdemeanor to a Class 6 felony the penalty for injuring, destroying, removing, or tampering with any firefighting equipment or apparatus, emergency medical services vehicle, or law-enforcement vehicle or equipment.

title: Required Release of Video or Audio Recording
author: ['Rasoul (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to required release of video or audio recording, relates to discharge of firearm or use of stun weapon or chemical irritant by law-enforcement officer, requires that, whenever a law-enforcement officer discharges a firearm or uses a stun weapon or chemical irritant on a person resulting in death or serious bodily injury, any video or audio recording that relates to such incident produced or obtained by a law-enforcement officer be open to inspection and available for release.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Duty to Render Aid
author: ['Levine (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement officer, relates to duty to render aid, relates to duty to report wrongdoing by another law-enforcement officer, requires any law-enforcement officer on duty who witnesses another person suffering from a serious bodily injury or a life-threatening condition to render aid and makes it a duty to report acts of wrongdoing, defined in the bill and including bias-based profiling, committed by another law-enforcement officer on duty.

title: Facial Recognition Technology
author: ['Aird (D)']
summary: Relates to facial recognition technology, relates to authorization of use by local law-enforcement agencies and public institutions of higher education, allows a locality or a public institution of higher education to authorize a local law-enforcement agency or campus police department to purchase or deploy facial recognition technology, which is defined in the bill.

title: Civil Action for Deprivation of Rights
author: ['Bourne (D)']
topics: ['Investigations and Discipline', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force']
summary: Relates to civil action for deprivation of rights, relates to duties and liabilities of certain employers in employing or contracting for the services of law-enforcement officers, creates a civil action for the deprivation of a person's rights by a law-enforcement officer and provides that a plaintiff may be awarded compensatory damages, punitive damages, and equitable relief as well as reasonable attorney fees and costs.

title: Virginia Law Officers' Retirement System
author: ["O'Quinn (R)"]
summary: Relates to Virginia Law Officers' Retirement System, relates to Department of Corrections Special Investigations Unit, adds agents of the Department of Corrections Special Investigations Unit to the Virginia Law Officers' Retirement System (VaLORS), provides that such employees will not be eligible to retire under VaLORS unless they have five years of creditable service as a member of VaLORS, the State Police Officers' Retirement System, or an equivalent local system.

title: Search Warrants
author: ['Adams L (R)']
summary: Relates to search warrants, relates to daytime execution, relates to exceptions, provides an exception to the requirement that a search warrant be executed only in the daytime if, prior to the issuance of the search warrant, law-enforcement officers lawfully entered and secured the place to be searched and subsequently have remained at such place continuously, provides that such search warrant may be executed at any time of day without authorization from a judge or magistrate.

title: Freedom of Information Act
author: ['Mullin (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Oversight', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Relates to Virginia Freedom of Information Act, relates to required release of law-enforcement disciplinary records, relates to exceptions, requires the release of law-enforcement disciplinary records related to completed disciplinary investigations.

title: Virginia Retirement System
author: ['Leftwich (R)']
summary: Relates to Virginia Retirement System, relates to retired law-enforcement officers employed as fingerprint examiners, allows a retired law-enforcement officer to continue to receive his service retirement allowance during a subsequent period of employment by a law-enforcement agency as a civilian fingerprint examiner.

title: Law Enforcement Civilian Oversight Bodies
author: ['Williams Graves (D)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement civilian oversight bodies, relates to deputy sheriffs, adds a sheriff's office to those law-enforcement agencies that may be overseen by a law-enforcement civilian oversight body created by a locality and adds a nonprobationary deputy sheriff to those law-enforcement officers who are subject to such body if created by a locality.

title: Policing Reform
author: ['Locke (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Investigations and Discipline', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Relates to policing reform, adds law-enforcement officers to those persons who are guilty of a Class 6 felony if they are in a position of authority over and carnally know without force, threat, or intimidation any inmate, parolee, probationer, arrestee, detainee, or pretrial defendant or posttrial offender, including those in the custody of a private, local, or state law-enforcement agency.

title: No Knock Search Warrants
author: ['Aird (D)']
summary: Relates to search warrants, prohibits any law enforcement officer from seeking, executing, or participating in the execution of a no knock search warrant, defined in the bill as any search warrant executed without law enforcement officers giving notice of their identity, authority, and purpose prior to entering the place to be searched, requires a law enforcement officer to provide notice of his identity, authority, and purpose.

title: Use of Neck Restraints
author: ['Norment (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, relates to prohibition on the use of neck restraints, prohibits the use of neck restraints by law-enforcement officers, defines neck restraint as the use of any body part or object to attempt to control or disable a person by applying pressure against the neck, including the trachea or carotid artery, with the purpose, intent, or effect of controlling or restricting the person's movement or restricting the person's blood flow.

title: Department of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Norment (R)']
summary: Relates to Department of Criminal Justice Services, relates to criminal justice training academies, adds to the powers and duties of the Department of Criminal Justice Services (the Department) regarding the oversight and evaluation of criminal justice training academies approved by the Department, requires the Department to provide direct assistance to any academy not meeting established minimum standards or performance objectives, requires each training academy to submit an annual report.

title: Assault and Battery
author: ['Norment (R)']
summary: Relates to assault and battery, increases the penalty for committing an assault or an assault and battery against a judge, magistrate, law enforcement officer, correctional officer, person directly involved in the care, treatment, or supervision of inmates, firefighter, or volunteer firefighter or any emergency medical services personnel from a Class 6 felony with a mandatory term of confinement of six months to a Class 5 felony.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Adams L (R)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, relates to certain civil actions, provides that a law enforcement officer may bring an action against any person, group of persons, organization, or corporation, or the head of such organization or corporation, to recover damages, together with reasonable costs and attorney fees, sustained by such officer during such officer's performance of official duties, provides for the abridgment or deprivation of such officer's rights.

title: Civil Action for Deprivation of Rights
author: ['Bourne (D)']
summary: Relates to civil action for deprivation of rights, relates to duties and liabilities of employers in employing or contracting for the services of law enforcement officers, creates a civil action for the deprivation of a person's rights by a law enforcement officer and provides that a plaintiff may be awarded compensatory damages, punitive damages, and equitable relief, as well as reasonable attorney fees and costs.

title: Minimum Training Standards for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Edwards (D)']
summary: Relates to minimum training standards for law-enforcement officers, relates to crisis intervention team training, requires all law-enforcement officers to complete crisis intervention team training as part of the compulsory minimum training standards subsequent to employment as a law-enforcement officer and as part of basic training and the recertification of law-enforcement officers.

title: Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission
author: ['Webert M (R)']
summary: Relates to Virginia Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission Accreditation Grant Fund and Program, establishes the Virginia Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission Accreditation Grant Fund and the Virginia Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission Accreditation Grant Program, relates to The Fund and Program that shall be overseen by the Department of Criminal Justice Services, relates to the disbursements from the Fund that shall be made to law-enforcement agencies.

title: Assault and Battery
author: ['Reeves (R)']
summary: Relates to assault and battery, relates to penalty, increases the penalty for committing an assault or an assault and battery against a judge, a magistrate, a law-enforcement officer, a correctional officer, a person directly involved in the care, treatment, or supervision of inmates, a firefighter, or a volunteer firefighter or any emergency medical services personnel from a Class 6 felony with a mandatory term of confinement of six months to a Class 5 felony.

title: Law Enforcement Misconduct
author: ['Lucas (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement misconduct, authorizes the Attorney General to file a civil suit or inquire into, or seek to conciliate through the Division of Human Rights, any unlawful pattern and practice against the Commonwealth or a locality whenever the Attorney General has reasonable cause to believe that law enforcement officers of any agency of the Commonwealth or any locality are engaging in a pattern or practice that deprives persons of rights, privileges, or immunities.

title: Inadequate Police Responses
author: ['Cole (R)']
summary: Relates to localities responsible for damages caused by inadequate police responses, provides that in any instance in which a locality intentionally or negligently fails to provide an adequate police response so as to prevent damage to the property of a property owner or business owner, the locality shall be responsible to the property owner or business owner for the resulting damages.

title: Collective Bargaining
author: ['Newman (R)']
summary: Relates to collective bargaining, relates to law enforcement, provides that no county, city, town, or like governmental officer, agent, or governing body is vested with, or possesses any authority to recognize any labor union or other employee association as a bargaining agent of any law enforcement agency or its employees, or to collectively bargain or enter into any collective bargaining contract with any such union or association or its agents with respect to any matter relating to them.

title: Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['McQuinn (D)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement officer, relates to failure to intervene in an unlawful use of force, relates to penalties, requires that any law-enforcement officer who witnesses another law-enforcement officer engaging or attempting to engage in the unlawful use of force against another person shall intervene, when such intervention is objectively reasonable and possible, to end the unlawful use or attempted unlawful use of force, or to prevent the further unlawful use of force.

title: Policing Reform
author: ['Locke (D)']
summary: Relates to policing reform, adds law-enforcement officers to those persons who are guilty of a Class 6 felony if they are in a position of authority over and carnally know without force, threat, or intimidation any inmate, parolee, probationer, arrestee, detainee, or pretrial defendant or posttrial offender, including those in the custody of a private, local, or state law-enforcement agency.

title: Assault and Battery
author: ['Surovell (D)']
summary: Relates to assault and battery, relates to penalty, eliminates the mandatory minimum term of confinement for an assault and battery committed against a judge, magistrate, law-enforcement officer, correctional officer, person directly involved in the care of inmates, firefighter, volunteer firefighter or any emergency medical services personnel and provides that such crime can no longer be committed as a simple assault.

title: Department of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Miyares (R)']
summary: Relates to Department of Criminal Justice Services, relates to powers and duties, relates to creation of statewide telephone hotline for complaints of police misconduct, directs the Department of Criminal Justice Services to create, maintain, and promote a statewide, toll-free telephone hotline through which members of the public may report incidents of police misconduct and to forward the information relating to each incident reported through the hotline to the appropriate investigative authority.

title: Law Enforcement Civilian Review Boards
author: ['Hashmi (D)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement civilian review boards, authorizes a locality to establish a law-enforcement civilian review board that may receive, investigate, and issue findings on complaints from civilians regarding conduct of law-enforcement officers and civilian employees, provides that investigate and issue findings on incidents, including the use of force by a law-enforcement officer, death or serious injury to any person held in custody, serious abuse of authority or misconduct.

title: Criminal Justices Services Board
author: ['Favola (D)']
summary: Relates to Criminal Justices Services Board, relates to Committee on Training, changes the membership of the Committee on Training by requiring that one member be an attorney representing the Virginia Indigent Defense Commission, one member be an attorney representing civil liberty groups, and one member be a mental health provider, the bill lessens the representatives from the Virginia Sheriffs' Association and Virginia Association of Chiefs of Police from two representatives to one.

title: Mobile Crisis Co-Response Team Programs
author: ['McPike (D)']
summary: Relates to mobile crisis co-response team programs, provides that the Department of Criminal Justice Services and the Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services shall support the development and establishment of a mental health first response and alert system that uses mobile crisis co-response team programs in areas throughout the Commonwealth.

title: Attorney General
author: ['Ebbin (D)']
summary: Relates to Attorney General, relates to criminal cases involving certain felonies committed by law-enforcement officers, provides that the Attorney General, with the concurrence of the local attorney for the Commonwealth, may assist in the prosecution of certain felony offenses committed by law-enforcement officers during the performance of their official duties.

title: Marcus-David Peters Act
author: ['Bourne (D)']
summary: Relates to response to mental health crises, establishes the mental health awareness response and community understanding services (Marcus) alert system.

title: Citizen Complaints Against Law Enforcement
author: ['Davis (R)']
summary: Relates to minimum standards for citizen complaints against law enforcement, relates to investigation time limits, requires that law enforcement agencies ensure, at a minimum, that in the case of all written citizen complaints, the time limits for conducting an investigation of such written complaints shall be consistent with the Commission on Accreditation for Law Enforcement Agencies, Inc.'s, standards on complaint procedures regarding investigation time limits.

title: Use of Military Property
author: ['Helmer (D)']
summary: Relates to the acquisition and use of military property by law enforcement agencies, provides that no state or local law enforcement agency shall acquire, purchase, or otherwise accept on any terms weaponized unmanned aerial vehicles, provides for aircraft that are configured for combat or are combat coded and have no established commercial flight application, provides for standard issue military rifles, provides for armored multiwheeled vehicles.

title: Use of Neck Restraints
author: ['Morrissey (D)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement officers, relates to prohibition on the use of neck restraints, makes it a Class 1 misdemeanor for a law-enforcement officer to use a neck restraint in the performance of his official duties, defines neck restraint as the use of any body part or object to attempt to control or disable a person by applying pressure against the neck, including the trachea or carotid artery, with the purpose, intent, or effect of controlling or restricting the person's movement.

title: Decertification of Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Simon (D)']
summary: Relates to decertification of law enforcement officers, requires any Sheriff, Chief of Police, or agency administrator to notify the Criminal Justice Services Board in writing within a specified number of hours of becoming aware that any certified law enforcement or jail officer currently employed by his agency has been terminated for engaging in misconduct, as set forth in the bill, requires the Board to initiate decertification proceedings against such current or former law enforcement or jail officer.

title: Body Worn Camera Systems
author: ['Reeves (R)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement agencies, relates to body-worn camera systems, creates a special nonreverting fund to be known as the Body-Worn Camera System Fund to assist local law-enforcement agencies with the costs of purchasing, operating, and maintaining body-worn camera systems.

title: Department of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Herring (D)']
summary: Relates to the Department of Criminal Justice Services, relates to law enforcement civilian review panels, requires localities, on or before a specified date, to establish law enforcement civilian review panels to enhance the accountability and transparency of local law enforcement agencies using guidelines developed by the Department of Criminal Justice Services.

title: Crisis Intervention Team Program
author: ['Kory (D)']
summary: Relates to crisis intervention team program, relates to annual report, requires the Department of Criminal Justice Services and the Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services to report annually by specified date to the Chairmen of the House Committee on Public Safety, the Senate Committee on the Judiciary, and the Joint Commission on Health Care on the status of crisis intervention team programs in the Commonwealth, including the number of programs and the criteria developed for each area.

title: School Security Officers and School Resource Officers
author: ['Kory (D)']
summary: Relates to school security officers and school resource officers, relates to training, relates to students with disabilities, relates to emergency, requires the compulsory minimum training standards for school security officers and school resource officers to include identifying and working with students with intellectual and physical disabilities, including exercising the appropriate level of caution and understanding during interactions with such students.

title: Abusive Language
author: ['Reeves (R)']
summary: Relates to abusive language to another, relates to penalty, clarifies that the crime of using abusive language to another applies to persons cursing or abusing law-enforcement officers or emergency personnel who are performing their assigned duties.

title: Decertification of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Reeves (R)']
summary: Relates to decertification of law-enforcement officers, relates to acts that compromise integrity or credibility, requires the sheriff, chief of police, or agency administrator to notify the Criminal Justice Services Board in writing within 48 hours of becoming aware that any certified law-enforcement or jail officer currently employed by his agency has been placed on a Brady list because such officer committed acts that compromise an officer's credibility, integrity, honesty, or other characteristics.

title: Department of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Price (D)']
summary: Relates to Department of Criminal Justice Services, relates to powers and duties of Director, relates to law-enforcement training standards, eliminates the Committee on Training that currently exists under the Criminal Justice Services Board (the Board) as the policy-making body responsible to the Board for effecting the compulsory minimum training standards for law-enforcement officers, deputy sheriffs, jail and correctional officers, and dispatchers and gives those responsibilities to the Director.

title: Attorney General
author: ['Price (D)']
summary: Relates to Attorney General, relates to investigation and prosecution of certain offenses committed by a law-enforcement officer, gives the Attorney General the authority to institute or conduct criminal prosecutions in cases involving certain felony crimes committed by a law-enforcement officer in the performance of his official duties, provides that the Division of Human Rights of the Department of Law shall have full and sole authority to do whatever is necessary or appropriate.

title: Civil Action for Deprivation of Rights
author: ['Morrissey (D)']
summary: Relates to civil action for deprivation of rights by a law-enforcement officer, creates a civil action for the deprivation of a person's rights by a law-enforcement officer, provides that a plaintiff may be awarded compensatory damages, punitive damages, and equitable relief, as well as reasonable attorney fees and costs, provides that sovereign immunity or any other immunities or limitations on liability or damages shall not apply to such actions.

title: Department of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Price (D)']
summary: Relates to Department of Criminal Justice Services, relates to law-enforcement officer training and qualifications, requires the Department of Criminal Justice Services (the Department) to develop uniform curriculum and lesson plans for the compulsory minimum entry-level, in-service, and advanced training standards to be employed by criminal justice training academies approved by the Department when conducting training, requires the Department to include the recognition of implicit biases.

title: Use of Neck Restraints
author: ['Carroll Foy (D)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement officers, relates to prohibition on the use of neck restraints, relates to penalty, makes it a Class 6 felony for a law-enforcement officer to use a neck restraint in the performance of his official duties, defines neck restraint as the use of any body part or object to attempt to control or disable a person by applying pressure against the neck, including the trachea or carotid artery, with the purpose, intent, or effect of controlling or restricting the person's movement.

title: Collective Bargaining
author: ['LaRock (R)']
summary: Relates to collective bargaining, relates to law enforcement, relates to transparency and accountability, prohibits a county, city, or town from entering into a collective bargaining contract with a labor union or other employee association representing law-enforcement officers or employees of a law-enforcement agency that prevents the Attorney General from seeking equitable relief against a law-enforcement agency engaging in a pattern or practice of unconstitutional misconduct, includes any stipulation.

title: Retirement System
author: ['Cosgrove (R)']
summary: Relates to Virginia Retirement System, relates to retired law-enforcement officers employed as school security officers, provides that if a retired law-enforcement officer was employed by a local school division as a school security officer on January 1, 2020, and had a bona fide break in service of at least one month between retirement and employment as a school security officer, such person is not required to establish a 12-month break in service that would otherwise be required by law.

title: Emergency Services and Disaster Law
author: ['DeSteph (R)']
summary: Relates to Emergency Services and Disaster Law, relates to immunity from liability, relates to sheriffs' offices and regional jails, clarifies that sheriffs' offices and regional jails are considered public agencies for purposes of immunity from liability for the death of, or any injury to, persons or damage to property resulting from emergency services activities provided while complying with or attempting to comply with the Emergency Services and Disaster Law.

title: Law Enforcement Misconduct
author: ['Lopez (D)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement misconduct, authorizes the Attorney General to file a civil suit or inquire into, through the Division of Human Rights, any unlawful pattern and practice against the Commonwealth or a locality whenever the Attorney General has reasonable cause to believe that law-enforcement officers of any agency of the Commonwealth or any locality are engaging in a pattern or practice that deprives persons of rights, privileges, or immunities secured or protected by the laws.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Coyner (R)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement officers, relates to minimum qualifications, changes the minimum qualifications for law-enforcement officers to provide that all such officers who enter upon the duties of such office shall not have been convicted of or pled guilty or no contest to any misdemeanor involving moral turpitude, including petit larceny, within the last three years, prohibits such convictions at all for such officers who enter upon the duties of such office.

title: Collective Bargaining
author: ['Stanley Wi (R)']
summary: Relates to collective bargaining, relates to law enforcement, provides that no county, city, town, or like governmental officer, agent, or governing body, is vested with or possesses any authority to recognize any labor union or other employee association as a bargaining agent of any law enforcement agency or its employees, or to collectively bargain or enter into any collective bargaining contract with any such union or association or its agents with respect to any matter relating to them.

title: Civilian Deaths in Custody
author: ['Price (D)']
summary: Relates to civilian deaths in custody, relates to report, requires every law-enforcement agency and correctional facility to report to the Department of Criminal Justice Services certain information regarding the death of any person who is detained, under arrest or in the process of being arrested, en route to be incarcerated, incarcerated, or otherwise in the custody of such law-enforcement agency or correctional facility.

title: Mobile Crisis Co-Response Team Programs
author: ['Kory (D)']
summary: Relates to mobile crisis co-response team programs, provides that the Department of Criminal Justice Services and the Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services shall support the development and establishment of a mental health first response and alert system that uses mobile crisis co-response team programs in areas throughout the Commonwealth, provides that a mobile crisis co-response team is defined in the bill as a group of mental health service providers working with law-enforcement.

title: Required Release of Video or Audio Recording
author: ['Rasoul (D)']
summary: Relates to required release of video or audio recording, relates to discharge of firearm or use of stun gun or chemical irritant by law-enforcement officer, requires that whenever a law-enforcement officer discharges a firearm or uses a stun gun or chemical irritant on a person resulting in death or serious bodily injury, any video or audio recording that relates to such incident produced or obtained by a law-enforcement officer shall be open to inspection and available for release.

title: Hate Crime
author: ['Askew (D)']
summary: Relates to hate crimes, relates to falsely summoning or giving false reports to law enforcement officials, increases the penalty for falsely summoning or giving false reports to law enforcement officials from a Class 1 misdemeanor to a Class 6 felony, which shall include a term of confinement of at least six months, when a person intentionally gives a false report as to the commission of any crime to any law enforcement official.

title: No Knock Search Warrants
author: ['Aird (D)']
summary: Relates to search warrants, prohibits any law enforcement officer from seeking, executing, or participating in the execution of a no knock search warrant, defined in the bill as any search warrant executed without law enforcement officers giving notice of their identity, authority, and purpose prior to entering the place to be searched, requires a law enforcement officer to provide notice of his identity, authority, and purpose.

title: Minimum Qualifications for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Price (D)']
summary: Relates to minimum qualifications for law enforcement officer, relates to disclosure of information, provides that any Sheriff or Chief of Police, the Director or Chief Executive of any agency or department employing Deputy Sheriffs or law enforcement officers, and the Director of the Department of Criminal Justice Services shall disclose to a prospective law enforcement or jail employer any information related to an arrest or prosecution of a former police officer, deputy sheriff, or jail officer.

title: Department of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Hope (D)']
summary: Requires the Department of Criminal Justice Services to develop a uniform curriculum and lesson plans for the compulsory minimum entry level, in service, and advanced training standards to be employed by criminal justice training academies approved by the Department when conducting training.

title: Duty to Render Aid
author: ['Levine (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officers, requires any law enforcement officer who witnesses another person suffering from a serious bodily injury or a life threatening condition to render aid and makes it a duty to report acts of wrongdoing committed by another law enforcement officer.

title: Decertification of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['McDougle (R)']
summary: Relates to decertification of law enforcement officers, relates to acts that compromise integrity or credibility, requires the Sheriff, Chief of Police, or agency administrator to notify the Criminal Justice Services Board in writing within a specified number of hours of becoming aware that any certified law-enforcement or jail officer currently employed by his agency has been placed on a Brady list.

title: Crisis Intervention Team Training
author: ['McDougle (R)']
summary: Relates to crisis intervention team training, relates to appropriation, appropriates a sum sufficient to provide basic and advanced crisis intervention team training to all state and local law enforcement officers in the Commonwealth.

title: Law Enforcement Officer Conduct
author: ['Aird (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement officer conduct during an arrest or detention, relates to use of force, relates to prohibited practices, prohibits the use of excessive force, defined in the bill as any force that is objectively unreasonable given the totality of the circumstances, including the severity of the crime at issue, whether the suspect poses an immediate threat to the safety of the officers or others, and whether the suspect is actively resisting arrest or attempting to evade arrest by flight.

title: School Resource Officers
author: ['Kory (D)']
summary: Relates to school resource officers, relates to duties, relates to prohibitions, clarifies that a school resource officer is a certified law enforcement officer who is hired by the local law enforcement agency for the singular purpose of providing law enforcement and security services to public elementary and secondary schools, and is prohibited from enforcing school board student discipline policies that have no connection to the provision of such law enforcement and security services.

title: Crisis Intervention Teams
author: ['Kory (D)']
summary: Relates to crisis intervention teams, relates to bilingual and multilingual members, directs the Department of Criminal Justice Services to include in the criteria for the development of crisis intervention teams a requirement that each crisis intervention team include at least two individuals who are fluent in a language or languages other than English that are commonly spoken in the community.

title: Department of Criminal Justice Services
author: ['Wampler (R)']
summary: Relates to the Department of Criminal Justice Services, relates to powers and duties, requires the Department of Criminal Justice Services to establish training standards and to publish and periodically update model policies for law enforcement personnel on deescalation techniques and practices, including guidelines for the use of force continuum and the risks of using neck restraints, such as chokeholds.

title: Uniformed Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Carter (D)']
summary: Relates to uniformed law-enforcement officers, relates to identification, relates to penalty, requires every law-enforcement officer who is on duty and in uniform to wear a badge, nameplate, or other device that conspicuously displays the officer's badge or other identification number or the name of the officer, provides that upon request for identification from any person, a law-enforcement officer who is on duty and in uniform shall disclose his badge or other identification number or his name.

title: Police Officers Deputy Sheriffs and Jail Officers
author: ['Bell Ro (R)']
summary: Relates to police officers, deputy sheriffs, and jail officers, relates to employment and decertification, provides that any sheriff or chief of police, the director or chief executive of any agency or department employing deputy sheriffs or law-enforcement officers, and the Director of the Department of Criminal Justice Services shall disclose to a prospective law-enforcement or jail employer any information related to an arrest or prosecution of a former police officer, deputy sheriff, or jail officer.

title: Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Bell Ro (R)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement officers, relates to duty to intervene and report unlawful use of force, requires a law-enforcement officer who witnesses another law-enforcement officer engaging or attempting to engage in the unlawful use of force against another person to intervene, when such intervention is feasible, to end the unlawful use or attempted unlawful use of force or to prevent the further unlawful use of force and to report such incident to his agency, provides that a law-enforcement officer.

title: Law Enforcement Agencies
author: ['Bell Ro (R)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement agencies, relates to body-worn camera systems, requires all law-enforcement agencies having jurisdiction over criminal law enforcement or regulatory violations to implement and operate a body-worn camera system and to require officers responsible for the prevention and detection of crime and the enforcement of penal, traffic, or highway laws to be equipped with a body-worn camera system.

title: Decertification of Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Avoli (R)']
summary: Relates to decertification of law-enforcement officers, relates to Criminal Justice Services Board, relates to statewide professional standards of conduct, requires the Criminal Justice Services Board (the Board) to adopt statewide professional standards of conduct applicable to all law-enforcement officers, requires any chief of police, sheriff, or agency administrator to notify the Board in writing within 48 hours of becoming aware.

title: Law Enforcement Agencies
author: ['Avoli (R)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement agencies, relates to accreditation, requires all local and state law-enforcement agencies to obtain and maintain accreditation by the Virginia Law Enforcement Professional Standards Commission, States that the Department of Criminal Justice Services (the Department) shall establish a review process to assist any law-enforcement agency that has failed to obtain or maintain accreditation status.

title: Projecting Laser at Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Robinson (R)']
summary: Increases from a Class 2 misdemeanor to a Class 1 misdemeanor the penalty for any person who intentionally projects a beam or a point of light from a laser, a laser gun sight, or any device that simulates a laser at another person while knowing or having reason to know such other person is a law enforcement or correctional officer.

title: Assault and Battery
author: ['Campbell R (R)']
summary: Relates to assault and battery, increases the penalty for committing an assault or an assault and battery against a judge, magistrate, law enforcement officers, correctional officers, a person directly involved in the care, treatment, or supervision of inmates, and volunteer firefighter or any emergency medical services personnel from a Class 6 felony with a mandatory term of confinement to a Class 5 felony.

title: Mental Health Support for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Maycumber (R)']
summary: Expands mental health support for law enforcement officers.

title: Law Enforcement Professional Grant Program
author: ['Maycumber (R)']
summary: Establishes a law enforcement professional development outreach grant program.

title: Tactics and Equipment Used by Peace Officers
author: ['Johnson J (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Establishes requirements for tactics and equipment used by peace officers.

title: State Oversight and Accountability of Peace Officers
status: Pending - Carryover - House Public Safety Committee
author: ['Goodman (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Oversight', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns state oversight and accountability of peace officers and corrections officers.

title: Audits of Requirements Relating to Peace Officers
author: ['Ramos (D)']
topics: ['Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns compliance audits of requirements relating to peace officers and law enforcement agencies.

title: Law Enforcement Data Collection
author: ['Lovick (D)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement data collection.

title: Recordation of Custodial Interrogations Act
status: Pending - Carryover - House Public Safety Committee
author: ['Peterson (D)']
summary: Enacts the uniform electronic recordation of custodial interrogations act.

title: Persons Injured as a Result of Police Misconduct
author: ['Thai (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force']
summary: Addresses meaningful civil remedies for persons injured as a result of police misconduct, including by allowing for an award of attorney fees in addition to damages and injunctive and declaratory relief.

title: Community Oversight Boards
author: ['Johnson J (D)']
summary: Concerns community oversight boards.

title: Uniform Electronic Recordation
author: ['Peterson (D)']
summary: Enacts the uniform electronic recordation of custodial interrogations act.

title: Background Investigations of Peace Officers
author: ['Klippert (R)']
summary: Concerns background investigations of peace officers, reserve officers, and corrections officers.

title: Investigation of Potential Criminal Conduct
author: ['Entenman (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns investigation of potential criminal conduct arising from police use of force, including custodial injuries, and other officer-involved incidents.

title: Permissible Uses of Force By Law Enforcement
author: ['Johnson J (D)']
summary: Concerns permissible uses of force by law enforcement and correctional officers.

title: Independent Prosecutions of Criminal Conduct
status: Pending - Carryover - House Public Safety Committee
author: ['Entenman (D)']
summary: Establishes a mechanism for independent prosecutions of criminal conduct arising from police use of force.

title: Behavioral Health System
status: Pending - Carryover - House Health Care and Wellness Committee
author: ['Griffey (R)']
summary: Promotes recovery and improving public safety by providing behavioral health system responses to individuals with substance use disorder and providing training to law enforcement personnel.

title: Accountability of Peace Officers
author: ['Pedersen (D)']
topics: ['Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns state oversight and accountability of peace officers and corrections officers.

title: Law Enforcement Personnel Collective Bargaining
author: ['Nguyen (D)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement personnel collective bargaining.

title: Duty of Peace Officers to Intervene
author: ['Dhingra (D)']
summary: Concerns a peace officer's duty to intervene.

title: Compliance Audits of Peace Officer Requirements
status: Pending - Carryover - Senate Law & Justice Committee
author: ['Dhingra (D)']
summary: Concerns compliance audits of requirements relating to peace officers and law enforcement agencies.

title: Peace Officer Hiring and Certification
author: ['Kuderer (D)']
topics: ['Training', ' Certification', ' Employment and Labor', ' Decertification', ' Standards']
summary: Concerns peace officer hiring and certification.

title: Vascular Neck Restraints
status: Pending - Carryover - Senate Law & Justice Committee
author: ['Padden (R)']
summary: Concerns vascular neck restraints.

title: Public Trust and Confidence in Law Enforcement
status: Pending - Carryover - Senate Labor, Commerce & Tribal Affairs Committee
author: ['Salomon (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Other Issues', ' Oversight', ' Use of Force']
summary: Enhances public trust and confidence in law enforcement and strengthening law enforcement accountability for general authority Washington peace officers, excluding department of fish and wildlife officers.

title: Unlawfully Summoning a Police Officer
author: ['Das (D)']
summary: Concerns unlawfully summoning a police officer, provides that a person may bring a civil action for damages against any person who knowingly causes a law enforcement officer to arrive at a location to contact another person with the intent to discriminate against, harass, or for other specified intentions.

title: Law Enforcement Data Collection
author: ['Nobles (D)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement data collection.

title: Information Regarding Police Use of Deadly Force
status: Pending - Carryover - Senate Law & Justice Committee
author: ['Padden (R)']
summary: Collects information regarding police use of deadly force, personnel complaints, pursuit incidences, and patrol car crashes.

title: Defenses in Personal Injury and Wrongful Death Actions
author: ['Frockt (D)']
summary: Concerns defenses in personal injury and wrongful death actions where the person injured or killed was committing a felony, adds an exception for actions arising out of law enforcement activities to the complete defense to any action for damages for personal injury or wrongful death that the person injured or killed was engaged in the commission of a felony, provides that in such law enforcement actions, it must be proven that the person was engaged in the commission of a felony at the time of occurrence.

title: Definition of Index for State Patrol Retirement System
author: ['Schoesler (R)']
summary: Modifies the definition of index for the Washington state patrol retirement system.

title: Law Enforcement Officer and Firefighter Retirement
status: Pending - Carryover - Senate Ways and Means Committee
author: ['Conway (D)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement officers' and firefighters' retirement system disability boards.

title: Partnership Model that Facilitates Community Engagement
author: ['Conway (D)']
summary: Creates a partnership model that facilitates community engagement with law enforcement.

title: Body Worn and Vehicle Dashboard Camera Recordings
status: Pending - Carryover - Senate Law & Justice Committee
author: ['Gildon (R)']
summary: Retains body worn and vehicle dashboard camera recordings.

title: Traffic Stops for Certain Traffic Violations and Adding
author: ['Nguyen (D)']
topics: ['Policing Alternatives and Collaboration', ' Other Issues', ' Standards']
summary: Prohibits traffic stops for certain traffic violations.

title: Worker Compensation for First Responders
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Banking and Insurance Committee
author: ['Romano (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Allows workers' compensation for first responders diagnosed with PTSD due to event during employment.

title: Required Equipment for State Police
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Government Organization Committee
author: ['Hamilton (R)']
summary: Relates to required equipment for State Police and Natural Resources police officers.

title: Worker Compensation Benefits for First Responders
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Banking and Insurance Committee
author: ['Baldwin (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Allows workers' compensation benefits for first responders diagnosed with PTSD.

title: Worker Compensation Benefits
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Banking and Insurance Committee
author: ['Jeffries (D)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Allows workers' compensation benefits for first responders diagnosed with PTSD.

title: Training for Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Woelfel (D)']
summary: Relates to law-enforcement training for investigating sexual assault cases involving adult victims, requires the Law-Enforcement Professional Standards Subcommittee of the Governors Committee on Crime, Delinquency, and Correction to develop standards and procedures for law-enforcement officers responsible for investigating sexual assault cases involving adult victims, sets forth required components of training.

title: State Police Loan Forgiveness Program
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Government Organization Committee
author: ['Ihlenfeld (D)']
summary: Establishes State Police Loan Forgiveness Program.

title: Worker Compensation Benefits for First Responders
status: Failed - Adjourned - Senate Banking and Insurance Committee
author: ['Weld (R)']
topics: ['Employment and Labor', ' Officer Safety and Wellbeing']
summary: Allows workers' compensation benefits for first responders diagnosed with PTSD.

title: Training of Certain Officers for Persons with Autism
author: ['Caputo (D)']
summary: Requires training of certain officers for persons with autism spectrum disorder.

title: Handle With Care Program for Trauma Inflicted Children
author: ['Grady (R)']
summary: Requires sheriff's departments to participate and utilize Handle With Care Program for trauma inflicted children.

title: Deputy Sheriff Retirement System
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Pensions and Retirement Committee
author: ['Lovejoy (D)']
summary: Relates to Deputy Sheriff Retirement System.

title: Worker Compensation Benefits for First Responders
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Fire Departments and Emergency Medical Services Committee
author: ['Lovejoy (D)']
summary: Allows workers' compensation benefits for first responders diagnosed with post traumatic stress disorder.

title: Compensation for State Police Officers
author: ['Hanna (R)']
summary: Relates to the require compensation for state police officers when required to be on standby so they can be called back to work if necessary.

title: Criminal Penalty for Killing Police
author: ['Pushkin (D)']
summary: Increases criminal penalty for killing police and corrections officer in the line of duty.

title: First Degree Murder of Law Enforcement Officer
author: ['Westfall (R)']
summary: Applies death penalty for first degree murder of law enforcement officer or first responder.

title: Enhanced Criminal Penalties
author: ['Westfall (R)']
summary: Provides enhanced criminal penalties for offenses committed against law enforcement officers or first responders.

title: Motivated Intimidation of Responders Prosecution Act
author: ['Reynolds (R)']
summary: Concerns bias Motivated Intimidation of Responders Prosecution Act.

title: Law Enforcement Transparency Board
status: Failed - Adjourned - House Political Subdivisions Committee
author: ['Walker Da (D)']
summary: Creates a law enforcement transparency board.

title: Police Officer Bill of Rights
author: ['Mallow (R)']
summary: Creates a Police Officer's Bill of Rights.

title: Standards for Pre-Certified Law Enforcement Officers
author: ['Kelly D (R)']
summary: Relates to minimum standards for hiring of pre-certified law enforcement officers, prohibits law enforcement agencies from employing or offering to employ a pre-certified law enforcement officer without certain findings, requires a hiring law enforcement agency to make written findings or adopt the written findings of a previous employing agency documenting that the officer meets certain standards, requires such findings to be made available to the Law Enforcement Professional Standards Subcommittee.

title: Law Enforcement Warrant for Third Party Information
author: ['Young (D)']
summary: Relates to law enforcement warrant for third party information.

title: False Reports Made to Law Enforcement
author: ['Walker Da (D)']
summary: Authorizes civil damages for any person who was subject to an intentionally false report made to law enforcement.

title: Civilian Law Enforcement and Military Authorities
author: ['Hanshaw (R)']
summary: Enhances cooperation between civilian law enforcement and military authorities.

title: Collection of Data Regarding Police Encounters
author: ['Rowe (D)']
summary: Provides for collection of data regarding police encounters that are not traffic stops.

title: State Police Review Board
author: ['Doyle (D)']
summary: Relates to the State Police Review Board.

title: Constitutional Rights Act
author: ['Hamrick (R)']
summary: Relates to protecting everyone's Constitutional Rights Act.

title: Law Enforcement Agency Policies on the Use of Force
status: Pending - Assembly Government Accountability and Oversight Committee
author: ['Spiros (R)', 'Cowles (R)', 'Darling (R)', 'Taylor L (D)', 'Roys (D)', 'Jacque (R)', 'Wanggaard (R)', 'Bowen (D)', 'Brandtjen (R)', 'Brostoff (D)', 'Feyen (R)', 'Armstrong (R)', 'Moses (R)', 'Rozar (R)']
summary: Concerns law enforcement agency policies on the use of force.

title: Reporting of Law Enforcement Use of Force Incidents
status: Pending - Assembly Government Accountability and Oversight Committee
author: ['Spiros (R)', 'Brandtjen (R)', 'Rozar (R)', 'Moses (R)', 'Armstrong (R)', 'Cabrera (D)', 'Feyen (R)', 'Wichgers (R)', 'Brostoff (D)', 'Brooks R (R)', 'Cowles (R)', 'Bowen (D)', 'Wanggaard (R)', 'Thiesfeldt (R)', 'Jacque (R)', 'Roys (D)', 'Taylor L (D)', 'Darling (R)']
summary: Reports of law enforcement use of force incidents.

title: Public Access to Policies Regarding the Use of Force
status: Pending - Assembly Government Accountability and Oversight Committee
author: ['Spiros (R)', 'Cowles (R)', 'Darling (R)', 'Taylor L (D)', 'Roys (D)', 'Jacque (R)', 'Wanggaard (R)', 'Bowen (D)', 'Brandtjen (R)', 'Feyen (R)', 'Armstrong (R)', 'Moses (R)', 'Rozar (R)']
summary: Concerns public access to policies regarding the use of force by law enforcement.

title: Decreasing Shared Revenue Payments to Municipalities
author: ['Spiros (R)', 'Wichgers (R)', 'Bradley (R)', 'Rozar (R)', 'Moses (R)', 'Cabral-Guevara (R)', 'Armstrong (R)', 'Magnafici (R)', 'Testin (R)', 'Feyen (R)', 'Nass (R)', 'Horlacher (R)', 'Brandtjen (R)', 'Sanfelippo (R)', 'Wanggaard (R)', 'Jacque (R)', 'Roth (R)', 'Darling (R)', 'Cowles (R)']
summary: Decreases shared revenue payments to municipalities based on decreased funding for law enforcement officers.

title: Wind River Reservation Law Enforcement
author: ['Select Cmte on Tribal Relations']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, authorizes tribal law enforcement officers to enforce state traffic laws as specified, requires an agreement between state and tribal authorities, provides for liability coverage, requires certification of tribal law enforcement officers by peace officer standards and training commission, defines terms, requires rulemaking, provides legislative findings.

title: Elected Official Residency Requirement
author: ['Hunt (R)', 'Case (R)', 'Blackburn (R)', 'Clausen (R)', 'Clifford (D)', 'Duncan (R)', 'Neiman (R)']
summary: Relates to elected officials, prescribes residency requirements for county assessor, county commissioner, county sheriff, and county treasurer, prescribes when a vacancy in office occurs, provides applicability.

title: Disclosure of Peace Officer Recordings
author: ['Provenza (D)', 'Olsen (R)', 'Clifford (D)']
topics: ['Technology', ' Use of Force', ' Data and Transparency']
summary: Relates to public records, requires the right of inspection of peace officer recordings as specified, specifies applicability.

title: Bias Motivated Crime
author: ['Sweeney (R)', 'Zwonitzer Dan (R)', 'Perkins (R)', 'Connolly (D)', 'Rothfuss (D)', 'Barlow (R)', 'Paxton (R)', 'Pappas (R)', 'Brown L (R)', 'Furphy (R)', 'Henderson (R)', 'Duncan (R)', 'Newsome (R)', 'Yin (D)']
summary: Relates to bias motivated crimes, creates additional elements for bias motivated crimes, creates enhanced penalties for bias motivated crimes, provides that the court shall consider whether a crime is bias motivated during sentencing, creates a civil cause of action, provides for antibias training of peace officers as specified, requires reports.

title: Law Enforcement Hiring Practices
author: ['Provenza (D)', 'Landen (R)', 'Washut (R)']
summary: Relates to peace officers, prohibits the hiring of peace officers with a history of serious misconduct as specified, requires the revocation of a peace officer certification as specified, provides rulemaking authority, requires a report, provides a definition.

title: Wind River Reservation
author: ['Select Cmte on Tribal Relations']
summary: Relates to law enforcement, authorizes tribal law enforcement officers to enforce state traffic laws as specified, requires an agreement between state and tribal authorities, provides for liability coverage, requires certification of tribal law enforcement officers by the peace officer standards and training commission, defines terms, requires rulemaking, provides legislative findings, provides for an effective date.
